summary: 01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/01/2018: Assailants fired three mortars at an Iraqi Turkmen Front headquarters in Tisin neighborhood, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated at an under-construction building at a marketplace along Mall Road in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two people were injured in the blast. This was one of two bombings in Chaman on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Pakistani Police checkpost in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least six people, including three officers, were injured in the blast. This was one of two bombings in Chaman on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least three people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police convoy in Pusht Rod district, Farah Afghanistan. Mohammad Ibrhim, the local police chief, was killed and two other officers were injured in the assault. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated underneath the vehicle of an Iraqi Volunteer Forces member in Radhwaniyah, Al Anbar, Iraq. The volunteer fighter was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Coptic Christian civilians outside a liquor store in Giza, Egypt. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources indicated that one of the assailants yelled "Die Christians!" during the attack.

01/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Salim Attari in Mumtazabad neighborhood, Multan, Punjab, Pakistan. Attari, the Dawat-e-Islami spokesperson, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Limpongo, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

01/01/2018: Assailants set fire to Anchile company forest machinery in Monte Verde, Los Lagos, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: An assailant threw three explosive devices at the Bontola police headquarters in Makassar, South Sulawesi, Indonesia. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked residents in Ayilamo, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of six related incidents in Benue over a 24-hour period. At least 21 people were killed, 30 others were injured, and an unknown number of others were reported missing across the attacks. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in self-defense.
01/01/2018: An explosive device attached to a Ministry of Interior (MoI) vehicle was discovered and defused in Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: An assailant stabbed and killed Njabulo Dlamini, an African National Congress (ANC) ward councilor, in Richards Bay, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Balqalai, in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and three officers were injured in the ensuing clash In addition, the assailants sustained seven casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Malam Gambo Makama at his residence in Arak, Sanga, Kaduna, Nigeria. At least two people, including Makama, the Chief of Numana, and his pregnant wife, were killed and his son was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Fulani extremists.
01/01/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden vehicle in Khogyani, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/03/2018: Assailants abducted Hasan Jamal Iskandar, a civilian, in Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Iskandar was killed and his body was discovered on January 5, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/01/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Army soldiers at an armored vehicles base in Harasta, Damascus, Syria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash, which lasted until January 3, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Ahrar al-Sham.

01/01/2018: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked residents in Turan, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of six related incidents in Benue over a 24-hour period. At least 21 people were killed, 30 others were injured, and an unknown number of others were reported missing across the attacks. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in self-defense.

At least 21 people were killed, 30 others were injured, and an unknown number of others were reported missing across the attacks. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in self-defense.

01/02/2018: Assailants abducted five passengers traveling on Herat-Kabul highway in Herat, Afghanistan. One hostage, a police officer, was killed shortly after the abduction. The whereabouts of the remaining passengers are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/01/2018: Assailants armed with machetes attacked a civilian in Gidan Wurji, Awe, Nasarawa, Nigeria. The civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/01/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian along Awe-Tunga road in Awe, Nasarawa, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) patrol in Achin district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One United States soldier, Mihail Golin, was killed and four other soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/01/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at a Frontier Corps (FC) checkpoint in Parom, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/01/2018: Assailants shot and injured a Levies Forces officer in Tertaj, Awaran district, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/02/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at the residence of North Western Assistant Excise Commissioner Leslie Jayantha Ranaweera in Makandura, North Western, Sri Lanka. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in the the 5th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Three officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Army patrol in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of a police officer detonated in Albu Diab, Al Anbar, Iraq. The officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants abducted five Public Health Department employees engaged in a vaccination campaign in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the abduction to the Taliban, which denied responsibility.

01/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy between Barawe and Merca districts, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the blast resulted in any casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Alaa al-Din al-Salihi at a market in Askari neighborhood, Kirkuk, Iraq. Al-Salihi, an Iraqi Turkmen Front district head, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants fired mortars that landed at a mechanic shop between Arafah and Al-Amal ash-Shabi in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/02/2018: An explosive device detonated in Novotoshkivske, Luhansk, Ukraine. One soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan National Army (ANA) patrol in Dahno, Logar, Afghanistan. At least four people, including three soldiers and one civilian, were killed and one civilian was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers equipped with explosives-laden vehicles, attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces border crossing in Tall Safouk, Nineveh, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault, killing 18 assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 01/02/2018: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked residents in Tomatar, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of six related incidents in Benue over a 24-hour period. At least 21 people were killed, 30 others were injured, and an unknown number of others were reported missing across the attacks. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in self-defense.

01/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol along Elwak-Kotulo Road in Mandera county, Kenya. At least five police officers were killed in the assault. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

An unknown number of GSU officers were injured and a vehicle was set on fire in the assault. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ali Nur Shurte at his residence in Suuq Boocle area, Mogadishu, Somalia. Shurte, the father of the military court chair Colonel Hassan Ali Nur Shute, was killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier, identified as Colonel Muhammad Hasan, in Wadajir neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Three assailants, including a suicide bomber, opened fire on a Frontier Corps (FC) checkpost in Baleli neighborhood, Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. During the assault, one of the assailants detonated an explosives-laden jacket. At least two assailants were killed and five people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the blast and ensuing clash. The Taliban Special Group (TSG) faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/02/2018: A suicide bomber detonated behind an internally displaced persons (IDPs) camp in Dalori, Jere, Borno, Nigeria. The assailant was killed and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants abducted 31 loggers near Gamboru, Ngala, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the abduction to Boko Haram.

01/02/2018: Assailants attacked Tse Igbudu Taraka, Benue, Nigeria. There were a unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/02/2018: Assailants publicly executed five individuals by firing squad in Kuntuwarey, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and accused of the victims of spying for the Kenyan, Ethiopian, and Somali governments.

01/02/2018: Assailants stopped and set fire to a vehicle transporting coal in Chahar Awlia, Samangan, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/02/2018: An explosive device detonated at the residence of Ariana Haradinaj in Helsingborg, Skane, Sweden. Haradinaj, the daughter of a former Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA) commander, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/02/2018: Assailants attacked a military detachment in Cabuyoan, Mabini, Compostela Valley, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that Boko Haram was behind the attacks.

summary: 01/03/2018: An assailant shot and killed Abubakar Ustarkhanov, the local police chief, in Avtury, Chechnya, Russia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, officials identified the assailant as Khamzat Baimuradov. Baimuradov, who was suspected of aiding militants, was killed while attempting to evade arrest during a police operation.

Al-Qatrani, the head of the education authority in Al-Abyar, was shot and killed when he resisted and attempted to escape. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Room of the Neighbourhoods Youths and suspected that Al-Qatrani was targeted because of his candidacy for a parliamentary seat.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police officials arrested a Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) commander in connection with the attack.

01/03/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown location in South Sudan. This was one of three similar incidents in the southern part of the country on this date. At least six assailants were killed across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Front of India (PFI).
01/03/2018: An explosive device detonated as it was being planted near a mosque in Shaykh Uthman, Aden, Yemen. One assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Four people, including three police officers and one civilian, were killed and another civilian was injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. One police officer was killed and two officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated in Labu-Labu, Maguindanao, Philippines. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel at Mt. Firis, on the border of Datu Saudi-Ampatuan and Datu Unsay, Maguindanao, Philippines. A soldier, identified as Ian Chris Celeste, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

01/09/2018: Assailants set fire to two security cameras at a school in Ban Sai Mor, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related incidents in Ban Sai Mor overnight. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Daynile neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2018: Assailants attacked Ethiopian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) personnel near Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Rabbi Raziel Shevach along Route 60 near Havat Gilad, West Bank. Shevach was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

01/09/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at a pub in Drogheda, Louth, Ireland. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New Irish Republican Army in the attempted attack.

01/09/2018: Assailants set fire to a kosher grocery store in Creteil, Ile-de-France, France. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that anti-Semitic extremists carried out the attack and noted that anti-Semitic graffiti had been painted on the store the previous week.

01/09/2018: Assailants fired mortars at a church in Bab Touma neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. This was one of three projectile attacks in different Damascus neighborhoods on the same day. At least five people were killed and 30 other people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

01/09/2018: Assailants fired mortars that landed and detonated in Al Qassa neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. This was one of three projectile attacks in different Damascus neighborhoods on the same day. At least five people were killed and 30 other people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2018: Assailants fired mortars that landed and detonated in Al Shaghour neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. This was one of three projectile attacks in different Damascus neighborhoods on the same day. At least five people were killed and 30 other people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) convoy in Daman district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along Balidih-Kulhi road near Kulhi, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists and stated that the explosive device was intended to target police personnel.

01/09/2018: Assailants abducted ten Central African refugees from Zapayi, Bas-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

01/09/2018: Assailants planted an explosive device intended to target a police patrol at the Mambore-Mkokoni junction in Lamu county, Kenya. When the police vehicle avoided the explosive device, the assailants opened fire on the vehicle. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
01/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of a police general in Dakahlia governorate, Egypt. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at El Ghirba synagogue in Hara Sghira Er Riadh, Medenine, Tunisia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks targeting Jewish buildings on Djerba Island on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, four individuals were arrested and confessed to carrying out the attacks.

01/09/2018: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at a Jewish prayer hall and religious school near Hara Sghira Er Riadh, Medenine, Tunisia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks targeting Jewish buildings on Djerba Island on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, four individuals were arrested and confessed to carrying out the attacks.

01/09/2018: Assailants raided a road construction camp in Jamakana near Lanjigarh, Odisha, India. An unknown number of workers were briefly held hostage and seven construction vehicles were set on fire during the attack. Maoists claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the road construction project.

01/09/2018: Assailants raided a police camp in Awashuwa, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. Two police officers were abducted and killed, and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.

01/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy between Busar and Ceel Waaq in Ceel Waaq district, Gedo, Somalia. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/09/2018: Security forces identified and killed a suicide bomber targeting the governor’s residence in Paktika, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/09/2018: Security forces intercepted two assailants attempting to detonate an explosives-laden vehicle at the Industrial Neighborhood roundabout in Tripoli, Libya. The two assailants were arrested, and the vehicle was defused. The Tripoli Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 01/09/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at Zakori graveyard along Daraban Road in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in La Gaitana, Boyaca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of four related attacks against the Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline in the area on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Miramar, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of four related attacks against the Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline in the area on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of four related attacks against the Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline in the area on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in La Granada, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of four related attacks against the Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline in the area on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cusiana-Cupiagua oil pipeline in Plan Brisas, Casanare, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Colombian Navy post in Arauquita, Arauca, Colombia. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle near Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. A farmer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed a court employee along Al Ma'arid street in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and stopped several civilian vehicles along Al-Nakhla road between Abu Najim and Zamzam, Sirte, Libya. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants seized food in the attack. The Tripoli Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 01/10/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a Shabwah Elite Forces convoy in As Said district, Shabwah, Yemen. In addition to the assailant, at least three soldiers were killed and several soldiers were injured in the blast. Ansar Al-Sharia, a subgroup of Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Assailants equipped with grenades attacked a Hadramawt Elite Forces base in Dawan district, Hadramawt, Yemen. Four assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

01/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Muhammad Bakhsh at his residence in Nasirabad, Balochistan, Pakistan. Bakhsh, a former Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) commander, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Thahan Phran vehicle responding to a previous attack in Ban Sai Mor, Pattani, Thailand. At least nine rangers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Ban Sai Mor overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities arrested two people in connection with the attack.

01/10/2018: A sniper shot and killed a soldier, identified as Luis Guillermo Asencio Alape, in Puente Lipa, Arauca, Colombia. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police headquarters in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Assailants raided Imam Gharbi, Nineveh, Iraq. This was one of two related incidents targeting villages in Mosul district on this date. At least 12 assailants were killed as security forces repelled both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/10/2018: Assailants raided Kanus, Nineveh, Iraq. This was one of two related incidents targeting villages in Mosul district on this date. At least 12 assailants were killed as security forces repelled both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near supermarkets in Madain, Diyala, Iraq. One person was killed and five people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 25 explosive devices in Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/10/2018: An explosive device attached to a police officer's vehicle detonated in Taleeh area, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab carried out the attack.

01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Abshir Karan in Huriwa neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Karan, the deputy district commissioner, was not harmed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Haji Mohib, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks targeting ALP checkpoints in the area on this date. Five ALP officers were killed and two officers were injured across both attacks; the assailants also sustained an undetermined number of casualties in the clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Chahar Qulfan, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Amir Muhammad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks targeting ALP checkpoints in the area on this date. Five ALP officers were killed and two officers were injured across both attacks; the assailants also sustained an undetermined number of casualties in the clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/10/2018: Security forces intercepted three suicide bombers in Gamboru, Ngala, Borno, Nigeria. Two of the assailants were shot and killed by military personnel when they refused to remove their explosive vests and a third assailant was intercepted and arrested. The undetonated vests were safely defused. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.

01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated in Aabko, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Syrian Army weapons depot in Slinfah, Lattakia, Syria. At least three soldiers were killed in the blast. The Abu Amarah Battalion claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed an explosives-rigged house in Adhaim, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Tomas Lucena in Velera, Trujillo, Venezuela. Lucena, a Constituent National Assembly member, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, officials attributed the attack to right-wing extremists and suspected that the victim was targeted for his support of President Nicolas Maduro.

01/00/2018: Sometime between January 7, 2018 and January 13, 2018, an explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. Saad Hadi Al-Mashrafawi, an Al-Shabab News Agency photojournalist, was killed as a result of the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Maulvi Mukhtar Ahmad Haqqani, a religious scholar, in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Rashtriya Rifles patrol in Kamalkote, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/10/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of villages near Mayo Moskota, Extreme-North, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Frontier Corps (FC) checkpoint in Khuzdar, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
01/10/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Kohlu, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Muhammad al-Muhammadi, the Hit district council head, and Asmaa Osama Abdul Rahman, an Al Anbar provincial councilor, at a soccer stadium in Al-Qadisiyyah, Al Anbar, Iraq. Al-Muhammadi and Abdul Rahman were unharmed; however, at least five people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/11/2018: An explosive device detonated in Kurki, Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. A civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: An assailant driving an explosives-laden vehicle surrendered at a military checkpoint near Abu Qurayn, Misrata, Libya. The assailant stated that he had previously been abducted by the Tripoli Province of the Islamic State and instructed to carry out a suicide attack against the checkpoint.
gname: Tripoli Province of the Islamic State

summary: 01/11/2018: Assailants attacked Malagakit, North Cotabato, Philippines. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. This was one of two attacks in this area on the same night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

01/11/2018: Assailants attacked a Vulcano Task Force military base in El Tarra district, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

01/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Libertadores neighborhood, Arauca, Colombia. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
01/11/2018: An explosive device detonated outside stores near Nahrawan, Diyala, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) patrol along the Afghan border in Sarobi, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. At least one officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/14/2018: An explosive device planted in Mohammed Hamdan's vehicle detonated in Sidon, South, Lebanon. Hamdan, a senior Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) official, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, an assailant, identified as Ahmad Baytiyah, was arrested in connection with the attack.

01/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting an Operation Barkhane military convoy between Menaka and Indelimane in Menaka district, Menaka, Mali. The assailant was killed and three French soldiers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the incident; additionally, sources attributed the attack to Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 01/11/2018: Assailants detonated explosive devices and opened fire on a Malian Army patrol in Hombori, Mopti, Mali. At least three soldiers were injured in the attack. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: An assailant disguised as a National Uprising Movement (NUM) member opened fire on a United States soldier and interpreter after luring them to a meeting in Achin district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least one NUM member was killed and one United States soldier was injured in the attack. Additionally, 13 assailants were killed in an ensuing airstrike. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/11/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile targeting a military camp in Najran region, Saudi Arabia. No casualties were reported as the missile was intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Kolofata, Mayo-Sava, Extreme-North, Cameroon. Three civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. In addition, two civilians were abducted and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of two attacks on civilians in Mayo-Sava on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/11/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Ashigashiya, Mayo-Sava, Extreme-North, Cameroon. One civilian was killed and one other was injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks on civilians in Mayo-Sava on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

01/11/2018: Assailants abducted a police officer, identified as MDL Balla Bagayogo, and set fire to a police station in Lere, Timbuktu, Mali. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/11/2018: Assailants fired mortars targeting the presidential palace at Villa Somalia in Mogadishu, Somalia. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of three related incidents in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

01/11/2018: Assailants abducted more than 30 Central African refugees from Zapayi, Bas-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

01/11/2018: Assailants fired mortars that struck Warta Nabada neighborhood in Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of three related incidents in Mogadishu on this date. At least one person was killed and four people were injured across two of the attacks. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/11/2018: Assailants fired mortars that struck Sheikh Sufi Cemetery in Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of three related incidents in Mogadishu on this date. At least one person was killed and four people were injured across two of the attacks. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

01/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Drobonso, Ashanti, Ghana. Two police officers were killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/11/2018: Assailants attempted to attack Bulacaon, Pigcawayan, North Cotabato, Philippines. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in this area on the same night. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
01/11/2018: Assailants threw a pipe bomb at Rachel's Tomb in Bethlehem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb into a residence in Dungannon, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, three suspects were arrested in connection with the incident.

01/11/2018: Assailants attacked Wun Rok village in Twic, South Sudan. At least seven people, including four police officers, were killed and five people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to supporters of General Paul Malong Awan Anei, the former Sudan People’s Liberation Army (SPLA) chief of staff.

01/11/2018: Assailants attacked Maryam Al-Tayeb, a social activist and blogger, in Bab al-Aziziyah area, Tripoli, Libya. Al-Tayeb was abducted and beaten before being released a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bab Tajura Brigade.
01/11/2018: An explosive device detonated in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. A child was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/11/2018: An explosive device was discovered and safely detonated at a public shelter in Old Town, Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom. Individuals Tending Toward Savagery claimed claimed responsibility for the incident. Nikolaos Karvounakis pleaded guilty for his involvement in the attack and claimed to be a member of Individuals Tending Toward Savagery, describing himself as a "lover of nihilist anti-political violence."

01/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on worshippers at the Shaykh Abd-al-Qadir al-Kilani Mosque in Shorsh, Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. One person was killed and another person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a produce stall in Wahda neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. One civilian was killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a fish stall in Bawi, Diyala, Iraq. One person was killed and four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of a Ministry of Health employee detonated in Shabab neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. The employee was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at an Iraqi Turkmen Front party headquarters in Hayy al Askari neighborhood, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Pakistani Police constable near Landi Kotal Roundabout in North Nazimabad neighborhood, Karachi, Pakistan. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

01/12/2018: An explosive device, targeting two electricity pylons, was discovered and defused in La Concha, Antioquia, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

01/13/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of military and police posts in Ghorak district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Twenty-seven people, including four soldiers and 23 assailants, were killed and two security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

01/12/2018: Assailants abducted three civilians in Toukoumaya, near Waza, Extreme-North, Cameroon. All three hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered in Nigeria later the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram.
01/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police post in Keegam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: Assailants attacked Dangaji village in Birnin Gwari, Kaduna state, Nigeria. One person was killed, an unknown number of people were injured, and houses were set on fire in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Birnin Gwari on this night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/12/2018: Assailants attacked Ungwan Gajere village in Birnin Gwari, Kaduna state, Nigeria. Nine people were killed, an unknown number of people were injured, and houses were set on fire in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in Birnin Gwari on this night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

01/12/2018: Assailants set fire to an incendiary device at the Santa Isabel de Hungria Parish in Estacion Central neighborhood, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting churches in Santiago on this date. Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the incidents in pamphlets left at the scene, which threatened Pope Francis's upcoming visit to Chile and expressed discontent with perceived domination over people's bodies, ideas, and acts. Officials also suspected that the Lautaro Youth Movement may have carried out the attacks.

01/12/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device at the Emanuel Chapel in Recoleta neighborhood, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting churches in Santiago on this date. Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the incidents in pamphlets left at the scene, which threatened Pope Francis's upcoming visit to Chile and expressed discontent with perceived domination over people's bodies, ideas, and acts. Officials also suspected that the Lautaro Youth Movement may have carried out the attacks.

01/12/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device at the Cristo Vencedor Chapel in Penalolen neighborhood, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting churches in Santiago on this date. Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the incidents in pamphlets left at the scene, which threatened Pope Francis's upcoming visit to Chile and expressed discontent with perceived domination over people's bodies, ideas, and acts. Officials also suspected that the Lautaro Youth Movement may have carried out the attacks.

01/12/2018: Assailants attempted to set fire to an incendiary device at the Cristo Pobre Shrine in Quinta Normal neighborhood, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties as the device failed to ignite. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting churches in Santiago on this date. Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the incidents in pamphlets left at the scene, which threatened Pope Francis's upcoming visit to Chile and expressed discontent with perceived domination over people's bodies, ideas, and acts. Officials also suspected that the Lautaro Youth Movement may have carried out the attacks.

01/12/2018: Assailants attempted to set fire to an incendiary device at the Jesus Maestro Church in Estacion Central neighborhood, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties as the device failed to ignite. This was one of five coordinated attacks targeting churches in Santiago on this date. Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the incidents in pamphlets left at the scene, which threatened Pope Francis's upcoming visit to Chile and expressed discontent with perceived domination over people's bodies, ideas, and acts. Officials also suspected that the Lautaro Youth Movement may have carried out the attacks.

01/12/2018: Assailants raided a civilian residence in Al-Sadiyah village near Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three people, including a volunteer fighter, were killed and another person was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/12/2018: Assailants attacked and killed a civilian in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victim of being a spy.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 01/12/2018: Assailants stopped vehicles and abducted at least 11 people, including Radio Television Graben Beni director Jadot Mangwengwe, near Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least three hostages, including Mangwengwe, were released on January 20, 2018. The fate of the remaining eight hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

01/12/2018: A suicide bomber detonated prematurely in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, two people were killed and six were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/12/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Joyee Begum, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on the same night. At least nine police officers were killed and eight police officers were injured across both attacks. The assailants sustained and unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

In addition, the Taliban claimed responsibility but later denied taking part in the attack. Authorities also attributed the incident to the Haqqani Network.

01/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of a tribal leader identified as Sheikh Turky al-Nadawi in Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. Al-Nadawi and his brother were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/28/2018: An explosives-rigged house detonated in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. One police officer was killed and nine officers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 01/28/2018: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of the campaign chief for Russian presidential candidate Ksenia Sobchak in Pskov, Russia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least one NNPC worker was killed in the attack and an unknown number were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.
01/28/2018: Assailants shot and injured a civilian at his residence in Ballymurphy, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
01/28/2018: Assailants shot and injured a civilian at his residence along Upper Meadow Street in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/28/2018: Two assailants, dressed in Israeli Defense Forces uniforms and carrying firebombs packed with shrapnel, were stopped and detained as they attempted to enter the Jewish community of Itamar in the West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

There were an unknown number of casualties, people were reported missing, and 73 cattle were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Rajput extremists. Additionally, sources suspected that the attack was carried out to disrupt a screening of the controversial film "Padmaavat."

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police identified and arrested five members of Sanatan Sanstha in connection with the attack. The group denied affiliation with those arrested. In addition, sources suspected that the attack was carried out to disrupt a screening of the controversial film "Padmaavat."

Adi, a local government chair, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar incidents in Taraba overnight. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

Following the blast, additional assailants attacked the base. There were an unknown number of casualties in the blast and the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham and Ahrar al-Sham. Sources also attributed the incident to the Al-Rahman Corps of the Free Syrian Army, which denied involvement.

The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities doubted the veracity of this claim and instead attributed the attack to both the Haqqani Network and the Taliban.

02/01/2018: Assailants attacked Shimba village in Shimba, Song, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least two people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/01/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Wurojam, Gassol, Taraba, Nigeria. At least six people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/01/2018: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Ferat Kocak in Neukolln, Berlin, Germany. Kocak, a left-wing politician, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities arrested Sebastian T. and Tilo P. in connection with the incident. Authorities also noted that the arson was an extreme right motivated violation.

02/01/2018: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of a left-wing bookshop owner in Neukolln, Berlin, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities arrested Sebastian T. and Tilo P. in connection with the incident. Authorities also noted that the arson was an extreme right motivated violation.
02/01/2018: Assailants threw a sound bomb into a coffee shop in Muhaylah, Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/02/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Saba al-Bor, Saladin, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/02/2018: Assailants launched grenades at a police station in Guayana City, Bolivar, Venezuela. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: Assailants launched a missile at Marib city, Marib, Yemen. The missile was intercepted by the coalition missile defense system. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/02/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at a Frontier Corps (FC) checkpost in Sheikh Wasil, Balochistan, Pakistan. Aside from the death of the assailant, at least two soldiers were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/02/2018: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Cherli, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and five people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/02/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Colonel Farah Isse Samatar detonated in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Samatar, a senior Puntland Security Force (PSF) officer, was killed in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Tahir Mus'ad al-'Uqlah between Qatabah and Sanah, Ad Dali, Yemen. Al-'Uqlah, a 33rd Armored Brigade commander, was not harmed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/02/2018: Assailants detonated explosives at a train station in Zillah, Jufra, Libya. There were an unknown number of casualties in the blast. The Fezzan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/02/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms and machetes raided Kitevya, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least three people were killed and a health center was looted during the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/02/2018: Assailants attacked Intelligence Response Team (IRT) operatives in an attempt to abduct a white foreign national in Toto, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least one IRT operative was killed and two other people were injured in the incident. The kidnapping attempt was unsuccessful. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/02/2018: Assailants in Turkey fired rockets that landed and detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least one Anadolu Agency journalist, identified as Sarp Ozer, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/02/2018: Assailants in Syria fired a rocket that struck a house in Bayir neighborhood, Reyhanli, Hatay, Turkey. This was one of three rocket attacks in Reyhanli on this date. At least two people were killed and six people were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/02/2018: Assailants in Syria fired a rocket that landed near a market in Reyhanli, Hatay, Turkey. This was one of three rocket attacks in Reyhanli on this date. At least two people were killed and six people were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/02/2018: Assailants in Syria fired a rocket that struck an office in Reyhanli, Hatay, Turkey. This was one of three rocket attacks in Reyhanli on this date. At least two people were killed and six people were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/02/2018: Assailants in Syria fired a rocket that landed along Ali Metin Dirimtekin Street in Kilis, Turkey. At least three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Matiullah in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Matiullah, the Imambargah Hazrat Abbas caretaker, was killed and another person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ-Pakistan).

02/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mohammad Taimur Baloch at the Tank bus stand in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Baloch, a Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ-Pakistan) activist, was killed and another person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/03/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Zaidan, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Batagund, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Four people, including two CRPF officers and two civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at a Pakistan Army camp in Kabal, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 11 soldiers were killed and 13 other soldiers were injured in the blast. The Taliban Special Group (TSG) faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/03/2018: Assailants set fire to 10 road construction vehicles in Maded, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Maoists.

02/03/2018: Assailants abducted Sitaram Bagde, an assistant police constable, in Kachalaram, Chhattisgarh, India. Bagde was killed and his body was discovered the following morning. This was one of two incidents in the area carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Maoists.

02/03/2018: Assailants abducted Manoj Padium, a road contractor employee, from his residence in Gatam, Chhattisgarh, India. Padium was shot and killed shortly after the kidnapping; additionally, his niece was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/03/2018: Assailants stopped a passenger bus near Kachalaram, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants forced passengers to disembark before setting fire to the bus. This was one of two incidents in the area carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Maoists.

02/03/2018: Assailants attacked Yegoua, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least two people were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/03/2018: Assailants attempted to attack oil pipelines at the Al-Dahra oilfield near Zillah, Jufra, Libya. At least five people, including two assailants and three soldiers, were killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Fezzan Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 02/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Dal-biyaano, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least four people, including two assailants and two soldiers, were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Lieutenant Colonel Moeen al-Shamsi in Qatabah, Ad Dali, Yemen. Al-Shamsi, a Yemeni Army commander and the head of the popular resistance in Damnt district, and one aide were killed and five people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: A suicide bomber equipped with an explosives-laden vest and a grenade attempted to attack a military headquarters in Qala-i-Naw, Badghis, Afghanistan. The assailant threw the grenade, but security forces shot and killed him before he could detonate his vest. Three soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: Assailants attacked a Freedom Party of Afghanistan office in Faizabad, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three guards of the office were killed and three other people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: An assailant opened fire targeting African civilians in a two-hour drive-by shooting spree in Macerata, Marche, Italy. Six African nationals from Nigeria, Ghana, Mali, and the Gambia were injured in the assault. Additionally, the assailant shot at a Democratic Party office during the attack. Luca Traini, a Neo-Fascist, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in retaliation for the death of an Italian woman by a Nigerian seeking asylum in Italy. At the time of his arrest, Traini also shouted "Viva Italia" and "Italy for Italians" while making a fascist salute.

02/03/2018: Assailants armed with a shoulder-launched missile shot down a Russian Air Force Sukhoi 25SM Fighter Jet on patrol over Murrat al-Numan, Idlib, Syria. After the pilot landed on the ground, he was able to shoot two assailants before detonating a grenade on himself to avoid capture. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for Russian airstrikes in Idlib.

02/03/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Farah Rud, Farah, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and six others were wounded in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Niaz Mohammad, the Pushto Koh district prosecutor, in Farah, Afghanistan. Two assailants were also killed when police responded. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/03/2018: Assailants set fire to St. Prince Volodymyr's Church in Lviv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

01/31/2018: Assailants fired projectiles at a Tatmadaw battalion in Mogaung, Kachin, Myanmar. At least 24 people were injured in the ensuing clash, which lasted until February 3, 2018. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties. The Kachin Independence Army (KIA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack aimed to disrupt military operations in the area.
02/03/2018: An explosive device detonated on a bridge near a police station in Bursa province, Turkey. A police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on joint police personnel in Tippapuram, Telangana, India. One police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/03/2018: Assailants raided a road construction site in Contulmo district, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties; however, two buildings and seven construction vehicles were set on fire in the attack. Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the release of Mapuche political prisoners.

02/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers in Azare, Hawul, Borno, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
02/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Deou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/03/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated an explosive device near Nengmandal, Meghalaya, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Garo National Liberation Army in the attempted attack.

02/03/2018: Assailants launched a missile at a border post in Kilis, Turkey. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Protection Units (YPG).

02/04/2018: Assailants shot and killed a local mayor near his residence in Asakirah, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

This was one of two related incidents at Hammud's residence on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attacks.

summary: 02/04/2018: Assailants fired a mortar at the residence of Khalaf Husayn Hammud, a Hawijah district councilor, in Madinah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. summary: 02/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military colonel in Saba al-Bor, Saladin, Iraq. Three people, including the colonel and two family members, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle south of Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Sinai Province of the Islamic State carried out the attack.

The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of recruiting people to join militias.

This was one of two related attacks that took place in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

summary: 02/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Pakistani Police patrol in Duki, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/04/2018: Two assailants threw Molotov cocktails at the Society of Hungarian Culture of Transcarpathia office in Uzhhorod, Zakarpattia, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties, but the office was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities identified the assailants as members of the Falanga group.

02/04/2018: Assailants attacked a Ugandan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in the KM-60 area in Merca district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if there were any casualties in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related incidents targeting AMISOM bases in Merca district on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

Additionally, three people were abducted; one hostage was later killed, and the fate of the remaining two hostages is unknown. This was one of two incidents targeting police stations in Bolivar on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/04/2018: Assailants attacked civilians about 12 kilometers outside of Alau-Kofa, Borno, Nigeria. At least two people were killed and one person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/04/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct construction engineers in Tala Wa Barfak district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and three were injured when police responded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Chinese nationals in Clifton neighborhood, Karachi, Pakistan. One Chinese national was killed and a passerby was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/05/2018: Assailants attacked and killed the village head of Esukutan locality, in Toko, South-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
