02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Latifiyah, Babil, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2018: Assailants equipped with explosives-laden vehicles attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces border post in Tall Safouk, Nineveh, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault, resulting in an unknown number of assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/06/2018: Assailants threw two grenades at an Assam Rifles (AR) transit camp in Imphal, Manipur, India. Nine soldiers were injured in the blasts. The Manipur People's Army (MPA), a subgroup of the United National Liberation Front (UNLF), claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel escorting prisoners at the Shri Maharaja Hari Singh (SMHS) Hospital in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two police officers were killed and one prisoner escaped during the attack. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in order to free Mohammad Naveed Jatt, a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) member.

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Territorial Defense Volunteers (TDV) personnel escorting teachers near Siya School in Bangoi, Yala, Thailand. At least three people, including a defense volunteer and two civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/06/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian outside a mosque in Daynile neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two attacks in Daynile neighborhood carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Al-Shabaab.

02/06/2018: Assailants shot and killed two people, including a soldier, in Daynile neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two attacks in Daynile neighborhood carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Al-Shabaab.

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated in a neighborhood in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in Bosaso on this date; this first blast was intended to draw first responders to the scene. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel responding to a previous attack in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. At least one police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in Bosaso on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

02/06/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police station in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. At least three police officers, including the deputy police commander, were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan, Somalia. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least two people, including one soldier and one civilian, were killed in the assault and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/06/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden vehicle in Baghe-e Kohna, Herat, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated outside a Ministry of National Defense office in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted near Beledweyne, Hiiraan, Somalia. One assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers along Gbajimba-Iyiodeh road, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.

02/06/2018: A suicide bomber surrendered to police officers instead of carrying out an attack in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/06/2018: Assailants entered a village and threatened residents in Langgawisan, Maragusan, Compostela Valley, Philippines. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. Some residents, including leaders and teachers, were held hostage during the incident. The outcome of the hostage-taking is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
02/06/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle was discovered and defused near the Russian Embassy in Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/06/2018: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices in a school in Kukukala, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.

02/06/2018: Assailants seized a wheat truck in Pashtun Zarghun district, Herat, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated near soldiers in Quezon district, Bukidnon, Philippines. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the soldiers. At least six soldiers were injured in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the harassment of people by soldiers in the area.

02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated in Jazirat ar Ramadi neighborhood in Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Jisr Diyala neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Husseinia neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/06/2018: Assailants shot and killed Ali Yilmaz, an Al-Nasr Alliance parliamentary candidate, in Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on a border outpost in Mandali, Diyala, Iraq. Two border guards were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle near Tuz Khormato, Saladin, Iraq. Three soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2018: Security forces identified and killed a female suicide bomber at a school in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

02/07/2018: Assailants set fire to a backhoe at a quarry site in Purok 4, New Ilocos, Davao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People’s Army (NPA).

02/06/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the burial site of Aysha Belniran, the mother of Muammar Qaddafi, near Jarv, Sirte, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel along Faqeer Baba Street in Kandahar, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated in Jori, Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on Frontier Corps (FC) soldiers fetching water in Hoshab, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the assault. The Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at a Pakistan Army vehicle in Idak, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near the vehicle of Malik Farooq in Hilal Khel, Nawagai subdistrict, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. Farooq, a tribal elder, was killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a convoy of a military commander in Inma neighborhood, Aden, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2018: Assailants launched rockets and mortars into residential areas in Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least four people were killed and 11 people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/06/2018: Assailants attacked police personnel in Akhtar, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least four police commanders were killed and four officers were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Khanqi, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least three people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/07/2018: Assailants established a checkpoint and stopped civilians in Islam Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
02/07/2018: Assailants shot and killed Lieutenant Farhan Barkhad, a Somali National Army (SNA) commander, in Hodan neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/07/2018: Assailants threw a pipe bomb at a residence in Lenadoon area in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2018: An assailant stabbed an Israeli security guard at the entrance of Karmei Tzur, West Bank. The guard, identified as Boris Balbrava, was injured in the attack, and the assailant was shot and killed by another security guard. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant, Hamza Zamareh, as a Palestinian extremist.

02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel in Narayanpur district, Chhattisgarh, India. One police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Sundarbani, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Six people, including three soldiers and three porters, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/07/2018: Assailants attacked Mowe, Loburo, Ogun, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/07/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Maqbanah district, Taizz, Yemen. At least 12 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/07/2018: Assailants abducted Susan Magara, a civilian, in Kampala, Central, Uganda. Magara was found dead on February 27, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
02/08/2018: An explosive device detonated along the road in Ar Radwaniyah, Babil, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/08/2018: Assailants opened fire at a cafe in Bakhtiyari, Diyala, Iraq. At least seven people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle at a joint police and Iraqi Volunteer Forces checkpoint in Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, one volunteer fighter was killed and 10 people, including civilians and security personnel, were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/08/2018: Assailants equipped with mortars and sniper rifles opened fire in Ab'ar neighborhood, Taizz, Yemen. At least two people, including human rights activist Riham al-Badir, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/08/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) checkpoint in Berta Adan Serar area near Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and several soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on joint police and military vehicles in Alamjar, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and a soldier was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on a female police sergeant at her residence in Maymana, Faryab, Afghanistan. The sergeant was killed and her child was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/08/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2018: An explosive device detonated in Noroz, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least three people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Tsukwa, Anyiin, Benue State, Nigeria. Three civilians were killed and three more were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on the car of Dr. Chris Ekiyor, former president of the Ijaw Youth Council, along East-West road, Unenurhie, Delta, Nigeria. Seven people were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/08/2018: Assailants attacked an Administration Police (AP) Special Forces camp in Kutulo, Wajir, Kenya. Three assailants were killed as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/08/2018: Security forces successfully repelled an attack in Azege, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/08/2018: Assailants equipped with sharp weapons and firearms attacked Hinga Madkami at his residence in Phulpar, Chhattisgarh, India. Madkami, a police informant and former Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) member, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

02/08/2018: Assailants attempted to attack the Bailadila mines near Bacheli, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/08/2018: Assailants fired rockets into Al-Aridhah, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Three children were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
02/09/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Haswah, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Nahrawan, Diyala, Iraq. One civilian was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2018: Assailants attacked the Iraqi Volunteer Forces border crossing in Tall Safouk, Nineveh, Iraq. There were no reported casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

02/09/2018: An explosive device detonated on a cricket field in the Chahardehi, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Three people were killed and two were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2018: An assailant stabbed Roger Singaravelu at his residence in Mill Park neighborhood, Melbourne, JVictoria, Australia. Singaravelu, who had served as a homestay host to the assailant, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities arrested and charged Momena Shoma in connection with the attack and stated that Shoma was inspired by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

02/09/2018: An explosive device detonated against a minibus between Dera and Konna, Mopti, Mali. At least four people were killed and 18 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/08/2018: An explosive device detonated in Spin Wam, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. At least one child was killed and another child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/08/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Dozak, Farah, Afghanistan. Eight assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/08/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near an Army checkpoint in Lasang, Bunawan, Davao del Sur, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/09/2018: Assailants attacked a National Directorate of Security (NDS) checkpost in Surkh Doz, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least six NDS personnel were killed and five people, including NDS personnel and police officers, were injured in the attack. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

Al-Saad, a Palestinian Joint Security Forces commander, was not harmed; however, at least one bystander was killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bilal Badr Group.

02/09/2018: Assailants abducted Taru Tana, a National Highway contractor, from his residence in Goju, Arunachal Pradesh, India. Tana was injured in captivity and was released on February 12, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM) carried out the attack.

02/09/2018: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Lal Jan Tamir, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/09/2018: Assailants set fire to the residence of Sani Muhammad in Bauchi, Nigeria. Muhammad, a former People's Democratic Party (PDP) North East publicity secretary, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four arson attacks in Bauchi on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/09/2018: Assailants set fire to the residence of Alhaji Sule Milo in Salmanu, Bauchi, Nigeria. Milo, a former Secretary to the State Government personal assistant, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four arson attacks in Bauchi on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/09/2018: Assailants set fire to the poultry farm of Alhaji Abdullahi in Bauchi, Nigeria. Abdullahi, a former aide to Governor Yuguda on Security, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four arson attacks in Bauchi on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/09/2018: Assailants set fire to the residence of a People’s Democratic Party (PDP) chieftain in Bauchi, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four arson attacks in Bauchi on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/09/2018: Assailants raided Kabikokole, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 50 people, including a nurse, were abducted and a health center was looted during the attack. At least 10 victims were sexually assaulted before being released a short time later; the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at the Zer Tepe military base in Cukurca district, Hakkari, Turkey. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

02/09/2018: Assailants fired a rocket that struck a house in Tha'aban neighborhood, Taizz, Yemen. At least two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/09/2018: Assailants attacked hunters in an area 100 kilometers west of Obo, Haut-Mbomou, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants stole food and ammunition during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated against a vehicle along Qarah Tapah-Azim road near Kasbah, Diyala, Iraq. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a family at their residence in Al-Jumhuriyah area in Dujail, Saladin, Iraq. Two people were killed and six people were injured in the assault. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Dujail on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/10/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated targeting police personnel responding to an earlier attack in Dujail, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Dujail on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

At least 10 people, including three assailants, six soldiers, and one civilian, were killed and nine people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the ensuing clashes that continued until February 11, 2018. The Afzal Guru Squad, a subgroup of Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM), and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting the Amarillo Bridge in La Mata, Cesar, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, though the bridge was damaged in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/10/2018: Assailants stopped a vehicle and detonated an explosive device along the highway in Boqueron, Cesar, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, though the road was damaged in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in the area on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/09/2018: Assailants abducted five Turkmen civilians in Hlewa, Saladin, Iraq. The five hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered the following day on February 10, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Volunteer Forces patrol in Arab Ebjur neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. Two volunteer fighters were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants attempted to attack an Iraqi Volunteer Forces checkpoint in Albu Bakr, Diyala, Iraq. An unknown number of assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/09/2018: Assailants attacked a police headquarters in Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault and arrested three assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
02/09/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Ghani Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces outpost in Jillam Albu Ajil neighborhood, Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. Three volunteer fighters were killed and two fighters were injured in the assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near the 22nd Mechanized Brigade headquarters in Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. There were no report casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a National Army of Colombia outpost in Quebrada Seca, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) and Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

02/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on military positions and raided Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least three civilians were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/09/2018: Assailants threw grenades at the residence of Mohamed Abukar Jafar in Hawl Wadag neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Jafar, a National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) official and the former Hawl Wadag district commissioner, was not harmed; however, two civilians were killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on Dakula Guillermo Tiambong in Camp Edward, Alegria, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. Tiambong, a tribal leader and farmer, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the New People's Army (NPA).

At least 16 NDS personnel were killed in the attack. The assailants also sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least four police officers were abducted and a vehicle was destroyed. Two officers were found unharmed, one officer was killed, and the fate of the remaining officer is unknown. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incidents and demanded that the government pursue hydropower projects using Nepali companies and labor.

This was one of three coordinated bombings targeting hydropower projects on this date. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incidents and demanded that the government pursue hydropower projects using Nepali companies and labor.

02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at the powerhouse of the Arun-III Hydropower Project in Diding, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three coordinated bombings targeting hydropower projects on this date. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incidents and demanded that the government pursue hydropower projects using Nepali companies and labor.
02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. One person was killed and three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at the entrance to a carnival in Oruro, Bolivia. Eight people were killed in the blast. Additionally, at least 60 people were injured between this incident and a similar bombing on February 13, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/10/2018: Assailants set fire to four forestry machines in La Fortuna, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on commuters in Zangwra, Miango, Plateau, Nigeria. Three civilians were killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/10/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated at a house in Marjah, Helmand, Afghanistan. An unknown number of police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/10/2018: Assailants shot down a Turkish Air Forces T129 ATAK Helicopter over Rajo, Aleppo, Syria. At least two crew members were killed in the attack. The People's Protection Units (YPG) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants shelled Salh neighborhood in Taizz, Yemen. An unknown number of civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/10/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Qatabah district, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least 12 people, including 10 assailants and two soldiers, were killed as security forces repelled the assault. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/10/2018: Authorities identified and arrested a suicide bomber in Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants took Roland Perequitte hostage in Cagawasan, Bukidnon, Philippines. Perequitte, the local village chief, was released at a later time. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
02/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 16 explosive devices in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/10/2018: Assailants stopped a Violet Organization bus and abducted an unknown number of relief workers in Idlib, Syria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Sawaid Al-Khayr.

02/11/2018: Assailants equipped with explosive devices raided a Sufi almshouse in Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, but an imam was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the targeted imam, identified as Saeed Hamid, of sorcery.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/11/2018: Two female suicide bombers were identified by Borno State police officers near a checkpoint in Dikwa, Borno, Nigeria. Both assailants were shot and killed by the officers. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

This was one of two related bombings targeting tollbooths in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the Gamarra tollbooth between Gamarra and Aguachica, Cesar, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related bombings targeting tollbooths in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/11/2018: Assailants stopped and set fire to a tractor-trailer in Socorro, Antioquia, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related arson attacks in Antioquia on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

At least one person, identified as district officer Adun Minsen, was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Yamu within a 10-minute period. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/11/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near an automatic teller machine (ATM) along Tha Sadet Road in Taluban, Pattani, Thailand. This was one of three related incidents in Taluban in which four explosive devices were defused. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

02/11/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated prematurely as assailants were driving it in Dahana Jawal, Farah, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
02/11/2018: An explosive device detonated at a market in Wadh, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/11/2018: Assailants stopped and set fire to a Transflorida passenger bus between Miranda and Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. Four people, including the church's priest, were injured in the assault before the assailant was shot and injured by police forces. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources stated that the assailant, Suliyono, had attempted to join the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in Syria.

At least one assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

summary: 02/11/2018: An assailant attempted to throw a Molotov cocktail at the United States Embassy in Seoul, South Korea. The assailant lit the device but dropped it into a bag with nine other incendiary devices, setting the bag on fire. The assailant then attempted to flee but was arrested at the scene. An unaffiliated individual claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the United States, which "has bullied South Korea and me."

02/11/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at Time Plaza in Idlib, Syria. At least seven people were killed and 30 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/11/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near a payphone in Taluban, Sai Buri, Pattani, Thailand. This was one of three related incidents in Taluban in which four explosive devices were defused. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

02/11/2018: Two explosive devices were discovered and defused along the riverbank in Taluban, Sai Buri, Pattani, Thailand. This was one of three related incidents in Taluban in which four explosive devices were defused. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

Three people, including the two assailants and one CRPF officer, were killed and another CRPF officer was injured in the ensuing clash that continued until February 13, 2018. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

Rather, a Power Development Department clerk and an All Parties Hurriyat Conference (APHC) activist, was killed in the attack. Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out to deter Hurriyat parties from practicing secularism.

The assailants then opened fire on military personnel responding to the attack, killing one soldier. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

summary: 02/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle responding to an earlier attack in Farhatiyah, Saladin, Iraq. 02/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Latifiyah, Babil, Iraq. Four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/14/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted at an NCell telecommunications tower in Bhaktapur, Province 3, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

02/13/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an NCell telecommunications tower in Sudal, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/14/2018: Assailants attacked a Cantar truck and indiscriminately opened fire in Birane market in Birane, Zamfara, Nigeria. At least 18 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/14/2018: Assailants shot and injured Maulvi Talib, a cleric, in Hath Chhoya, Uttar Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/14/2018: Assailants stabbed and poured petrol on a Nigerian civilian in Rustenberg, North West, South Africa. The victim was injured in the assault, but police intervened before he could be set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the attack was xenophobic in nature.

02/14/2018: An assailant armed with a semi-automatic rifle entered Building 12 at Stoneman Douglas High School and opened fire on students and teachers in Parkland, Florida, United States. At least 17 people were killed and 17 other people were injured in the assault. The assailant escaped the building and was arrested a few hours later. Authorities identified the assailant as Nikolas Cruz, noting that he possessed "racist, homophobic and anti-Semitic views." and that he had etched swastikas into his ammunition magazines.
02/14/2018: An explosive device detonated near street markets in Amil area, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in Al-Furat neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of the Duwarah mayor detonated in Hit, Al Anbar, Iraq. The mayor was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated in Kohlu district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/15/2018: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces personnel near Tall Safouk, Nineveh, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault, killing an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Territorial Defense Volunteers (TDV) patrol escorting teachers and schoolchildren near Pracha Uthit School in Bannang Sareng, Yala, Thailand. At least six people, including three defense volunteers and three children, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: Assailants attacked a farm owned by President Laurent Kabila in Kabasha, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with Republican Guard forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Mazembe Militia.

02/15/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Waberi neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. The driver of the vehicle was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab may have carried out the attack.

02/15/2018: Security forces discovered and defused four explosive devices planted underneath La Rocha bridge between Yopal district and Sogamoso district, Boyaca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/15/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas oil pipeline in Cubugon, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, though the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Tugas, Patikul, Sulu, Philippines. At least one soldier and two assailants were killed and two soldiers were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

02/15/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an oil well in Aguazul district, Casanare, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated bombings targeting oil wells at the Cupiagua-Recetor camp on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/15/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting an oil well in Aguazul district, Casanare, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated bombings targeting oil wells at the Cupiagua-Recetor camp on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
02/14/2018: A suicide bomber driving an explosives-laden motorcycle was identified and arrested in Zhar Sahib, Helmand, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated in western Herat, Afghanistan. Two children of a Taliban member were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the house of a tribal elder in Abyak, Samangan, Afghanistan. Two people were killed and two were injured in the blast. It is unclear if the tribal elder was among the victims. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated in Mandew, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/15/2018: Assailants opened fire at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Panzgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: Assailants attacked Makhmur, Nineveh, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault, killing three assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 02/14/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Sheikh Wali, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/15/2018: Assailants set fire to an electric substation in Male, Maldives. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, two assailants were arrested in connection with the incident.

02/15/2018: Three explosive devices were discovered and defused in Jay Nagar, Tripura, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Communist Party of India- Marxist in the attempted attack.

02/15/2018: An assailant threw an incendiary device at the Bandeirantes TV offices in Curitiba, Parana, Brazil. A security guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along Little Mountain Road in Anderson, South Carolina, United States. The assailant was identified as Wesley “Dallas” Ayers and sources noted that he was self-radicalized and read propaganda from Anwar al-Awlaki and Osama bin Laden, among others. Ayers also pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as an assailant attempted to plant it at a market in Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. The assailant was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Mushahidah, Saladin, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/15/2018: An explosive device detonated near a vehicle transporting tribal elders in Tor Simat, Orakzai district, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. At least one elder was killed and two other elders were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Nahlak, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 10 police officers and 12 assailants were killed and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Assailants also held one police officer hostage during the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/16/2018: Two female suicide bombers detonated at the Tashan Kifi fish market in Sabon Gari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of two coordinated suicide bombings that occurred within a time span of four minutes in the area on this date. In addition to three assailants, 18 people were killed and 22 others were injured across the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated near the vehicle of Malik Abdur Rehman in Gat Agra, Bajaur district, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. Rehman, and Aman Lashkars member, was killed in the blast. The Taliban Special Group (TSG) faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/16/2018: Assailants opened fire at Qarsa Primary School in Qarsa, Wajir, Kenya. At least three teachers were killed and another teacher was injured in the assault. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qarsa on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that members of the Christian community were targeted because they were occupying Muslim territories in northeastern Kenya.

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated at a market in Paloquemao neighborhood, Bogota, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in Bogota on this date. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident in a pamphlet left at the scene.

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated in an empty bus in Bogota, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related bombings in Bogota on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/16/2018: Assailants attempted to hijack the MV Kudos cargo ship and kidnap the crew in the waters between Sibago Island and Coco Island, Tuburan, Basilan, Philippines. The attack was repelled, but one crew member was wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

02/16/2018: A female suicide bomber detonated at the Tashan Kifi fish market in Sabon Gari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of two coordinated suicide bombings that occurred within a time span of four minutes in the area on this date. In addition to three assailants, 18 people were killed and 22 others were injured across the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Hizam Brigade checkpoint in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. Three fighters were killed and several fighters were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

02/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Qarsa, Wajir, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qarsa on this date; this second incident targeted police personnel responding to an earlier attack at Qarsa Primary School. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/16/2018: Assailants threw grenades at the residence of a police intelligence officer in Baghicha, Herat, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/16/2018: Assailants stopped and set fire to four trucks along Route 444 between Lumaco and Los Sauces, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three similar arson attacks in the area on this date. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/16/2018: Assailants set fire to at least two trucks and two agricultural machines at a farm in Santa Barbara, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three similar arson attacks in the area on this date. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/16/2018: Assailants set fire to at least 14 trucks at a plant in Los Alamos, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three similar arson attacks in the area on this date. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on T Chalukumba Ao in Mokokchung, Nagaland, India. Ao, a National People’s Party (NPP) provincial assembly candidate, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/16/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Arrah, Bihar, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/16/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police checkpoint in Panchlaish neighborhood, Chittagong, Bangladesh. A police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/16/2018: Assailants shot and killed Shiba Shankar Dash, a contractor, at a road construction site near Paji Bahali, Odisha, India. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/16/2018: Two assailants armed with a machete attacked Usman Pahero in Hilir Muara, South Kalimantan, Indonesia. Pahero, a Kotabaru Rescue Action Committee (KAPAK) environmental activist, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was related to the victim's opposition to mining activity in the area.
02/17/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. Four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Al-Furat neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. The owner of the vehicle was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Security forces identified and killed an assailant in an explosives-laden vehicle along the Kirkuk-Arbil road in Kirkuk district, Kirkuk, Iraq. The vehicle was defused by security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants abducted dozens of civilians and seized six trucks along Maiduguri-Damboa road in Yeleri, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/18/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a 57th Infantry Battalion truck in Meta, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao, Philippines. Five soldiers were injured in the blast. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to recent military operations targeting the group in the areas of Datu Salibo, Datu Unsay, and Datu Saudi.

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked the staff and facilities at the Russian Center for Science and Culture in Kyiv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Right Sector group.

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked security forces responding to reports of civilian harassment in San Isidro, Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. At least one soldier and one assailant were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked Hadhramaut Elite Forces soldiers in Mukalla district, Hadramawt, Yemen. At least six soldiers and several assailants were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers and assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

02/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Ugandan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy near Barawe, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. An unknown number of assailants were killed as security forces repelled the assault. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants abducted a soldier, identified as Sahal Ahmed Rasle, from a vehicle in Gedo region, Somalia. The hostage was taken to Buqda town in Hiiraan and was publicly executed. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: An assailant armed with a knife stabbed refugees outside a church in Heilbronn, Baden-Wurttemberg, Germany. Three civilians from Afghanistan, Iraq, and Syria were injured in the attack before the assailant was arrested. Willi B. claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that he was frustrated with the asylum policy in Germany. Sources also noted that the suspect told investigators, "The foreigners would be treated better than him, his family would have problems, he blamed Merkel for that" and that he intended to "set a political mark against Angela Merkel."

02/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle between Eringeti and Oicha in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five people were killed and eight people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

02/17/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting an Israeli military patrol in Khan Yunis district, Gaza Strip. Four soldiers were injured in the blast. The Popular Resistance Committees claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked a Hydraulics Without Borders (HYFRO) vehicle in Mushikiri, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two Congolese aid workers were killed and one worker was abducted in the assault. The hostage was tortured before being released on February 19, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in El Pan, Esmeraldas, Ecuador. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 02/17/2018: Assailants attacked Mmhonlumo Kikon's convoy near Yimpang, Nagaland, India. Kikon, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) provincial assembly candidate, was not harmed; however, three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least two people, including the officer, were injured in the blast. The Taliban Special Group (TSG) faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on internally displaced persons at the Sortony camp in Kabkabiya, North Darfur, Sudan. One person was killed in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks targeting displaced people at the camp on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants abducted two displaced civilians near the Sortony camp in Kabkabiya, North Darfur, Sudan. One hostage was killed and his body was discovered on February 19, 2018; the fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. This was one of two similar attacks targeting displaced people at the camp on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants abducted Dharamendra Kumra, a Right to Information (RTI) activist, in Sarai, Bihar, India. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/17/2018: Assailants attacked civilians near Kiriwiri, Ouham, Central African Republic. At least 10 women were abducted in the attack; the victims were sexually assaulted before being released. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/18/2018: An explosive device detonated at a massage center in Ghadeer neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/18/2018: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and opened fire on an Iraqi Volunteer Forces convoy in Saduniyah, Kirkuk, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

02/19/2018: Assailants attacked the Government Girls Science and Technology College in Dapchi, Yobe, Nigeria. At least 112 civilians, mostly students, were abducted in the attack.
