Asaduzzaman, the Ahmadiyya Mulsim Jamaat Jame Mosque imam, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on two Marine sergeants in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. One sergeant, identified as Ferdinand Ulang, was killed, while the other, identified as Arnel Navarro, was injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting Marine personnel in Cotabato City on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Marine officers attending to the victim of an earlier attack in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. A Marine officer, identified as Alfredo Tumbaga, and an assailant were killed and another assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks targeting Marine personnel in Cotabato City on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the two assailants as Mohammad Saud Andes and Badjorie Karim.

02/23/2018: Assailants abducted Bedma Tameya from a village in Sukma district, Chhattisgarh, India. Tameya was killed and his body was discovered on February 26, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists and stated that the victim was accused of being a police informant.

02/23/2018: Assailants threw petrol bombs at a house along Railway street, Ballymena, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on the pro-Pyongyang General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) headquarters in Chiyoda, Tokyo, Japan. There were no reported casualties in the assault. Two assailants were arrested in connection with the attack. One assailant claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for missile testing by North Korea. Sources also characterized the assailants as "right-wing activists" and noted that they "do not consider ethnic Koreans as members of the same society, and consider it acceptable to kill or wound them."
02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated in Rashidiyah, north of Baghdad, Diyala, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated outside of a civilian residence in Ahrar, Basra, Iraq. The owner of the residence was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden Humvee vehicle targeting a military base in Matki, Helmand, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, two soldiers were killed and a third soldier was injured in the blast. This was one of two related suicide bombings in Helmand on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/24/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden Humvee vehicle targeting a National Directorate of Security (NDS) building in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, one person was killed and seven others were injured in the blast; the victims included security personnel and civilians. This was one of two related suicide bombings in Helmand on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

02/24/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest at a National Directorate of Security (NDS) office in Shash Darak, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, three people were killed and five others were injured in the blast. The Taliban and the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State each separately claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/24/2018: Security forces identified a suicide bomber attempting to target a military checkpoint in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. The assailant then detonated his explosives-laden motorcycle, killing only himself. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Mobile Police Squad in Cano Ceiba, Puerto Rico, Meta, Colombia. One police officer, Wilkar Fernando Rodriguez Ramirez, was killed and one other was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 02/24/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Rafiullah Gull Afghan in Khair Khana, Kabul, Afghanistan. Afghan, a former senator and Jamiat-i-Islami Afghanistan (JIA) party member, was killed along with his driver. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ghulam Yahya in Qala-i-Naw, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Yahya, the finance deputy for the provincial police department, was killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/22/2018: Assailants attacked a police check post in Khairabad, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives-laden vehicles and six other assailants attacked a counterterrorism headquarters in Gold Mohur area of the Tawahi, Aden, Yemen. In addition to four assailants, 14 people were killed and 40 others were injured in the attack; the victims included both civilians and security personnel. The Adan-Abyan Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Adan-Abyan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 02/24/2018: Assailants set fire to a store along Rangae Mankha Road, Muang Narathiwat, Narathiwat, Thailand. This was one of two arson attacks in the area on this day. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/24/2018: Assailants set fire to a store along Chamrun Nara Road, Muang Narathiwat, Narathiwat, Thailand. This was one of two arson attacks in the area on this day. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated near a store in Jisr Diyala, Baghdad, Iraq. A civilian was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near the Imperial Hotel in Muang Narathiwat, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants launched a rocket-propelled grenade at the vehicle of Brigadier General Haydar Muhafal, Ministry of Defense's infantry department director, in Marib, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated in Az Zahari, Taizz, Yemen. One civilian was killed and another civilian was wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

02/24/2018: Assailants attacked and abducted a doctor at Al-Thawrah General Hospital in Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants abducted five civilians from Sdeirah, Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the abduction to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of the state government secretary in Sittwe, Rakhine, Myanmar. At least two people, including a police officer, were injured in the blast. This was one of three similar attacks that took place in Sittwe on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army.

02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the state high court in Sittwe, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three similar attacks that took place in Sittwe on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Arakan Army.

02/24/2018: An explosive device detonated in front of the and Records Department Office in Sittwe, Rakhine, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of three similar attacks that took place in Sittwe on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, source attributed the attack to the Arakan Army.

02/24/2018: A sniper shot an killed Domingo Berber, a member of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU), in Bulalacao, Oriental Mindoro, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
02/24/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at the office of the deputy commissioner in Jessore, Khulna, Bangladesh. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants attacked Makhmur, southeast of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack, killing three assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/24/2018: Assailants abducted Animbom Aaron Akiabom, the regional delegate for social affairs, from his vehicle in Ambo, Batibo, North-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Ambazonia Defense Forces (ADF) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded that the government show proof of life of detained Ambazonia leaders.

02/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed an Intelligence Bureau (IB) official in Kohat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The Darra Adamkhel faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/24/2018: Assailants armed with machetes and firearms attacked Katindo military camp in Kasika, Goma, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Mayi Mayi carried out the attack.

02/25/2018: Assailants abducted seven people in Rutshuru, Kamukwale, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two people were released and the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to an unidentified militia faction.
02/24/2018: Assailants set fire to the residence of the chief of Nguti in Akwaya, Manyu, South-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on the Njinikom gendarmerie brigade and Total filling station in Njinikom, Boyo, North-West, Cameroon. At least three people, including two assailants and a shopkeeper, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

02/24/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at the intersection of Travis Road and Little Mountain Road in Anderson, South Carolina, United States. The assailant was identified as Wesley “Dallas” Ayers and sources noted that he was self-radicalized and read propaganda from Anwar al-Awlaki and Osama bin Laden, among others. Ayers also pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
02/25/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in Arab Ebjur, Baghdad, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: Assailants attacked a police post at the Khabbaz oilfield about 35 kilometers to the southwest of Kirkuk, Iraq. Two police officers were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/25/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at a volunteer fighters’ headquarters in Kirkuk, Iraq. The assailant was killed and three volunteer fighters were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the volunteer fighter headquarters was targeted because Sunnis and Kurds were tortured there. Sources also suspected that the attack was meant to raise support for ISIL among Kurds who live in Kirkuk.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/25/2018: Assailants attacked a village north of Kirkuk, Iraq. There were an unknown number of casualties; the victims included both civilians and security personnel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police officer guarding the residence of Fazal Haq Qureshi, an All Parties Hurriyat Conference (APHC) leader, in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The officer was killed and his rifle was stolen in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident; however, officials doubted the veracity of this claim. Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind separately claimed responsibility for the attack. Additionally, authorities stated that the assailant, Eisa Fazli, was affiliated with Tehrik al-Mojahedin, Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), and Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police post outside the Sheikh Noor-ud-Din Noorani shrine in Charar-i-Sharif, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One police officer was killed and his rifle was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: Assailants abducted four construction employees in Rabatak, Samangan, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/25/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Yahya Khel district, Paktika, Afghanistan. At least three people, including a police officer, were killed and six people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Giro district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants were killed while three soldiers and 17 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: Assailants attacked Sabha Airport in Sabha, Libya. Security forces repelled the attack, resulting in an unknown number of assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/24/2018: Armed assailants driving a 4x4 vehicle attacked an army checkpoint in Murzuq, Libya. At least two soldiers and one assailant were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Fezzan Province of the Islamic State.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 02/25/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire targeting a Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) vehicle between Busar and Ceel Waaq, Gedo, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/24/2018: A roadside landmine detonated targeting a military convoy in Poblacion, President Roxas, North Cotabato, Philippines. A soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/25/2018: Assailants attacked a humanitarian aid vehicle near Markounda, Ouham, Central African Republic. Six aid workers, including a United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) employee, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) personnel near Tarlaguda, Chhattisgarh, India. Two CAF officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

02/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on Venezuelan civilians in Tibu, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Three civilians were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in Tibu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Tibu, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in Tibu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/25/2018: An assailant attempted to throw an explosive device targeting Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) Mankal Vaidya during a rally in Hosada, Karnataka, India. The assailant, Raymond Kaitan Miranda, was injured when the device detonated in his hands. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Shetimari, Kaga, Borno, Nigeria. An army captain was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Boko Haram carried out the attack.

02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a village patrol in Salvador, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. A village councilor, identified Ladio Bayoy, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

02/25/2018: Assailants armed with tire irons and smoke bombs attacked a leftist community center in Piraeus, Attica, Greece. At least five people, including a lawyer representing the family of murdered musician Pavlos Fyssas, were injured in the assault. Golden Dawn claimed responsibility for the incident.
02/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on former politician Ibrahim Little in Kidan-Dan, Giwa, Kaduna, Nigeria. Little was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
02/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed Jan Kuciak, a journalist, and his fiance, Martina Kusnirova, in Velka Maca, Galanta, Trnava, Slovak Republic. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/25/2018: Assailants abducted Nangialay, a police driver, from the northern outskirts of Kunduz, Afghanistan. The hostage was killed and his body was discovered on March 3, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the kidnapping to the Taliban.

02/26/2018: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs) and automatic rifles attacked the Turkman Artisan Association headquarters in Musalla, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2018: Assailants attempted to attack construction machinery in Novita, Choco, Colombia. Security forces responded to the incident and the assailants retreated. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on Nigerian soldiers along Gombe road connecting Damboa district to Biu district, Borno, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed and four soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

02/26/2018: Assailants attacked a Shabwa Elite Forces position in Al-Musayniah, As Said, Shabwah, Yemen. There were an unknown number of casualties. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/27/2018: Two suicide bombers attempted to attack a security headquarters in Tahouna, southeast of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. The two assailants were killed and a soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/27/2018: Security forces identified assailants, including suicide bombers, who were attempting to attack intelligence and military installations in Darzab district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. The security forces opened fire, causing a suicide vest to detonate, killing at least 27 assailants. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mohamed Hussein Kahiye at his shop in the Sarkuusta neighborhood outside Mogadishu, Somalia. Kahiye, a traditional elder and former electoral delegate, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

02/26/2018: Assailants attacked a ranch and abducted six individuals, including four civilians and two members of Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU), in Tumbaga, Nasalaan, Quezon, Philippines. All six people were released a few hours later. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack aimed to break apart haciendas in the area so that the land could be redistributed fairly and freely to farmers.

02/26/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Baba Wali, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were killed and four people, including two soldiers and two civilians, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mohammad Wali Sahibzada, a senior adviser to the Mesherano Jirga, in Wagha Jan, Logar, Afghanistan. Sahibzada was unharmed, however, two of his bodyguards were killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Kaisariani, Athens, Attica, Greece. A taxi driver was injured in the blast. The Armed Revolutionary Forces claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A prisoner was killed and a police officer was injured in the blast. Sources identified the slain detainee as a member of Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) and noted that the attack was intended to help him escape from police custody. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/00/2018: Sometime between February 25, 2018 and February 27, 2018, an explosive device detonated between Kouakourou and Pourra-Sawa, Mopti, Mali. At least two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).
02/26/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. One person was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2018: Assailants attacked an army combat patrol in Lombelu, Kasai-Central, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 15 people were killed in the ensuing clash; the victims included assailants, civilians, and soldiers. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Kamwina Nsapu Militia.

02/26/2018: Assailants set fire to an Albanian consulate diplomatic vehicle in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a National Uprising Movement (NUM) outpost in Bahadar Khan, Khanabad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One uprising member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan National Army (ANA) checkpoint in Khawaja Pista, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on security forces in Chapa Khak, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

02/27/2018: Assailants abducted a motorcycle taxi rider on Nyamilima Ishasha road, between Nyamilima and Ishasha, near Binza village, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/27/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated on Al-Quds street in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting civilians near Kubaysah, southern Hit, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two children were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on Husayn ‘Ali al Khuyun in Shatrah, Dhi Qar, Iraq. Al Khuyun, an Al-‘Abudah tribal chieftain, was unharmed and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle in Bukhtiarabad, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy between Tibu and Salazar de Las Palmas districts in Norte de Santander, Colombia. Five soldiers were killed and 10 soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

02/27/2018: A landmine detonated under a civilian vehicle in Yakhtul, Taizz, Yemen. One civilian was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
02/27/2018: An explosive device detonated in Arab Ebjur, Baghdad, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Sahwa Council vehicle in northern Baghdad, Iraq. One Sahwa Council member was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants attacked civilians near Karashabak, Nineveh, Iraq. Three civilians were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 02/27/2018: Two explosive devices detonated at a civilian residence on Mill Street in Lisburn, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. A third pipe bomb was discovered at the scene and defused following the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Kenyan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Fafahdun, Gedo, Somalia. At least five assailants were killed and one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash with AMISOM and Somali military forces. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

02/27/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and five officers were injured in the incident. This was one of two coordinated attacks along the Kandahar-Uruzgan border on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire at an army vehicle traveling along the Bondoc Peninsula Highway, Bacong Ibaba, Quezon, Philippines. The vehicle was also struck by a landmine. Four soldiers from the Army's engineering brigade were injured along with an additional five civilians. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on an army detachment in Barangay 9, Catanauan, Quezon, Philippines. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

02/27/2018: Assailants stabbed and killed Hamid Kirmani, a bodyguard of President Ashraf Ghani, in Kart-e Char, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: Assailants attacked a security post in Awlad, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks targeting checkpoints in Darzab district on this date. At least nine assailants were killed and 13 assailants and 5 police officers were injured across the ensuing clashes. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 02/27/2018: Assailants attacked a security post in Dinar Jawzjan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks targeting checkpoints in Darzab district on this date. At least nine assailants were killed and 13 assailants and 5 police officers were injured across the ensuing clashes. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/27/2018: Assailants attacked a security post in Sajal Qashlaq, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks targeting checkpoints in Darzab district on this date. At least nine assailants were killed and 13 assailants and 5 police officers were injured across the ensuing clashes. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 02/27/2018: Assailants threw grenades at the residence of the district commissioner in Wajid district, Bakool, Somalia. Four people, including the district commissioner, were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

02/27/2018: An explosive device detonated during a Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) conference in Kotwali, Chittagong, Bangladesh. An unknown number of people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaat-E-Islami (Bangladesh).

02/27/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of villages in Gwamba, Demsa, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least 20 people were killed and 23 people were injured during the raid. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

02/27/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at a polling station in Tizit, Nagaland, India. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a Pro-Russia Militia and noted that three Polish nationals were arrested in connection with the incident.

03/01/2018: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs) and automatic firearms attacked a camp in Rann, Kala/Balge, Borno, Nigeria. At least eleven people, including United Nations aid workers, soldiers, police officers, and Nigerian security forces members, were killed and eight other people were injured in the incident. Additionally, at least three people were abducted in the attack. One of the hostages, Saifura Hussaini Ahmed Khorsa, was beheaded on or before September 16, 2018 and another hostage, Hauwa Amina Liman, was killed on or before October 15, 2018. The fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/02/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting Australian Embassy vehicles in Qabel Bay, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, one civilian was killed and 22 others, including two Australian contractors, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/02/2018: Assailants equipped with grenades and assault rifles attacked the French Embassy in Ouagadougou, Centre, Burkina Faso. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Ouagadougou on this date. Five people, including four assailants and one security guard, were killed in this incident. Additionally, at least 85 people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured across both assaults. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation for the killing of Mohamed Hacen al-Ancari, a JNIM leader, in a recent security operation.

This was one of two coordinated attacks in Ouagadougou on this date. Eleven people, including four assailants and seven soldiers, were killed in this incident. Additionally, at least 85 people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured across both assaults. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incidents and stated that the attacks were carried out in retaliation for the killing of Mohamed Hacen al-Ancari, a JNIM leader, in a recent security operation.

In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least five police officers were killed and three officers were injured across the attacks. summary: 03/08/2018: Assailants attacked and killed a Third Presidential Protection Brigade soldier in Khur Maksar neighborhood, Aden, Yemen. The soldier was suffocated and beaten. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2018: Assailants abducted Omais Bhat from Qaimoh, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Bhat was tortured and released a few hours after the kidnapping; however, he later died from his injuries on March 22, 2018. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the victim was targeted because of his involvement in "anti-movement activities."
03/08/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at Ghazi Marjan Primary School in Mirakhel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2018: Assailants fired a projectile at a civilian vehicle between Deir Ballut and Jinderes in Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

03/08/2018: Assailants abducted two civilians and publicly flogged them in Kunduz, Afghanistan. The two hostages were injured and released shortly thereafter. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban and noted that the group accused the victims of having a telephone relationship.
03/08/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated an explosive device in Dicle, Diyarbakir, Turkey. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at the Conflict Resolution Services Ireland (CRSI) office on Falls Road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident

03/08/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along the Crossing Salbu-Lower Salbu highway in Datu Salibo, Maguindanao, Philippines. A soldier was slightly injured while defusing the device. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

03/08/2018: Assailants fired a rifle grenade at a military detachment in Nabalawag, Midsayap, North Cotabato, Philippines. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

03/08/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpost in Joyee Begum, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Three police officers were injured while the assailants sustained an undetermined number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/08/2018: An assailant attacked a police post in Khakrez district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The assailant was killed and a police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/08/2018: An explosive device detonated in Panjwai district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. A child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/08/2018: An explosive device detonated near Malian Armed Forces soldiers returning from an operation in Mopti, Mali. At least four soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/09/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Ganda, Dafo, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks that took place in Plateau on this date. At least 11 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across both attacks. An unknown number of civilians were reported missing in the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.

03/09/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Miango, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks that took place in Plateau on this date. At least 11 people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured across both attacks. An unknown number of civilians were reported missing in the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.
03/08/2018: Assailants shot and injured Amal Silva, a Western Provincial Council (WPC) member, in Ratmalana, Colombo, Western, Sri Lanka. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/08/2018: An explosive device detonated in Bab al-Sham, Diyala, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on Albu Nisan, Saladin, Iraq. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/09/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Radhwaniyah, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/09/2018: Five assailants threw Molotov cocktails targeting the Aksemsettin Mosque in Lauffen am Neckar, Baden-Wurttemberg, Germany. There were no reported casualties. The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/09/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Frontier Corps (FC) convoy along Hub Power Project Road in Hub, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/09/2018: Assailants shot and injured a Levies Forces officer along Sariab Road in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/09/2018: A suicide bomber detonated his explosive vest outside a gathering of Hazara civilians in Dasht-e-Barchi, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition, to the assailant, at least 10 people were killed and 22 people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Sakhi Sahib shrine in Ghazni, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 03/09/2018: An explosive device detonated near a 57th Infantry Battalion detachment in Sambolawan, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao, Philippines. Folowing the blast, assailants opened fire on the detachment. At least one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
03/09/2018: Assailants shot and killed Ishtiaq Ahmed Dar, a hotel owner, in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/09/2018: Assailants attacked a Iraqi Special Operations Forces (ISOF) patrol near Kirkuk, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/09/2018: Assailants shot and killed Jemar Pitogo, a former New People’s Army (NPA) member, in Baklayan, Mahalang, Negros Occidental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA) and indicated that the group suspected the victim of being an asset for security personnel.

03/09/2018: Assailants attacked Laake, Kwall, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. Four children were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

03/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on the Nassougou Water and Forest Station in Nassougou, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties, though two motorcycles were stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/09/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a checkpoint in Al-Sitton, south of Ajdabiya, Wahat, Libya. The suicide bomber was killed and at least three people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the blast. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 03/10/2018: Three explosive devices detonated on an agricultural road near Had Akhdar, Diyala, Iraq. Two farmers were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Nasr al-Salam, Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a volunteer fighters’ patrol in Najatiyah, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. A volunteer fighter was killed and six others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/09/2018: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs) attacked a Turkmen Front headquarters in Kirkuk, Iraq. A counterterrorism service member was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Zurmat district, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers and four assailants were killed while one officer and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: Assailants attacked police check post in Ramazan, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and seven officers were injured in the incident. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/09/2018: Assailants attacked soldiers and police officers in Farah Rud, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 43 people, including 18 security personnel and 25 assailants, were killed and several other people were injured in the assault. In addition, three security personnel were taken hostage in the ensuing clash. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/10/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Farah city, Afghanistan. At least six officers were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
03/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near a vehicle in Lehri, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/10/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the Kralkhud police station in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused three explosive devices, intended to target police patrols, along Pirtand-Madhuban road in Dumri, Jharkhand, India. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

03/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Special Task Force (STF) personnel in Pamed, Chhattisgarh, India. Two STF officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

03/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Kahda, Banaadir, Somalia. At least four soldiers were killed and one person was injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: Assailants fired mortars at a residential area in Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Three children were killed and a fourth was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

03/10/2018: Assailants abducted four health workers in Saghar district, Ghor, Afghanistan. The hostages were released the following day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban. The public health director later cast doubt on the Taliban's involvement.

03/10/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused outside the guesthouse of Malik Riaz Khan, a Member of Provincial Assembly (MPA), in Bannu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/10/2018: Assailants attacked African National Congress (ANC) official Nqobizwe Mkhize at his home in Mfume, eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. Nqobizwe and two other people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/10/2018: Assailants threw petrol bombs at Muslim-owned restaurant in Anamaduwa, North Western, Sri Lanka. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected that the incident was racially motivated.

03/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on an IDF outpost in Baytuniya, Ramallah and Al-Bireh, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on an IDF outpost in Psagot, Ramallah and Al-Bireh, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks in this area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a restaurant in Yusufiyah, Babil, Iraq. A civilian was killed and three others, including a military conscript, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: An explosive device detonated after a fox stepped on it near Ar Rashad, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported human casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices, including landmines and explosives-laden vehicles, in an undetermined number of villages in Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and opened fire on civilians along the Kirkuk-Baghdad highway, between Al-Maftul and Sarhah, Saladin, Iraq. At least ten civilians were killed and five others were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at a Turkish vegetable shop on Kirchenstrasse, Itzehoe, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at a civilian vehicle in Bati Kot district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including seven civilians and one assailant, were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement and instead blamed the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.

03/11/2018: An explosive detonated in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two farmers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 03/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) convoy in Daman district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 03/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near emergency forces and security forces members in northern Aden, Adan, Yemen. At least seven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants armed with grenades and firearms attacked a military detachment at a command post in Guisang, Poblacion, Balbalan, Kalinga, Philippines. At least one soldier was killed and another soldier and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

03/11/2018: Assailants attacked the administrative compound in Anar Dara, Farah, Afghanistan. In addition to at least 14 assailants, eight security personnel were killed and 23 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) guard post outside the residence of Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) Abdul Majeed Paddar in Damhal Hanjipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/11/2018: Assailants threw petrol bombs at the house of a Hindu Makkal Katchi party official near Periyapalayam, Tamil Nadu, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpost along the Kandahar-Uruzgan highway in Sarkhbid, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 25 assailants were killed and 14 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Kahda, Banaadir, Somalia. The soldier was killed and his weapon was stolen in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Mahad Alle area, Mogadishu, Somalia. Three people, including the soldier and two civilians, were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/11/2018: Assailants attacked a base belonging to Cordaid, a Dutch NGO, in Bangassou, Mbomou, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties, although property was stolen during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Anti-Balaka Militia carried out the attack.

03/00/2018: Sometime between March 1, 2018 and March 21, 2018, assailants set fire to a church in Hindugh, Dhading, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The same church was attacked twice over a three week period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/00/2018: Sometime between March 1, 2018 and March 21, 2018, assailants set fire to a church in Hindugh, Dhading, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The same church was attacked twice over a three week period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Mushahidah, Saladin, Iraq. A civilian was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
03/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a livestock kiosk in Suwaib, Baghdad, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle near the Fallujah dam in Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 03/12/2018: An assailant stabbed an Austrian soldier near the Iranian Embassy in Vienna, Austria. The soldier was wounded and the assailant was killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Mohamed El-M and stated that he was a member of a Facebook group that called for the release of Sunni detainees in Iran.

At least two people were killed and another person was abducted in the assault. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of three coordinated incidents in Djugu on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked a guard post in Goube, Ouallam, Tillaberi, Niger. At least three gendarmes were killed and another gendarme was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists were behind the attack.

03/11/2018: Assailants, including at least two suicide bombers, attacked an Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) border post in Saravan, Sistan and Baluchestan, Iran. At least four assailants were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaish al-Adl.

03/12/2018: An explosives-laden donkey detonated targeting police officers in Sarkani district, Kunar, Afghanistan. At least two Afghan Local Police (ALP) personnel were injured in the blast. No claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/12/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Shakar Tangi, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) who were returning to their homes in Areit, East Darfur, Sudan. At least two people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked Chaudhary, a local mayor, at his residence in Sukhkhad Bazaar, Ghodaghodi, Province 7, Nepal. Chaudhary was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Shawalgah, Farah, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed, two were injured, and four others were abducted in the ensuing clash. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/12/2018: Assailants set fire to three vehicles in Gutersloh, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. There were no reported casualties. Action Cell Haukur Hilmarsson claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for Turkish military operations in Afrin.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked Kwall, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks that occurred in the area on this date. At least 25 people were killed, two people were wounded, and many houses were set ablaze across the attacks. Additionally, an unknown number of people were reported missing and their fate is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.

03/12/2018: Assailants attacked Zirshe, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of three related attacks that occurred in the area on this date. At least 25 people were killed, two people were wounded, and many houses were set ablaze across the attacks. Additionally, an unknown number of people were reported missing and their fate is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.

At least 25 people were killed, two people were wounded, and many houses were set ablaze across the attacks. Additionally, an unknown number of people were reported missing and their fate is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Fulani extremists.

The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident in a banner left at the scene and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the forest department's work in the area.

Corey Johnson claimed responsibility and stated that he carried out the attack because the victims made fun of how he practiced his Muslim faith. Sources also noted that Johnson allegedly contacted members of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and was interested in joining the group.

03/11/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of a tribal leader in As Sahal, Qayyarah, Nineveh, Iraq. At least four people, including the tribal leader, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

03/22/2018: Assailants attacked a police barracks at the Alas oil field in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 03/22/2018: Assailants detonated explosives at a pipeline in Naft Khanah, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/22/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Marees front, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least 14 people, including two soldiers and 12 assailants, were killed and 15 people, including three soldiers and 12 assailants, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/23/2018: An explosive device targeting a military patrol in Albu Diab, Al Anbar, Iraq. A captain was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/23/2018: Assailants fired a mortar targeting Turkmen civilians celebrating Nowruz in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: Assailants attacked a Federal Police patrol guarding electricity maintenance teams in Gaydah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/23/2018: Assailants attacked a marketplace in Toummour, Diffa, Niger. Five civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

03/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Rangers patrol at Ban Taliang School in Koh Saton, Narathiwat, Thailand. Two rangers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at a basketball game in Borongotan, Upi, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least four people were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Borongotan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Borongotan, Upi, Maguindanao, Philippines. One police officer, identified as Marjun Lahaylahay, was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Borongotan on this date; this second blast targeted police personnel responding to a previous incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

03/23/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle outside Ghazi Muhammad Ayoub Khan stadium in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. The explosives detonated at the conclusion of a wrestling match. In addition to the suicide bomber, 15 people were killed and 51 others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
03/23/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus near Laantabuur, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Four civilians were killed and five civilians were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: An assailant hijacked a vehicle in Carcassonne, Occitanie, France. One passenger was killed and the driver of the vehicle was injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks carried out in Carcassonne and Trebes on this date. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Redouane Lakdim, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was a "soldier of the Islamic State" and demanded the release of Salah Abdeslam, one of the assailants who carried out the November 2015 Paris attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) also claimed responsibility; however Lakdim's connection to the group could not be confirmed.

03/23/2018: An assailant opened fire on police personnel jogging outside a riot police squad barracks in Carcassonne, Occitanie, France. One police officer was injured in the attack. This was one of three related attacks carried out in Carcassonne and Trebes on this date. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Redouane Lakdim, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was a "soldier of the Islamic State" and demanded the release of Salah Abdeslam, one of the assailants who carried out the November 2015 Paris attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) also claimed responsibility; however Lakdim's connection to the group could not be confirmed.

03/23/2018: An assailant opened fire inside Super U supermarket and took civilians hostage in Trebes, Occitanie, France. Shortly thereafter, a hostage was released as a police officer, identified as Arnaud Beltrame, took her place. Police later raided the supermarket, killing the assailant and ending the standoff. In addition to the assailant, Beltrame and two civilians were killed and 13 others were injured. Three explosive devices were also discovered and defused at the scene. This was one of three related attacks carried out in Carcassonne and Trebes on this date. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Redouane Lakdim, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was a "soldier of the Islamic State" and demanded the release of Salah Abdeslam, one of the assailants who carried out the November 2015 Paris attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) also claimed responsibility; however Lakdim's connection to the group could not be confirmed.

03/23/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Khanyar area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as the device failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: Assailants abducted Talwarshingh Madavi from his residence in Darachi, Maharashtra, India. Madavi, a former Maoist, was killed and his body was discovered the following morning. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

03/23/2018: An explosives-laden pressure cooker detonated targeting Bikash Traders, a jewelry shop, in Lahan, Province 2, Nepal. At least 8 people were injured in the blast. Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha- Goit (JTMM-G) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the targeted shop owner's refusal to respond to an extortion demand.

03/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mohammed Anis Siddiqi in Orangi Town neighborhood, Karachi, Pakistan. Siddiqi, a Pakistan Union Council 26 councilor and Muttahida Qami Movement (MQM) member, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

03/23/2018: An explosive device detonated while police were removing Maoist banners and posters near Ulloor, Chhattisgarh, India. Two police officers were injured in the blast. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: Two assailants stabbed Mireille Knoll, a Jewish Holocaust survivor, and set fire to her apartment along Philippe August Street in Paris, France. Knoll was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

03/23/2018: Assailants raided the Al-Shomou Foundation newspaper office in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. At least seven people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/23/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Malagim district, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least 11 people, including three soldiers and eight assailants, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting volunteer fighters near Az Zur, Diyala, Iraq. A volunteer fighter was killed and three others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle at a checkpoint near Sadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. At least four civilians were killed and two others were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a volunteer fighters’ vehicle near Al-Khanukah, Saladin, Iraq. One volunteer fighter was killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/24/2018: Assailants kidnapped five volunteer fighters near their base in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. The hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered three hours later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Mushahidah, Saladin, Iraq. A civilian was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) may have carried out the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 03/24/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting the Transandino oil pipeline between Tumaco and Pasto cities in Narino, Colombia. No casualties were reported in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Major General Mostafa al-Nimr along Muaskar Romany Street in Rushdy, Alexandria, Egypt. Al-Nimr, the Alexandria security director, was not harmed, though two police officers were killed and six people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State and the Hasam Movement.

03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a tent housing civil activists supporting the Pakhtuns Tahaffuz Movement in Chaman Hazoori, Kabul, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and nine others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting District Reserve Guard (DRG) personnel near Sirsitti, Chhattisgarh, India. At least four police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

The assailants attempted to set fire to an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) vehicle, but security forces repelled the attack. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

03/24/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated at a former Al-Qaida affiliate headquarters in Idlib city, Syria. At least seven people were killed and 25 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

03/24/2018: Assailants set fire to a hospital in Papua, Indonesia. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four attacks in Papua on this date. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the hospital was targeted because it did not provide "native Papuans anything."

03/24/2018: Assailants set fire to a school in Papua, Indonesia. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four attacks in Papua on this date. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the hospital was targeted because it did not provide "native Papuans anything."

03/24/2018: Assailants set fire to civilian residences in Papua, Indonesia. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four attacks in Papua on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka), which denied involvement.

03/24/2018: Assailants abducted an unknown number of civilians from Papua, Indonesia. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. This was one of four attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka).

03/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers responding to an earlier attack on an oil pipeline between Tumaco and Pasto, Narino, Colombia. 03/25/2018: Assailants on a motorbike threw an explosive device targeting the vehicle of Jeeevan Ghimire, the Minister for Social Development, in Pathari-Sanischare, Province 1, Nepal. This was one of three explosive devices discovered and defused in the area on this date. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/25/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Urlabari, Province 1, Nepal. This was one of three explosive devices discovered and defused in the area on this date. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/25/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Pathari-Sanischare, Province 1, Nepal. This was one of three explosive devices discovered and defused in the area on this date. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

03/25/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Pakistan Petroleum Limited (PPL) trailer near the residence of a local Pakistani Police district commissioner in Kharan district, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the attack and accused PPL of exploiting the natural resources within the region.

03/25/2018: Assailants attacked Mashumari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. One assailant was killed and one civilian and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

03/25/2018: Assailants shot and killed a police captain in Hakim Sanaee, Ghazni, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

03/31/2018: Assailants abducted three traditional rulers of Ika, Issia, and Ambombo, in Widikum, Momo, North-West, Cameroon. All three hostages were released as of April 4, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/01/2018: An explosive device attached to a bus detonated in Biya area, Baghdad, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/01/2018: An explosive device detonated near industrial shops in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: Assailants shelled the Sixth Brigade headquarters in Sabha, Libya. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tabu tribe.

04/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle transporting Hazara civilians near Kandahari Bazaar in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one Hazara civilian was killed and another person was injured in the assault. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 04/01/2018: An explosive device detonated outside Al Anbiya’ Mosque in Bakr, Al Anbar, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: Assailants set fire to construction equipment in Dalagdag, Davao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. This was one of four related attacks targeting construction equipment in this area between March 31 and April 1, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People’s Army (NPA).

04/01/2018: Assailants set fire to construction equipment in Fatima, Davao del Norte, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. This was one of four related attacks targeting construction equipment in this area between March 31 and April 1, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People’s Army (NPA).

04/01/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpost in Darzab district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least 10 assailants were killed and six officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
