summary: 03/31/2018: An explosive device detonated in Bekhar, Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/01/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives-laden vehicles and assailants opened fire at a Ugandan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Bulo Marer, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least 38 people, including 30 assailants and eight soldiers, were killed and six soldiers were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, armed with mortars and firearms attacked a military base in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related incidents that occurred around Maiduguri on this date. At least 28 people, including 13 assailants and 15 civilians and soldiers, were killed and 83 others were injured across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

04/01/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, armed with mortars and firearms attacked Bale Shuwar, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related incidents that occurred around Maiduguri on this date. At least 28 people, including 13 assailants and 15 civilians and soldiers, were killed and 83 others were injured across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

04/01/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, armed with mortars and firearms attacked Bale Kura, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related incidents that occurred around Maiduguri on this date. At least 28 people, including 13 assailants and 15 civilians and soldiers, were killed and 83 others were injured across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).
04/01/2018: Assailants shot and killed two district officials in Xamar Weyne neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/01/2018: Assailants abducted approximately 20 civilians from Koubou, Haut-Mbomou, Central African Republic. Security forces rescued 15 hostages shortly after the kidnapping, though two hostages were injured during the rescue operation. The fate of the remaining five hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

04/01/2018: Assailants raided the residence of Ahmad al-Sufi in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. Al-Sufi, the press secretary of former President Ali Abdullah Saleh, was not harmed, although a security guard was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/01/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it under a bridge along the Kabul-Kandahar highway in Shahjoy district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/01/2018: Assailants abducted Father Celestin Ngango from Goma, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Ngango, a Catholic priest, was released unharmed on April 5, 2018 following the payment of a ransom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on park rangers at Virunga National Park in Lubero district, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One ranger was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

04/01/2018: Assailants shot and killed a women's rights activist in Huriwa neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/01/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside the home of Sead Sadikovic in Bijelo Polje, Montenegro. Sadikovic, a journalist for TV Vijesti, was not harmed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/01/2018: Assailants shot and killed Jaime Vasallo, a councilperson, in Mabalas-balas, Bulacan, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a convoy of buses transporting civilians and opposition fighters between Eastern Ghouta and Idlib in Damascus, Syria. At least six people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/01/2018: Assailants set fire to a Polish tourist bus along Stryiska Street in Lviv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a pro-Russia militia.

04/01/2018: Assailants equipped with explosive devices and sniper rifles attacked military personnel in Ar Rahidah, Taizz, Yemen. At least 10 soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/01/2018: Assailants raided Utikini, Papua, Indonesia. A hospital, a school, and several residences were set on fire during the attack. Additionally, three people, including two assailants and one soldier, were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Mercedes-Benz showroom along Via Augusta in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Bastards & Blasphems, an anarchist group, claimed responsibility for the attack and stated, "We don’t think it necessary to justify an attack on a Mercedes showroom in a wealthy neighbourhood of Barcelona."
04/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a soldier in Timbuktu, Mali. The soldier was killed and his weapon was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/01/2018: An assailant armed with two knives threatened a security guard and a transit worker in Greater Sudbury, Ontario, Canada. When police arrived at the scene, the assailant attempted to attack the officers. The officers then opened fire, injuring the assailant and a bystander. A White extremist, identified as Alexander Stavropoulos, claimed responsibility and chanted "white power" during the incident.

04/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a rickshaw transporting Christian civilians in Shah Zaman neighborhood, Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least four Christian civilians were killed and another person was injured in the assault. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/02/2018: An explosive device detonated against a minivan in Bulobarde, Hiiraan, Somalia. At least 10 people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/02/2018: Assailants abducted 23 civilians in Tagbara, Ouaka, Central African Republic. The hostages were released a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the kidnapping to the Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC).

Parrey was not harmed; however, three people were injured and Sheikh was abducted in the attack. The hostage was killed shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), which denied involvement

04/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Eustaquio Porras, a barangay captain, in Carvasana, Iloilo, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the New People's Army (NPA) may have carried out the attack.

04/02/2018: Assailants held 12 European tourists hostage in Nguti, South-West, Cameroon. They were released with a few hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/02/2018: Assailants abducted six municipal councilors on their way to vote in North-West, Cameroon. The councilors were release the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/02/2018: Assailants attacked the district headquarters in Almar, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

04/03/2018: Security forces identified and engaged assailants attempting to attack a military base in Bolhoon, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attempted attacks that occurred in Surigao del Sur on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People’s Army (NPA).

This was one of two related attempted attacks that occurred in Surigao del Sur on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People’s Army (NPA).

04/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Abukar Sheikh Ahmed in Wadajir neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an anti-Balaka militia.

At least two soldiers and 10 assailants were killed and five police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. Two people were killed, including Colonel Fahmi Mansour Ahmed al-Shumairi and one other soldier, and two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

04/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed Haji Dawood, a tribal elder and the brother of a Wolesi Jirga member, in Paktika, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/03/2018: Assailants attacked a Saudi oil tanker in the Red Sea off the coast of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the incident. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out in response to a Saudi-led coalition airstrike that killed 16 displaced people in Al Hudaydah governorate on April 2, 2018.

04/03/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police station along the Lokoja-Abuja road in Gegu, Kogi, Nigeria. At least two people, including police officers, were killed and one prisoner was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2018: Seven assailants set fire to construction equpment in Banualay, Palma Gil, Davao Del Norte, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

04/03/2018: Two assailants opened fire on a village chair, Joaquin Sardon Segumban, and a village watchman in Kibayao, North Cotabato, Philippines. Two people, including Segumban, were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2018: Assailants armed with rifles and knives attempted to steal produce from residents in Bele, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least four assailants were killed in the ensuing clash with military personnel. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/03/2018: An assailant punched a Muslim student in the face at Metropolitan Community College in Kansas City, Missouri, United States. The student was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the assailant made anti-Muslim comments and that the attack occurred on "Punish a Muslim Day," which promoted violence against members of the Muslim community.

04/03/2018: Assailants abducted Augustine Nwunagham in Wabane, South-West, Cameroon. Nwunagham, the Divisional Officer for Wabane, was released shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/04/2018: Two explosive devices attached to an electricity pylon detonated targeting an Afghan National Army (ANA) vehicle in Macroryan, Kabul, Afghanistan. Six ANA soldiers were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/03/2018: Assailants attacked two former New People’s Army (NPA) members accompanied by military personnel in Montevista, Compostela Valley, Philippines. The two former NPA members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the NPA.

04/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on Antonio Takinan in Magpet, North Cotabato, Philippines. Takinan, an indigenous peoples' (IPs) mandatory councilor, was killed and two other people escorting Takinan were injured in the assault. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Antonio Takinan was targeted because of his participation in counter-insurgency campaigns and because he was guilty of human rights abuses. The NPA also accused Takinan of spying for the military, forcing people to join security forces to fight against the NPA, and extorting money from locals. Sources also noted that Takinan had previously received threats from the NPA for criticizing the group and that Takinan worked to convince people to join the Civilian Active Auxiliary (CAA) rather than the NPA.

04/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Ahmed Nur's vehicle in Kaaraan neighborhood, Mogadishu, Somalia. Nur, the Daynile deputy district commissioner, was not harmed; however, at least two civilians were killed and nine civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

04/04/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) post in Keegam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/05/2018: An explosive device detonated in Dharapani, Province 2, Nepal. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/05/2018: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia post in Aqcha district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Two militia members were killed and another militia member was injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
04/05/2018: An explosive device detonated in Saharbati, Khulna, Bangladesh. A child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/05/2018: Assailants in an SUV attempted to sideswipe a vehicle driven by a Muslim woman wearing a hijab in Houston, Texas, United States. After both vehicles stopped, one assailant exited his vehicle, shouted anti-Muslim epithets, and proceeded to stab and injure the woman. The assailants then fled the scene and have not yet been identified. Sources noted that the attack took place on "Punish a Muslim day."

04/06/2018: Security forces identified and arrested two assailants planting an explosive device at a Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team (BPAT) outpost in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. The explosive device was subsequently defused. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

04/06/2018: Assailants armed with machine guns opened fire on a coffee shop along Filastin Street in the 9 Nissan neighborhood, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/06/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 12 explosive devices in Saqlawiyah, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/06/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of a police colonel in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) position in Lubero, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people, including two soldiers and a civilian, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

04/06/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at an Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) office in Kharan, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/06/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Bannu district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a military checkpoint near the Aden Adde International Airport in Mogadishu, Somalia. The assailant was killed and at least two soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related suicide bombings targeting checkpoints in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.

04/06/2018: Three suicide bombers detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a military checkpoint in Saypiano area, Mogadishu, Somalia. In addition to the three assailants, two soldiers were killed in the blast. This was one of two related suicide bombings targeting checkpoints in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attacks.
04/13/2018: Assailants set fire to Al-Sheikh Saada Mosque in Akraba, Nablus, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Israeli settlers claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: Two assailants opened fire on a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) vehicle in Gao, Mali. One Nigerien peacekeeper was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

04/07/2018: Assailants abducted Jamal Saleh al-Tayf from his residence in Saidiyah, Tripoli, Libya. Al-Tayf, the Aziziyah mayor, was shot and injured before being released on April 12, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting an electricity pylon in Las Marias, Narino, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, though the pylon was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 04/06/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Cukurca district, Hakkari, Turkey. Two soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

04/06/2018: Three assailants opened fire at the Jarandih railway siding in Kantaghar, Jharkhand, India. An unknown number of workers were injured and several offices and vehicles were damaged during the attack. The Jharkhand Janmukti Parishad (JJP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the railway siding was targeted because the local contractors were working with the group's consent.

04/06/2018: Assailants threw explosive devices and opened fire on a Sudanese military convoy serving with the Operation Restoring Hope Coalition near Midi, Hajjah, Yemen. Dozens of soldiers were killed and approximately 100 soldiers were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Pakistan Armed Forces patrol in Mir Ali, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. At least five soldiers were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/06/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated behind Al-Khansa Mosque in Barzeh neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. At least one person was killed and six other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/06/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) checkpoint in Balghali, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: An explosive device detonated along the highway in Dia, Mopti, Mali. Four civilians were killed and another civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/06/2018: Assailants abducted two civilians from Okokolo, Agatu, Benue, Nigeria. The two victims were killed and their bodies were discovered on April 7, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/07/2018: Security forces identified and engaged assailants attempting to extort money from civilians in San Vicente, Northern Samar, Philippines. There were no reported casualties and two assailants were arrested following the clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

04/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Al-Kayf, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three civilians were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/07/2018: Security forces discovered and defused three explosives-laden vehicles and an unknown number of explosives-laden barrels in western Al Anbar governorate, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/07/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated 13 explosive devices in Nineveh governorate, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated at the National Movement for Development and Reform (Al-Hal) party headquarters in Hit, Al Anbar, Iraq. In addition to the assailants, at least four people, including three police officers, were killed and seven people, including a parliamentary candidate, were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the headquarters was attacked in order to target "candidates in the polytheist election."
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/07/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Qassaban, Laghman, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and two additional assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/07/2018: A police officer opened fire on his colleagues at a police checkpoint in Argahandab district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Four police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) checkpoint in Hansholei village near Jowhar, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least three people, including two soldiers and one civilian, were killed and four people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
04/07/2018: Assailants shot and killed a former militant in Koshkalat, Tump subdistrict, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/07/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a mosque in Bab, Aleppo, Syria. At least eight people were killed and 20 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on Wilson Geresola in Camalandaan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Geresola, a Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

04/07/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Sirwah district, Marib, Yemen. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least four soldiers were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
04/07/2018: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle near Pishchane, Luhansk, Ukraine. Four people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/07/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at a civilian residence in Himchi, West Bengal, India. Eight people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents in Jimin Nyaku, Keana, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least two people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
04/07/2018: Assailants shot and killed Domingo Ruedas, a village chief, in Mulanay, Quezon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2018: Assailants attacked and killed a United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) aid worker near Leer, Southern Liech, South Sudan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: An assailant threw a grenade at a shop along Al-Jumhuriyah Street in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast, and the assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/08/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Alam, Saladin, Iraq. The owner of the vehicle was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel near the Akhtar Matar shrine in the 1st Police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. A police commander was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: A suicide bomber detonated targeting military personnel in Hit, Al Anbar, Iraq. The assailant was killed and six soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Ban Batu, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks targeting security checkpoints in Bacho district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Ban Iyoh, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks targeting security checkpoints in Bacho district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Royal Thai Marine Corps post in Ban Satae, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks targeting security checkpoints in Bacho district on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

04/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed Hamidou Koundaba, the Koutougou mayor, near his residence in Koutougou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Koundaba was targeted for his collaboration with the government of Burkina Faso.
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 04/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed Father Etienne Sengiyumva, a Catholic priest, in Kyalema, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nyatura militia.

04/08/2018: Security forces identified and killed two suicide bombers targeting Mandanari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

04/08/2018: Assailants attacked Kituamoke, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Security forces repelled the assault, capturing three assailants. The Mai Mai Mazembe militia claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out to allow the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) to attack Mwalika.

04/07/2018: Assailants threw a grenade targeting a police patrol in Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. At least two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 04/08/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint in Qarasheikh, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one border police officer and one assailant were killed while two officers and four assailants were injured in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in districts of Faryab on this date. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: Assailants attacked National Uprising Movement (NUM) posts in Bilchiragh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 18 Uprising members were killed and 40 were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in districts of Faryab on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/08/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device from a flyover in Rosary Heights 2, Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. A street vendor was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed Beer Dilacshe, a National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) officer, in Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/08/2018: Three assailants planted two explosive devices along the border fence with the Gaza Strip in Southern district, Israel. There were no reported casualties as the devices were later recovered and defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) base in Bangui, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on Roland Labad, a municipal employee and political aspirant, in Purok 3, Barubuhan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Labad was killed and another municipal employee, identified as Carlito Murcia, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/08/2018: An assailant armed with a screwdriver attempted to stab an Israeli settler at a gas station near Maale Adumim, West Bank. The settler was injured in the assault before the assailant was shot and killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant, Mohammad Abdul-Karim Marshoud, as a Palestinian extremist.

04/08/2018: An explosive device detonated at a crusher factory in Triyuga, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

04/08/2018: Assailants abducted Justice Mbeng Martin, a former judge, in Ewelle, South-West, Cameroon. Mbeng was released on April 11, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
04/08/2018: An explosive device detonated at a power substation in Thoubal Khunou, Manipur, India. At least two workers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/08/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. One police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 04/08/2018: Three assailants set fire to the vehicle of Sinn Fein councilor Kevin Campbell in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to dissident republicans.

04/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents in Guidan Ayua, Kadarko, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least four people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/07/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Takhta, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks on checkpoints on the same night. At least six police officers were killed and three officers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban and the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.

04/07/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Takhta, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks on checkpoints on the same night. At least six police officers and five assailants were killed and three officers and eight assailants were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban and the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.

04/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military checkpoint along Bangolo-Kouibly Road in Baou, Montagnes, Ivory Coast. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Afghan National Army (ANA) personnel in Qaramqol district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two ANA soldiers were killed and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: A police officer opened fire on his colleagues at a police checkpoint in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Ismail Chetae detonated in Tanyong Dalo, Pattani, Thailand. Chetae, a defense volunteer, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in front of a temple on Prachawiwat Road in Sungai Kolok, Narathiwat, Thailand. At least one person was injured in the blast. This was one of three coordinated bombings in Sungai Kolok on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to separatists.

04/09/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated behind the Plaza Hotel in Sungai Kolok, Narathiwat, Thailand. At least six people were injured in the blast. This was one of three coordinated bombings in Sungai Kolok on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to separatists.

04/09/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in front of a restaurant in Sungai Kolok, Narathiwat, Thailand. At least six people were injured in the blast. This was one of three coordinated bombings in Sungai Kolok on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to separatists.

04/09/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. This was one of two attacks in Seiyun carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on Shaykh Salamah Bin 'Ayid al-Kathiri in Seiyun, Hadramawt, Yemen. Al-Kathiri, a tribal leader and General People’s Congress (GPC) member, was killed in the assault. This was one of two attacks in Seiyun carried out by the same assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

04/09/2018: An explosives-laden rickshaw detonated at a market in Shindand, Herat, Afghanistan. At least six people were killed and seven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which the group denied.

04/09/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Chishti Sharif district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers and 15 assailants were killed and eight assailants and four soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The Taliban Special Group (TSG) faction of Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on Muhammad Ahmad Muqbil in Bab al-Kabir area, Taizz, Yemen. Muqbil, an Al-'Asbah Brigade military instructor, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Afghan National Army (ANA) vehicle in Maydan Shahr, Wardak, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a wake in Bulad, Negros Occidental, Philippines. At least three people, including Jose Joerito Amable, a retired Staff Sergeant and current Civil Security Group of Moises Padilla Mayor Magdaleno Pena head, Alejandro Borres, a retired police officer, and Pedirico Bitgue 3rd, were killed and two other people were injured in the assault. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying popular resistance committee members in Az Zahir district, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least three popular resistance commanders were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Shaykh Anwar al-Tamimi in Tarim, Hadramawt, Yemen. Al-Tamimi, the head of the al-Tamim tribe and a member of the Inclusive Hadramawt Conference Supreme Council, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on park rangers at Virunga National Park near Bulambo, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Six people, including five park rangers and a driver, were killed and one ranger was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.

04/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a bus carrying District Reserve Guard (DRG) personnel in Namaid, Chhattisgarh, India. At least two DRG officers were killed and five officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

Three assailants were shot and killed by security forces before the fourth assailant detonated an explosives-laden vest. In addition to the assailants, at least two security personnel were killed and six security personnel were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: Assailants tied up two security guards and set fire to the administration block of Hazar Naw High School in Hazar Naw, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The two guards were released and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

04/10/2018: Assailants opened fire at an International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) compound in Leer, Southern Liech, South Sudan. One ICRC guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on a military truck in Tagbac, North Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a cafe near a security checkpoint in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. At least one civilian was killed and four people, including three civilians and one soldier, were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Hope Restoration vehicle near Bentiu, Northern Liech, South Sudan. One aid worker was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it along a road in Ali Khail district, Paktia, Afghanistan. One assailant was killed and three assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
04/10/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Paktia, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/10/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices were discovered and defused in Wardak, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Israeli residence in Shaarei Tikva, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

04/10/2018: Assailants set fire to Tamen village in Kadarko, Keana district, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least one person was abducted and 20 residences were set on fire in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.
04/10/2018: Assailants abducted four people, including two health workers, in Nbouna, Mopti, Mali. The four hostages were released on April 12, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: Assailants attacked Arun Pidit Bhandari at a market in Sahidchok, Narayangadh, Province 3, Nepal. Bhandari, the Bharatpur-10 ward chairperson, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) may have carried out the attack.

04/10/2018: Assailants abducted Ata Ibrahim, associate professor of organic chemistry at the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences at the University of Al Hudaydah, Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

04/11/2018: Security forces identified and intercepted two suicide bombers attempting to target Shia pilgrims near Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. One assailant was shot and killed, while the second assailant detonated an explosives-laden belt. The assailants were the only reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle outside a courthouse detonated in Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near a restaurant in Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Security forces discovered and defused several explosive devices planted at an ancient citadel in Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/12/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces convoy in Sadirah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least five people were killed and four people were injured in the ensuing clash; the victims included volunteer fighters and local villagers. This was one of two related attacks in Sadirah on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/11/2018: Security forces identified and arrested two assailants planting an explosive device in Siniyah, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying Abdul Tawab Taib, the provincial director for agriculture, irrigation, and livestock, in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. Taib and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a mobile phone tower in Chimtal district, Balkh, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two attacks targeting mobile phone towers in Chimtal on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a mobile phone tower in Chimtal district, Balkh, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two attacks targeting mobile phone towers in Chimtal on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Digal, Kunar, Afghanistan. At least two assailants were killed and another two assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 04/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a girls' school in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. An unspecified number of security guards were locked in a room and beaten before being released. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked a German NGO Help convoy in Tingarane, 25km north of Ayorou, Tillaberi, Niger. Five people were abducted during the attack. Four employees were wounded but released shortly after the attack; however, the fate of Joerg Lange, a German aid worker, remains unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jama'a Nusrat ul-Islam wa al-Muslimin' (JNIM) and the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on polio workers in Nushki, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Pakistani Police checkpoint in Dera Murad Jamali, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one Frontier Corps (FC) soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Brigadier General Munir al-Yafi'i Abu-al-Yamanah in Al Haswah, Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Abu-al-Yamamah, a security belt commander, was not harmed and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attacked a military detachment in Labu-Labu, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

04/11/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile at Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by the air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile at Najran, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by the air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: Security forces identified and destroyed a drone targeting Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: Security forces identified and destroyed a drone targeting Abha, Asir, Saudi Arabia. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Kalika Construction building in Bharatpur, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

04/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) and Central African Armed Forces (FACA) joint patrol in the 5th Arrondissement, Bangui, Central African Republic. At least 27 people, including one Rwandan peacekeeper, were killed and more than 100 people, including eight peacekeepers, were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. Muslim extremists claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military engineering unit near the border crossing in Karni, Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
04/11/2018: Assailants attacked and killed a civilian in Rafin Bauna, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military vehicles in Talayan, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked the Philippine Army's 57th Infantry Battalion in Pagatin, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

04/11/2018: Security forces discovered and defused three explosive devices in Rajpeta, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near Madan Bhandari Memorial Hall in Tharuhat Rangasala, Triyuga, Province 1, Nepal. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to two members of the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Frontier Constabulary (FC) checkpoint near Baisakhi neighborhood, Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/11/2018: Assailants abducted Omda Hasoun Mangali, the leader of popular court, along with his companions, along El Zubair Street in El Muhandiseen, Omdurman, Khartoum, Sudan. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked a mining site in Kuru-Kuru, Anka, Zamfara, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. At least 26 people were killed across attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked Jarkuka, Anka, Zamfara, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. At least 26 people were killed across attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.
04/11/2018: Assailants attacked Jandeikyula village, Wukari, Taraba, Nigeria. At least 25 people were killed in the attack. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants abducted and publicly executed a civilian in Mardyan district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, noting that the victim was accused of killing one of the Taliban’s commanders.

04/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated targeting Special Forces in Saydabad district, Wardak, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, four security personnel were killed and an unknown number were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) and Somali National Army (SNA) base in Kabtanlas, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least three Ugandan soldiers were killed in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device underneath a culvert in Payenda Khel, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along Nurpur-Chamba Road near Nurpur, Himachal Pradesh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces training center in Balad, Saladin, Iraq. Four volunteer fighters were injured in the assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated underneath a Madurai-Coimbatore passenger train near Pollachi, Tamil Nadu, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/11/2018: Assailants established a roadblock and killed a civilian in Anyiin, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants fired mortars targeting Turkish military personnel in Kani Rash, Arbil, Iraq. One soldier was killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked a Matungu Baptist Church prayer group meeting in Eshimuli, Kakamega, Kenya. At least nine people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Security forces identified and destroyed an explosives-laden vehicle at an unknown location in Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Al-Shabaab.
04/11/2018: An explosive device detonated at a housing project in Sumagdang, Isabela City, Basilan, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents in Kadarko, Keana, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and several people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians along Ankoma-Doka highway in Doma, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents in Udela, Awe, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/11/2018: Assailants shot and killed a farmer (Aondoaver Muemumu) Ayilamo-Anyiin highway in Logo, Benue, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

04/11/2018: Assailants attacked and cut off the hand of a student at a school in Kadarko, Keana, Nasarawa, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.

04/00/2018: Sometime between April 8, 2018 and April 14, 2018, assailants abducted Faisal Yousef and Nimat Dawud from their residences in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. The whereabouts of Yousef and Dawud, who were both National Council of Syrian Kurds (ENKS) members, is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on Brigadier General Fahim Qaim, the Maidan Wardak police chief, in Purk Bazaar, Logar, Afghanistan. Qaim was unharmed, though two of his bodyguards were injured in the attack. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/00/2018: Sometime between April 8, 2018 and April 14, 2018, assailants hijacked an Action against Hunger vehicle along Tessit-Keygourutane highway in Tessit, Gao, Mali. The outcome of the hijacking is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy escorting a palm oil truck in Ekondo Titi, Ndian, South-West, Cameroon. Three assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/12/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting a funeral procession at a cemetery in Sadirah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least 25 people were killed and 15 people were injured in the blasts. This was one of two related attacks in Sadirah on this date; this bombing targeted the funeral of Iraqi Volunteer Forces personnel and villagers killed in an earlier assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/12/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Army checkpoint in Anjabah area near Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/12/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Larzanak, Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel, including police officers and soldiers, and 15 assailants were killed while four security personnel and 22 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two similar attacks in Shindand on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle responding to an earlier attack on a checkpost near Shindand, Herat, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and four were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Shindand on the same night. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

04/12/2018: Assailants detonated explosives at the Trasandino Pipeline in Ricaurte, Narino, Colombia. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

04/12/2018: Assailants attacked the district headquarters in Khwaja Umari district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 40 people, including governor Ali Dost Shams and 27 assailants, were killed and 23 people, including 13 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. Police officers and intelligence officials were also among the casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/12/2018: Assailants raided the Bouro Primary School in Bouro, Nassoumbou, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One student was killed and one teacher, identified as Issouf Souabo, was abducted in the attack. The hostage was released on June 11, 2018. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim, Issouf Souabo, was targeted because he taught his students using the French language.
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 04/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Pakistan Armed Forces vehicle in Sangsila, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. The Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a motorcycle in Kahan, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

04/11/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by the air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Colombian marine in Changuera, Jurado, Choco, Colombia. One soldier was wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army (ELN).

04/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on ‘Abduh ‘Ali al-Julaydi al-Subayhi, a Socialist Party leading figure, in Aden, Adan, Yemen. Al-Subayhi was harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/12/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/12/2018: Assailants set fire to a Dole Stanfilco warehouse in Kalpisot, Lunen, South Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the New People's Army (NPA).

04/12/2018: An explosive device detonated at a soccer stadium in Barawe, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least five people were killed and 10 people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the group had previously threatened people in Barawe not to play soccer with African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces. Additionally, sources stated that the device was intended to target regional and district officials attending the match.

04/12/2018: Assailants shot and killed Edmiraldo Sollando, a Sulu Integrated Provincial Health Office employee, in San Raymundo, Jolo, Sulu, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

04/12/2018: Assailants attacked Agboughul, Benue, Nigeria. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Fulani extremists were involved in the attack.
04/12/2018: Assailants launched a missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by an air defense system. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/13/2018: Assailants set fire to the vehicle of Rodmal Rathore, a former Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA), at his residence in Mahananda Nagar, Madhya Pradesh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/12/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Kote Sangi, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
04/12/2018: A grenade was discovered and defused near a residential house in 6th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/13/2018: Assailants threw a sound bomb and opened fire targeting Anwar Fakhri Karim in Adhaim, Diyala, Iraq. Karim, an Iraqi Turkmen Front parliamentary candidate, was not harmed; however, his driver was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was targeted because he was a candidate in the "polytheistic democracy" election.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/13/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 12 explosive devices along a road in Nineveh governorate, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

04/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Mukhtar al-Musawi's convoy in Tal Afar district, Nineveh, Iraq. Al-Musawi, an Iraqi Volunteer Forces commander, was not harmed in the blast, and three additional explosive devices were discovered and defused at the site. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 04/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting 'Abbud al-Karkhi in Kanaan, Diyala, Iraq. Al-Karkhi, a Diyala Court of Appeals judge, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

04/13/2018: Security forces discovered and defused four explosive devices in Semar, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.

04/13/2018: Assailants threw explosive devices and Molotov cocktails at Israel Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers and security barriers near a border crossing with Israel in Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

The kite crash-landed in an unknown area of Gaza Strip, without any reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

04/13/2018: Assailants launched a missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by an air defense system. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least 13 hostages were released on April 19, 2018. Three others were released on April 21, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

04/13/2018: Assailants sabotaged a railway track with a piece of iron in Kiul, Bihar, India. At least one person was killed and two people were injured when a passenger train the iron. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Maoists carried out the attack.

Topno was found beheaded the following day. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Pastor Abraham Topno of being a police informant.

Sources also noted that the attack occurred as the High National Elections Commission (HNEC) was preparing for Libya's upcoming general and presidential elections, which were scheduled to take place sometime in 2018.

05/07/2018: Assailants set fire to National Irrigation Administration (NIA) property in Tagbak, Tanawan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
