At least one assailant and 10 National Uprising Movement (NUM) members were killed while 14 other NUM members and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, at least 30 other NUM members were kidnapped; the outcome of the abduction is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least one officer was killed and four people, including three officers and one assailant, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/07/2018: Assailants shot and killed two soldiers of the Presidential Defense Forces in Khur Maksar, Aden, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/07/2018: Assailants dragged three truck drivers from a school, beat them, and forced them to drive their trucks outside of the village in the outskirts of Gatta village, Maharashtra, India. One of the trucks did not start but the other two were driven out of the village and set on fire by the assailants. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and declared a bandh in response to the killing of 40 Maoists by security forces in Gadchiroli district in April 2018. Sources stated that the 40 Maoists were killed in two encounters, which Maoists believed were "fake" and resulted in the death of innocent people.

05/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Five police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on Sifiso Cele in Ray Nkonyeni, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. Cele, the Oshabeni branch treasurer and African National Congress (ANC) activist, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/07/2018: Assailants attacked the district center in Shahrak, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least 14 people, including three uprising members, one police officer, and ten assailants were killed while two police officers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on Rabun Maarouf, the Al-Jil al-Jadid (New Generation) Movement head, along Mudhafariya Street in central Arbil, Iraq. Maarouf was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/07/2018: Assailants fired mortars at civilian residences near Qaniah, Al Bayda, Yemen. Five civilians were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
05/07/2018: Assailants set fire to a Barisan Nasional tent in Sungai Petani, Kedah, Malaysia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/05/2018: Assailants kidnapped Iber Angulo Zamora and three others from a boat travelling along the Naya river in Santa Maria, Cauca, Colombia. The four were killed sometime before June 4, 2018. Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 05/08/2018: Assailants fired a mortar into Hafiz Godai, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and 19 others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Suicide bombers in explosives-laden vehicles attacked Gate 90 in Um al-Qandil, Sirte, Libya. One assailant detonated the vehicle while another assailant was killed by security forces at the checkpoint. In addition to the two assailants, at least four people, including two soldiers and two civilians, were killed and six other people were injured in the blast. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/08/2018: Assailants attacked Tala Wa Barfak district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including security forces personnel and civilians, were killed and three security force members were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Additionally, at least seven personnel were abducted and 100 others were reported missing. At least 31 of those reported missing were recovered on May 10, 2018; however the fate of the remaining hostages and missing persons is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/07/2018: Two assailants attacked security forces in Alam, Saladin, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/08/2018: Assailants threw two grenades at an Assam Rifles (AR) camp in North AOC area, Imphal, Manipur, India. An AR constable was injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident

05/04/2018: Assailants attacked a police patrol in Maruf district, Kandahar Afghanistan. Twenty people, including five officers and 15 assailants, were killed, 20 others, including nine officers and 11 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash which lasted until May 6, 2018. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/08/2018: Assailants attacked and killed Najm Hadi Fayyad, a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) official, in Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Nasser Hamid Aboud, a police colonel, in Qara Durrat, Kirkuk, Iraq. Aboud was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/08/2018: Explosive devices were discovered and safely defused on the Steel Bridge in Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Assailants attacked a security post providing security to a voter registration center in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Assailants abducted a woman and stoned her to death in Sablale, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The woman was accused of being married to 11 men simultaneously. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Assailants attempted to fire rockets and mortars at an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Ali Kamin, Mogadishu, Somalia. The shells landed in a residential neighborhood, injuring seven civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Inmates in a prison attacked and held at least six guards hostage in Depok, West Java, Indonesia. Five guards were executed and one was released, while one inmate was also killed and four guards were injured during the standoff that lasted for 36 hours. Jemaah Ansharut Daulah claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Security forces discovered and defused a pipe bomb at the garden of a house on Tarry Drive in Lurgan, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to dissident Republicans.

05/08/2018: An assailant armed with an explosive device was arrested in the forest between Madnar and Permpal, Kondagaon district, Chhattisgarh, India. The assailant was thought to be targeting security forces with the device. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources identified the assailant, Mohan Kashyap, as a Maoist.

05/08/2018: Assailants abducted two alleged police informers in Suktara, Chhattisgarh, India. Both hostages were shot and killed a short time later. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and accused the victims of being police informants.

05/09/2018: Security forces identified two female suicide bombers targeting Alhaji Bunu Mosque in Jidari Polo, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. The two assailants detonated their explosives, killing only themselves, before reaching their target. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.

05/08/2018: Assailants abducted two people, including a city prefect, identified as Makan Doumbia, and his driver, from Tenenkou, Mopti, Mali. The hostages were released on February 19, 2019. Fulani extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they would "teach the Koran to the prefect."
05/08/2018: Assailants shot and injured Olivera Lakic, an investigative journalist, outside of her residence in Podgorica, Montenegro. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/08/2018: Assailants attacked and killed a Turkish soldier in northern Iraq. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/08/2018: A suicide bomber detonated and assailants opened fire on the convoy of Member of Parliament (MP) Zaytoun al-Dulaimi in Hadar, Baghdad, Iraq. In addition to the death of the assailant, Dulaimi's son was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Assailants abducted Abel Montúfar Mendoza in Coyuca de Catalan, Guerrero, Mexico. Mendoza, a local mayor and Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI) local legislature candidate, was tortured and killed and his body was discovered in the trunk of his vehicle a short time later. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/08/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Imghad Tuareg Self-Defense Group and Allies (GATIA) vehicle in Ahina, Anchawadij, Gao, Mali. One GAITA member was killed and two were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: An explosive device detonated near an Iraqi Oil Drilling Company vehicle at Khabaz Oil Field in Qarah Tappah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three workers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/08/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Sarim ‘Abd al-Husayn in Babil, Iraq. Al-Husayn, a Sa’irun Coalition candidate, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/08/2018: An assailant opened fire on the residence of a Pakistani Police officer in Sadiq Banda, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least three people were killed and six other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/08/2018: Assailants raided Mayonga, Tshopo, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties, though buildings were set on fire in the attack. Thomas Mesandu, a Mayi Mayi leader, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was revenge for the mistreatment of his son by government soldiers.

05/08/2018: Assailants set fire to a conveyor belt at a Societe Le Nickel (SLN) mining site in Kouaoua, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/08/2018: Assailants abducted Abdulhameed Hassan Alhadam in Hada district, Dhamar, Yemen. The whereabouts of Alhadam, the General Public Conference representative, are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a civilian vehicle between Indelimane and Menaka, Menaka, Mali. At least five civilians were killed in the assault. This was one of two attacks targeting Taureg civilians in Mali on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants attacked civilians at a camp between Indelimane and Menaka, Menaka, Mali. At least two people were killed in the incident. This was one of two attacks targeting Taureg civilians in Mali on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked a police station in Dasht-e-Barchi, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two unrelated attacks targeting police stations in Kabul on this date. At least 25 people, including nine assailants, were killed and 28 people were injured across both attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for this incident, stating that the attack was carried out in retaliation for United States and Afghan forces' airstrikes against civilians. Additionally, sources attributed the attack to the Haqqani Network and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/09/2018: Five suicide bombers attacked a police station in Shar Naw, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two unrelated attacks targeting police stations in Kabul on this date. At least 25 people, including nine assailants, were killed and 28 people were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for this incident; additionally, sources attributed the attack to the Haqqani Network and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

05/09/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest targeting a military vehicle at a khat market in Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. In addition to the assailant, 10 people were killed and eight others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/09/2018: Security forces identified and engaged assailants extorting civilians in Imelda, Northern Samar, Philippines. A security official and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

05/09/2018: An explosive device detonated outside the governor's office in Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. An unknown number of people, including guards and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked Nega village, Numan, Adamawa State, Nigeria. At least eight people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured, while a church and an unknown number of houses were set on fire. The Nigerian Army repelled the attack and killed an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: A timed explosive device detonated targeting a Border Security Force (BSF) outpost in Koirengei, Imphal, Manipur, India. Two BSF personnel were killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. The People's Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak (PREPAK) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was part of the group's wider campaign of violence to recreate an independent state of Kangleipak.

05/08/2018: Assailants launched a projectile and opened fire at a military vehicle in Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. Five soldiers were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/08/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Jalawla, Diyala, Iraq. Security forces repelled the attack and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched two missiles targeting Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the missiles were intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to Saudi airstrikes in Yemen.

05/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol near boundary pillar number 10 at an unknown location in Myanmar. At least four assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Arakan Army (AA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched a missile targeting Jazan, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the missile was intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to "crimes" committed by American and Saudi security forces against Yemeni citizens.
05/09/2018: Assailants shot and killed Bartolome Mackay, a village chief, in Trinidad, Isabela, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants set fire to 10 road construction vehicles in Pirtand, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
05/09/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Bagua, Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

05/09/2018: Assailants fired a rocket that struck a vehicle at Maysat square in Maysat neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. At least two people were killed and 11 other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two projectile attacks in different Damascus neighborhoods on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants fired a rocket that struck the Damascus Commercial Tower in Marjeh neighborhood, Damascus, Syria. At least two people were killed and 13 other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two projectile attacks in different Damascus neighborhoods on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants armed with grenades and automatic firearms attacked a Pakistan Muslim League: Nawaz (PML-N) election office in Lyari neighborhood, Karachi, Pakistan. At least four people, including Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz (PML-N) leader Aqeel Rehmani and one assailant, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Baba Ladla Gang.
05/09/2018: Assailants attacked Tutuwa, Taraba, Nigeria. At least nine people were killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device at the Khilung Kalika Agro-firm in Thadakhet, Province 4, Nepal. There were no reported casualties, but an electrical generator and shed were destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a soldier in El Ogla, El Oued, Algeria. A soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint in Ghorak district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks targeting border police checkpoints in different districts of Kandahar on this date. At least five border police officers and 30 assailants were killed while seven border police officers and 45 assailants, were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint in Registan district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks targeting border police checkpoints in different districts of Kandahar on this date. At least five border police officers and 30 assailants, were killed and seven border police officers and 45 assailants, were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Birat, Lol, South Sudan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Army-in opposition (SPLA-IO). Sources also attributed the attack to the South Sudan United Front (SSUF), which denied responsibility.
05/09/2018: Assailants threw two grenades at a civilian residence in Sumar, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/09/2018: A sniper shot and killed Sultan Yassin al-Hamdani, a volunteer fighters commander, in Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants detonated explosive devices at the Said Afandi Chirkeyskiy Sufi shrine in Chirkey, Dagestan, Russia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Caucasus Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also attritbuted the attack to the Khasavyurt Group.
gname: Caucasus Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/09/2018: Assailants kidnapped an unknown number of civilians in Jiljiiley, Hiiraan, Somalia. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

05/09/2018: Assailants raided Mande Mbaawa, Guma, Benue, Nigeria. The attack resulted in an unknown number of injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Fulani extremists.

05/09/2018: An assailant set fire to an altar at St. Frances Cabrini Parish Church along 108th Street SW in Lakewood, Washington, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked Srinivas Devadiga, a Bharatiya Janata Party activist and former municipal councilor nominee, in Ladi, Moodbidri, Karnataka, India. Devadiga was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked a military convoy escorting government officials near Akwaya, South-West, Cameroon. At least one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

05/09/2018: Assailants abducted an engineer accused of being an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) member in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. The hostage was tortured and killed and his body was returned to his family on June 7, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/09/2018: Assailants abducted a pharmacist accused of being an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) member in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. The hostage was tortured and killed as of June 9, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).
05/09/2018: Assailants attacked and set fire to a Roma settlement in Rudne. Lviv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/00/2018: Sometime between May 6, 2018 and May 12, 2018, assailants abducted Christopher Ekidi Ewang in Konye, Meme, South-West, Cameroon. Ewang, a local police commissioner, was released on May 13, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Ambazonia Defense Forces (ADF).

05/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a soldier along Kihihi-Isasha road in Kanungu district, Western, Uganda. The soldier, identified as Gladia Amenyo, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: An explosives-laden package detonated at St. Stephen's Episcopal Church located on 4090 Delaware Street in Beaumont, Texas, United States. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities arrested Jonathan Torres in connection with this attack and an earlier bombing attempt on April 26, 2018.

05/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at an all-girls public school in Hassu Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/10/2018: Three assailants armed with firearms and knives attacked Imam Hussain Mosque, a Shia mosque, on Old Main Road, Ottawa, Verulam, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. At least one person was killed and two others were injured in the assault. The mosque was also set on fire. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a group that supported the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and noted that the leader of the group, Farhad Hoomer, contained ISIL propaganda and a picture of him wearing an ISIL beanie on his phone.

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on two civilians in San Isidro, Negros Occidental, Philippines. One civilian, identified as Lusan Ledama, was killed and the other, identified as Jose Villagante, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a cargo truck and then set fire to it in Magallon Cadre, Negros Occidental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Avin Muhammad Hasan al-Zahawi, a Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) parliamentary candidate, along Khanaqin-Aliawa road, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. One security guard was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device near a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) detachment on a highway in Dicalungan, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

05/10/2018: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) at a military detachment in Madia, Maguindanao, Philippines. Three assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Dorahi, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 23 soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. In addition, five police officers were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. This was one of three attacks carried out in Farah on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Raj, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 11 police officers were killed and three officers were injured in the attack. This was one of three attacks carried out in Farah on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Lash Wa Juwayn district, Farah, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. This was one of three attacks carried out in Farah on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/10/2018: Assailants set fire to a telecommunications tower in Khwaja Ghar district, Takhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants attacked a voter registration center in Taluqan, Takhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants attacked a construction company in Bangi district, Takhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at the residence of Abdulkarim al-Kaabi in Abu al-Khasib, Basra, Iraq. al-Kaabi, a Fatah alliance parliamentary candidate, was unharmed as the device failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Moygashel, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Aristeo Ilao, a councilor, in Manalo, Sampaloc, Quezon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: Assailants threw grenades and opened fire on the house of Arnel Labao in Bato-Bato, Capiz, Philippines. Labao, a village councilor running for village captain, was not harmed as no casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: An assailant armed with a poisoned knife attacked police officers in front of the headquarters in Kelapa Dua, Depok, West Java, Indonesia. The assailant stabbed and killed one officer and security forces then shot and killed the assailant. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jemaah Ansharut Daulah (JAD).
05/10/2018: Assailants set fire to a Emmanuel Church Budor in Doti, Province 7, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: An explosive device detonated along the Pakistan Railways Quetta-Punjab line track in Spezand, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. A second device was discovered and defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a railway's electrical boxes in Trento, Trentino-Alto Adige, Italy. There were no reported casualties though train service was disrupted. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel near Qoryoley, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle near Wanlaweyne, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least seven soldiers were killed and two others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: Assailants attacked Qurraish village in Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three security personnel were injured in the attack. Additionally, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Malik Saz Mohammad near the Jinnah bus stand in Khar subdistrict, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Mohammad, a pro-government tribal elder, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Dimapur, Nagaland, India. One CRPF officer, identified as Havaldar Rajinder Singh, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants fired two projectiles that landed and detonated in Umar Mandan, Diyala,, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire and killed Habib Baggash, the Al-Islah Party leader in Taizz, at the intersection of Almasbah and Jamal Street in al-Masbah, Taizz, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants abducted three people, including Inadjatafane mayor Beydi Ould, former mayor of Boni Boucary Cisse, and a school director, along Sevare-Douentza road in Mopti, Mali. Ould and Cisse were released on May 13, 2018, while the fate of the school director is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near a Pakistani Police patrol in Kohat Chowrangi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one officer was killed and 13 other people, including officers and civilians, were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/11/2018: A remote-controlled explosive device detonated at a videoke bar in Martirez, Jolo, Sulu, Philippines. Ten civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked Afghan police checkposts in Daychopan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least four people, including the Shamalzo district police chief, were killed and three other officers were injured in the incident. Additionally, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked a guard post in Wardwan. Soibug, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A police officer was killed in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/11/2018: Assailants launched mortars in Islah, Diyala, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/11/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated an explosive device near a school being used as a polling station in Wahed Huzayran, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Kurdistan TV building in Sulaymaniyah, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: An explosive device detonated outside the Datu Demaudtang Dilangalen Elementary School, a designated polling location, in Narra, Tugal, North Cotabato, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

05/11/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire targeting security personnel in Malinao, Camarines Sur, Philippines. A soldier was killed and three others were injured in the attack; the assailants also sustained an undetermined number of injuries in the clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People’s Army (NPA).

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a tourist vehicle at Virunga National Park near Kibati, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. A park ranger, identified as Rachel Masika Baraka, was killed and three other people, including Bethan Davies and Robert Jesty, British tourists, and their driver, were abducted in the assault. The driver was injured and released shortly after the kidnapping while the two British hostages were released on May 13, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Mayi Mayi.

05/11/2018: Assailants abducted 13 United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) peacekeepers between Kongolo and Kalemie in Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Eleven of the hostages were released on the same day, while the remaining two peacekeepers were released on May 16, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to a Mayi Mayi.

05/09/2018: Assailants attacked a voter registration center in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and two security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked an area near Barwanat al-Kabira, Diyala, Iraq. Three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/11/2018: Assailants abducted a village chief and two of his relatives from Thanchi, Chittagong, Bangladesh. Two of the hostages were released on May 14, 2018, while the remaining hostage was rescued on May 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the kidnapping to the Arakan Army (AA).

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked Oshan village in Shahrak district, Ghor, Afghanistan. At least 46 people, including 15 pro-government militia members, six ANA soldiers, and 25 assailants, were killed while 11 security personnel and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a Emmanuel Church in Kanchanpur, Province 7, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Security forces identified and engaged an assailant attempting to plant an explosive device near a bus stand in Cherla, Telangana, India. The assailant fled and the device was defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol near Dudagad, Rajnandgaon, Chhattisgarh, India. An assailant was killed in the ensuing clash, and an explosive device was subsequently discovered and defused. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on Sibuyiselo Dlamini along R66 Highway in Ulundi, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. Dlamini, the Zululand district chairperson and an Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) councilor, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/11/2018: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at the residence of Yasser Dawabsheh in Duma, West Bank. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Israeli settlers.

05/11/2018: Explosive devices detonated targeting soldiers in Bestler-Dereler, Sirnak, Turkey. One soldier was killed and a second soldier was injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) vehicle near Kharmod, Awantipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a volunteer fighters’ checkpoint in eastern Dawr, Saladin, Iraq. Four people, including two volunteer fighters and two civilians, were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/11/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired ballistic missiles targeting residential areas in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the missiles were intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
05/11/2018: An assailant rammed his vehicle into an Israeli soldier in Shavei Shomron, West Bank. The soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire at the residence of an intelligence officer in Wadajir Mogadishu, Somalia. Four people, including two security guards and two civilians, were killed and two people were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on Jose Remedios Aguirre while he was campaigning in Parque Ecologico, Apaseo el Alto, Guanajuato, Mexico. At least two people, including Aguirre, a Morena party mayoral candidate, were killed and two other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Belloku, Lol, South Sudan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO). Sources also attributed the attack to the South Sudan United Front (SSUF), which denied responsibility.
05/11/2018: An assailant attacked Geshov, an investigative reporter, in Cherven Bryag, Pleven, Bulgaria. Geshov was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Malang Dand, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Ghazni on the same day. At least 19 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in Ghazni on the same day. At least 19 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

05/12/2018: An assailant stabbed pedestrians along the Rue Monsigny in Paris, Ile-de-France, France. Police opened fire in response, killing the assailant. One civilian was killed and four people, including a Chinese national, were injured in the attack. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Khamzat Azimov, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "You started it by bombing Islamic lands. France, you started it by killing Muslims... and then we give you a response, you cry. If you want this to stop, put pressure on your government, I’m not the first one to tell you. Others like me told you before acting, but you refused to listen." Sources also noted that Azimov pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL). The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the veracity of this claim could not be verified.

05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on security forces in Dashti Archi, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including six assailants and six soldiers, were killed and nine people, including four assailants and five soldiers, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked Federal Police and tribal forces checkpoint near Saduniyah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least six security personnel were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/11/2018: Assailants launched four mortar shells at a polling station in Abu Sayda, Diyala, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Brigadier General 'Abd-al-Karim al-Sayyadi, commander of the 30th Armored Brigade, in Qatabah district, Ad Dali, Yemen. al-Sayyadi survived, but three of his escorts were killed and two others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Approximately 100 assailants armed with artillery and firearms attacked security posts and a casino in Muse, Shan, Myanmar. At least 19 people, including three Chinese nationals, were killed and 20 people were injured in the attack. The casualties included civilians and security personnel. The Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for military operations against the Kachin Independence Army (KIA). Sources also attributed the attack to the KIA, which the group denied.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked Qara-i-Sheikhi area in Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: A magnetic explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three people were killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near Zanqar, Kirkuk, Iraq. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a volunteer fighters’ patrol near Al-Maslakhah, Saladin, Iraq. At least four volunteer fighters were killed and three others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants attacked voters in Abu Karmah, Diyala, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on an army patrol in Atubon, Tanawan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Two soldiers and one assailant were killed while eight soldiers and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to military operations and human rights abuses in areas of Negros Occidental.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked Farah, Afghanistan. At least 61 people, including 16 security personnel and 45 assailants, were killed and 41 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Farah province, Afghanistan. At least 20 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 15 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Paktika, Afghanistan. At least 11 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Argahandab district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least 22 police officers were killed and seven officers were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/12/2018: Assailants fired mortars into a Turkish military base in Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants attacked Ruhagarika, Cibitoke, Burundi. At least 26 people were killed and seven others were wounded in the attack. The Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi (Red-Tabara)

summary: 05/11/2018: An assailant attempted to run over soldiers south of Hebron, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, a Palestinian extremist was arrested in connection with the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Halfoley, Hiiraan, Somalia. Thirteen assailants were killed and two civilians were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab and noted that the victims had refused to provide livestock to the group.

05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel at a livestock market in Bulo Marer, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Four civilians were killed and five people, including two soldiers, were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Carlos Matas in Nuburan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Matas, a dxCA FM radio broadcaster/blocktimer and retired soldier, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/12/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham tribunal at the Palace of Justice in Idlib, Syria. At least 28 people were killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the blast; the victims included Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham and Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) members and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a volunteer fighters’ patrol in Al-Khan, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three volunteer fighters were killed in the blast. This was one of two related bombings targeting security personnel that occurred in Kirkuk on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a federal police patrol in Maktab Khalid, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one police officer was killed and two others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related bombings targeting security personnel that occurred in Al-Khan on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: Two suicide bombers attempted to attack a voting center in Yarf al-Malh, Diyala, Iraq. Security guards shot and killed both assailants and there were no other casualties. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Dina Gope near his residence in Anushabad, Bihar, India. Gope, a Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) local leader, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting a power pylon in Tumaco, Narino, Colombia. No casualties were reported in the blast, though the power supply was disrupted. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/12/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mohammud Barkhadle Abdi, the Peace, Unity and Development Party secretary, in Laascaanood, Sool, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/12/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Takeghat, Mali. At least 13 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian, identified as Mohamed Sheikh Adani, in Werder, Somali, Ethiopia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF).

05/12/2018: Assailants opened fire at the central office of the Electricity of Haiti (EDH) in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Haiti. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/12/2018: Assailants abducted Wilson David Ilaquiche Gavilanez from a bar in Tobar Donoso, Carchi, Ecuador. Gavilanez, an Ecuadorean corporal, was killed a short time later but his body was discovered as of March 4, 2019 near a river in Playon, Narino, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oliver Sinisterra Front of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 05/13/2018: A landmine detonated targeting a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) vehicle in Aguelhoc, Tessalit, Kidal, Mali. Three Chadian peacekeepers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

05/13/2018: Assailants attacked gold miners in Bolivar, Venezuela. At least 20 miners were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

05/13/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers equipped with an explosives-laden vehicle, explosives-laden vests, rocket-propelled grenades, and assault rifles, attacked the Tax and Revenue office in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 17 people, including eight assailants, were killed and 36 people were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for airstrikes against Afghan civilians by the United States.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/13/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives at the Church of the Immaculate Santa Maria in Surabaya, East Java, Indonesia. In addition to the two assailants, five people were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks targeting churches in Surabaya in which 40 people were injured across the attacks. Jamaah Ansharut Daulah claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Three suicide bombers detonated explosives-laden belts at the Indonesian Christian Church (GKI) on Jalan Diponegoro road in Surabaya, East Java, Indonesia. In addition to the three assailants, one person was killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks targeting churches in Surabaya in which 40 people were injured across the attacks. Jamaah Ansharut Daulah claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at the Central Pentecostal Church along Arjuno Street in Surabaya, East Java, Indonesia. In addition to the assailant, eight people were killed in the attack. This was one of three related attacks targeting churches in Surabaya in which 40 people were injured across the attacks. Jamaah Ansharut Daulah claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: A suspected suicide bomber attempted to detonate explosives at Cathedral Church in Surabaya, East Java, Indonesia. The assailant was arrested by security forces. No group claimed responsibility or the incident.

05/13/2018: An assailant attempted to attack Pniel Protestant Church in Palu, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia. The assailant fled the scene before carrying out the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: An explosive device was discovered ad safely defused at Imam Hussein Mosque, which had also been targeted on May 10, 2018, in Ottawa, Verulam, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated in Wor Mayi district, Paktika, Afghanistan. Abdul Hai, a tribal elder, was killed and seven civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Assailants attacked Pakistan Army soldiers near the Afghanistan border in Shawal subdistrict, North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least six soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the ensuing clash, while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting ‘Abd-al-Qadir Sulayman in Al-Maslakhah, Saladin, Iraq. Sulayman, a tribal chieftain, and his son were killed and three others were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of a Kurdish border guard officer along Al Mahad Street in Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. The officer was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 05/12/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) headquarters in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated against an ambulance in Badush, Nineveh, Iraq. A medic was killed and the driver was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/13/2018: Assailants set fire to two Indian container trucks in Dhunibesi, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
05/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Nigerian Air Force helipad in Igbogene, Bayelsa, Nigeria. An air force member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) and Hindu extremists.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Suryodaya Transport Private Limited garage in Mechinagar, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, police officials arrested a Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) member in connection with the attack.

05/13/2018: Four assailants attacked civilians with a sledgehammer along Bonds Street in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that loyalists may have been involved in the attack.

05/13/2018: A pressure cooker bomb was found on the Madi Bridge section of Prithvi Highway, Damauli, Province 4, Nepal. The explosive device was safely defused by the Nepal Army bomb disposal team. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

05/13/2018: An explosive device was found at Pokhara Airport in Pokhara, Province 4, Nepal. The Nepal Army bomb disposal team safely defused the bomb. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
05/13/2018: A pressure cooker bomb was found in Zerokilo, Rasuwa, Province 3, Nepal. The Nepal Army bomb squad safely defused the explosive device. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Two assailants on motorcycles threw a grenade between the Royal Century Hotel and Bhatbhateni supermarket in Bharatpur, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties but the windows of the supermarket and hotel were destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

05/13/2018: An explosive device was found near the Karra river East-West Highway in Hetauda, Province 3, Nepal. The device was safely defused by the Nepal Army. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
05/13/2018: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused at the Damak Bus Park in Damak, Province 1, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident..

05/13/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device at Srinagar Danda Hill in Tansen, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks to occur in Tansen on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device in Tansen, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks to occur in Tansen on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).
05/13/2018: Assailants set fire to generators of telecom company Ncell in Khajura, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/13/2018: An explosive device was discovered in Sundar-Haraincha, Province 1, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/13/2018: An explosive device was discovered in Bansgadhi, Province 5, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/13/2018: An explosive device was discovered in Butwal, Province 5, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/13/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mustre Aguib, a village chair seeking reelection, in Palimbang. Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Emilita de la Merced, a village councilor candidate who was on board a vehicle with 20 Dumagat people, in Donya Remedios Trinidad, Bulacan, Philippines. At least one person was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated at the residence of a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader in Akondaberia, West Bengal, India. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on Musa Kaleem inside his residence in Mir Ali subdistrict, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Kaleem, the son of a former Member of National Assembly (MNA), was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/13/2018: An explosive device detonated near the vehicle of Malik Haji Ahmed Khwezai in Sultankhel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khwezai, a tribal elder, was not harmed; however, his driver was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/13/2018: Security forces identified and arrested an individual armed with a knife at a the Qalandiyah checkpoint in Jerusalem, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as a Palestinian extremist.
05/13/2018: Assailants attacked a voter registration center in Pashtunabad, Logar, Afghanistan. A police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/13/2018: Assailants attacked the son of Parliament of the Opposition bloc parliamentary faction Nestor Shufrych, Oleksandr Shufrych, in Kyiv, Ukraine. There were an unknown number of people wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/15/2018: Approximately 2,000 assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked Farah, Afghanistan. At least 330 people, including 300 assailants, were killed and 116 other people, including 16 security forces and 100 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/14/2018: Four suicide bombers, members of the same family, detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle at an Indonesian police headquarters in Sidoarjo, East Java, Indonesia. Four assailants were killed and ten people were injured in the blast. Jamaah Ansharut Daulah claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/14/2018: An explosive device detonated near Pakistan Armed Forces soldiers close to a petrol pump in Miran Shah, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
