At least 34 people, including eight government personnel and 25 assailants, were killed and eight security personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of injuries. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a South West State police officer in a restaurant in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. At least four people, including one security member and three civilians, were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility, though the suspect was arrested and denied being a member of the group.

05/17/2018: Assailants attacked a police post and stole three rifles in Dalgate area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2018: Assailants attacked Jammu and Kashmir Bank in Qaimoh, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Security forces discovered and defused six explosive devices in Husru forest in Lohardaga, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.
05/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed Dinnes Ramos, a recently-elected village councilman, in Pitalo, Cebu, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Assailants set fire to the Israelite Society of Pelotas synagogue in Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. There were no reported casualties in the attack. A pro-Palestinian group claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote on the wall of the targeted synagogue that members of the Jewish community "should 'wait' for an 'international Intifada.'"

05/17/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused three explosive devices in Doro Naira, Borno, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.

05/17/2018: Assailants attacked a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) convoy in Alindao, Basse-Kotto, Central African Republic. At least one peacekeeper and 40 assailants were killed and eight peacekeepers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to an Anti-Balaka Militia.

05/17/2018: Assailants stopped six trucks and a vehicle on a road between Jufra and Sabha, Libya. An unknown number of people were kidnapped in the attack. The fate of the hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Assailants fired mortars into Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of three related mortar attacks in Mogadishu on this date. A civilian was killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Al-Shabaab.

05/17/2018: Assailants fired mortars that landed near the Presidential Palace in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of three related mortar attacks in Mogadishu on this date. A civilian was killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Al-Shabaab.
05/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed Felix Moldon, a village councilor, in Santo Nino, Quezon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2018: A sound bomb detonated outside the Kirkuk office in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Assailants stormed Waduku village, shooting sporadically and setting houses on fire, in Adamawa, Nigeria. The residents repelled the attack in which two civilians and three assailants were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/17/2018: Assailants fired mortars into Dagmada Xamar Weyne, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of three related mortar attacks in Mogadishu on this date. A civilian was killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Al-Shabaab.

05/18/2018: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle near Zanqar, Kirkuk, Iraq. One person was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/18/2018: An explosive device planted inside the vehicle of Major General Nasser Hussein detonated south of , North Sinai, Egypt. A police captain, identified as Abdel Meguid al-Mahy, was killed and Hussein, the head of the Central Security Department, was injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/18/2018: An explosive device detonated inside of Spinghar Cricket Stadium in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks at the stadium on the same day. At least eight people were killed and 45 people were injured across both attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/18/2018: Two explosive devices detonated near the gates of a Spinghar Cricket Stadium in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks at the stadium on the same day; this second attack targeted civilians fleeing from the fist attack. At least eight people were killed and 45 people were injured across both attacks. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/18/2018: An assailant threw an explosive device at a toll road gate in Sidoarjo, East Java, Indonesia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire targeting 42nd Infantry Battalion soldiers at Palalian Bridge in Palalian, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. At least two soldiers were injured in the blast. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to military operations targeting the group.
05/18/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Hawr Rajab, Baghdad, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: An explosive device detonated against a civilian vehicle in Ali Sibahi, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. One person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/18/2018: Multiple explosive devices detonated at the Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) Hamah Military Airport fuel and arms depot in Hamah, Syria. At least 11 soldiers and militia members were killed and several other people were injured in the blasts. Saraya al-Jihad Fi Bilad al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/18/2018: Assailants threw a nail bomb at a civilian house on Bloomfield Road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Shibis, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in neighborhoods of Mogadishu on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/18/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Bar-Ubah, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in neighborhoods of Mogadishu on the same day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/18/2018: An assailant opened fire at Santa Fe High School in Santa Fe, Texas, United States. At least 10 people, including students and teachers, were killed and 14 people, including the assailant, were injured in the attack. Additionally, fake explosive devices were discovered in and around the school. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Dimitrios Pagourtzis, claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that Pagourtzis was interested in Nazism and fascism and had recently posted pictures of German nationalist symbols and a picture of him wearing a T-shirt stating "born to kill" on social media.
05/18/2018: Assailants attacked a 13 Rashtriya Rifles patrol in Mir Mohlla, Bandipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported injuries and no group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/18/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a civilian residence along Parkhall Road in Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants attacked a construction site in Bhansi, Chhattisgarh, India. A contractor was killed, an unknown number of workers were injured, and six vehicles were torched during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on a grocery store at the Rupai-Siding Market in Doomdooma, Tinsukia, Assam, India. Two people were killed in the attack. An unidentified individual claimed responsibility for the incident, stating that he carried out the attack on the orders of the United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA).

05/18/2018: Two suicide bombers attempted to infiltrate a military camp in Kawuri, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. Soldiers detected the assailants and both were killed when one of the explosives-laden vests detonated. The second vest was successfully defused by the Explosive Ordnance Disposal team. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/17/2018: Assailants abducted two teachers in Tenenkou, Mopti, Mali. The hostages were released the following day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants armed with rockets and firearms attacked a highway police post in Nahrin, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least four police officers were killed and four officers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/18/2018: Assailants raided Umaisha, Nasarawa, Nigeria. At least five people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants abducted Muhammad Sha'ban from Shikhan, Nineveh, Iraq. Sha'ban, a taxi driver, was killed and his body was discovered on May 21, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/18/2018: An explosive device detonated on a road leading to Zaqar, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one Kurdish civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/18/2018: An assailant set fire to the front doors of Saint John's Cathedral Church in Fresno, California, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants abducted an Israeli tour group visiting cannabis fields in La Maria, Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. The Israeli tourists were released on May 22, 2018, while their tour guide was shot and killed on May 22, 2018. Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 05/19/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired two ballistic missiles targeting a military radar camp in Khamis Mushayt, Asir, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as one missile was intercepted and the second missile landed in an uninhabited area. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Qarqin district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. An unknown number of assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/19/2018: Four assailants armed with incendiary devices, firearms, and sharp weapons attempted to take parishioners hostage at the Archangel Michael Church in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia. Seven people, including a civilian, two police officers, and the four assailants, were killed while three others, including a civilian and two police officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Caucasus Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities doubted the veracity of this claim.
gname: Caucasus Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/19/2018: Assailants fired three mortars at an Iraqi Army base near Ar Radwaniyah, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) carried out the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/19/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at a shop in At Talibiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/18/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 16 people, including four officers and 12 assailants, were killed and 24 other people, including six officers and 18 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

05/19/2018: Assailants attacked a mosque in Agay, Tillaberi, Niger. At least 11 people were killed in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Agay on the same night. One person was injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Self-Defense Group of Imghad Tuaregs and Allies (GATIA) and the Movement for the Salvation of Azawad (MSA).
gname: Self-Defense Group of Imghad Tuaregs and Allies (GATIA)

summary: 05/19/2018: Assailants raided an unknown number of homes in Agay, Tillaberi, Niger. At least six people were taken from their houses and executed. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Agay on the same night. One person was injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Self-Defense Group of Imghad Tuaregs and Allies (GATIA) and the Movement for the Salvation of Azawad (MSA).
gname: Self-Defense Group of Imghad Tuaregs and Allies (GATIA)

summary: 05/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on Maulana Habibullah in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. Habibullah, the Bilal Mosque imam and a Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam Fazl (JUI-F) leader, was killed in the assault. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the victim was targeted for "promoting polytheist elections."
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/19/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel in Sheikh Amir, Nineveh, Iraq. Four police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mazahim Thamer in Hammam al-Alil, Nineveh, Iraq. Thamer, the Hammam al- Alil mayor, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at police personnel in Murran, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as the grenade failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants set fire to a forest depot on Alapalli-Bhamragadh Road in Gadchiroli, Talwada, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties. The Perimili Dalam subgroup of the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants abducted six civilians on a fishing trip on Lake Edward, Rukungiri district, Western region, Uganda. One hostage was released on an unknown date. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. Mayi Mayi claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded ten boxes of bullets in exchange for the hostages.

05/19/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of a military colonel detonated in Wadajir, Mogadishu, Somalia. The colonel, identified as Ragge Moh'ed Adow, was killed in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants attacked military posts in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were killed and three were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in Andar on the same night. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/19/2018: Assailants attacked police personnel responding to an earlier attack on military posts in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four assailants were killed and four police officers, including the district police chief, and five assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks in Andar on the same night. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.
05/19/2018: An assailant set fire to an Islamic cultural center in Hassleholm, Skane, Sweden. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/19/2018: Assailants beat Yiannis Boutaris, the mayor of Thessaloniki, in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. Boutaris was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Neo-Fascists.

05/19/2018: Assailants set a fire in front of the Chabad House at 75 Cowley Rd in Oxford, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Anti-Semitic extremists claimed responsibility for the incident through a note left at the scene.

05/20/2018: Assailants raided Mangboko, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least ten civilians were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

This was one of four similar incidents in which 19 explosive devices were dismantled in different parts of Al Anbar on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

This was one of four similar incidents in which 19 explosive devices were dismantled in different parts of Al Anbar on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

05/20/2018: Assailants shot and killed Demetrio Mendoza Deomampo, a recently elected barangay captain, in Pinagtung-ulan, Batangas, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and 24 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants abducted the Mayor of Bangem Council, Ekuh Simon and his deputy, Enongene Epie Manga, in Bangem, Ndibsi, South-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the mayor and deputy mayor were targeted because they encouraged people to participate in Cameroon's national day celebrations.
05/20/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Batibo, Momo, North-West, Cameroon. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Tseke, Benue, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were abducted in the assault. 05/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on traders/farmers in Mchia, Anyiin, Benue, Nigeria. At least five people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

05/20/2018: Assailants set fire to a cement truck on National Highway 37, between Irang Bridge and Awangkhul, Noney, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/20/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near Shah Wali Masjid in Faizullah neighborhood, Hangu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Mayor Lacson Lantud in Cabasagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Four people, including a barangay chairman and a police officer, were killed and three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants attempted to attack a village in Rashad, Kirkuk, Iraq. Security forces repelled the assault, killing five assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/20/2018: An unknown number of landmines exploded near military forces near Derna, Libya. At least five soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Derna Protection Force (DPF).

Poudel, the local Ward Chairperson, was not harmed but at least two people were injured in the blast. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the incident and had issued a threat to Bhim Poudel due to his involvement in the eviction of civilians living illegally in the Damak market area.

05/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on 5th Presidential Guard Brigade soldiers at a checkpoint in Taizz city, Yemen. At least two soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
05/20/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mohammad Ibrahim, a former jihadi commander, in Awrki, Kapisa, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: An explosive device detonated at a civilian residence in Albu Jawari, Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. A child was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/20/2018: Assailants abducted Mathieu Sawadogo and his wife in Arbinda, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Sawadogo, a Catholic catechist, and his wife were released on September 14, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Wadi al-Mausal neighborhood, Taizz, Yemen. At least one soldier was killed and two other people, including another soldier and Mu'in al-Dahbali, the Taizz governor for the children government, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2018: Assailants fired rockets at a market in Al Mujama, Marib, Yemen. At least five people were killed and 22 other people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/21/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired a ballistic missile targeting Jazan Regional Airport in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Saudi air defense forces intercepted the missile; the attack did not result in casualties. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Ibrahimkhil, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two police officers and 12 assailants were killed while three police officers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/20/2018: Assailants shot and killed Aweys Omar Abdi, an employee in the prime minister’s office, in Taleex, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying military personnel near the Ex-Control Afgooye intersection in Mogadishu, Somalia. At least three people were killed and two people were injured in the blast. The casualties included soldiers and civilians. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/11/2018: Assailants fired missiles at the Ince Inebolu, a Turkish cargo ship, 70 miles offshore from the port of Salif, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Dih Yak district in Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Ghazni on the same day. At least 12 officers were injured across the incidents in Dih Yak and Bahrami Shahid. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across all four incidents. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Ghazni on the same day. At least 12 officers were injured across the incidents in Dih Yak and Bahrami Shahid. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across all four incidents. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Ajristan district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Ghazni on the same day. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across the four incidents. In addition, 15 security personnel were abducted in this attack. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Ghazni on the same day. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties across the four incidents. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Aq Tapa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including nine pro-government militia members and two police officers, were killed while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at an electricity pole in Muang Yala, Yala, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN).

05/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on a motorcycle convoy in Virunga National Parki, Kiviriri, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people, including a civilian and two soldiers, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Matopolo, Kasai-Occidental, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least seven people were killed and 11 were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked de-mining personnel working with the Turkmenistan-Afghanistan-Pakistan-India (TAPI) oil pipeline project in Mama Kariz, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Five de-miners were killed and one was abducted in the incident. The body of the hostage was discovered on May 23, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which the group denied.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Loi Diwal, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and five were abducted in the raid. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/21/2018: Security forces discovered an explosive device at a voter registration center in a mosque in Taq-Qala, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. As police attempted to defuse the device, it exploded, injuring one police officer and one civilian. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 05/21/2018: An explosive device detonated near a 46th Infantry Battalion platoon in Patawon, Cabuyuan, Compostela Valley, Philippines. At least five soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

05/21/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a civilian residence in Aguada, Isabela, Basilan, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2018: Four assailants shot and killed Atty. Geronimo S. Marabe Jr., a former Ozamis City prosecutor, in the 50th District of Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Saidpora, Arihal, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Mushahidah, Saladin, Iraq. The owner of the vehicle was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Iblig, Sinjar, Nineveh, Iraq. Two volunteer fighters were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 05/21/2018: An explosive device planted along a Pakistan Railways track was discovered and defused in Qasimabad neighborhood, Hyderabad, Sindh, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/21/2018: A drone was identified and destroyed near the Russian Air Force Hmeimim Airbase in Jableh, Lattakia, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Khaled bin al-Walid mosque in Oued Sebaa, Sidi Bel Abbes, Algeria. At least two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed two soldiers in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. The soldiers belonged to the Somali Custodial Corps and the Somali National Army (SNA). Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed Sinaly Sampana and Mare Tereta, two civilians, in Waaka, Diafarabe, Tenenkou, Mopti, Mali. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

05/21/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along Miran Shah Bypass Road in Miran Shah, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The device was thought to be targeting a Pakistan Armed Forces convoy. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/21/2018: Assailants attacked Turkish military personnel in northern Iraq. Two soldiers were killed and another two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/21/2018: Assailants set fire to a Big Foot Construction road roller in Luyang, Negros Oriental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two incidents targeting construction equipment in Negros Oriental on this day. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the targeted construction company's failure to follow the NPA's revolutionary policies.

05/21/2018: Assailants set fire to a Big Foot Construction road roller in Bagtic, Negros Oriental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two incidents targeting construction equipment in Negros Oriental on this day. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the targeted construction company's failure to follow the NPA's revolutionary policies.

05/21/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct a civilian in Mahlah, Raymah, Yemen. The kidnapping was unsuccessful and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/22/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at the Libyan National Army 152nd Brigade Checkpoint 60 south of Ajdabiya, Libya. In addition to the bomber, at least two soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks around Wahat on the same day. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/22/2018: Assailants attacked a Libyan National Army checkpoint and abducted a police officer in Awjalat, Wahat, Libya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two coordinated attacks around Wahat on the same day. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 05/22/2018: Assailants set fire to an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) sniper post south of Kissufim, Southern district, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

05/22/2018: Assailants attacked 36th Al-Sa'iqa Special Forces soldiers in Tamsakat, Derna, Libya. Colonel ‘Abd al-Hamid ‘Aqila al-Warfali, the commander, was killed and two other soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sharia (Libya) and the Derna Protection Force (DPF).

05/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers in Al-Obeidi, Al Anbar, Iraq. A police officer was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police station in Khudur Fashikh, Refai, Dhi Qar, Iraq. One police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants attacked Malang village in Ghor, Afghanistan. At least three people, including former provincial council member Haji Ghulam Yahya and two bodyguards, were killed and two people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/22/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Darzak, Herat, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and seven were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
05/22/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Yemeni navy member in Khur Maksar, Aden, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: An explosive device detonated in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/22/2018: A suicide bomber detonated targeting a military convoy in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The assailant was killed and four soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants fired mortars at a Burundian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) base in Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
05/22/2018: Assailants shot and killed a traffic police officer at the Bakara market in Mogadishu, Somalia. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants assaulted a guard before detonating explosives at the farmhouse of Vikram Usendi in Bodanaar, Kanker, Chhattisgarh, India. Usendi, a Member of Parliament and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) member, was not harmed; however, the guard was injured in the attack. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: An assailant armed with a knife attacked police officers at a police station in Maro Sebo, Jambi, Indonesia. Two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants abducted an Independent Election Commission (IEC) volunteer at a voter registration center in Mosazay, Takhar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/22/2018: Assailants abducted an employee of the identity card issuing authority in Darqad district, Takhar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants attacked a National Directorate of Security (NDS) checkpoint in Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two NDS officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/22/2018: Assailants abducted Daniel and Jeffrey Angog at a local festival in Purok 3, Camansi, Compostela Valley, Philippines. Both hostages members of the Civilian Active Auxiliary (CAA), were led a short distance away before being executed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
05/22/2018: An explosive device detonated at Jeevan Brick Factory in Dhunibesi, Province 3, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/22/2018: Assailants abducted eight people, including a local elder and an unknown number of government employees, in Asmar, Kunar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/22/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a Syrian Army base near the Auwyred Dam east of Palmyra in Homs, Syria. Following the blast, additional assailants opened fire on the base. At least 31 people, including 26 Syrian and Russian soldiers and militia members and five assailants, were killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/22/2018: Assailants ambushed civilians riding a motorcycle on Naka-Markurdi Road, Benue, Nigeria. Two people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the attack was carried out by Fulani extremists.

05/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Israeli vehicle near Kafr Ni'ma, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

05/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on Siphiwe Montlha, an African National Congress (ANC) ward councilor, in Extension 5 neighborhood, Gauteng, South Africa. Monthlha was killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants attacked a joint Self-Defense Group of Imghad Tuaregs and Allies (GATIA) and Movement for the Salvation of Azawad (MSA) patrol south of Indelimane, Menaka, Mali. A dozen people, including three GATIA-MSA members and nine assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 05/22/2018: Assailants attacked a Roma settlement in Velyka Berezovytsia, Ternopil, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/22/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting water tankers in Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/23/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a security forces patrol in Goriwan, Bijbehara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ten civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Jalaluddin Train in Hazar Ganji, Balochistan, Pakistan. Train, a Pakistani Police station house officer, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, an assailant was arrested at the scene of the attack.

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) official in Nawan Kili neighborhood, Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
05/23/2018: An explosive device detonated near a market in Nasr al-Salam, Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices in northern Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/22/2018: Assailants abducted Mahguob Khalaf, a mayor, from Kanan, Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. The hostage was killed shortly after the kidnapping. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/23/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of a tribal member in Umm al Hintah, Diyala, Iraq. At least five people, including two assailants and three civilians, were killed and seven others, including three civilians and four assailants, were injured in the attack and ensuing clash with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 05/23/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices in Al-Maamil, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Sara Godar. Helmand, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were killed and three were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Kohsan district, Herat, Afghanistan. Three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Abdihakin Mo'alim Dahir at a hotel in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Dahir, a Puntland member of parliament, was killed along with a bodyguard. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Gordzad, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated incidents targeting military entities in the area on this date. At least nine people, including four soldiers and five assailants, were killed and 12 people, including five soldiers and seven assailants, were injured in the ensuing clashes surrounding the base and the checkposts. In addition, at least seven soldiers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked the military Gulzar checkpost in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated incidents targeting military entities in the area on this date. At least nine people, including four soldiers and five assailants, were killed and 12 people, including five soldiers and seven assailants, were injured in the ensuing clashes surrounding the base and the checkposts. In addition, at least seven soldiers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked the military Gulzar-1 checkpost in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated incidents targeting military entities in the area on this date. At least nine people, including four soldiers and five assailants, were killed and 12 people, including five soldiers and seven assailants, were injured in the ensuing clashes surrounding the base and the checkposts. In addition, at least seven soldiers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a military tank in Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and five soldiers were abducted in the incident. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of four coordinated incidents targeting military entities in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked Afghan National Army (ANA) posts in Sozma Qala district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers and three assailants were killed while seven soldiers and nine assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a military camp in Bulo Marer, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two incidents targeting military camps in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a military camp in Lambar 50, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of two incidents targeting military camps in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Al-Shabaab.

05/00/2018: Sometime between May 20, 2018 and May 26, 2018, assailants abducted an unknown number of villagers from Budarikarka, Chhattisgarh, India. At least one hostage was killed on May 27, 2018 while the remaining hostages were assaulted and released. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in western Badghis, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed, four were injured, and another four were reported as missing as a result of the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Additionally, there were an unknown number of assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Kalasabz, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/23/2018: Assailants using four remote-controlled explosives-laden speed boats attempted to attack Saudi-led coalition commercial and military vessels in the Red Sea near Kamaran Island, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. United Arab Emirates (UAE) security forces destroyed two of the boats and the remaining two boats fled. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Syrian Army base in Faida, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 78 people, including nine Russian Armed Forces soldiers, 26 Syrian soldiers, and 43 assailants, were killed and three other Russian soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 05/23/2018: Assailants set fire to a wheat field in Al-Deirat, south of Hebron, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Israeli settlers claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote "Enough with the agricultural terror" and "We will reach everywhere."

05/23/2018: Assailants set fire to a cherry orchard in Kfar Ezion, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

05/23/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpost in Rabat, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Six people, including two border police officers and four assailants, were killed while two border police officers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

05/25/2018: Assailants stormed the Star Inn and took civilians hostage in Menka, North-West, Cameroon. Government forces responded and five hostages died in the ensuing clashes along with 27 assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

05/23/2018: An explosive device detonated on a road in Kozluk district, Batman, Turkey. One village guard was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

05/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Abaicho Abba at an unknown location in Cameroon. Abba, a soldier assigned to infiltrate a group to serve as an informant, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a police vehicle near a bus stand in Jammu, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least three people, including police officers and civilians, were injured in the blast. Tehrik al-Mojahedin claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. Tehrik al-Mojahedin claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/25/2018: At least three assailants abducted Mohammad Yusuf Wagay, a civilian, from his residence in Gund Prnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The hostage was killed shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), which the group denied.

05/23/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden belt in al-Saqlawiyah Park in Shuala, Baghdad, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, at least three people were killed and 15 others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Chora district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. At least 24 people, including five soldiers, three police officers, and 16 assailants, were killed and eight other people, including four officers and four soldiers, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Zaldy Mallari was targeted because he committed war crimes and human rights abuses while he was the Allacapan police chief from 2011 to 2013. The NPA also accused Mallari of acquiring land illegally and being a government informant.

05/24/2018: Assailants attacked Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the attack, killing two assailants and injuring three others. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

05/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Tangi Dara, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least four civilians were killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Froilan Abella, the provincial Ports Authority manager, along Roman Highway in Limay, Bataan, Philippines. Abella was killed and a second Ports Authority employee was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Khwaja Mohammad, the head of a dam project, in Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. Mohammad was killed and his bodyguard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a congregation addressed by former minister and prominent Shia leader, Maulvi Iftikhar Hussain Ansari, in Pattan, Baramulla, Gundi Khwaja Qasim, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least nine people were killed and 11 others were injured in the blast. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants set fire to a mosque at 1 Rue Jean Jaures, Auneau, Centre-Val de Loire, France. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: An assailant attempted to ram a Bobcat tractor into Israel Defense Forces (IDF) personnel near the Tomb of the Patriarchs in Old City, Hebron, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. The assailant was killed after IDF personnel responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Rami Svarana, a Palestinian extremist.

06/02/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Fateh Kadal area, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three CRPF members and one civilian were injured in the blast. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Budshah Chowk, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A CRPF member and a civilian were injured in the blast. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) vehicle in Magarmal Bagh, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: A suicide bomber with a firearm attacked a Pakistan Rangers checkpost in Hub, Balochistan, Pakistan. Aside from the death of the assailant, at least two soldiers were injured in the incident. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the Pakistani Police Faqirni Gate Checkpost along Circular Road in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/02/2018: Security forces discovered and carried out a controlled detonation of an explosives-laden vehicle in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 06/02/2018: Assailants attacked a police station/checkpoint in Qanan, south of Ajdabiya, Wahat, Libya. A civilian was killed and five civilians were injured in the attack. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 06/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol in Al-Itha, Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. Four police officers were killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire at a family residence in Farhatiyah, Balad, Saladin, Iraq. Twelve civilians were killed and another was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/02/2018: An explosive device detonated at the home of an Iraqi Armed Forces senior officer in Qadisiyah, Samarra, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Sheikh Abdirahman Sharif, a prominent cleric, in Bardere district, Gedo, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/02/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and rocket-propelled grenades opened fire on a military base in Balli-Khadar, Bari, Somalia. At least six soldiers were killed in the attack. The assailants also sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: A magnetic explosive device attached to a vehicle carrying Ministry of Information and Culture employees detonated in Bagrami district, Kabul, Afghanistan. An archaeologist, identified as Abdul Wahab Ferozi, was killed and three ministry employees were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Nabil Jamil near a market in Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. Jamil, the Office of Planning and International Cooperation director, and a companion were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants fired rockets at the United Nations' Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) Super Camp in Kidal, Mali. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Gurdeep Singh Pehalwan in Amritsar, Srinagar, Punjab, India. Pehalwan, a Congress councilor, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Hamidullah Wazir near Sarobi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Wazir, a political administration official, was killed and three Levies Forces officers were injured in the assault. Another officer was also reported missing. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/02/2018: Assailants in Gaza fired two projectiles into southern Israel. There were no reported casualties, as one rocket was intercepted and the other failed to reach Israel. This was one of two similar projectile attacks overnight. The Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigade claimed responsibility for the incident, and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the recent killing of a volunteer Palestinian medic.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on security personnel at a market in Mogadishu, Somalia. Three people, including a civilian, were killed in the attack. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident. In addition, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/02/2018: Assailants abducted three Kurdish civilians in Warta, Arbil, Iraq. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

06/02/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at Turkish military personnel during a road construction project in northern Iraq. Two soldiers were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK).

06/02/2018: Assailants set fire to an excavator at a limestone mine in Kolar, Shaktikhor, Province 3, Nepal. The Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand) claimed responsibility for the attack through leaflets left at the scene.

06/02/2018: Assailants attacked a National Directorate of Security (NDS) convoy in Farah, Afghanistan. At least 16 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in Um Gubeisha, South Darfur, Sudan. At least one person was killed and three were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Jingo Sherwin Noche, a recently elected village chairperson, in Duhatan, Balayan, Batangas, Philippines. Noche was killed and his companion was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/02/2018: Assailants attacked and killed Orlando Negrete, a social leader, in Cordoba, Colombia. This was one of four attacks targeting social leaders in Colombia over a 24-hour period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least six assailants were killed and five soldiers, including one Pakistan Air Force soldier, and an unknown number of assailants were injured across both assaults. At least six assailants were killed and five soldiers, including one Pakistan Air Force soldier, and an unknown number of assailants were injured across both assaults. 06/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at police personnel in Sherbagh, Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/03/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed an unknown number of explosive devices in Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

This was one of two attacks on this day in which 33 people were killed. 06/03/2018: Assailants attacked Tseadough, Mbachom, Kwande, Benue, Nigeria. At least seven people were killed and six others were injured in the attack. 06/03/2018: Assailants attempted to infiltrate and attack Hasrat village in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. This was one of two coordinated incidents along the same road in Albu Kamal district on this date. At least 71 people, including 45 pro-government fighters and 26 assailants, were killed and an unknown number of other people were injured across both clashes.
