summary: 06/08/2018: An explosive device detonated in al-Sena'a, Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. Five civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/08/2018: Assailants attempted to attack the Mohmand People Council office but were stopped by police personnel guarding the building in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. A gunfight ensued in which one police officer and one assailant were killed and one police officer was injured. Security forces also defused several explosive devices at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/08/2018: Assailants attacked the home of a district chief in Mangave Foya, Diamare, Extreme-North, Cameroon. At least six civilians and five assailants were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

06/08/2018: Assailants, including 10 suicide bombers, equipped with four explosives-laden vehicles attacked Albu Kamal, Deir Ez-Zor, Syria. At least 51 people, including 16 Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers, 14 militia members, and 21 assailants, were killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Somalia National Army (SNA) soldier at a khat market in Afgoye district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/08/2018: Assailants attempted to steal a weapon from the security officer of former Member of Legislature (MLA) Abdul Gaffar Sofi in Kulgam Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/08/2018: An explosive device detonated near markets in Al-Shaab, Baghdad, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/08/2018: Assailants abducted Dinanath Upadhyay, a supervisor at a tea garden, in Tinsukia, Assam, India. Upadhyay was released on June 25, 2018. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Dinanath Upadhyay of providing information about the locations and movements of ULFA and National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Khaplang (NSCN-K) members to a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislator and his employer.

06/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a gendarme station in Kabayel, Bingol, Turkey. A soldier was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK).
06/08/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in El Malam, South Darfur, Sudan. Three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/08/2018: Assailants attacked farmers in Dubo El Madrasa, North Darfur, Sudan. At least two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Janjaweed.
06/08/2018: A landmine detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Kidal, Mali. At least eight civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: Assailants attacked a police base in Qalay-i-Zal district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 27 people, including 19 police officers and eight assailants were killed and five police officers and nine assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/09/2018: A suicide bomber detonated before entering the Monday Market in Dapchi, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. The assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in Lashkar Gah overnight between June 8, 2018 and June 9, 2018. At least two security personnel were killed and five others were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/09/2018: A magnetic explosive device attached to the vehicle of Ghulam Mohiadin detonated in Rodat district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Mohiadin, a district education department official and district council candidate, was killed in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/09/2018: An explosive device detonated in Kot district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed and 16 others were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/09/2018: An explosive device detonated at a produce market in Khalis, Diyala, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and 20 others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/09/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, equipped with an explosives-laden vehicle and mortars attacked a military base in Bar Sanguni, Lower Juba, Somalia. At least one assailant was killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: Assailants attacked a military camp in Boni, Mopti, Mali. At least two soldiers and seven assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists carried out the attacks.

06/09/2018: A landmine detonated targeting a military vehicle responding to an earlier attack in Dala, Mopti, Mali. Two soldiers were killed in the blast. This was one of two related attacks that occurred in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists carried out the attacks.

06/09/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched a missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Three civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a 14 Rashtriya Rifle patrol in Bandipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/09/2018: Assailants shot and killed Emad al-Bosayli, a traffic department engineer, at his residence in Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Arab Emirates-backed army Colonel in al-Jumhuri neighborhood, Taizz, Yemen. The Colonel, identified as Radwan el-Wassabi, was killed in the attack and four of his guards were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: A landmine detonated targeting an Indian Army patrol in Sabjian, Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms raided a road construction site in Dalki, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties, though 13 construction vehicles were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the People's Liberation Front of India (PLFI).

06/09/2018: An assailant opened fire on construction workers in Langol Tarung, Imphal West, Manipur, India. One laborer was killed and another laborer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/09/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at Dilla university in Dilla, Oromia, Ethiopia. At least nine people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: An explosive device detonated at a market in Khost district, Afghanistan. At least five people were killed and 15 others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/09/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Hatra, Nineveh, Iraq. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/09/2018: Assailants fired projectiles that landed and detonated in Fuah, Idlib, Syria. The assailants then entered the village and attacked militia members. This was one of two related incidents in neighboring villages of Idlib on the same day. At least nine people, including six militia members and three assailants, were killed across both attacks. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/09/2018: Assailants fired projectiles that landed and detonated in Kafrayah, Idlib, Syria. The assailants then entered the village and attacked militia members. This was one of two related incidents in neighboring villages of Idlib on the same day. At least nine people, including six militia members and three assailants, were killed across both attacks. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the incidents.
06/09/2018: An explosive device detonated near stores in Tarmiyah, Al-Faris, Saladin, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: A magnetic explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated at the Chardehi Market in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a military police checkpoint in Al-Murur, Taizz, Yemen. A police officer and a child were killed and four civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Khoja Bolan, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Nehgan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 13 police officers were killed and four others were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an undetermined number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: Assailants attacked a National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) base in Siinka Dheer, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/10/2018: Twenty assailants abducted Corporal Johannes Parreno and Dindo Sagayno, a soldier and a Civilian Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, respectively, from a roadblock in Buso, Davao Oriental, Philippines. Sagayno escaped on July 6, 2018 while Parreno escaped on August 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the abduction to the New People’s Army (NPA).

06/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the home of a local police commander in Nahri Saraj district, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one assailant was killed while three civilians and three police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched a missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/00/2018: Sometime between June 10, 2018 and June 12, 2018, assailants opened fire on Fulani civilians in Fan, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was reported missing in the attack and cows were stolen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/00/2018: Sometime between June 10, 2018 and June 13, 2018, assailants attacked Fulani civilians in Kassa, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a scrap materials gathering point along Kabang Road, Kabang, Mubi South, Adamawa, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

06/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device at the entrance of the Tomb of the Patriarchs in Old City, Hebron, West Bank, West Bank and Gaza Strip. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

06/10/2018: Assailants abducted a Methodist priest, Kayode Akande, and two other people along Iwo-Osogbo road in Ileogbo, Ola-Oluwa, Osun, Nigeria. The three hostages were released as of June 14th, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
06/10/2018: An assailant threw a grenade at a bar in Birohe, Gitega, Burundi. At least one person was killed and 21 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) patrol in Bambari, Ouaka, Central African Republic. One Burundian peacekeeper was killed and another peacekeeper was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC).
gname: Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC)

summary: 06/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Central African Armed Forces (FACA) and United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) convoy in Bambari, Ouaka, Central African Republic. Five assailants were killed and three people, including two Central African Armed Forces (FACA) soldiers and one Russian instructor, were injured in the attack and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC)
gname: Union for Peace in Central Africa (UPC)

summary: 06/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden vehicle in Baghlan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: Assailants attacked civilians near Kwall Junction, Irigwe, Bassa, Plateau, Nigeria. Two civilians were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

06/10/2018: An explosive device detonated near the residence of Mir Asghar Rind in Gomazi neighborhood, Mand, Balochistan, Pakistan. Rind, the former Minister of Provincial Fisheries, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Hamal Baloch between Sirkin and Mirabad in Turbat, Balochistan, Pakistan. Baloch, a Balochistan National Party (BNP) candidate, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
06/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a Pakistani Police station in Kahna, Punjab, Pakistan. At least one officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
06/10/2018: Assailants set fire to a depot housing ballot boxes in Rusafa, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/10/2018: An assailant lured six Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members into a house in Suidan Jazeera, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. All six SDF members were beheaded and killed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Turkish soldiers in Hatay, Turkey. At least one soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

06/10/2018: Assailants abducted Tazisong Christopher at Mile 16 on Mbonge road in Bolifamba, South-West, Cameroon. Christopher, a local police commissioner, was rescued on June 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the incident to separatists.
06/10/2018: Assailants raided Mukunge village in Southern, Rwanda. An unknown number of civilians were injured and property was stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians inside of a house in Taloh Dulong, Bannang Sata, Yala, Thailand. Five people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that separatists may have carried out the attack.

06/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest targeting employees of the Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development in the 6th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 17 people were killed and 40 people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/11/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked the Education Department building in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed and 10 people were injured in the attack. Security forces also defused an explosives-laden vehicle at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/11/2018: An explosive device denoted targeting a civilian vehicle in Qiaq, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpost in Aq Tapa, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 15 people were killed in the attack. The casualties included soldiers and police. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

06/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated explosives at a shop in Baga road, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. In addition to the suicide bomber, one person was killed and at least four others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

06/11/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives-laden vehicles targeting military personnel in Derna, Libya. The two assailants were killed and four soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Iraqi Volunteer Fighters checkpoint in Qurret Tabah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three soldiers were injured in the assault; additionally, the assailants sustained an undetermined number of casualties during the clash. This was one of two related attacks in Qurret Tabah on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 06/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near medics rushing to the scene of an earlier assault in Qurret Tabah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two people were killed and 10 other people were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Qurret Tabah on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/11/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in Al-Askari, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/11/2018: A magnetic explosive device detonated at a market in Mirza Din, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants abducted Shaykh Farhad Agha al-Kaka'i, the brother of an al-Kaka'iyah notable, along with four workers from his farm in Zanqar, Kirkuk, Iraq. The workers were released on June 25, 2018. The fate of al-Kaka'i is unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded $500,000 and the release of three imprisoned ISIL leaders in exchange for Shaykh Farhad Agha al-Kaka'i.

summary: 06/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Daud Khan Shaheedzoy, a High Peace General Council member, in Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military detachment in Meta, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least five assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks targeting military detachments in the area on this date. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military detachment in Limpongo, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least four assailants and one civilian were killed in the ensuing clash. This was one of two related attacks targeting military detachments in the area on this date. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ruben Aureada Carabido in Busokbusokan, Quezon, Philippines. Carabido, a village chief, was killed in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on Noel Meralles, an election officer, in Poblacion-4, Bauan, Batangas, Philippines. Meralles was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire at a sugarcane plantation in Bolbok, Batangas, Philippines. Two people, identified as Florencio Cupo Jr. and Catalina Decepeda, were killed and another, identified as Gregorio Decepdia, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire at a Border Roads Organization (BRO) camp in Verinag, Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. A Beacon constable, identified as Pintu Sharma, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants shot and injured Mangulu Madkami, a village head and former Maoist, in Silakuta, Malkangiri, Odisha, India. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Mangulu Madkami of being a police informant. Sources also noted that Madkami was a former Maoist.

06/11/2018: Assailants detonated a crude bomb and subsequently shot and killed Shahzahan Bachchu, the owner of Bishaka Prokashoni publishing house, in Sirajdikhan, Dhaka, Bangladesh. Jama'atul Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Shahzahan Bachchu was targeted because he consistently offended Muslims and Islam. Sources also noted that Bachchu had previously received threats in response to his activism for secularism. In addition, sources suspected the involvement of Al-Qaida in the Indian Subcontinent.

06/11/2018: Assailants raided a police barracks and opened fire at a security checkpoint in Thanamandi, Rajouri, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties, although weapons were stolen during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).
06/11/2018: An assailant stabbed civilians in Afula, Northern, Israel. The assailant and a civilian were injured. A Palestinian extremist claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mostafa Abu Rania at his residence in Masaeed, North Sinai, Egypt. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sinai Province of the Islamic State.

summary: 06/11/2018: Assailants looted and torched buildings, including a Catholic church, in Kaya, Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. Security forces and vigilante locals repelled the attack and one assailant was killed and one vigilante and an unknown number of assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

At least two officers and one assailant were killed and two officers and two assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, one police officer was abducted; the outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police outpost in El Jicaral, Leon, Nicaragua. At least three officers were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Major General John Malu in Tse Adoo, Katsina, Benue, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties and one person was killed and another was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

06/11/2018: Assailants armed with an air pistol opened fire on two Malian migrants at the intersection of Viale Lincoln and Via Salvatore Commaia in Caserta, Campania, Italy. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the assailants shouted "Salvini, Salvini!" during the attack.

06/11/2018: Assailants detonated explosives at the house of a Popular Mobilization Forces member in Makhul, Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked the Citizens Protection Ministry in Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the release of Dimitris Koufoudinas.

06/11/2018: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Al-Owaisat, Jurf Sakhar, Babil, Iraq. A police officer and his driver were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a conveyor belt at a Societe Le Nickel (SLN) mining site in Kouaoua, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An assailant was arrested in connection with the attack and confessed to carrying out the incident.

06/12/2018: Assailants attacked Pur Chaman district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and 50 assailants were killed and two people were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked police and military checkposts in Qaflatan, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same night. At least two security force members and 17 assailants were killed while three security force members and 19 assailants were injured across the attacks. In addition, at least four soldiers were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked military checkposts in Aqlani, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same night. At least two security force members and 17 assailants were killed while three security force members and 19 assailants were injured across the attacks. In addition, at least four soldiers were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/11/2018: Assailants attacked police and military checkposts in Qashlaq, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in the area on the same night. At least two security force members and 17 assailants were killed while three security force members and 19 assailants were injured across the attacks. In addition, at least four soldiers were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/12/2018: Assailants attacked Nathuko, Quiterajo, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least one civilian was beheaded and several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

06/12/2018: Assailants set fire to a vehicle transporting khat in Batra-Min, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least four people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

06/12/2018: Assailants launched mortar shells at a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Timbuktu, Mali (MINUSMA) super camp in Timbuktu, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/12/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives-laden vehicles targeting military personnel in Shiha, Derna, Libya. The two assailants were killed and an unknown number of others, including soldiers and civilians, were killed or injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Derna Protection Force (DPF).

At least 26 assailants and five police officers were killed and 26 people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/12/2018: Assailants attacked police checkposts in Zurmat district, Paktia, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

A civilian, identified as Lenmar Cabasag, was killed and Jakosalem, a newly-elected village chief, succumbed to his injuries on June 24, 2018. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Mike Jakosalem was "a member of a crime syndicate and a pusher of illegal drugs." Sources also noted that he was a supporter of the government.

06/12/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) post in Janglat Mandi, Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ten CRPF personnel were injured in the blast. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident
06/12/2018: Assailants shot and killed Aljeron Padilla, a mayoral aide, in Arellano, Quezon, Isabela, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Wright was arrested in connection with the attack and held up signs during the incident asking President Trump to "release the OIG reports," a reference to a conspiracy theory.

This was one of at least 30 attacks between April and August, 2018 in which 887 people were abducted. At least 128 hostages were released as of February 4, 2020 while the fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO), noting that many of the female victims were sexually assaulted and were forced to marry members of the group, while many male victims were forced into becoming fighters for the group.

This was one of at least 30 attacks between April and August, 2018 in which 887 people were abducted. At least 128 hostages were released as of February 4, 2020 while the fate of the remaining victims is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO), noting that many of the female victims were sexually assaulted and were forced to marry members of the group, while many male victims were forced into becoming fighters for the group.

summary: 06/17/2018: Assailants attacked civilians travelling on Baghdad-Kirkuk road in Injanah, Kifri Diyala, Iraq. At least three people were killed and seven others were abducted during the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in order to coerce the Iraqi government to release Sunni Muslim women from prison. Sources also stated that residents were targeted because they had sided with government forces in past conflicts.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Yambi, Puncak Jaya, Papua, Indonesia. Three soldiers were injured in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the arrival of army personnel at a local village meeting.

06/17/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) patrol along Al Kahraba Street in Raqqah, Syria. At least five people were killed and five other people were injured in the blast; the victims included SDF members and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/17/2018: A suicide bomber detonated explosives outside the office of the Nangarhar provincial governor in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. In addition to the suicide bomber, 18 people were killed and 49 others injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 06/17/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police vehicle in Tarba, Wajir, Kenya. At least eight police officers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: Assailants attacked the Syria-Iraq Border in Iraq. There were an unknown number of casualties among the assailants in the ensuing clashes with security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/17/2018: An explosive device detonated in Mardan, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least two civilians were killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/17/2018: Assailants attacked a National Office for Road Security (Onasser) in Tindangou, Kompienga, Est, Burkina Faso. This was one of three simultaneous incidents in Burkina Faso overnight. One police officer and one assailant were killed and a police officer was injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/17/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Tindangou, Kompienga, Est, Burkina Faso. This was one of three simultaneous incidents in Burkina Faso overnight. One police officer and one assailant were killed and a police officer was injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/17/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Komin Yanga, Koulpelogo, Centre-Est, Burkina Faso. This was one of three simultaneous incidents in Burkina Faso overnight. One police officer and one assailant were killed and a police officer was injured across the three attacks No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/17/2018: Assailants armed with grenades and automatic firearms attacked an Assam Rifles patrol in Aboi, Nagaland, India. At least four jawans were killed and six were injured in the attack. It is unknown if the assailants sustained any casualties. The National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Khaplang (NSCN-K) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the occupation of Nagaland by Indian forces. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) also claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: A woman attacked people with a knife in a supermarket on Avenue Jean Albert Lamarque in La Seyne-sur-Mer, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, France. Two people were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, an assailant shouted "Allahu Akbar" and called the victims "miscreants" during the attack and was apprehended.
06/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mohammad Iqbal Kawa, a civilian, at his residence in Kelam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/17/2018: An explosive device detonated at a park in Manasbal, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least 13 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: Assailants abducted eight shepherds from their residences in an area north of Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. No outcome was reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Nand Kishor Gurjar in Farukh Nagar, Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, India. Gurjar, a Member of the Legislative Assembly was unharmed as no casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: Assailants shelled Jahlan, Ad Dali, Yemen. Eight civilians were killed and 15 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/17/2018: Assailants using incendiary kites and balloons set fire to a forest in Kissufim, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in which 21 fires were started across two forests in southern Israel on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/17/2018: Assailants using incendiary kites and balloons set fire to a forest in Beeri, Eshkol, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in which 21 fires were started across two forests in southern Israel on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.
06/17/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused at Tatara Park in Hayatabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Taizz, Yemen. Five civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
06/17/2018: An explosive device detonated in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Four civilians were killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two men in Nkoe, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).
06/18/2018: Assailants shot and killed Hector Alonso Ayala Romero, a soldier, in Fortul, Arauca, Colombia. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/16/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused between Santo Nino and Tumanding, North Cotabato, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including seven assailants, were killed and seven other people, including five assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. The casualties included soldiers and police officers. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/18/2018: Assailants abducted six soldiers in Sultan Bagh, Ghazni, Afghanistan. The soldiers were released later the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Subhanullah Khitab, the acting district chief, in Marko, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Khitab was killed and his bodyguard was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/18/2018: Assailants abducted six people, including two Popular Mobilization Forces members, between Ain Al-Azab and Al-Jazirah, Hatra, Nineveh, Iraq. The hostages were executed a few hours later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 06/17/2018: Assailants launched a missile at Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by the Saudi Royal Air Force. A Pakistani civilian was injured in the blast. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/18/2018: Assailants shot and killed Walid Nabil Fadil, a civilian, in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Walid Nabil Fadil of selling hashish. Sources also stated that Fadil had refused to join and fight alongside a Houthi group.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked Mali gendarmerie in Toguere-Toumbe, east of Teninkou, Mopti, Mali. One gendarme was killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/18/2018: An explosive device detonated in Saba, Dialloube, Mopti, Mali. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Indian army patrol in Kupwara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/17/2018: An explosives-laden drone was shot down by military personnel in Al-Nukhaila, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Kandahar on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Kandahar on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Miya Nishin district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Kandahar on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

06/18/2018: An explosive device detonated near an Afghan Rangers vehicle in Shamalgah, Farah, Afghanistan. At least one ranger was killed and two others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked Sangin district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Helmand on the same day. At least two Afghan National Army (ANA) soldiers were killed and two other people, including one police officer and once civilian, were injured across the ensuing clashes. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Helmand on the same day. At least two Afghan National Army (ANA) soldiers were killed and two other people, including one police officer and once civilian, were injured across the ensuing clashes. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked Nahri Saraj district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Helmand on the same day. At least two Afghan National Army (ANA) soldiers were killed and two other people, including one police officer and once civilian, were injured across the ensuing clashes. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/18/2018: Assailants attacked Lashkar Gah district, Helmand, Afghanistan. This was one of four related incidents in different districts of Helmand on the same day. At least two Afghan National Army (ANA) soldiers were killed and two other people, including one police officer and once civilian, were injured across the ensuing clashes. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/26/2018: Assailants raided a Jammu and Kashmir Bank and attempted to steal a rifle from a security guard in Pinjoora, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Although the guard was injured, the assailants failed to acquire the rifle. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations convoy between Yei and Lasu towns in Yei River, South Sudan. A Bangladeshi peacekeeper was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/26/2018: Assailants fired rockets into Southern, Israel. Three rockets were intercepted by the Iron Dome Missile Defense System. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to Israeli bombings.

06/24/2018: Assailants abducted Mevlut Bengi, a shopkeeper, in Dogubeyazit, Agri, Turkey. Bengi was killed on June 26, 2018. The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Mevlut Bengi of being a government spy. Sources also stated that Bengi worked as an election observer during Turkey's parliamentary and presidential elections, which took place on June 24, 2018. Additionally, sources noted that the victim was a supporter of the Justice and Development (AK) Party.

06/26/2018: Assailants ambushed a group of soldiers with the Philippine Army's Community Support Program (CSP) with explosive devices and gunfire in Roxas, Northern Samar, Philippines. Three soldiers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/25/2018: Assailants attacked the house of a police officer in Khanabad, Kunduz, Afghanistan. Two of the officer's relatives were killed while the officer himself was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Dand Patan district, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two police officers and one civilian were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/26/2018: Assailants abducted four police officers serving as guards for the house of Karia Munda, a member of parliament from the Bharatiya Janata Party, in Anigara, Jharkhand, India. The assailants released all four hostages on June 29, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack the Pathalgadi Movement.

06/26/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Andar district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in Ghazni on this day. At least nine assailants and two police officers were killed and four assailants and three officers were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/26/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of three related attacks in Ghazni on this day. At least nine assailants and two police officers were killed and four assailants and three officers were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/26/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Shakir Ahmad Bhat, a Special Police Officer (SPO), in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting SPO residences in Pulwama on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources indicated that the assailants threatened to kill the officers if they did not quit their jobs.

06/26/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Sajad Ahmad Ahangar, a Special Police Officer (SPO), in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks targeting SPO residences in Pulwama on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources indicated that the assailants threatened to kill the officers if they did not quit their jobs.
06/26/2018: Security forces discovered and defused three explosive devices between Basaguda and Dharamapur, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Al-Iftikhar Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/27/2018: Assailants launched a mortar at Al Hudaydah Airport in Al-Jabali, Hudaydah, Yemen. Seven civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

This was one of three coordinated bombings in Afrin; this third blast targeted people being transferred to the hospital from two earlier explosions. The Afrin Falcons claimed responsibility for the attacks.

This was one of three coordinated bombings in Afrin and one of two blasts at the same roundabout on this date. At least 10 people, including one assailant, were killed and 20 other people were injured across all both attacks; the victims included Levant Front members and civilians. The Afrin Falcons claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/27/2018: A suicide bomber detonated outside a Levant Front headquarters at Kawa Hadad Roundabout in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. This was one of three coordinated bombings in Afrin and one of two blasts at the same roundabout on this date. At least 10 people, including one assailant, were killed and 20 other people were injured across all both attacks; the victims included Levant Front members and civilians. The Afrin Falcons claimed responsibility for the incidents.

06/27/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a police station in Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/27/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Memla, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants and one police officer were killed and nine assailants and one officer were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in Lehri, Sibi district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least one shepherd was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

06/29/2018: Assailants attempting to plant explosive device were identified by security forces in Kanambangan, Pinagturilan, Occidental Mindoro, Philippines. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

06/29/2018: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire at a military patrol in Ahagam, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
06/29/2018: An explosive device planted under a vehicle was discovered and safely defused west of Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/29/2018: Assailants attacked Albu Sliebi, Diyala, Iraq. Five civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 06/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in Tal Dhahab, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two farmers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

06/29/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct Zulfiqar Stanikzai, a Wolesi Jirga candidate, in Arghandeh, Kabul, Afghanistan. One person was killed and six people, including Stanikzai, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

06/29/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint near Aye-Khanum, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least six people, including four assailants and two border police officers were killed two officers were injured in the ensuing clash.
