07/01/2018: Assailants attacked the village of Rahwol-Fwi, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least four people were killed in the attack, and a church, hospital, and 17 houses were destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/01/2018: Assailants attacked Mogadishu Stabilization Forces personnel in Kahda, Banaadir, Somalia. The ensuing clash resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie brigade at Camp I in Penda Mboko, Litoral, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash, but the building was set on fire in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/01/2018: Assailants attacked Cyamuzi village in Nyaruguru district, Southern, Rwanda. Assailants stole foodstuffs and briefly held an unknown number of civilians hostage during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/00/2018: Sometime between January 1, 2018 and December 31, 2018, assailants opened fire on Seliam Wangsa in an unknown location in India. Wangsa, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) worker, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM).

07/02/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least one person was killed and seven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/02/2018: A sniper shot and killed Antonio Halili, Mayor of Tanauan City, during a flag-raising ceremony in Tanauan, Batangas, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: An explosive device detonated at a rubber plantation in Kuyae, Yala, Thailand. A civilian, identified as Nai Suthin Heawkuntok, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the anti-government extremists.

07/02/2018: An explosive device detonated along an agricultural road near Kalhar, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/02/2018: An explosive device detonated in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one shepherd was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/02/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device into Café Jar al-Qamar in Khur Maksar, Aden, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Assailants launched rockets at a security forces' bomb disposal team in Kure, Awaran, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least six soldiers were killed and two other soldiers were injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security forces vehicle in Panjgur, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/02/2018: A suicide bomber detonated targeting a United States military vehicle in Badkhab, Logar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least two civilians were killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/02/2018: Assailants attacked the vehicle of Rehmat Hussain, a political administration official, in Boya, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two Levies officials were killed and Hussain was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden house in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of four related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden house in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of four related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden house in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of four related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden house in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. This was one of four related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Gabriel Adolfo Correa Chavestan, a municipal councilor, in Buenos Aires, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents may have carried out the attack.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 07/02/2018: An explosive device detonated between Zubayd and At Tuhayta in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Seven civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/02/2018: Assailants attacked a military exam center near the Al Murur roundabout in Taizz, Yemen. At least one officer was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/02/2018: Assailants attacked farmers in an area near the Ethiopian border in Gedarif, Sudan. At least seven farmers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Assailants set fire to forestry machinery north of Carahue, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Mapuche activists.

07/02/2018: Two assailants assaulted a Muslim civilian wearing a headscarf in Anderlues, Hainaut, Wallonia, Belgium. The victim was beaten and stabbed in the attack. Unidentified anti-Muslim extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and called the victim a "filthy Arab." Sources also posited that the attack was the result of Islamophobia.

07/02/2018: Assailants abducted the mayor of al-Therban village in Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. The hostage was killed and his body was discovered on July 9, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and stated that the victim was targeted for cooperation with security forces and assisting internally displaced persons.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/02/2018: Assailants launched a grenade at a military camp in Bounra, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/02/2018: Assailants attacked a member of the Sikh community in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The victim was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Assailants attacked Hassan, Dawr, Saladin, Iraq. A police officer was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/02/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a Somali Airline employee in Yaqshid, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/02/2018: Four assailants attempted to set fire to an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) post in near the Gaza border in Southern, Israel. One assailant was killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
07/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused and explosive device between Ain Baal and Aitanit, Lebanon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/02/2018: Assailants abducted Kapurchand Rajput, a construction contractor, in Tetrai, Chhattisgarh, India. Rajput was killed on July 3, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/02/2018: Assailants attacked Tse Tyogbihi, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
07/02/2018: Armed assailants attacked Arly Forest Station in Arly, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed Ferdinand Bote, Mayor of General Tinio town, after leaving the National Irrigation Administration (NIA) office in Cabanatuan, Imelda, Nueva Ecija, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a police patrol between Handaro and Sangailu in Garissa, Kenya. At least four police officers were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan special forces headquarters in Gordzad, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least eight soldiers were killed, six were injured, and three were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting oil company employees in Toba Nokhani, Dera Bugti, Balochistan, Pakistan. Three people were killed and five others were injured in the blast. The Baloch Republican Army (BRA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/03/2018: An assailant threw a grenade at a Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) election office in Razmak, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Ten PTI members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants opened fire targeting the Al Sha'b Police Chief, Major Waddah al-Jahuri Abu-Sayyaf, in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Al-Jahuri and his bodyguard were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: A suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle was identified and killed while attempting to target a Jubaland military base in Beerka, Lower Juba, Somalia. Additional assailants also attacked the base. At least 20 assailants and three soldiers were killed and five assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked and killed seven civilians in Argelia, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN), which denied involvement.

07/03/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting a Ugandan African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Shalan Bood, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Khalaf al-Khabeel in Al-Atal, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least two people, including Al-Khabeel, a Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) leader, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/03/2018: An assailant opened fire on Elmar Veliyev, the mayor of Ganca, in front of his office in Ganja, Ganja-Qazakh, Azerbaijan. Veliyev was wounded in the attack. An individual, identified as Yunis Safarov, claimed responsibility for the incident in a video "urging people in Azerbaijan to start an armed struggle against officials and 'kill enemies of Islam.'" Sources also posited that Safarov carried out the attack in order to "establish an Islamic state in Azerbaijan."

07/03/2018: Assailants launched a missile targeting Aridah, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. One civilian was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian, identified as Abdirahman Mumin Muridi, in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab was involved in the attack.

07/03/2018: Assailants launched a rocket toward At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Eight civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/03/2018: Assailants kidnapped four people in Datu Paglas, Maguindanao, Philippines. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and noted that the hostages were accused of involvement in drug activities.

07/03/2018: An assailant set fire to a Jehovah's Witnesses church in Olympia, Washington, United States. There were no reported casualties but the church was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Likud South Africa Jewish group chairperson Sergio Kowensky in Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa. Kowensky was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of anti-Israeli extremists.

07/01/2018: Assailants set fire the vehicle of Salma Al Sherif in Al-Sammad, Madinah, Saudi Arabia. The attack occurred one week after a ban on female motorists was lifted. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by men who oppose women drivers.

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked Tse Tyogbihi, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. One woman was abducted and was found alive the following day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/07/2018: Assailants abducted a village chief and another person in Oukoulourou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Both victims were executed and their bodies were discovered on July 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.; however, sources suspected the involvement Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked non-state militia checkposts in Baharak district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least six assailants and two militia members were killed while four assailants and three militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked a Giants Brigade position in Waziiyah district, Taizz, Yemen. 11 people, including nine assailants and two soldiers, were killed and 14 others, including eleven assailants and three soldiers, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked the municipal hall and village in Mopac, Poblacion, Maguindanao, Philippines. Four assailants were killed and two soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, five civilians were kidnapped and the outcome is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a government employee in Khlong Hin, Pak Lo Subdistrict, Pattani, Thailand. The employee, identified as Ma-ae Sale, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Adam Khan, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least three civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpost in Naghlo, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and four were injured in the attack. Additionally, sources noted that two officers were taken hostage, though officials denied this. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at the governor's compound in Asadabad, Kunar, Afghanistan. Two government employees were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants launched a mortar shell at Al-Marif, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. One civilian was killed and four others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Bogota National Navy patrol in Buenaventura, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. Eight soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army (ELN)

07/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers near the Saravena police station in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. One officer was injured and an assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army (ELN).

07/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Mullah Amir Mohammad, a former uprising group commander, in Burka district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Three people, including two Independent Election Commission (IEC), were killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/04/2018: Assailants fired mortars at a Kenyan military base in Fafahdun, Gedo, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near a joint Operation Inherent Resolve (OIR) and Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) convoy in Namliyah, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the convoy. At least two people were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Galmudug administration forces in Caad, Mudug, Somalia. At least 15 soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated in front of the residence of Shaykh Lutfi Mani in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. Shaykh Mani, a Sahaba Mosque imam and preacher, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties; however, Mani's vehicle was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants abducted three farmers in Lagadi, Gedarif, Sudan. The outcome of the abduction is unknown, though sources noted that the assailants took the hostage to Ethiopia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Qoryoley district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Security forces responded. It is unknown if the ensuing clash resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/04/2018: Two explosive devices detonated at a popular market in Shuala, Kadhimiya, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one person was killed and 11 other people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/04/2018: An assailant opened fire on a wedding party in Mudhaykhirah, Ibb, Yemen. Eight people were killed and 13 others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants abducted four judges from Sari Pul-Jawzjan highway in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. The judges were released on July 24, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2018: Assailants beheaded four people, including a tribal chief and his three sons, in Tal Khaima, Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. This was one of two related attacks in Tal Khaima on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/04/2018: Security forces discovered and defused along a road in Burha Pahar, Garhwa, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

07/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Akshay Sharma between Tarn Taran and Khadoor Sahib, Punjab, India. Sharma, an National Students' Union of India (NSUI) state president, was not harmed; however, at least two people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated at a rubber plantation in Tanoh Puteh, Bannang Sata, Yala, Thailand. Sukho Khamkaew was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) convoy in Mongalla, Jubek, South Sudan. A driver was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/04/2018: Four explosive devices were discovered and defused between Datu Paglas and Mamasapano, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near troops in Balkana, Saladin, Iraq. At least five soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on Shawqi Hadad in Kufa, Najaf, Iraq. Hadad, a Saraya al-Ashura commander and aide to Shia cleric Moqtada al-Sadr, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/04/2018: Assailants shelled a residential area in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Five civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Santuraki, Taraba, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on Fulani villages on the same day. At least 11 people were killed and an unknown number were wounded between two attacks in Santuraki and Nnega. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nyandan militia.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Abbare, Lau, Taraba, Nigeria. The attack was repelled and there were no reported casualties. This was one of four coordinated attacks on Fulani villages on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nyandan militia.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Nnega, Lau, Taraba, Nigeria. This was one of four coordinated attacks on Fulani villages on the same day. At least 11 people were killed and an unknown number were wounded between two attacks in Santuraki and Nnega. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nyandan militia.

07/04/2018: Assailants attacked Mayo Lope, Taraba, Nigeria. At least three people were killed and an unknown number were wounded in the attack. This was one of four coordinated attacks on Fulani villages on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Nyandan militia.

07/04/2018: An assailant punched a man with a Donald Trump flag in his yard in Boynton Beach, Florida, United States. The assailant also dragged the man with his vehicle as he fled the scene. The civilian was injured in the attack. An unknown individual claimed responsibility for the incident and told the victim to remove a Donald Trump flag from his yard.

07/05/2018: Assailants abducted Javaid Ahmad Dar, a police constable, near his residence in Vehel Chatta Watan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Dar was killed and his body was discovered early on June 6, 2018. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Special Operations Group (SOG) camp in Lasipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/03/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least six people were killed and three people were injured in the attack. The casualties included assailants, police officers, and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/05/2018: Assailants fired a rocket that landed in Asadabad, Kunar, Afghanistan. Two people, including a police officer, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: An armed drone fired missiles targeting an Arab Coalition headquarters in Buraiqeh district, Adan, Yemen. Security forces intercepted and destroyed the drone. An unknown number of people were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: An incendiary device detonated at a Woolworths store at Gateway mall in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks at Woolworths stores in Durban on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Jihadi-inspired extremists.

07/05/2018: An incendiary device planted in a jacket pocket on a clothing rack detonated at a Woolworths store at the Pavilion shopping centre in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks at Woolworths stores in Durban on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to Jihadi-inspired extremists.

07/05/2018: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and abducted seven civilians along a road in Buhriz, Diyala, Iraq. The seven hostages were shot and killed shortly after the kidnapping. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a rubber plantation near Ban Thung Ya Mu, Yala, Thailand. Jaron Chanluek, a rubber tapper, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants attacked a military post in Jayhah, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least five soldiers and 15 assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/05/2018: Assailants attacked a Galmudug administration forces base near Caad, Mudug, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/05/2018: Assailants beheaded a Popular Mobilization Forces (PMF) in Murad Khatun, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants attacked Shammar tribal members in Al Hamdaniyah Complex in Bakhdida, Nineveh, Iraq. One child was killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of a soldier in Ash Shamayatayn district, Taizz, Yemen. The soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on two vehicles carrying Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) in Caad, Mudug, Somalia. One woman was killed and several others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab and noted that the victims were fleeing the village after a previous attack had taken place there.
07/05/2018: Assailants shot and killed Derow Dhaqane Mohamed, a traditional elder and electoral delegate, in Daynile, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/05/2018: Assailants threw a pipe bomb at a residence in Enniskeen, Craigavon, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: A pipe bomb was found at an apartment complex at Northview Apartments along Antrim Road, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. The Army bomb squad safely disposed of the device. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants attacked a civilian residence in Badush, Nineveh, Iraq. A man and his three children were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated near an army checkpoint in Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least two people, including one soldier and one civilian, were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Kenyan Administration Police (AP) vehicle escorting a bulldozer between Handaro and Sangailu, Garissa, Kenya. At least five police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab carried out the attack.

07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Zuwiyah, Saladin, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/05/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Eastern Lakes, South Sudan. At least two assailants and 17 civilians and were killed and 11 people were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated the assailants were affiliated with the former deputy president.

07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated at an anti-Turkish demonstration in Al-Hayyah, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and 22 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/05/2018: Two explosives-laden vehicles detonated in Jarabulus, Aleppo, Syria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Tse Tyogbihi, Logo, Benue, Nigeria. Three civilians were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

07/05/2018: An explosive device detonated in Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/05/2018: Assailants detonated three explosives-laden vehicles targeting military forces responding to an earlier attack in Tal Humaydat, Nineveh, Iraq. At least six people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/05/2018: Assailants abducted Genaro Negrete Urbano and his wife from their vehicle along Mexico City-Tuxpan Highway in Hidalgo, Mexico. His wife was released on July 6, 2018 while Urbano, the Naupan mayor, was shot and killed on July 29, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/05/2018: Assailants abducted four Tuareg civilians in Ebangh Mallane, Gossi, Timbuktu, Mali. Three hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered on August 4, 2018. The whereabouts of the fourth hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 07/05/2018: A sound bomb detonated targeting the residence of a judge in Hayy Ramadan Khalaf, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 07/09/2018: An explosive device detonated against a police convoy in near Al-Bakkara, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one conscript was killed and three others were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/09/2018: An explosive device detonated in Jalawla, Diyala, Iraq. A farmer was wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Ganjabad, Bala Bolok district, Farah, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the district on this date. At least five assailants and three police officers were killed and seven assailants four officers were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/09/2018: Two suicide bombers attacked security forces om Baiji, Saladin, Iraq. One assailant was arrested while the other assailant detonated, killing four soldiers and injuring one soldier. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 07/09/2018: An explosive device detonated in front of a shop in Nakarkhel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Two people, including a Taliban unit leader and a civilian, were killed in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 07/09/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on Assam Rifles om Kangpat. Manipur, India. One soldier was killed and three others were injured in the attack. The People's Liberation Army (India) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Giresun, Turkey. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

07/09/2018: Assailants set fire to a Dole Stanfilco box truck in Banarao, Talandang, Davao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties, though the truck was destroyed in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities doubted the veracity of the claim.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI) officers, drafted to protect the Fountain estate residents, with petrol bombs, bricks, and bottles in Bogside, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Two officers and a civilian were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Catholic youths.
07/10/2018: Assailants hijacked a van and set it on fire along Fahan Street in Bogside, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on Hassan Abdi in Dabka, Mogadishu, Somalia. Abdi, a former electoral delegate, was killed in the assault. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/09/2018: Assailants opened fire targeting police forces in Malingo, Buea, South-West, Cameroon. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. At least 12 people, including police officers, civilians, and 10 assailants, were killed while an unknown number of others were injured across the ensuing clashes. One police officer was also abducted, and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF).

07/09/2018: Assailants fired projectiles and attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) observation posts in Al-Ateira, Lattakia, Syria. At least 33 people, including 27 soldiers and six assailants, were killed and 40 other soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Tajamo Ansar al-Islam claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

At least 13 assailants, were killed and 20 assailants were injured across the attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked police checkposts in Khwaja Umari district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different districts of Ghazni overnight. At least 13 assailants, were killed and 20 assailants were injured across the attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

At least 13 assailants, were killed and 20 assailants were injured across the attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/09/2018: Assailants opened fire targeting police forces in Muea, Buea, South-West, Cameroon. This was one of four related attacks in the area on this date. One police officer was also abducted, and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF).

At least 12 people, including police officers, civilians, and 10 assailants, were killed while an unknown number of others were injured across the ensuing clashes. One police officer was also abducted, and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF).

At least 12 people, including police officers, civilians, and 10 assailants, were killed while an unknown number of others were injured across the ensuing clashes. One police officer was also abducted, and the outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Restoration Forces (ARF).

07/07/2018: Two explosive devices detonated near the headquarters of the Investigative Police in Santiago, Santiago Metropolitan, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on the husband of a village mayor near Bakarpur, Haryana. India. Session Judge was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. In addition to eight assailants, three National Uprising Movement (NUM) members were killed and 23 others, including 16 assailants and seven security personnel, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/09/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at civilians in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and four people, including a police officer, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/09/2018: Assailants attempted to plant an explosive device in Marjah, Helmand, Afghanistan. The device detonated prematurely, killing two assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/09/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Gerani, Bala Bolok district, Farah, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in the district on this date. At least five assailants and three police officers were killed and seven assailants four officers were injured across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/10/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at and election rally for Barrister Haroon Bilour, an Awami National Party (ANP) candidate, in Yakatoot, Peshawar, Kyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 22 people, including Bilour, were killed and 75 others were injured in the blast. The Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Barrister Haroon Bilour was targeted in retaliation for the Awami National Party's efforts to target TTP members.

07/10/2018: Assailants launched a missile targeting Al-Shuqaiq, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by Saudi air defenses. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) personnel providing security for a water pump installation in Lindoy, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. One CAFGU member was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/10/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Radhwaniyah, Al Anbar, Baghdad, Iraq. A civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/10/2018: An explosives-laden house detonated in Qahtaniyah, Nineveh, Iraq. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: A suicide bomber detonated explosives at a National Directorate of Security (NDS) checkpoint in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 10 people were killed and four others were injured. The victims included NDS personnel and civilians. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the alleged torture of detained group members.

summary: 07/10/2018: Assailants attacked the district police headquarters in Wali Muhammadi Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different districts of Ghazni overnight. At least 13 people, including four police officers and nine assailants, were killed and 17 people, including five police officers and 12 assailants, were injured in this attack. A total of 13 assailants were killed and 20 assailants were injured across all four attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/10/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at the office of the secretary of the Meghalaya Public Service Commission in Lachumiere, Meghalaya, India. No casualties were reported in the attack. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ferdinand Cariaga, Barangay Salab chairperson, while he was riding his motorbike in Pangao-an, North Cotabato, Philippines. Cariaga was injured but survived the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/10/2018: Assailants open fire on the motorcycle of Ibrahim Bakil Baguinda, an Arabic teacher, in Talon-Talon, Zamboanga, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Baguinda was killed and his daughter was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/10/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at a Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) position in Zaizun, Daraa, Syria. In addition to the assailant, at least 14 soldiers were killed and an unknown number of other soldiers were injured in the blast. Khaled Ibn al-Walid Army claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/10/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on Reserve Police Force (RPF) personnel in Minpa, Chhattisgarh, India. Two assailants were killed and one police officer was injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier, identified as Patchai Suree, along Charusathian Road in Moo 11 near Maruebo Ok, Narathiwat, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

07/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on patrols for the Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI) and attacked the Fountain estate with petrol bombs in Bogside, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a Safaricom communication mast in Hamey, Garissa, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks carried out in the area on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.
07/10/2018: Approximately 11 explosive device planted in a bag were discovered and defused under a bridge in Pailin, Cambodia. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/10/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device under the vehicle of Luis Alberto Galvis in Estacion Tisquirama, Cesar, Colombia. Galvis, a local Workers' Trade Union of the Petroleum Industry (USO) leader, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/10/2018: Assailants abducted two people, including Ibes Trujillo Contreras, in Suarez, Cauca, Colombia. One hostage was released the following day while Contreras, a community and social leader, was killed and his body was discovered on July 17, 2018 at the banks of the Marilopez River. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/10/2018: Assailants shelled a residential area in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Eight civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
07/10/2018: A gunman opened fire on barangay councilor Ruel Mabano in the Kalunasan, Cebu, Philippines. Mabano was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/10/2018: Assailants launched a mortar shell at a civilian residence in Naqilabad, Helmand, Afghanistan. One civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: Assailants attacked Luis Perez Garcia, a journalist, at his residence in Iztapalapa, Mexico city, Federal, Mexico. Perez Garcia was beaten and killed and his house was set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: An assailant set fire to a field near an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Nachal Sorek, West Bank. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in this area on this day. An Israeli extremist, identified as David Sharaf, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he wanted to "Burn Arabs because they burn us."

07/10/2018: An assailant set fire to an olive grove in Jerusalem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in this area on this day. An Israeli extremist, identified as David Sharaf, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he wanted to "Burn Arabs because they burn us."

07/10/2018: An assailant set fire to vegetation near buildings and residences in Jerusalem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in this area on this day. An Israeli extremist, identified as David Sharaf, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he wanted to "Burn Arabs because they burn us."

07/10/2018: An assailant shot and injured a woman in her vehicle pulling into a car wash along South Mason road in Katy, Texas, United States. Nicholas D'Agostino, who had previously ranted on Facebook "about female motorists and how incompetent they are and that their sole purpose is to give birth to male children," claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/11/2018: Assailants set fire to Joyak High School in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants attacked a military post in Qarluq, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks and one of two attacks with related casualties that occurred on the same day. At least six soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in this attack. Additionally, 50 assailants were killed across this attack and one in Pul-e-Momin. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Khaki Safed district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least five people were killed and four were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2018: Assailants ambushed Technical Investigation Corps (CTI) officers in Guayacana, Narino, Colombia. Three officers, Willington Alexander Montenegro Martinez, Yair Alonso Montenegro, and Douglas Dimitry Guerrero Medina, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents were arrested in connection to the attack.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 07/11/2018: Assailants attempted to fly incendiary balloons and kites into southern Israel near the Israel border in Gaza Strip. The assailants were repelled by Israel Defense Forces (IDF) personnel and there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/10/2018: 15 suicide bombers attempted to detonate explosives in Tall Dhahab, Balad, Saladin, Iraq. Four of the assailants were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

07/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and additional assailants fired projectiles and opened fire on Hayt village in Daraa, Syria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. The Khaled Ibn al-Walid Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least four police officers were killed and seven others were wounded across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/11/2018: An explosive device detonated at a construction site near a market in Poblacion, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/11/2018: An explosive device detonated in Short Strand, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties but a car was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a number of cars close to the Ballybeen Estate in Dundonald, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2018: Assailants attacked police officers and a fire engine in Collon Lane, Carnhill, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/11/2018: An explosive device was found on the nationalist side of the peaceline on Clandeboye Drive, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. The Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI) safely disposed of the device. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of recently resettled internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Digrais, South Darfur, Sudan. This was one of three coordinated attacks and one of two attacks with related casualties that occurred on the same day. At least 17 soldiers were killed and 11 soldiers were injured in this attack. Additionally, 50 assailants were killed across this attack and one in Qarluq. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

Additionally, 15 police officers were abducted in the attack; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/11/2018: An explosive device detonated near a store near Bani Rukkab, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) armored personnel carriers in Huriwa, Mogadishu, Somalia. The blast resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/12/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting a power pylon near Al-Mahdiyah, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on the motorbike of Ritchel Celestial Parreno, principal of the Bulol High School, along a road in Pikit, North Cotabato, Philippines. Parreno was injured but survived the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Sources noted that the assailant called the victim a terrorist and further stated "Arab, go back to your country!"

07/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Defense Minister Joseph Beti Assomo in Small Ekombe, South-West, Cameroon. This was one of two attacks targeting Beti Assomo's convoy in the area on this date. At least six assailants were killed while five people, including four soldiers and a journalist, and an unknown number of assailants were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to separatists.

This was one of two attacks targeting Beti Assomo's convoy in the area on this date. At least six assailants were killed while five people, including four soldiers and a journalist, and an unknown number of assailants were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to separatists.

There were no reported casualties as the devices failed to detonate and were safely removed by an ammunition technical officer (ATO). No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in different parts of Ghazni on the same date. At least four officers and were killed and four other officers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.
