At least four officers and were killed and four other officers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/12/2018: Assailants threw explosive devices and opened fire at a Kenyan Administration Police (AP) camp in Mansa, Mandera, Kenya. There were no reported casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab carried out the attack.
07/12/2018: Assailants set fire to an an Orange Hall in Crumlin, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants threw petrol bombs targeting police officers and landrovers in Bogside, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. It is unknown whether there were any injures. The New Irish Republican Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants attacked a white transit van with a petrol bomb on Lecky Road, Bogside, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. The petrol bomb failed to detonate and there were no injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Qari Syed Alam, a former spokesman for a National Assembly member, along Nasir Bagh Road in Board Bazaar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Alam was killed and a civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants entered the residence of Jitendra Singh in order to demand levy payment in Bariatu, Latehar, Jharkand, India. When Singh stated he was unable to pay, he was taken out of his house and thrashed along with his brother. Local villagers intervened and killed one assailant while injuring another. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Jharkhand Janmukti Parishad (JJP).

07/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Colonel Fahmi al-Sabaihi in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Colonel al-Sabaihi, a police chief, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants attacked Qadam, Dhamar, Yemen. At least 40 civilians were abducted and one house and farm were set on fire in the incident, which continued until July 14, 2018. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qadam on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/12/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct a civilian in Qadam, Dhamar, Yemen. At least one assailant was killed and another assailant was injured when the civilian successfully resisted the kidnapping. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qadam on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/12/2018: An assailant poured gasoline all around his condominium in an attempt to burn down the entire complex at 5601 Collins Avenue in Miami, Florida, United States. There were no reported casualties as authorities were able to arrest the suspect before he could start the fire. The assailant was identified as Walter Edward Stolper and authorities stated the Stolper wanted to "burn down the building with all the f------ Jews." Sources also noted that Nazi memorabilia, including a Santa Hitler mug, was found in his residence.

07/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in the 10th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/12/2018: Assailants fired a mortar at a civilian residence in Shahjoy district, Zabul, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2018: An explosive device planted in a motorcycle detonated in the 1st police district of Qala-i-Naw, Badghis, Afghanistan. Eleven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants set fire to a telephone tower in Deh Rahwod district, Uruzgan province, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks on telephone towers in the district on the same night. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/13/2018: Assailants set fire to a telephone tower in Deh Rahwod district, Uruzgan province, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two attacks on telephone towers in the district on the same night. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

07/13/2018: An assailant opened fire on a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicle in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The soldiers returned fire, killing the assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel in Puerto Valdivia, Antioquia, Colombia. Two police officers, identified as Police Commander Alexander de Jesus Hernandez Alvarez and sub-commander Rafer Stith Baldovino Munoz, were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at an election rally for Balochistan Awami Party (BAP) candidate Nawabzada Siraj Raisani in Darengarh, Balochistan, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 150 people, including Raisani, were killed and 300 other people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State and the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) both claimed responsibility for the incident. Authorities later identified the assailant as Hafeez Nawaz.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 07/13/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Hisarak district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and seven assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/13/2018: An explosive device planted in a motorcycle detonated targeting the convoy of Akram Khan Durrani, a JUI-F election candidate, in Bannu, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Durrani was not harmed, but four people were killed and 32 others were injured in the blast. The Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants attacked a Nigerian military convoy in Boboshe, Balagallaye, Dikwa, Borno, Nigeria. At least five assailants were killed and three military personnel were still reported missing as of July 18, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

07/14/2018: Assailants armed with explosive devices and firearms attempted to attack a police headquarters in Taizz, Yemen. The assailants attempted to detonated the devices while inside the headquarters but were arrested by the police before the devices detonated. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/13/2018: An explosive device detonated near Albu Bali, Khalis, Diyala, Iraq. A farmer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) vehicle in Achabal, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two CRPF members were killed and two others, including one civilian, were injured in the attack. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Yaripora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Yonis Adan Hassan in Bula Jameo, Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. Hassan, the police commissioner, was not harmed; however, at least three people were killed and four people were injured in the blast; the victims included civilians and security guards. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on Sheikh Abdullahi Mohamed Roble in Wedow, Mogadishu, Somalia. Roble, a former electoral delegate, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/13/2018: An explosive device was thrown at the residence of Gerry Adams along Glen Road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Adams, a former Sinn Féin president, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting the houses of prominent Sinn Féin leaders in Belfast on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the incidents were carried out by the New Irish Republican Army, which denied involvement.

07/13/2018: An explosive device was thrown at the residence of Bobby Storey in Coolnasilla, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. Storey, a Sinn Féin northern chairperson, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting the houses of prominent Sinn Féin leaders in Belfast on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the incidents were carried out by the New Irish Republican Army, which denied involvement.

07/13/2018: An assailant in Gaza Strip threw a grenade at Israel Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers near the Gaza border, Southern, Israel. At least one soldier was injured and the assailant was killed in retaliatory fire. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/13/2018: An assailant threw an explosive device at Israel Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers in Abu Dis, West Bank. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on an army position in Igtalongon, Iloilo, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army.
07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security vehicle in Hurmaz, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and one other was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident

07/13/2018: Assailants set fire to St. Vincent school along Willowfield Drive in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Puerto Morrito, Rio San Juan, Nicaragua. Four police officers were killed and nine officers were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on the town hall in Puerto Morrito, Rio San Juan, Nicaragua. A teacher was killed and five municipal employees were injured in the attack. This was one of two related attacks carried out by the assailants on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on farmers who were formerly Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) near Janga, North Darfur, Sudan. At least two farmers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Assailants attacked a guard post at the residence of Ismail Hallob, the deputy governor of Saladin, in Athia, north of Ishaqi, Saladin, Iraq. One soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Njoke Johnson Njombe in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Njombe, a local village chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Philip Mokwa in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Mokwa, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Elinge Ndoto from his residence in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Ndoto, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Herman Njumbe from his residence in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Njumbe, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Francis Molinga from his residence in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Molinga, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Lieti Woloko from his residence in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Woloko, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants abducted Njie Mbanda from his residence in Buea, South-West, Cameroon. Mbanda, a local tribal chief, was released on July 31, 2018. This was one of seven related kidnappings in and around Buea on the same day. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attacks.

07/13/2018: Assailants attacked Limbe, South-West, Cameroon. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

07/13/2018: An explosive device detonated on the premises of the Local Police in Tres de Febrero, Buenos Aires, Argentina. Three people were injured, including a municipal employee and a police officer. This was one of two attacks targeting police in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police station in Transradio, Esteban Echeverria, Buenos Aires, Argentina. There were no reported injuries. This was one of two incidents targeting police in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/13/2018: Five explosive devices detonated near a Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) patrol outside Pundari, Bijapur, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blasts and three additional devices were discovered and defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked and abducted three Libyan and one Romanian Akakus Oil Operations Company workers at El-Sharara Oilfield Site Number 186 in Murzuq, Libya. Two Libyan hostages were freed a short time later while the remaining two hostages were released on March 30, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/14/2018: Assailants, including a suicide bomber in an explosives-laden vehicle, attacked a checkpoint outside the presidential palace in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks near the palace on this date. At least three assailants were killed and 11 people were injured across both attacks. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/14/2018: Assailants detonated an explosives laden vehicle at a checkpoint outside the presidential palace in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks near the palace on this date. At least three assailants were killed and 11 people were injured across both attacks. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/14/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at checkpoint in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least one police officer was killed and 11 people were injured in the blast. The victims included police officers and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: Assailants set fire to a tractor trailer in Buenaventura district, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on Syed Obaidullah Sadat in Ghazni, Afghanistan. Sadat, a former member of Ghazni's Provincial Council, was killed in the attack. The assailant was also killed when security forces responded to the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/14/2018: Assailants shot and killed Abdul Hameed, a prayer leader, in the 5th police district of Farah, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/14/2018: Assailants shot and killed Abdul Ali, an Afghan National Army (ANA) official, in the 3rd police district of Farah, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/14/2018: Assailants set fire to Kiptan Baba Middle School in Krabawai, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked a Nigerian military base in Jilli, Geidam, Yobe, Nigeria. At least 31 military personnel, two Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) members, and five assailants were killed and 25 military personnel and three CJTF members were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, an unknown number of solders were reported missing in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

07/13/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Khash Rod district, Nimroz, Afghanistan. Six police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) checkpoint in Kal Qala, Farah, Afghanistan. At least nine assailants and 11 soldiers were killed while 13 assailants and four soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was killed and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Major General Shallal 'Ali Shayi', the Aden Security Chief, at the at the Caltex roundabout in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Colonel Ahmad Sa'id Hazza' al-Subayhi, commander of Camp Khalid Bin-al-Walid, in Taizz, Yemen. Seven soldiers, including al-Subayhi, were killed and several others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/14/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. There were no reported casualties as the missile was intercepted by Saudi air defense forces. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ferdinand Ramos in Barangay II, Santo Tomas, Batangas, Philippines. Ramos, a former vice mayor, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/14/2018: Assailants shot and killed Romel Luancing, a barangay councilor, in Antipolo del Sur, Batangas, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/14/2018: Assailants launched rockets at a civilian residence in Sderot, Southern, Israel. At least three civilian were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

07/14/2018: Assailants launched a rocket near a synagogue in Sderot, Southern, Israel. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
07/14/2018: Assailants launched at least 27 rockets at Southern, Israel. The rockets were intercepted by Israel's Iron Dome missile defense system. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/14/2018: Assailants abducted Gabriel Vado Ruiz, a police officer, in Monimbo, Masaya, Nicaragua. Shortly after the abduction, Ruiz, was tortured and killed and his corpse was then set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to right-wing extremists.

07/14/2018: A sea mine detonated off the coast of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Five fishermen were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/14/2018: Assailants set fire to an abandoned house at Tranaquepe farm near Lumaco, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two arson attacks in the area on this date. In pamphlets left at the scene, Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/14/2018: Assailants set fire to five vehicles and machines at the Flor del Valle farm in Curacautin, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two arson attacks in the area on this date. In pamphlets left at the scene, Mapuche activists claimed responsibility for the incidents.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked Limbe, South-West, Cameroon. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties, however, several properties and a truck were set ablaze. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

07/14/2018: Assailants abducted two people accused of being police informers in Rengawahi, Kanker, Chhattisgarh, India. One hostage, identified as Milan Haldar, was killed and his body was discovered the following day, July 15, 2018. The fate of the other hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents targeting checkpoints in the district on this day. At leas six police officers were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Bahrami Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents targeting checkpoints in the district on this day. At leas six police officers were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

07/14/2018: Two explosive devices detonated near a military vehicle in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Colonel Ahmed Saeed Hazza al-Subayhi, the Khaled Ibn al-Walid Camp comander, and five other soldiers were killed in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/15/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at a police station in Indramayu, West Java, Indonesia. Police officers opened fire on the assailants, injuring one assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaah Ansharut Daulah.

07/15/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Marko, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers and five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/14/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkpoints in Zebak district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 25 assailants and eight security personnel members were killed and 39 people, including 28 assailants and 11 security personnel members, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of police chief Abdul Ghafoor Azizi detonated in the 5th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Azizi was injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/15/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Alishing district, Laghman, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
07/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Nari district, Kunar, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/15/2018: Assailants attacked Injagalane, Menaka, Mali. At least 14 people were killed, an unknown number of others were wounded, and several vehicles were set on fire in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

07/15/2018: Assailants attacked border police checkpoints in Jaji Maydan district, Khost, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including four assailants, were killed and two people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/15/2018: Two suicide bombers attempted to attack a police checkpost in Ghani Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Police opened fire on the assailants, killing one of them while the other detonated his explosives, killing only himself. No further casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on Border Security Force (BSF) personnel in Barkot, Kanker, Chhattisgarh, India. Two soldiers were killed and one soldier and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/15/2018: Assailants launched a projectile at Aridah, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Three civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/15/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at the Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development building in Dar-ul-Aman, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least seven people were killed and 15 people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

All five soldiers were rescued by the Sudanese National intelligence Security Services (NISS) on July 30, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

Two people, including a soldier and a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, were killed and the motorcycle driver was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations-African Union Mission in Darfur (UNAMID) peacekeeper near Al-Salam in South Darfur, Sudan. The peacekeeper, an Egyptian national, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least six police officers and 25 assailants were killed and 10 officers and 15 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an electricity tower in Al-Qurnah, Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least one soldier was killed and four police officers were injured across the attacks. In addition, 15 assailants were either killed or wounded. At least one soldier was killed and four police officers were injured across the attacks. In addition, 15 assailants were either killed or wounded. At least one soldier was killed and four police officers were injured across the attacks. In addition, 15 assailants were either killed or wounded. However, sources suspected that the attack was the result of Islamophobia.

07/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed district leader 'Abd-al-Razzaq Abu-Hasunah in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a power distribution network maintenance team in Baladiat, Habibiya, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Saladin Operation Command Chief of Staff Brigadier General Imad Ahmad Muhammad in Mutaybijah, Saladin, Iraq. Muhammad and two of his bodyguards were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 07/17/2018: An explosive device detonated in Rashidiyah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two brothers, identified as Hamad Farhaj Jum’a and Iyad Farhan Jum’a, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

In addition to the assailant, 22 people were killed and five were injured in the blast; the victims included civilians and Taliban members. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 07/17/2018: Assailants attacked a checkpost in Haybati, Paktika, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/17/2018: Assailants fired a mortar at Taizz, Yemen. Three civilians were killed and six were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
07/17/2018: An explosive device detonated against a police convoy in Albu Najm, Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. A police commander was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of 'Adil al-Ja'di, a Salafi al-Hikmah al-Yamaniyah Society leader, in Aden, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Lower Dir, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/17/2018: Assailants raided the house of Sadiq al-Qadi. a tribal leader, and attempted to kidnap him in southwestern Ibb, Yemen. The assailants failed to abduct al-Qadi, but later detonated explosive devices at his house. At least eight people, including one of al-Qadi's relatives and seven assailants, were killed and four assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

07/25/2018: A suicide bomber detonated his explosives-laden vest outside Tameer-i-Nau Education Complex school, which was serving as a polling station, in Bhosa Mandi, Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. In addition to the suicide bomber, 31 people were killed and up to 60 others were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at a polling station in Koshk, Khuzdar, Balochistan, Pakistan. One police officer was killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants launched grenades and opened fire on a Military Protection Party escorting polling staff in Dashtak, Kech, Balochistan, Pakistan. Four people, including three soldiers, were killed and 14 others were injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants launched a rocket at Balochistan National Party-Awami’s electoral camp in Bonistan, Balochistan, Pakistan. One civilian was injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants threw a cracker at a Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) facilitation camp in Larkana, Sindh, Pakistan. Five people were injured in the blast. The Sindhudesh Revolutionary Army (SRA) claimed responsibility for the incident and "rejected Pakistan’s electoral system and urged Sindhis to oppose assemblies and boycott polls because 'assemblies are rubber stamp'" and deemed them a "threat to Sindh’s secular culture."

07/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on two police vehicles near al-Zilal Casino area, north of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. At least one person, Commissioner Nizar Faysal Ghazi Jasim, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Asa'ib Ahl al-Haqq.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated in an orchard in Zwhraa, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. The village head was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants shot and killed two farmers in Zwhraa, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on tractor drivers near Adhaim, Khalis, Diyala, Iraq. One person was killed and another person was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/25/2018: An assailant opened fire on the vehicle of a Basrah Gas Company employee in Al-Zubair, Basra, Iraq. The employee was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: A sniper opened fire on Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) personnel in Kissufim, Eshkol, Southern, Israel. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement).

07/25/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle at a vegetable market in Suwayda, As Suwayda, Syria. Following the blast, additional assailants armed with explosive devices and firearms attacked the market. This was one of 11 coordinated incidents in and around Suwayda on the same day. At least 302 people, including 56 assailants, militia members, and civilians, were killed, and 180 other people were injured across all 11 attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants raided an Agusan Milling Philippine (AGUMIL) oil depot in Camagong, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. There were no reported casualties, but the assailants disarmed two guards before setting fire to an electric control panel, an electric boiler, and a portable pump. This was one of two attacks in Camagong on this day. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for increasing plantations in the area.

07/25/2018: A suicide bomber detonated at Mashnaqa Roundabout in Suwayda, As Suwayda, Syria. Following the blast, additional assailants armed with explosive devices and firearms attacked the area. This was one of 11 coordinated incidents in and around Suwayda on the same day. At least 302 people, including 56 assailants, militia members, and civilians, were killed, and 180 other people were injured across all 11 attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants armed with explosive devices and firearms attacked Al-Shibki village in As Suwayda, Syria. At least 36 women and children were abducted from the village. As of November 8, 2018 seven hostages were killed and the remaining 29 victims were released. This was one of 11 coordinated incidents in and around Suwayda on the same day. At least 302 people, including 56 assailants, militia members, and civilians, were killed, and 180 other people were injured across all 11 attacks. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Camagong, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Two police officers were injured in the assault. This was one of two attacks in Camagong on this day. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/23/2018: Assailants dressed as border police personnel opened fire on soldiers in Ghani Khel, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least four people were killed and one was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated in a shop in Maymana, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least seven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a senior military official in Ceelasha Biyaha, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least four people, including soldiers were injured in the blast. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
07/25/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade near the gate of the 'Amir marketplace in Aden, Adan, Yemen. Six people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Brigadier General 'Abd-al-Ghani al-Subayhi, commander of the Western Axis and the First Hazm Brigade, in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Al-Subayhi survived the blast, but it was unclear if he was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy escorting food and logistical supply trucks along Afgoye-Wanlaweyne road near Wanlaweyne in Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least six soldiers were killed and several soldiers were injured in the blast. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/25/2018: An explosive device planted in a military vehicle escorting Shaykh al-Quhaym detonated in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Al Quhaym, a district director general, was unharmed; however three soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants set fire to the Saint-Pierre du Martroi Church in Orleans, Centre-Val de Loire, France. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, the assailants left graffiti that included "Allah ou Akbar."

07/25/2018: Assailants set fire to a civilian residence in Charsada district, Ghor, Afghanistan. This was one of six related incidents in the district on this date. Six local elders were abducted across the attacks. The fate of the hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/25/2018: Assailants set fire to a civilian residence in Charsada district, Ghor, Afghanistan. This was one of six related incidents in the district on this date. 07/25/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a post office in Wahibug, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/25/2018: Assailants set fire to a mosque in Chatsworth, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants attacked election officials in Dire, Koulikoro, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
07/25/2018: Three crude bombs were discovered and safely defused at Gitaldaha railway station in Gitaldaha, West Bengal, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated against a Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (COBRA) patrol along Bansaguda-Terram road in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh, India. Two COBRA members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

07/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers at the Tarbuunka junction in Hodan, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying Buddhist poachers in Ban Kampong Buenae, Sungai Padi, Narathiwat, Thailand. Four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated at the Public Prosecutor's Office headquarters in Puerto Asis, Putumayo, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.

summary: 07/25/2018: Assailants attacked two Saudi oil tankers in the Red Sea at the Bab al-Mandeb Strait near the coast of Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties, though one of the tankers was damaged in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Mashtal, Baghdad, Iraq. One person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/26/2018: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces personnel in Shaykh Hamad, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three fighters were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 07/26/2018: Assailants attacked military and police checkpoints in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. The assailants also sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on Nestor Hedi Trinidad in Sitio Libas Sibahay, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. Trinidad, the Bagani of his Manawa tribe and a former Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/26/2018: An assailant stabbed Israeli civilians in Adam, West Bank. One civilian and the assailant were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist, identified as Mohammed Dar Youssef.

07/26/2018: Assailants attacked the campaign team of opposition leader Soumaila Cisse in Fiko, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants set up a fake checkpoint and opened fire on a police vehicle in Tagsagaong, Tomoaong, Davao Oriental, Philippines. One police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/25/2018: An explosive device detonated in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Four civilians were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 07/26/2018: Assailants shot and injured Saleban Osman Kusow, an electoral delegate, in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a government official and a police officer in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Both targets were killed in the assault. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/26/2018: Assailants attacked armed forces officers in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least three soldiers were killed in the incident. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
07/26/2018: Assailants shot and injured a Puntland administration official in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/26/2018: Assailants attacked a police guard post outside the residence of Mohammad Shafi Banday, a Peoples Democratic Party leader, in Bona Bazar, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties; however, four rifles were stolen in the attack. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
07/26/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Hundoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) bunker in Gorwan, Bijbehara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One assailant was killed and at least four CRPF officers were injured in the blast. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants attacked a market and military base in Jakana, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. At least four soldiers, two police, and seven assailants were killed in the attack, and nine civilians and an unknown number of assailants were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/26/2018: Assailants abducted kidnappers of Mohamed Ould Lefzil, a Mauritanian business person and the son of the F'derick mayor, in Tfariti, Es Semara, Western Sahara. The outcome of the abduction of the kidnappers is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Polisario Front.

07/26/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a National Directorate of Security (NDS) convoy in Bagh-i-Davod, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the suicide bomber, at least six people were killed and six others were injured in the blast; the victims included intelligence officials and civilians. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the NDS was targeted for its role in coordinating military operations against the group.

07/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police vehicle in Milihoi, Lamu, Kenya. At least one officer was killed and two officers were injured in the attack. Additionally, assailants fired rocket propelled grenades at the police vehicle and a civilian vehicle in the area, destroying them both. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a polling station in Ropashakh Akbar, Nasirabad, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/26/2018: Assailants set fire to a house in Islay Street, Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/22/2018: Assailants abducted Tabufor Francis, a Senior State Counsel in Fundong, in Belo, North-West, Cameroon. Francis was released sometime between July 29, 2018 and August 4, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/27/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. Six police officers were killed while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/27/2018: Assailants attacked Jubaland Forces (JF) and Ethiopian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) soldiers in Saateelow, Gedo, Somalia. At least five people were killed in the attack while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/27/2018: Assailants attacked Kenya Defense Forces (KDF) soldiers in Dhamaso, Gedo, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties, though telecommunications equipment and a well were damaged in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

07/27/2018: Assailants attempted to extort money and food from civilians in San Isidro, Quezon, Philippines. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash as security forces responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

07/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on Abdirashid Hasan Hashi Gabi Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Gabi, a former deputy commander in the Puntland Security Force (PSF), was killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/27/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Bunari, Monguno, Borno, Nigeria. At least 11 soldiers and three civilians were killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the incident. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the attack.

07/27/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device outside the residence of Walid al-Khatib, a General Assembly member of the Transitional Political Council of the South, in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/27/2018: Assailants set fire to a Palestinian residence in Khillet al-Wusta, Nablus, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. 07/27/2018: Assailants attacked Mairari, Guzamala, Borno, Nigeria. At least 16 assailants were killed and four civilians and a soldier were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

07/27/2018: Assailants attacked government buildings in Khwaja Ghar district, Takhar, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

07/25/2018: Assailants set up barricades along a pro-abortion rights protest along Avenida Brasil in Santiago, Chile. The assailants then began stabbing protesters, injuring four people, including three protesters and one police officer. The Social Patriot Movement claimed responsibility for setting up the barricades but denied carrying out the stabbing attack, attributing the stabbing to anarcho-feminists.

07/27/2018: Assailants opened fire in Ahmul, Ibb, Yemen. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

07/28/2018: Explosive devices detonated against a Philippine Army vehicle in Tambobong, Davao del Sur, Philippines. Two soldiers were wounded and the truck was damaged in the blast. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Iraqi Volunteer Forces convoy in Sad al-Khuzeimi, Rutbah, Al Anbar, Iraq. One volunteer fighter was killed and eight fighters were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

07/28/2018: Assailants attacked electricity towers in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties, though the towers were damaged in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.

summary: 07/28/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest at the entrance of a midwife training center and another assailant stormed the building in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. In addition to the two assailants, three people were killed and eight others were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

Two relatives, municipal councilor Carlos Abalos and municipal employee Richard Abalos, were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

07/28/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a the municipal police station in Lambayong, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. There were no reported casualties as the grenade failed to detonate. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

At least four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to National Liberation Front (FNL) (Burundi).

07/28/2018: Assailants shot and killed security operations chief Ali Naji al-Sharif in Usaylan district, Shabwah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Houthi extremists were involved in the attack.

08/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Yemini diplomat in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The diplomat, identified as Najib Ahmad al-Gharasi, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
