This was one of nine rockets attacks in southern Israel during a 24 hour period. Hamas (Islamic Resistance Movement) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the death of two Hamas members in an Israeli air strike one day prior to the attack.

08/09/2018: Assailants in Iraq attacked Turkish military personnel near Mount Guven in Cukurca, Hakkari, Turkey. One soldier was killed and five soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

08/09/2018: Assailants attacked mining trucks in Tubangoyi Forest area, Maniema, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Two people were killed and four people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Malaika Militia.

08/09/2018: Assailants attacked and abducted an unknown number of polio eradication workers, and police staff assisting them, in Rashakai, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Police freed the victims and arrested the assailants. It is unclear if the hostages were injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks on polio vaccination teams on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2018: Assailants attacked a polio vaccination team, and police officers assisting them, in Risalpur, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported injuries but the assailants threatened them with guns. This was one of two attacks on polio vaccination teams on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a municipal council member in Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Iraq. The municipal council member was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle along Ahmad Khail-Zazi Aryub road in Laja Ahmad Khail district, Paktia, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. Additional explosive devices were defused at the scene. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Samad Doz, Badghis, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and four officers were injured in the attack. In addition, 10 assailants were either killed or injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/09/2018: Assailants abducted an unknown number of people in Idlib, Syria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/09/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct a tugboat crew near Lahad Datu Tambisan area in Sabah waters, Malaysia. There were no reported casualties, as security forces intervened. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

08/09/2018: Assailants fired missiles that landed and detonated in Share' al-Nil neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/09/2018: Assailants fired missiles that landed and detonated in Talat al-Raham, Aleppo, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/09/2018: Assailants fired missiles that landed and detonated in Mahabah, Aleppo, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/09/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade outside the residence of Husayn al-Yasari, the Head of Karbala Directorate for Nationality, in Hay al Mu'allimin, Karbala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Puerto Narino, Arauca, Colombia. One soldier was killed and one other was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Awtari, Wardak, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Wardak on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Salar, Wardak, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Wardak on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Haft Asiab, Wardak, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Wardak on this day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/08/2018: Assailants fired a rocket that struck a house in Mohammad Agha district, Logar, Afghanistan. Three people were killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/10/2018: A landmine detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. One person was killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants threw a sound bomb, followed by a grenade, at the residence of imam Shaykh Jalal al-'Awlaqi in Aden, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along the main street near a cafe and bank in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility; however, at least three people were arrested in connection with the incident.

08/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a gendarmerie patrol vehicle near a festival in Fuheis, Balqa, Jordan. At least two police officers were killed and five other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to jihadi-inspired extremists.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Ferdinand Ngoh Ngoh, the secretary-general at the presidency, in Nyom, Yaounde, Central, Cameroon. At least two assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked civilians at a football pitch in Khadraniyah, Saladin, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/10/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces checkpoint in Albu Juwari, Saladin, Iraq. At least 5 volunteer forces were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/10/2018: Assailants armed with mortars, explosive devices, and firearms attacked Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 466 people, including 326 assailants, were killed in the ensuing clashes which lasted until August 14, 2018. Additionally, some security personnel may have been abducted in the attack. The victims included security personnel and civilians. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack would "strengthen their position in talks." In addition, the Afghan government also attributed responsibility to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and the Haqqani Network, though the Taliban insisted that they carried out the attack alone.

08/10/2018: Assailants opened fire at the municipal police station in Lapinig, Northern Samar, Philippines. At least two police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Diarao Baba, Dicamay II, Jones, Isabela, Philippines. In addition to an unknown number of assailant casualties, at least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/10/2018: Assailants set fire to five empty trucks in Bacheli, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked a bank guard at Jammu and Kashmir Bank branch in Khrew, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The bank guard, identified as Mumtaz Ahmad, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting farmers riding motorcycle in Nimrud, Nineveh, Iraq. One farmer was killed and one was injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Nimrud on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting people responding to an earlier incident in Nimrud, Nineveh, Iraq. One tribal fighter was killed and nine people were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Nimrud on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Emiliano Trochez Yonda, an indigenous leader, in Guadualito, Santander de Quilichao, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Virgilio Agir Masicampo Jr., a village chairman, in Magsaysay, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Virgilio Agir Masicampo Jr. was targeted for committing "'sins' against the masses."

08/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Agapito Euraoba, a former village chief, in San Agustin, Negros Occidental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Agapito Euraoba was targeted for committing "'sins' against the masses."

08/10/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired two missiles into Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Saudi security forces intercepted the missiles; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked and killed Lokesh Kartam, a suspected police informant, in Bade Gudra, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Maoists.

08/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel in Jamisola, Santa Lucia, Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. One police officer and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Bunmi Ojo, an All Progressives Congress (APC) leader and former governor, on Adebayo Road in Ado-Ekiti, Ekiti, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants armed with rocket propelled grenades (RPG) attacked military personnel near the Algerian and Malian border, in Tiris Zemmour, Mauritania. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/10/2018: Assailants attacked a joint security checkpoint in Puli Khumri Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least 16 people, including police and military personnel, were killed and two security personnel were injured in the attack. Additionally, sources noted that three security personnel were abducted, though this was not verified. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/10/2018: Assailants set fire to the office of the Lithuanian Gay League (LGL) in Vilnius, Lithuania. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however sources posited that the attack was motivated by homophobia.
08/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Nabil Mizhir Kawthar, a Syrian National Coalition member, in central Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack.

08/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Palukasamo, Narathiwat, Thailand. Two civilians were killed and their motorcycle was stolen in the attack. The Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Buddhists were randomly targeted in order to create conflict between Buddhists and Muslims in Thailand.
08/11/2018: Assailants shot and killed a volunteer ranger, identified as Phumsak Yenthua, in Don, Pattani, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants armed with machetes attacked civilians in Mayimoya, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least six people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

08/10/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the Cano Limon-Covenas Oil Pipeline in El Consuelo, Arauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

08/11/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden truck in Dalbaldin, Balochistan, Pakistan. The blast targeted a bus carrying Saindak mining project workers and Frontier Corps (FC) troops. The suicide bomber was killed and six people were injured. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the Saindak Mining Project workers were targeted because they mine gold from BLA controlled areas.

08/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpost in Manjiye, Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. At least one assailant and three officers were killed while one assailant and two officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Mohammad Ajmal in Diamer district, Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. Ajmal, the Diamer Deputy Commissioner, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/11/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Ghormach district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 10 soldiers and 30 assailants were killed and 15 soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash that lasted until August 13, 2018. Additionally, five soldiers were abducted. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/11/2018: Security forces identified a suicide bomber attempting to detonate an explosive belt at the Church of Virgin Mary and the assailant detonated on Mosturd Bridge in Shubra el-Kheima, Qalyubia, Egypt. The assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched a missile at Saudi military camp in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by the Saudi-led Arab coalition. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/11/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Kouri Bougoudi, Tibesti, Chad. Three military officials were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants threw two hand grenades at a Philippine Army 57th Infantry Battalion detachment in Labu-Labu, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. A civilian was injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) and the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF).

08/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a joint Philippine Army (PA) and Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) detachment in Poponton, Northern Samar, Philippines. There were no reported casualties as security forces repelled the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/11/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on a vehicle between Boungou and Ougarou, Gnagna, Est, Burkina Faso. At least six people, including gendarmes and one civilian, were killed in the attack. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the incident was carried out by Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

08/11/2018: Assailants harassed civilians in Hoyohoy, Tangub, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Security forces responded to the incident and at least one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/11/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Kouri Bougoudi, Tibesti, Chad. This was one of two incidents targeting military posts in Kouri Bougoudi on the same day. At least three soldiers were killed and an unknown number of other were abducted across both attacks. The hostages were released on October 4, 2018. The Military Command Council for the Salvation of the Republic (CCSMR) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Military Command Council for the Salvation of the Republic (CCSMR)

summary: 08/11/2018: Assailants attacked a military outpost in Kouri Bougoudi, Tibesti, Chad. This was one of two incidents targeting military posts in Kouri Bougoudi on the same day. At least three soldiers were killed and an unknown number of other were abducted across both attacks. The hostages were released on October 4, 2018. The Military Command Council for the Salvation of the Republic (CCSMR) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Military Command Council for the Salvation of the Republic (CCSMR)

summary: 08/11/2018: Two suicide bombers detonated targeting Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. In addition to the two assailants, ten people were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants set fire to the Government Bilingual High School in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported causalities in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked a power transmission line between Diyala and Kirkuk, Iraq. This was one of three related incidents targeting power transmission lines on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked a power transmission line between Dur and Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. This was one of three related incidents targeting power transmission lines on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked a power transmission line between Hawijah and Mullah Abdullah, Kirkuk, Iraq. This was one of three related incidents targeting power transmission lines on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: Two explosive devices detonated as assailants were attempting to plant them in Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three assailants were killed in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/11/2018: Assailants attacked an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Tariq al-Mattar, Tripoli, Libya. At least 77 people were abducted and the camp was destroyed in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ghniwah Militia.
08/11/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Thung Yang Daeng, Pattani, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/11/2018: Assailants set fire to a conveyor belt at a Societe Le Nickel (SLN) mining site in Kouaoua, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources noted that the attack was carried in response to "SLN felling trees and expanding its mining activities."

08/12/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) convoy in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. One civilian was killed and 10 people were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants attacked military police forces guarding the Al Thawrah hospital in Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. An unknown number of assailants and four soldiers were killed and 10 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Abbas Brigade.
08/12/2018: Assailants attacked a courthouse and freed a prisoner in Buraiqeh district, Adan, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants raided a Monte Rock Corp. quarry site in Abuan, Guitnang Bayan II, San Mateo, Rizal, Philippines. There were no reported casualties, though weapons were stolen and several vehicles were set on fire during the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Monte Rock Corporation was targeted because of the environmental damage it had caused.

08/12/2018: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) at a Philippine Army (PA) camp in Bugbuga, Santa Cruz, Ilocos Sur, Philippines. At least one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpost in Aliabad, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least three officers and one assailant were killed and one other person was injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Security forces discovered three explosive devices in Kuloy, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. Two explosive devices were successfully defused, but the third device detonated, injuring one soldier. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

08/12/2018: Assailants threw Molotov cocktails at an Israeli vehicle travelling along highway 60 in Al-Aroub, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants attacked a polling station in Arkodia, Timbuktu, Mali. The chair of the polling station was shot and killed, four election workers were assaulted, and the polling station was set on fire in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
08/12/2018: Assailants seized voting materials and set them on fire in Kiname, Timbuktu, Mali. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/12/2018: Assailants attacked election officials near Ngouma, Mopti, Mali. An unknown number of officials were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants set fire to a polling station in Keltamba, Douentza, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two similar attacks in Keltamba on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/12/2018: Assailants set fire to a polling station in Keltamba, Douentza, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two similar attacks in Keltamba on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/12/2018: Assailants attacked electoral officials in Takoutala, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants halted voting proceedings. This was one of two similar attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants attacked electoral officials in Sendegue, Mopti, Mali. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants halted voting proceedings. This was one of two similar attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/11/2018: An assailant threw three explosive devices at the Turkish consulate in Amsterdam, Netherlands. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Ecran P., a member of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK), claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/12/2018: An explosive device detonated outside the mayor's office in Biratnagar, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha- Goit (JTMM-G) claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out in order to demonstrate that the group could operate in areas outside of Province 2. Sources also suspected that the incident was carried out by the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

08/12/2018: Assailants abducted and killed Gulzar Ahmad, a suspected informant, in Murran, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM).

08/12/2018: Suicide bombers attacked military personnel in Al-Aitha, east of Dawr, Saladin, Iraq. At least 19 people, including 14 assailants and five soldiers, were killed and at least one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/12/2018: Assailants attacked a Defense and Security forces mixed control post along Bamenda-Ndop road, North-West, Cameroon. Two assailants were killed and one police officer and three gendarmerie members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: Assailants abducted Mozaffar Ahmed from his residence from Gowher Chanda, Lohagara, Chittagong, Bangladesh. The whereabouts of Ahmed, a Union Parishad member, are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
08/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near a bus in Twaineh, Hamah, Syria. At least 14 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/12/2018: Gunmen opened fire on Enoch Kibunguchy's vehicle in Soy, Kakamega, Kenya. Kibynguchy, a member of parliament, was not harmed but his driver was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/12/2018: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Saydabad district, Wardak, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/12/2018: An assailant opened fire in a market in Mogadishu, Somalia. Security forces responded to the attack. Two people were killed, including a civilian and the assailant, in the ensuing clash. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident. In addition, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a security forces vehicle in Panjgur district, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two security officials were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: Assailants abducted five civilians in Souq al-Juma, Tripoli, Libya. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Bashir al-Baqarah militia.

08/13/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Buhriz, Diyala, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/13/2018: Assailants abducted three tribal elders in Xiim Adde, Galguduud, Somalia. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/13/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying workers for a border wall in Tadoo, Mandera, Kenya. At least three people were killed and one person was injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/13/2018: Assailants attacked a water plant site at As-Sarir site in Wahat, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: A suicide bomber detonated near a demonstration site outside an Afghan Independent Election Commission (IEC) office in Pul-i-Charkhi, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least one person was killed and a police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/13/2018: Assailants slit the throat of Chhotu Kumar, a civilian, near Satpokhara, Bihar, India. The assailants then planted explosives in Kumar's body. This was one of two related attacks in Satpokhara in a 24-hour period. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Waheed Ur Rehman Parra in Chadoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Parra, the People's Democratic Party (PDP) youth president, was unharmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: An assailant opened fire on Umar Khalid, a Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) scholar and activist, in New Delhi, Delhi, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Two individuals claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they carried out the attack in order to "to punish 'anti-nationals.'"

08/13/2018: Assailants launched a rocket at a civilian residence in Arab Kakal, Takhar, Afghanistan. Five civilians were killed and six others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/13/2018: Assailants abducted Benedicto Dinoy, a tribal leader, from his residence in Dumalaguing, Impasug-ong, Bukidnon, Philippines. Dinoy was shot and killed and his body was discovered the next day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) riding motorcycles in Ginatilan, North Cotabato, Philippines. Two officers and a pregnant woman were killed and one officer and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

08/13/2018: Assailants hijacked two buses and forced the passengers to disembark in Ghormach district, Faryab, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban and noted that the group used the buses to transport soldiers that they had previously abducted.

08/13/2018: Two explosive devices detonated near a market in Sulichaur, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

08/13/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired a missile into Najran, Saudi Arabia. Saudi security forces intercepted the missile; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: Assailants attacked Aye-Khanum Port in Dashti Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 12 police officers were killed and five officers were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/13/2018: An explosives-rigged house detonated in Siniyah, Saladin, Iraq. Three people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Rashed Jawad Bahloul in Syed Kheel, Dhi Qar, Iraq. Bahloul, the head of the Al-Ibrahim tribe, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/13/2018: Assailants shot and killed Azam Khan, a Karachi Metropolitan Corporation (KMC) police official, in Liaquatabad, Karachi, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Khan was targeted because he did not cast a vote in the most recent election.
08/13/2018: An explosive device detonated at an Indian Army Pension Camp in Butwal, Province 5, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/14/2018: Two assailants threw a grenade at a shop during a Pakistan Independence Day rally in Nushki, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least 14 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Assailants attacked Allahuddin military base in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least 45 security personnel, including soldiers and police officers, were killed in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/15/2018: Assailants launched artillery and opened fire on police checkposts in Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants and four police officers were killed and eight people, including five assailants and three police officers, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/14/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Deh Mazang, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/14/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device near a security commandment in Qarabagh district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Assailants attacked police personnel in Arghandab district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 18 assailants and 13 police personnel were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

08/14/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Ameen Mahmoud in Aden, Adan, Yemen. Mahmoud, the governor of Taizz, was not killed, though an unknown number of his escorts were killed or injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Assailants abducted Kamal al-Shawesh, a journalist and human rights activist, in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Al-Shawesh was released on September 24, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

08/14/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms and an explosives-laden vehicle attempted to attack a military base in Alamada, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Five assailants, one of whom was injured, were arrested by security personnel. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: An explosives-laden body detonated near Satpokhara, Bihar, India. Two police officers were injured while attempting to remove his body. This was one of two related attacks in Satpokhara in a 24-hour period. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: An assailant drove his vehicle into cyclists and pedestrians before crashing into barriers at the House of Parliament at Westminster Palace in London, England, United Kingdom. At least three people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities arrested Salih Khater, a Sudanese immigrant, at the scene.

08/14/2018: Assailants threw two pipe bombs at Rachel's Tomb in Bethlehem, West Bank. There were no reported casualties as the devices failed to detonated and were defused by security forces. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Suryabinayak, Province 3, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

08/14/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Lokanthali, Province 3, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

08/14/2018: Assailants set up a checkpoint and stopped vehicles in Three Corners, South-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties, though the assailants seized and destroyed identity cards. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

08/14/2018: An explosive device detonated at the ward office in Gauradaha, Province 1, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

08/14/2018: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a farmer riding a motorcycle in Al-Aitha, Baqubah, Diyala, Iraq. The farmer was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/14/2018: A roadside bomb detonated in a market in Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. Two people were killed and four-15 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

08/14/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Nayapati, Province 3, Nepal. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand).

summary: 08/14/2018: Assailants abducted a Master Chief of the Cameroonian Navy, in Mundemba, South-West, Cameroon. The hostage was tortured and buried alive. Separatists claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/14/2018: Security forces intercepted two assailants with an explosive device in Jamal, Kathmandu NP, Kathmandu, Province 3, Nepal. The assailants were arrested and the device was defused. 08/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Norma Azucena Rodríguez Zamora, causing the vehicle to flip over between San Alejo and Tejocotal in Hidalgo, Mexico. At least two people were injured and Zamora, a newly-elected Lower House of Congress member, was abducted in the attack. Zamora was released on August 16, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Assailants armed with mortars attacked a volunteer fighter base in Mansuriyah, Diyala, Iraq. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 08/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus in Etim Ekpo, Akwa Ibom, Nigeria. One civilian was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: Assailants set fire to a residence in New Lodge Road area , Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related incidents to occur on New Lodge road on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/14/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle responding to a previous incident in Kas, Komur, Adiyaman province, Turkey. A soldier was injured in the blast. summary: 08/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy in Muea, Buea, South-West, Cameroon. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) team near Mistri, Rajnandgaon, Chhattisgarh, India. Two constables were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

08/15/2018: Assailants attacked a cowshed construction site in Bara, Bihar, India. An unknown number of construction workers were injured in the attack. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the attack through a pamphlet left at the scene.
08/15/2018: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Yabed, south of Jenin, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/00/2018: Sometime between August 1, 2018 and August 31, 2018, assailants opened fire on traders in Queen Elizabeth National Park, Rubirizi district, Western, Uganda. Three traders were injured and one was abducted in the attack. The hostage was released on an unknown date following the payment of a ransom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/00/2018: Sometime between August 1, 2018 and August 31, 2018, assailants destroyed the vehicle of Anatoliy Banhen, a council member, in Kharkiv, Ukraine. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/00/2018: Sometime between August 1, 2018 and August 31, 2018, assailants opened fire on civilians in Bherihari, Bihar, India. One village head was shot and killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

08/16/2018: Assailants attacked Malem Serajuddin, a District Chief, on Maimana-Andkhoy highway in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Serajuddin and his three bodyguards were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/16/2018: Assailants attacked Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/16/2018: Assailants launched rocket-propelled grenades and opened fire on a training center of the National Directorate for Security (NDS) in the 5th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and two people were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

The hostage was released on November 13, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

The officer, identified as Danny Maur, was released on August 18, 2018. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that they had abducted the police officer because he was participating in illegal activities.

08/16/2018: Assailants abducted two Presidential Protection soldiers in Aden, Adan, Yemen. The soldiers were killed later the same day and their bodies were discovered on August 19, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/16/2018: An explosive device detonated at a League Party office in Villorba, near Treviso, Veneto, Italy. There were no reported casualties in the blast. A second device was discovered and defused at the scene. Cellula Haris Hatzimihelakis/Internazionale nera claimed responsibility for the incident in support of Santiago Maldonado.

08/16/2018: An assailant threw a Molotov cocktail into the Belden United Methodist Church in Tupelo, Mississippi, United States. There were no reported casualties, but a storage room was damaged in the fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/16/2018: Assailants attacked Iranian border guards along Barda Buk Road, Awayi Blasan, Baneh, Kordestan, Iran. Four border guards were injured in the attack. The Zagros Eagles claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for an operation conducted by the Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) against Democratic Party of Iranian Kurdistan (KDPI) peshmerga members in Oshnavieh, Iran on August 10, 2018.

There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/18/2018: A homemade grenade detonated in Tameziaft, Bouira, Algeria. At least two children were killed and four children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Haroon Taili, a sarpanch, in Kholwad, Gujarat, India. Two people, including an assailant, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Chandar Sharma in Mithi, Sindh, Pakistan. Sharma, a Pakistan People’s Party (PPP) leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/18/2018: Assailants attacked United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) peacekeepers in Mbres, Nana-Grebizi, Central African Republic. At least three peacekeepers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to an anti-Balaka militia.

08/18/2018: Assailants abducted four Red Cross employees in Mponda Luganza, Kongolo, Tanganyika, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown, however, the hostages were injured during the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mai Mai Hapa Na Pale.

08/19/2018: A suicide bomber opened fire and detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a military convoy in Dringarh, Balochistan, Pakistan. The assailant was killed and at least six security personnel members were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers at a temporary checkpost in Saingal, Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the assault; however, the assailants set fire to the checkpost. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/19/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at Qala-e-Zaman Khan, Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two projectile attacks in different neighborhoods of Kabul on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/20/2018: Assailants abducted two soldiers in eastern Taizz city, Taizz, Yemen. The two soldiers were later killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/24/2018: Assailants attacked a police picket in Ichgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least two police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Army patrol in Al-Bakr, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three soldiers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/24/2018: Assailants abducted 12 security contractors for Tahoe Resources Inc. in Mataquescuintla district, Jalapa, Guatemala. The hostages were injured and then released several hours later. The Peaceful Resistance Group of Mataquescuintla claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/24/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police vehicle in Biyong, Masbate, Philippines. Four police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/24/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a police patrol in Gumboc, Leon, Iloilo, Philippines. At least three police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed Roberto Montecalbo, a village watchman, in Camalig, Albay, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/24/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Khoshal, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/24/2018: Assailants intimidated workers and set fire to three trucks in Forestal Arauco, Cancha El Topo Arauco, Bio-Bio, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar incidents in Chile on the same day. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the attacks.

08/24/2018: Assailants set fire to two trucks and four forest machines in Pitrufquen, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar incidents in Chile on the same day. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the attacks.

08/24/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Tulul as Safa, As Suwayda, Syria. An unknown number of soldiers were killed and at least 72 other soldiers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/24/2018: An explosive device detonated in Bayjak, Aliyawa, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Federal Police patrol in Al-Gharib, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a police patrol pick-up in Puerto Tejada, Cauca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 08/25/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked a police checkpoint at Kilometer 17 along Arish-Qantara International Road in North Sinai, Egypt. At least eight people, including four assailants and four police officers, were killed and 12 people, including two assailants and ten police officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) vehicles along a road in Mastung district, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three officers were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Assailants in Yemen launched a missile at an army camp in Bir Askar, Najran, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by Saudi Air Defense Forces; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

In addition to the assailant, two people were killed and four people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/25/2018: Assailants attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Daynunay, Bay, Somalia. At least four soldiers and two assailants were killed while six soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Assailants hijacked five commercial vehicles in Harardhere, Mudug, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab and noted that the owners of the vehicles were accused of spying for the government.

08/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the motorcade of Presidential Defense Forces Brigadier General Sanad al-Rahwah in Buraiqeh district, Adan, Yemen. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/25/2018: An explosive device detonated in Mansuriyah, Kirkuk, Iraq. One civilian was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed an explosive device outside a house on Marshallstown Road, Carrickfergus, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/25/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Jani Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: A landmine detonated targeting army personnel in Keran, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One soldier was killed in the blast. This was one of two similar incidents in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: A landmine detonated targeting an army patrol in Gogal Dar, Keran, Kupwara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One soldier was injured in the blast. This was one of two similar incidents in this area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ) activists in Karachi, Pakistan. Two people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/25/2018: Assailants shot and killed Antonio Abris, a town councilor, in Sung-an, Mercedes, Eastern Samar, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) patrol in Lasjan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on Pepe Baccay in Pilitan, Isabela, Philippines. Baccay, a former village councilor, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/25/2018: Assailants launched a mortar shell at the building of Kirkuk Satellite channel and the office of Kurdsat TV in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/26/2018: Assailants attacked National Protection Unit (UNP) bodyguards providing protection to Feliza Vargas Quiroga, a FARC political party member, and stole their weapons in La Trinidad, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/26/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade and opened fire on a Frontier Corps (FC) vehicle in front of a bank in Turbat, Balochistan, Pakistan. Five people, including three FC soldiers and two civilians, were injured in the blast. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/26/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and rocket propelled grenades (RPGs) attacked foresters traveling in a vehicle in Farkhor, Khatlon, Tajikistan. Two of the foresters were killed and one was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/25/2018: Assailants abducted Ahmad Khan, a district attorney, in Darwazbala district, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Khan's whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/26/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) position near Bireh, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/26/2018: Assailants attempted to loot and extort money from people in Kalamari, Borno, Nigeria. Security forces responded to the incident and three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

08/26/2018: Assailants fired mortars targeting Abu Karmah, Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks carried out in this area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/26/2018: Assailants fired mortars targeting Abu Sayda, Diyala, Iraq. One woman was killed in the attack. This was one of two similar attacks carried out in Abu Sayda on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/26/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Iraqi Volunteer Forces patrol in Amerli, Saladin, Iraq. At least one volunteer fighter was killed and two fighters were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on Eric Tupas, a village chief, in Daraga, Placer, Masbate, Philippines. Tupas and another person were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

08/25/2018: Assailants attacked the offices of Mytilineos company in Marousi, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported injuries, though the building was damaged in the attack. Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsibility for the incident and alleged that Vangelis Mytilineos had created his "empire by ripping natural resources, exploiting thousands of people who work for him and - as he has the right connections - making some very profitable deals especially with the national power company."

08/26/2018: Two assailants assaulted Vladimir Kovacevic with metal bars in Banja Luka, Republika Srpska, Bosnia-Herzegovina. Kovacevic, a Bosnian Serb television journalist, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Liberation Army (EPL) and Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
08/26/2018: An explosive device planted on a bus detonated in Dora, Baghdad, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/26/2018: Assailants attacked Emmanuel Tusenge Sebazungu along the road between Gakoro and Jomba in Rutshuru, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Sebazungu, a Radio Umudiho FM director, was abducted and his brother was beaten and left at the scene. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded a ransom in exchange for the victim.

08/26/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier outside his house in Al-Humairat, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/26/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian identified as Joemarie Saracia in Isabela, Negros Occidental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/26/2018: Assailants shot and killed Benito P. Salvani, a former barangay chair, in Purok 5, Taguibo, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/26/2018: Assailants abducted three civilians in Bande, Chhattisgarh, India. Two civilians, identified as Sonu Pada and Somaji Pada were found dead on September 2, 2018. The fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were targeted for being police informants.
08/26/2018: Assailants attacked Shinkorak, Kunar, Afghanistan. Security forces responded, killing two assailants and injuring two more. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/27/2018: Assailants opened fire and launched fragmentation grenades at a military patrol in El Troncal, Arauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
08/26/2018: Assailants shot and killed Amir Ali, a Hazara civilian, in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Sadiq Adozai, a pro-government tribal leader, in Qila Abdullah, Balochistan, Pakistan. One person was killed and five people were injured in the ensuing clash. The victims included police and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants armed with explosives attacked a military convoy in Chechkatu, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks on the convoy on this date. At least three soldiers and 50 assailants were killed while five soldiers and 15 assailants were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/27/2018: Assailants armed with explosives attacked a military convoy in Char Shanba, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks on the convoy on this date. At least three soldiers and 50 assailants were killed while five soldiers and 15 assailants were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

08/27/2018: Assailants armed with explosives attacked a military convoy in Chehilgaz, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of three coordinated attacks on the convoy on this date. At least three soldiers and 50 assailants were killed while five soldiers and 15 assailants were injured across the three attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.
08/27/2018: Assailants shot and killed two Afghan Air Force pilots in Khwaja Boghra, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/27/2018: Assailants raided Guba village in South Darfur, Sudan. Four civilians were killed and an unknown number of people were injured in the attack. The assailants also set fire to the village. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting a military vehicle at the Al-Baraka junction in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants attempted to ram a vehicle into Israel Defense Forces (IDF) personnel near Joseph's Tomb in Nablus, West Bank. Soldiers opened fire, injuring two assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.
08/27/2018: A roadside bomb detonated in Ghadeer, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Yusof Mirzai, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least four assistants were killed while two police officers and eight assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/26/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a former police officer and a former security guard in Danta, Calipatan, San Jacinto, Masbate, Philippines. Both victims were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

08/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on military personnel stationed at a gas station near Midan al-Nasr, Arish, North Sinai, Egypt. Three people, including one soldier and two civilians, were injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on the guard of a Member of the Provincial Assembly (MPA) in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The guard was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants shot and killed 20 cows belonging to local villagers in Adhaim, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and stated that the villagers were suspected of collaboration with government forces.

08/27/2018: Assailants attacked Kohistan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Security forces responded, killing 28 assailants. In addition, 15 people, including 13 assailants and 2 soldiers, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/26/2018: Two explosive devices detonated in Tilkef, 20 km north of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. At least four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/27/2018: Assailants attacked areas in southern Tripoli, Libya. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kani Brigade.

08/28/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near businesses and a military truck along the National Highway in Kalawag III, Isulan, Sultan Kudarat, Philippines. The East Asia Division of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also attributed the incident to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM), which denied involvement, and the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

summary: 08/28/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Helalzao, Kunar, Afghanistan. Three people were killed and 16 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on Presidential Committee convoy on 26th of September Street, Taizz, Yemen. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least seven people, including Reverend Adamu Gyang Wurim, were killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked a mining site in Wereh, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and one other was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Loh-Fan, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Loh-Pwat, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Nafan, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Sagas, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Nzom, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Ude, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. This was one of six attacks in Plateau on this day. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Fan, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants attacked Dorowa, Plateau, Nigeria. At least one person was killed and two were reported missing during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Fulani extremists.

08/28/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms attacked a police station in Pama, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties, but the station was set on fire in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

08/28/2018: An explosive device detonated against a military vehicle near Fada Ngourma, Est, Burkina Faso. At least seven soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date; the bombing targeted security forces responding to an earlier attack in Pama. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists in the attack.

08/28/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a 44 Rashtriya Rifles armored vehicle in Nowpora Payeen, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/28/2018: Assailants shot and injured Muhammad Amin Malik, a civilian, in Lurgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: An assailant equipped with a Molotov cocktail set fire to the Guru Nanak Sikh temple at 1 Sheriff Brae in Leith, Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom. There were no casualties, but the temple was extensively damaged in the fire. This was one of two attacks on religious building in Leith carried out by the same assailant on the same day. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Paul Johnson, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "...his issues are with religion and God in general."

08/28/2018: An assailant set fire to the Leith Methodist Church at 1 Junction Place in Leith, Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom. There were no casualties, but the front door damaged in the fire. This was one of two attacks on religious buildings in Leith carried out by the same assailant on the same day. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Paul Johnson, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "...his issues are with religion and God in general."

08/28/2018: Assailants shot and killed Blessing Oguori, a former local government councilor, along Osubi road in Okpe, Delta, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Army personnel as they were attempting to defuse two roadside explosive devices in Gulumba Gana, Borno, Nigeria. Three assailants were killed and one soldier and an unknown number of assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

08/28/2018: Assailants in Yemen fired a missile at Najran, Saudi Arabia. Security forces intercepted the missile; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an ambulance in Mahager, North Sinai, Egypt. A paramedic and a driver were injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Avtaar Singh, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader, in Monghama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian in Bahiza, Diyala, Iraq. The hostage was killed no later than August 29, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/28/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an unknown number of explosive devices, including explosives-rigged bodies, in Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: Assailants shot and killed a retired gendarme officer before setting his corpse on fire next to his vehicle in Guzang, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
08/28/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol in Shuhani, Diyala, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/29/2018: Assailants attacked and set fire to a Provincial Electricity Authority (PEA) building in Bannang Dama, Yala, Thailand. At least six people were held hostage during the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

08/29/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a Provincial Electricity Authority (PEA) building in Khok Pho, Pattani, Thailand. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the incident to separatists.

08/27/2018: Assailants attacked police officers in Anar Dara district, Farah, Afghanistan. Three police officers were killed and a police commander, identified as Abdul Sami, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/27/2018: Assailants detonated explosives targeting a bridge in Tarin Kot, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2018: An explosive device plant on a truck detonated in front of Camp 'Abbud checkpoint in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: An explosive device planted on a motorcycle detonated in Ghayl Ba Wazir, Hadramawt, Yemen. 'Umar 'Abdallah Bin-Shaykhan, a civilian, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/28/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and grenades attacked a Hizam Brigade checkpoint in Mihsamah, Abyan, Yemen. At least five Hizam Brigade personnel were killed and two others were injured in the incident. In addition, he assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/29/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two police officers in Baghdad-Kirkuk Highway in Diyala, Iraq. Two people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Kenyan Defense Forces (KDF) convoy traveling along the Kiunga-Sankuri road in Lamu, Kenya. At least five soldiers were killed and 10 soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle detonated at a checkpoint at the southern entrance of Qaim, Al Anbar, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, at least ten people were killed, including five security personnel, and 14 people were injured, including 11 civilians. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/29/2018: An explosive device detonated near Khaled Obediat close to Nawruz Ali Roundabout along Raju Road in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least two people, including Obediat, an Al-Sham Legion commander, were killed and 18 other people were injured in the blast; the victims included Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) soldiers, militia members, and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

08/29/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Merca, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/29/2018: Assailants attacked and destroyed a church in Zayit, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/29/2018: Assailants sabotaged power lines in Khalwakha, Herat, Afghanistan. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
