08/29/2018: Assailants attacked security checkpoints in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants were killed and five assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
08/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. Two civilians were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked the residence of Ghanem Mutshar abdul Hayy, a war correspondent, in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. The victim was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: Assailants abducted Asif Rafiq Rather from his residence in Pinglish, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Rather, the son of police officer Rafiq Ahmad Rather, was released unharmed on August 31, 2018. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the abduction was carried out in order to exchange the victim for the release of assailant family members.

08/29/2018: Assailants attempted to attack the Darwazbala district center in Badakhshan, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the assault. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

08/29/2018: Assailants attacked a Century Peak Energy Corp power plant vehicle in Igcabugao, Igbaras, Iloilo, Philippines. One employee was injured in the attack. The New People’s Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and apologized for the civilian/s injuries, claiming that it was an accident.

08/29/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle carrying security personnel detonated in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Two security officers and an unknown number of civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
08/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting security personnel in Mukhaysah, Diyala, Iraq. One police officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/29/2018: Assailants attacked and killed former Maoist, Podia Wadde, in Cholnar, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Maoists.

08/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Arzo, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two people were killed and one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: Assailants abducted Sentieh II Martin Yosimbom, a traditional ruler, in Oku, North-West, Cameroon. Yosibom was released on September 7, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

08/29/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at a residence in Strathfoyle, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/29/2018: Assailants beheaded Charles Chrisanthus, a Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chair, and temporarily detained his wife and child on his farm in Numan, Adamawa, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/29/2018: Assailants attacked a presidential hunting camp in Kompienga, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties; however, the camp was set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2018: An explosive device detonated against a police vehicle in Mamondara, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed and three were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/30/2018: An explosive device detonated at a market in Abu Ghraib, Al Anbar, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/30/2018: A suicide bomber wearing a Federal Police uniform detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a Federal Police/Mobilization checkpoint in Al-Abbasi, Kirkuk, Iraq. In addition to the assailant, at least two police officers were killed and one officer was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 08/30/2018: Assailants raided the house of Hussein al-Hamad, an Iraqi Volunteer Forces commander, in Khuwayn, Nineveh, Iraq. At least eight people, including al-Hamad, were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 08/30/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Zaro, Borno, Nigeria. At least 48 soldiers were killed and at least 19 injured in the attack. It is unknown whether there were any assailant casualties. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2018: Assailants attacked civilians and military personnel in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least two civilians, one of whom was beheaded, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

08/30/2018: Assailants shelled Radman al-Awad district, Al Bayda, Yemen. At least two people, including Ahmad al-Hamzi, the head of Saba news, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists.

08/30/2018: Assailants abducted Jerome Egbe, a People's Democratic Party (PDP) House of Representatives aspirant, in Asari Eso Layout, Cross River, Nigeria. A civilian, identified as Ido Cyprian, was also injured in the attack. The fate of the hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on a medical doctor in Obomkpa, Delta, Nigeria. The medical doctor, Ernest Obah, was killed ad to of his friends were abducted in the attack. The hostages were rescued a short time alter. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

08/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in the Ban Krue Sae community market on a road in Tanyong Lulo, Pattani, Thailand. One defense volunteer and one civilian were killed and another civilian was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/30/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a tribal mobilization fighters vehicle in Riyadh, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

The guard was injured in the assault. This was one of two related attacks at the CHRR office on this date. This was one of two related attacks at the CHRR office on this date. 08/31/2018: Assailants destroyed a bridge over the Orontes River at Al Ghab Plain in Idlib, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria).

08/31/2018: Assailants destroyed a bridge over the Orontes River at Al Ghab Plain in Idlib, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two similar attacks targeting different bridges over Orontes River on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria).

08/31/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Mir Sarfaraz Sasoli in Kalat, Balochistan, Pakistan. Sasoli, a tribal elder, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/31/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near the North Gas company apartments in Al-Wasiti, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

08/31/2018: Assailants attacked and set fire to several Christian-owned buildings in Demshaw Hashem, Minya, Egypt. Three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Muslim Brotherhood
08/31/2018: Assailants abducted David Castilla, a merchant, in Ocana, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Castilla was released on October 12, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
08/31/2018: A sound bomb detonated in Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2018: Assailants shot down a police helicopter in Bodhei, Lamu, Kenya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a District Reserve Guard (DRG) patrol in Rabdipara, Chhattisgarh, India. One DRG officer was killed and three were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/01/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated outside Maytham Mosque targeting a meeting between National Intelligence Agency (MIT) officers and Turkish Land Forces soldiers in Azaz, Aleppo, Syria. 09/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on patrol and road security forces soldiers at the Taj Shamsan Hotel in Taizz, Yemen. At least two soldiers were killed and three soldiers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Abbas Brigade.

09/01/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated as soldiers were attempting to defuse it in Darkheynley, Mogadishu, Somalia. Two soldiers were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/02/2018: Assailants abducted two Teduray farmers in Ampatuan, Maguindanao, Philippines. The victims were killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM), which the group denied.

09/01/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated a number of explosive devices northern border with Israel, Gaza Strip. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Palestinian extremists.

09/01/2018: Two explosive devices detonated between Sarmin and Idlib in Syria. Many people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaysh al-Islam (Syria).

09/01/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Ad-Dana, Idlib, Syria. At least four people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Jaysh al-Islam (Syria).
09/01/2018: Assailants abducted Lieutenant General Mohamed al-Haddad from his home in Misrata, Libya. Al-Haddad was released after several hours. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2018: Assailants attacked supporters of the Cameroon People's Democratic Movement (CPDM) party in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. At least five people were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources said they were "targeted by the armed men for their roles in campaigning ahead of the upcoming Presidential elections which the fighters say will not hold in the area."

09/01/2018: Assailants abducted two sons of a former Divisional Officer of Ndop in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. The whereabouts of Chombong Jerome and Chombong Jude are unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/01/2018: Assailants abducted a police officer in Kumbo, North-West, Cameroon. The whereabouts of the officer are unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that separatists were involved in the attack.

09/01/2018: Assailants abducted two customs agents at the Vugizo border post along Ruzizi River in Fizi, South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Both hostages were released on September 6, 2018 after a ransom was paid. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Hayy an-Nida, Kirkuk, Iraq. An unknown number of civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked the Cano Limon pipeline in La Llana, Norte de Santander, Colombia. The outcome of the incident is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

At least one US soldier, Sergeant Major Timothy A. Bolyard, was killed and another US soldier, Bryan McQueen, was injured in the assault. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/03/2018: Assailants abducted 61 traditional elders from Gal Goriale, Galguduud, Galmudug, Somalia. Seven of the hostages escaped on September 11, 2018. The remaining hostages were released as of September 29, 2018. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the tribal elders were targeted "because their sub-clan had refused to pay full compensation for five people killed from another clan."

09/03/2018: Assailants took guards hostage and fired a rocket at Khuwaja Khail high school with a rocket near Sharana, Paktika, Afghanistan. The guards were released shortly thereafter. No casualties were reported. This was one of three attacks on high schools in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants took guards hostage and threw a grenade at Hazrat Bilal high school near Sharana, Paktika, Afghanistan. The guards were released shortly thereafter. No casualties were reported. This was one of three attacks on high schools in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

09/03/2018: Assailants took guards hostage and threw a grenade at Syed Jalal Bukhari high school near Sharana, Paktika, Afghanistan. The guards were released shortly thereafter. No casualties were reported. This was one of three attacks on high schools in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban, which denied involvement.

09/03/2018: An assailant attempted to stab military personnel at Givat Avot checkpoint in Kiryat Arba, West Bank. The assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked a police headquarters and checkposts in Jani Khel district, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least 25 people, including four police officers and 21 assailants, were killed and at least six others were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked Albu Shaher, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least seven civilians were killed and a police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/03/2018: Assailants launched a rocket targeting an Aramco facility in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missiles were intercepted and destroyed; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants abducted eight people, including seven students and the headmaster, at Presbyterian School of Science and Technology in Bafut, North-West, Cameroon. All eight hostages were released as of September 7, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Ambazonia Defense Forces (ADF).

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie brigade at Bafut, North-West, Cameroon. The were an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.
09/03/2018: An explosive device detonated outside a mayor's house in Kirkuk, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants opened fire near a police station in Bambili, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked Sabga, North-West, Cameroon. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/03/2018: Assailants stormed the campus of Government Bilingual High School, stripped security guards of their uniforms, and made them leave in Tiko, South-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/03/2018: Assailants attacked a head teacher in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/03/2018: An explosive device detonated near markets in Ur, Adhamiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. Four people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/03/2018: Assailants attacked a United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) patrol in Ngadi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two South African peacekeepers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
09/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Gendarmerie Brigade personnel in Gayeri, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Security forces identified and killed three assailants attempting to plant a roadside bomb in Hakkari, Turkey. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

09/03/2018: An explosive device attached to a military vehicle detonated in the 1st police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) patrol near Jenin, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants threw explosive devices at an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) patrol near Bethlehem, West Bank. No casualties were reported in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed Thulani Nxumalo, an African National Congress (ANC) branch chairperson, in KwaNdengezi, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel at Jebel Mghila in Jelma district, Sidi Bouzid, Tunisia. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/03/2018: Assailants stopped a bauxite truck near Kashitand, Jharkhand, India. The driver was removed from the vehicle and injured before the assailants set the vehicle on fire. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the attack in a note left at the scene.

09/03/2018: Assailants physically assaulted Ajay Yadav in Herhanj, Jharkhand, India. Yadav, a Chukku ward committee member suspected of being a police informant, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tritiya Prastuti Committee (TPC).

09/04/2018: An explosive device detonated at the Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline near La Llana Creek and the Catatumbo River in Llana Alta, Teorama, Norte de Santander, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

09/04/2018: Assailants abducted four people in Maywand district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
09/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military vehicle in Kaaraan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Four soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/04/2018: Assailants shot and killed a military officer and his bodyguard in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and rocket-propelled grenades attacked a police post in Kotal Sabz, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 11 assailants and two police officers were killed while 20 people including sixteen assailants and four police officers, were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: An assailant attempted to detonate an explosive device at the United States embassy in Garden City, Cairo, Egypt. There were no reported casualties in the premature blast; however, the assailant, Abdullah Ayman Abdel-Samie, was arrested at the scene. The Omar Abdel Rahman Brigade claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants attacked commercial vehicles in Pulka, Borno, Nigeria. Two people, including a soldier and a civilian, were killed and 21 civilians were abducted in the attack. The 21 hostages were rescued on September 6, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

09/04/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Sangrama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Three people were injured in the attack. The victims included CRPF officers and civilians. Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants attacked Mile 2 town and attempted to attack the convoy of the Minister of Basic Education in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Security forces repelled the attack and, during the ensuing clashes, at least three security personnel were injured and an unknown number of other people were killed or injured. no group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/04/2018: Assailants abducted HRH Abumbi II, the Fon of the Bafut Kingdom, from his palace in Bafut, North-West, Cameroon. Abumbi II was released hours later. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists and say Abumbi II was targeted because he was conniving with security forces in their fight to track down separatist fighters.

09/04/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Qala-i-Naw, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three assailants were killed and five assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near a garden in Abu Karma, Diyala, Iraq. One farmer was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on Joselito Crizaldo along Matillosa Street in Poblacion, Monkayo, Compostela Valley, Philippines. Crizaldo, the Pasian barangay captain, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on Victor Ageas in Osmena, Compostela Valley, Philippines. Ageas, a Board of Directors of Nagkahiusang Mamumuo sa Suyapa Farm (NAMASUFA-NAFLU-KMU) member and labor union leader, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/04/2018: Assailants opened fire at the Razat mining site in Gana-Ropp, Barkin Ladi, Plateau, Nigeria. At least five people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

09/04/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the house of an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) member in Bakr, Al Anbar, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants attacked an FARDC position in Rwenzori, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

09/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Telagh, Sidi Bel Abbes, Algeria. At least three soldiers and two assailants were killed and three other soldiers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

09/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a railway in Naushahro Feroze, Sindh, Pakistan. No casualties were reported, but the railroad track was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on an army barracks in Qoryoley district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Security forces responded, killing at least two assailants. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/04/2018: Assailants stabbed and injured a female Internally Displaced Person (IDP) in Nyala, South Darfur, Sudan. This was one of two similar attacks in Nyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants stabbed and injured a female Internally Displaced Person (IDP) in Nyala, South Darfur, Sudan. This was one of two similar attacks in Nyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/04/2018: Assailants shot and killed a National Directorate of Security (NDS) official in Parwan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) checkpost in Yakhchal, Helmand, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, an unknown number of assailants were killed. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Armed assailants blocked humanitarian corridors to internally displaced people (IDP) camps in Bria, Haute-Kotto, Central African Republic. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: An explosive device planted in a bus detonated in Rusafa, Baghdad, Iraq. Three passengers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/04/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at a United Nations base camp in Menaka, Mali. At least one UN peacekeeper was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/04/2018: Assailants launched missiles targeting an Aramco facility in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missiles were intercepted and destroyed; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: A suicide bomber shot and killed a security guard and detonated explosives at Moalem wrestling club in Dasht-e-Barchi, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related bombings at Moalem wrestling club on this day. In addition to the assailant, 26 people were killed and 91 others were injured across both blasts. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 09/05/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated targeting journalists and individuals responding to an earlier suicide bombing at Moalem wrestling club in Dasht-e-Barchi, Kabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related bombings at Moalem wrestling club on this day. In addition to the assailant, 26 people were killed and 91 others were injured across both blasts. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 09/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Miranzai, Badghis, Afghanistan. Two people, including police chief Ismail Khan Shukori, were killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/05/2018: An assailant, identified as a police officer, opened fire on his colleagues in Kandahar Qeshlaq, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least eight police officers were killed in the attack and their bodies were subsequently set on fire. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants attacked a military post in Ab Kamari district, Badghis, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting military personnel in the district on this date. At least 10 assailants were killed and 18 assailants were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/06/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel responding to an earlier attack in Ab Kamari district, Badghis, Afghanistan. Eight soldiers were killed in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting military personnel in the district on this date. At least 10 assailants were killed and 18 assailants were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/05/2018: Assailants attacked the office of Mayor Mariano Blanco in Ronda, Cebu, Philippines. The building security guards were first disarmed and then Blanco was shot and killed. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ibrar Khalil, an Awami National Party (ANP) leader, in Peshawar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Khalil and his nephew were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: An explosive device detonated in Bialong, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. One person was killed and three were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Rashtriya Rifles personnel in Lassipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: A roadside bomb detonated targeting a military vehicle in Kabonga, Est, Burkina Faso. Two soldiers were killed and six were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Muslim extremists.

09/05/2018: Assailants launched a rocket targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. The rocket was intercepted and destroyed; however, 26 people were injured in the attack. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants attacked a military vehicle in Kisotsin, between Bamenda and Oku, North-West, Cameroon. At least two assailants were killed while at least 11 soldiers were injured. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police convoy escorting trucks carrying food aid in Qarghah Now, Ghor, Afghanistan. Three police personnel, including the district police chief, were killed in the attack. Additionally, the assailants hijacked 14 trucks carrying wheat. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/05/2018: Assailants attempted to attack a security checkpoint in Band-e-Timur, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Security forces responded to the attack, killing 10 assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/03/2018: Assailants attacked Bambui, North-West, Cameroon. It is unknown whether there were any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/05/2018: Explosive devices detonated on a bridge in Tuweina, Hamah, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. This was one of two attacks targeting bridges in villages of Al-Ghab Plains on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria).

09/05/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces checkpoint in Shalalat, Kirkuk, Iraq. The volunteer forces repelled the attack, injuring an unknown number of assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/05/2018: Explosive devices detonated on a bridge in Beit al-Ras, Hamah, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. This was one of two attacks targeting bridges in villages of Al-Ghab Plains on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the National Liberation Front (NLF-Syria).

09/05/2018: Assailants attacked a Brega Petroleum Marketing Company (BPMC) storage depot in Tajura, Tripoli, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bab Tajura Brigade.

09/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security forces patrol in Hamzoni, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants armed with grenade launchers and firearms attacked an Assam Rifles (AR) post in Aigijan, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: An explosive device detonated near a checkpoint in Gulan square, Herat, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting people who were responding to an earlier explosion near a checkpoint in Gulan square, Herat, Afghanistan. Three people were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants set fire to a health center in an unknown village in Malunda, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/05/2018: Assailants abducted a shepherd in Umm al-Rumman, As Suwayda, Syria. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Andriy Vagapov, a local civic activist, in Suvorovsky, Odesa, Ukraine. Vagapov was struck by the bullets, but survived the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants set fire to the campaign hall of Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) in Addu, Hithadhoo, Maldives. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/05/2018: Assailants raided CEBI church tents at an internally displaced people (IDP) camp in Bria, Haute-Kotto, Central African Republic. One person was abducted in the attack and the outcome is unknown. The Popular Front for the Renaissance of the Central African Republic (FPRC) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 09/06/2018: An assailant stabbed far-right presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro in Juiz de Fora, Minas Gerais, Brazil. Bolsonaro was injured in the attack. An unaffiliated individual, identified as Adelio Bispo de Oliveira, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he was "fulfilling an order from God." Sources also noted that presidential elections were scheduled for October 7, 2018.

09/06/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Biya, Rasheed, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/06/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 33 explosive devices in Parasnath Hill, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) and noted that the explosives may have been planted to target police forces.

09/06/2018: Assailants launched a rocket targeting Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted and destroyed. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

09/06/2018: Assailants abducted Andre Gabiassi, principal and French teacher at the Government Bilingual High School, in Mankon, North-West, Cameroon. The whereabouts of Gabiassi are unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents in Nding Suisut, Plateau, Nigeria. At least two people were killed, including a pastor, and two other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

09/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle between Baqubah and Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. Two people were killed and five were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on Teotemio C. Saday in Cabantao, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. Saday, a barangay chairperson, was killed and his companion was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/06/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Khaki Jabar district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants abducted nine displaced persons from Bria, Haute-Kotto, Central African Republic. The hostages were killed shortly after the abduction. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Popular Front for the Renaissance of the Central African Republic (FPRC).
gname: Popular Front for the Renaissance of the Central African Republic (FPRC)

summary: 09/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Mohammed Ali Zein in Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. Zeini, the interim speaker of the Iraqi Council of Representatives, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: An explosive device detonated near the residences of a Fatah Movement official in Miyeh Miyeh, South, Lebanon. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/06/2018: Assailants shot and killed a tribal elder in Saaj, Farah, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was targeted for being an informant.

09/06/2018: An assailant set fire to a Republican Party headquarters in Laramie, Wyoming, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Police arrested a 27-year-old suspect who plead guilty to carrying out the incident.

09/06/2018: An assailant armed with a sickle attacked guards at the 211th military police battalion near the Presidential Office in Taipei, Taiwan. There were no reported casualties and the assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants attacked and extorted All Manipur Students’ Union (AMSU) members in Nungba, Manipur, India. There were an unknown number of casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Isak-Muivah (NSCN-IM).

09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Khanjan Khel, Wardak, Afghanistan. Four civilians were killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian, identified as Mayerly Cortes Rodriguez, in Orpua, Choco, Colombia. The hostage was released on September 19, 2018. The National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Rodriguez was targeted for being an informant.

09/07/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated while Colonel Ahmed al-Gaafary was inspecting the vehicle in Halal Mountain, North Sinai, Egypt. Colonel al-Gaafary was killed and at least one army officer was injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai, Egypt. A military conscript was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Six assailants attempted to steal weapons from police officers in Khulchuhor-Ranipora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One assailant was killed and one police officer was injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were attempting to plant it in Gardi Salaw, Laghman, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/07/2018: Assailants launched a missile targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted and destroyed; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) camp in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near a playground in Saba al-Bor, Saladin, Iraq. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants armed with projectiles and firearms attack a military base and residents in Gudunbali, Borno, Nigeria. At least eight people were killed and an unknown number of other people were injured in the assault. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on Assam Rifles (AR) forces in Aibol Joupi, Manipur, India. At least one soldier was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Security forces intercepted an explosives-laden boat attempting to target an international shipping vessel near Fasht, Hajjah, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

09/07/2018: Assailants looted money and abducted the owners of currency exchange offices in Radaa district, Al Bayda, Yemen. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. This was one of two similar incidents in Al Bayda on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

09/07/2018: Assailants looted money and abducted the owners of currency exchange offices in Afar, Al Bayda, Yemen. The whereabouts of the hostages are unknown. This was one of two similar incidents in Al Bayda on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

09/07/2018: Assailants abducted two people from Bacheli, Chhattisgarh, India. The hostages were killed and their bodies were discovered on September 10, 2018. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were targeted for being police informants.

09/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on security forces in Huriwa, Mogadishu, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Djiboutian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) personnel in Bulobarde, Hiiraan, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and several others were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/07/2018: Assailants set fire to residences in Ilala, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/06/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Raj, Farah, Afghanistan. At least one police officer and three assailants were killed and three police officers and four assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, four police officers were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants attacked a security post in Haft Shahid, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least one soldier and 11 assailants were killed and one soldier and nine assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated near an army convoy between Boni and Hombori, Mopti, Mali. Following the blast, assailants then opened fire on the convoy. At least one soldier was killed and five other soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants abducted 35 villagers who had refused to attend a meeting held by the assailants in Phulpad, Dantewada district, Chhattisgarh, India. All 35 hostages were tied to trees, physically assaulted, and released a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/07/2018: An explosive device detonated at the Faculty of Agronomy at the University of Chile in La Pintana, Santiago, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Individuals Tending Toward Savagery claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Mangajek district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least seven police officers were killed in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/08/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Kishk, Herat, Afghanistan. At least nine police officers and eight assailants were killed while five officers and five assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
09/07/2018: Assailants launched three mortars at the Green Zone area in Karkh, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/07/2018: Assailants fired rockets that landed and detonated in Mhardeh, Hamah, Syria. At least nine people were killed and more than 30 people were injured in the attack. Ansar al-Tawhid claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

09/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed Hakeem-ur-Rehman Sultani, a Hurriyat Conference activist, in Bomai, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/08/2018: Assailants attacked the base of a road construction company and stole an excavator in Akum, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two related attacks to take place in North-West on this day. At least two people were killed across the two incidents, including a civilian and a bus driver. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was intended to interrupt the upcoming elections, which were scheduled for October 7, 2018.

09/08/2018: Assailants dug a gorge in the road cutting off access to the rest of Cameroon in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Once cars and buses containing at least 1,000 people were forced to stop, the assailants destroyed the identification cards of the drivers and set fire to at least four passenger buses. This was one of two related attacks to take place in North-West on this day. At least two people were killed across the two incidents, including a civilian and a bus driver. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was intended to interrupt the upcoming elections, which were scheduled for October 7, 2018.

09/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a guard post at an educational center in Chang Phueak, Narathiwat, Thailand. Two village defense volunteers were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Muhammad Kirumira, the former Buyende District Police Commander, in Bulenga, Central region, Uganda. Two people, including Kirumira, were killed in the attack. Authorities arrested three people, one of whom confessed to the attack.
09/08/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle near Murran Chowk, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least one person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/08/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint in Makuda, Bay, Somalia. At least four soldiers were killed and four were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/08/2018: Assailants attacked volunteers at a makeshift memorial to former First Deputy Prime Minister Boris Nemtsov on the Bolshoy Moskvoretskiy Bridge in Moscow, Russia. At least one volunteer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to SERB Group (Russian Liberation Movement).

09/08/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the vehicle of Joseph Nguen Monytuil in Juba, Jubek, South Sudan. Monytuil, the Northern Liech governor, was not harmed in the blast as no casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/08/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Asadollah Halimi, the head of the Paktia joint forces coordination center, in Puli Alam district, Logar, Afghanistan. Halimi was killed and two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/08/2018: Assailants fired three rockets at Basra Airpor in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties or damages in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/08/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Baga, Borno, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/08/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mosharrof Hossain, a union parishad chair, in Krishnanagar Bazar, Dhaka, Bangladesh. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/08/2018: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices in Tamar, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, though sources speculated the explosives were planted to target security forces.

09/08/2018: Assailants set fire to primary schools and teacher housing units in Tankoualou, Komandjoari, Est, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) and Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

summary: 09/00/2018: Sometime between September 1, 2018 and September 15, 2018, assailants abducted 100 Wa Christians from the Kachin Baptist Convention (KBC) in Mong Pauk district Shan, Myanmar. The hostages were released on October 5, 2018. This was one of two coordinated kidnappings targeting Christian civilians in Shan state in early September. The United Wa State Army claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the abduction was carried out in order to keep Christians from forcibly converting locals.

09/00/2018: Sometime between September 1, 2018 and September 15, 2018, assailants abducted 92 Lahu Christians from the Lahu Baptist Convention in Keng Tung, Shan, Myanmar. The hostages were released on October 10, 2018. This was one of two coordinated kidnappings targeting Christian civilians in Shan state in early September. The United Wa State Army claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the abduction was carried out in order to keep Christians from forcibly converting locals.

09/00/2018: Sometime between September 1, 2018 and September 15, 2018, assailants destroyed a church in Mong Pauk district, Shan, Myanmar. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of three similar attacks on churches in Shan state in early September. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the United Wa State Army.

summary: 09/09/2018: Assailants abducted an International Organization for Migration (IOM) staff member in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle targeting a procession of civilians commemorating the death of Ahmad Shah Massoud in Taimani, Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least seven people were killed and 24 people were injured in the blast. This was one of two related suicide bombings in Kabul on this date. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 09/09/2018: Security forces identified and killed a suicide bomber wearing an explosive vest who was attempting to target civilians commemorating the death of Ahmad Shah Massoud in the 10th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. No other casualties were reported. This was one of two related suicide bombings in Kabul on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked an army base in Mangal, Baghlan, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in the district on this date. At least 20 security personnel were killed and five were injured across the attacks. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number police and military checkposts in Baghlani Jadid, Baghlan, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks in the district on this date. At least 20 security personnel were killed and five were injured across the attacks. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked the district center and the police headquarters in Day Mirdad district, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel, including the police chief, and 52 assailants were killed while 65 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked Khamyab district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least seven assailants and eight police officers were killed and 11 people, including eight assailants and three police personnel, were injured in the attack. In addition, seven security personnel were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden motorcycle outside a police station in Datu Odin Sinsua, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) was involved in the attack.

09/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an oil pipeline in Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting personnel responding to an earlier blast at an oil pipeline in Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least four responders were injured in the blast. This was one of two coordinated attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/09/2018: Assailants attacked a security checkpoint in Ab Kamari district, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least 12 assailants and one police officer were killed and 17 others, including 16 assailants and one police officer, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/09/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Al-Shalaq, North Sinai, Egypt. At least two security personnel were killed and four others were injured in the blast. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 09/09/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device near the Sukma-Konta national highway in Sukma district, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Maoists.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of the Assistant Divisional Officer in Oku, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of three related incidents to take place in Oku on this day. Across the three attacks, a gendarmerie van was stolen and three police officers were abducted. The outcome of the abductions is unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked the Oku gendarmerie brigade in Oku, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of three related incidents to take place in Oku on this day. Across the three attacks, a gendarmerie van was stolen and three police officers were abducted. The outcome of the abductions is unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked a special branch police station in Oku, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of three related incidents to take place in Oku on this day. Across the three attacks, a gendarmerie van was stolen and three police officers were abducted. The outcome of the abductions is unknown at this time. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on an police station in Minab, Hormozgan, Iran. At least three police officers were killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: An incendiary device detonated at a motorcycle shop in Ban Na, Songkhla, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Ban Na on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/09/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting administrative officials and defense volunteers responding to an earlier attack in Ban Na, Songkhla, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Ban Na on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/09/2018: Assailants attacked Char Tut, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least nine security personnel were killed and five people were injured in the attack. One police officer was abducted and was killed later the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpost in Farah, Afghanistan. Four police officers were killed and five police officers were abducted in the ensuing clash. The fate of the hostages is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/09/2018: Assailants abducted four Kurdish individuals, including Peshmerga members and civilians, from Youssef Bek, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. The hostages were beheaded later the same day. 09/10/2018: Assailants abducted six suspected police informers in Kurnapally, Telangana, India. The assailants beat up all six hostages and released them a short time later. At least one hostage died from his injuries and the other five were injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist).

09/09/2018: An explosive device hidden under a cart detonated at a vegetable market in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. Three people were injured, including two civilians and a tax collector. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkposts in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 39 assailants 17 security personnel were killed and 14 assailants and 3 security personnel were injured in the attack. In addition, an unknown number of security forces were abducted; their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2018: Assailants armed with rocket-propelled grenades and firearms attacked a security checkpost in Bandar, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of six coordinated attacks in Bandar on this date. At least 10 assailants and 13 security personnel were killed and 20 security personnel were injured across the attacks. The victims included police officers and soldiers. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Khamarabad, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least two assailants and one police officer were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/10/2018: Assailants fired a mortar at a civilian residence in Yakhchal, Helmand, Afghanistan. Six civilians were killed and six were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Colonel Abu-Muhtam in Haswah, Adan, Yemen. Abu-Muhtam, the Security Belt's 4th Battalion commander, was not harmed but an unknown number of security personnel were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack separately to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) and the Adan-Abyan Province of the Islamic State.
09/10/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the attempted attack.

09/10/2018: Six assailants, including suicide bombers, attacked the National Oil Company headquarters in Dahra, Tripoli, Libya. In addition to two assailants, two people were killed and ten people and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the attack. Additionally, an unknown number of people were briefly held hostage during the attack. The Tripoli Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated the attack was intended to harm the "economic interests of oppressing governments funding crusaders."

summary: 09/10/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting the district headquarters in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. In addition to the assailant, at least six people were killed and 16 people were injured in the blast. The victims included police officers and civilians. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Abdul Ahmad Ganai, a teacher, in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was targeted for being an intelligence agent.

09/10/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Tulul al-Safa, As Suwayda, Syria. The East Asia Division of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also attributed the incideny to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) and Ansar Al-Khilafa (Philippines).
gname: East Asia Division of the Islamic State

summary: 09/16/2018: Assailant set fire to a vehicle and hedges at the residence of an Indian family in Borkwood Park, Orpington, England, United Kingdom. At least twelve people, including six soldiers and six civilians, were killed in the assault. This was one of three similar attacks in Ituri on the same day. At least eight people were injured and 31 people were abducted across all three incidents. At least 30 hostages were released the same day while the fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.

At least eight people were injured and 31 people were abducted across all three incidents. At least 30 hostages were released the same day while the fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attacks.
