09/20/2018: Assailants threw incendiary devices at a Turkish association in Reuterstrasse, Neukolln, Berlin, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/20/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel in Spin Wam, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Five soldiers were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) and Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/19/2018: Assailants set fire to two backhoes and a pay loader of a quarry operator in Cawitan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the negative environmental impact of the quarry's activities.
09/20/2018: An explosive device detonated in Talataye, Gao, Mali. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/21/2018: Assailants attacked Rughenda military camp near Butembo Airport, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least two civilians were killed in the ensuing clash. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Mayi Mayi.

09/21/2018: An explosive device detonated in Koh Sayad, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least eight children were killed and four other children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Security Belt checkpoint in Lawdar district, Abyan, Yemen. At least two soldiers were killed and two soldiers were abducted in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

09/20/2018: An explosive device detonated at a power transmission tower in Sija, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/21/2018: Assailants abducted Firdous Ahmad Kuchey from his residence in Bata Gund, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Kuchey, a police officer, was shot and killed later on the same day. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Shopian district on the same date. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the attacks. Authorities also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/21/2018: Assailants abducted Kuldeep Singh from his residence in Bata Gund, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Singh, a police officer, was killed later on the same day. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Shopian on the same date. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the attacks. Authorities also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/21/2018: Assailants abducted Nisar Ahmad Dhobi from his residence in Kapren, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Dhobi, a police officer, was killed later on the same day. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Shopian on the same date. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the attacks. Authorities also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/21/2018: Assailants abducted Fayaz Ahmad Bhat from his residence in Kapren, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Bhat, the brother of a police officer, was released later on the same day. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Shopian on the same date. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the attacks. Authorities also attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

09/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on a convoy of trucks on the Maku bridge in Manipur, India. One driver was abducted while two others were injured. The whereabouts of the hostage are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Khaplang (NSCN-K).

09/21/2018: Assailants threw a pipe bomb at a military base in Beit El, West Bank. There were no reported casualties as the device failed to detonate. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a border police vehicle in Satya, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/21/2018: Assailants set fire to a Panchayat Ghar in Yaripora, Kulgam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/21/2018: Assailants abducted Muzaffar Khaliq, a People's Democratic Party (PDP) worker in Malangpora, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Khaliq was released after he announced is resignation from the PDP on a social media video. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mario Leonel Gomez Sanchez, a reporter for El Heraldo de Chiapas, in Yajalon, Chiapas, Mexico. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on an unknown number of security checkpoints in Jawand district, Badghis, Afghanistan. Six people, including three security personnel and three assailants, were killed and two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/21/2018: Explosive devices detonated targeting a bridge between Bamenda, Bui, and Donga, North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the attack but the bridge was destroyed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

09/21/2018: Security forces identified and killed assailants attempting to plant explosive devices to target a bridge in Mbiame, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to separatists.

09/21/2018: An explosive device detonated near a joint District Reserve Guard (DRG) and Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (COBRA) patrol in Gangaloor, Chhattisgarh, India. At least one DRG officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

09/21/2018: Assailants attacked African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) and United States soldiers about 50 km northwest of Juba in Lower Juba, Somalia. At least 20 assailants were killed in the ensuing clashes. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of Mayor Abu al Khasib in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/21/2018: Assailants armed with bats attacked Eleonora Forenza, a member of the European Parliament, and antifascist protesters in Bari, Apulia, Italy. Four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to CasaPound.

09/21/2018: Assailants abducted journalist Aaz Al Tadamn in Idlib, Syria. Al Tadamn was interrogated in a makeshift prison before being released on September 24, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Furqa 23.

09/22/2018: Five assailants opened fire on a military parade in Ahvaz, Khuzestan, Iran. In addition to five assailants, 25 people were killed and at least 60 others were injured in the attack. The Arab Liberation of Al-Ahvaz, Patriotic Arab Democratic Movement, and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/22/2018: Assailants launched a missile at King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Airport in Jazan, Saudi Arabia. The missile was intercepted by Arab coalition air defense forces; no casualties were reported. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/22/2018: Assailants armed with firearms, machetes, axes, and knives attacked residents and soldiers in Rwenzori, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 24 people, including soldiers and civilians, were killed and at least 21 other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

09/22/2018: Assailants abducted Mushtaq Ahmed Mir, a civilian, from his residence in Harwan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Mir, a laborer, was killed and his body was discovered on September 24, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/22/2018: An explosive device fitted to the vehicle of Yahya Sheikh Amir, a university professor, detonated in Dabka, Mogadishu, Somalia. Amir's brother was killed and one other person was injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/22/2018: An explosive device attached to a civilian vehicle detonated in Waberi, Mogadishu, Banaadir, Somalia. No casualties were reported in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in Mogadishu on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/22/2018: Assailants abducted Benjamin Ubaid in Latih, Sulu, Philippines. Ubaid, a teacher, was released on September 24, 2018. The Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded a ransom in exchange for Shariff Benjamin Asamli Ubaid.

09/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on two village chiefs in Kidal, Mali. The two chiefs, identified as Mohamed Ag Eljamet and Saida Ould Cheik, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mario Callejo in Gualsic, Pangasinan, Philippines. Callejo, a village councilperson and the father of Mayor Jojo Callejo, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/22/2018: An explosive device detonated in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. One civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on Oleh (Oleg) Mykhailyk near his residence in Odesa, Ukraine. Mykhailyk, a Syla Lyudey (Power of the People) activist, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/22/2018: Security forces identified and killed two assailants, including a suicide bomber, who were attempting to carry out an attack in Mamond, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).

09/22/2018: An assailant attempted to throw two hand grenades at a convoy commemorating Shiite Muslim holy Day of Ashura in Biya, Rasheed, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack and the assailant was arrested. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two coca eradicators, identified as Hover Alexander Orrego and Edixon Panche Noscue, in El Dovio, Valle del Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

09/23/2018: Assailants abducted six people from a vehicle in Lubero, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Mayi Mayi.
09/22/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Qoryoley district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. The outcome of the attack is unknown. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Toqi, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and four officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: An explosive device detonated in the 2nd police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related explosions in the area on this date. One police officer was injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/23/2018: Two explosive devices detonated targeting security personnel responding to an earlier blast in the 2nd police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related explosions in Kandahar on this date. One police officer was injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

09/23/2018: Assailants abducted three Inata gold mine workers near Djibo, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. One hostage was killed on June 19, 2019, while the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) and Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 09/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint near Gadoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian in Raymah, Yemen. The fate of the hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
09/23/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Dih Sabz district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants set fire to an eighteenth century church in Joensuu, North Karelia, Finland. There were no casualties in the attack, but the church was destroyed in the attack. An unidentified individual was arrested and claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants stopped two vehicles transporting Kidari Sarveswara Rao and Sivari Soma, in Thottangi, Andhra Pradesh, India. Soma, a former Telugu Desam Party Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA), and Rao, a current Telugu Desam Party Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA), were abducted, questioned, and killed in the assault. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/23/2018: An assailant shot and killed Rodolfo C. Yucaran, a Civilian Armed Auxiliary (CAA) member, in Tacpao, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Mayor Ismail abdul Wahed in Athba, Nineveh, Iraq. The mayor was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 09/23/2018: Assailants stopped and opened fire on the vehicle of Samir Kumar near Chandwara, Bihar, India. At least two people, including Kumar, a former Muzaffarpur mayor, and his driver, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
09/23/2018: Assailants shot and killed Ramzi Sagheer, an Education Ministry official, in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/23/2018: Assailants opened fire at a security checkpoint in Tarim, Hadramawt, Yemen. A security commander was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Qahira, Adhamiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. Three people were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 09/23/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely while being planted near Himreen, Diyala, Iraq. An assailant was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 09/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on a peace committee camp in Dashat i Goran, Balochistan, Pakistan. Three Peace Committee members were killed in the attack. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting peace committee members responding to an earlier attack in Dashat i Goran, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two peace committee members were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Mariam Uy Acob, a paralegal volunteer of the Kawagib Moro Human Rights, in Tukanalipao, Maguindanao, Philippines. Acob was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Kekeno, Borno, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

09/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Tagab district, Kapisa, Afghanistan. One Afghan Local Police (ALP) officer was killed and a second officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Shaykh 'Ali al-Qadi in Shamasi, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Qadi, a preacher and Yemen Scholars Association member, was not present at the residence and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/23/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Qoryoley district, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. One civilian was killed and three people, including two soldiers and a civilian, were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants attacked a military camp in Taksile, Lamu, Kenya. At least ten assailants were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed Hassan Alin, a formal electoral delegate, in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks on former electoral delegates in the area on this day. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed Aminow Mayow, a formal electoral delegate, in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks on former electoral delegates in the area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on Puntland Presidential Guard soldiers in Bosaso, Bari, Somalia. One soldier and one assailant were killed and two people were injured in the assault. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also suspected the involvement of Al-Shabaab.

09/25/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a security checkpoint in Afgoye, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. One soldier was killed and at least two police officers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
09/24/2018: An explosive device detonated outside of a shop in Imphal, Manipur, India. Seven people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants raided the village of Oicha, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least one person was killed, 17 people were abducted, and four houses were burned down. Two of the hostages were released on February 2, 2019 and another hostage was released on March 19, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

09/24/2018: Assailants attacked a military position in Bule, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 6 people, including two soldiers and four civilians, were killed in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Ituri on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: Assailants attacked a fishing camp in Tagba, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No casualties were reported in the attack. This was one of two attacks in Ituri on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

09/24/2018: An explosive device detonated in Qadis district, Badghis, Afghanistan. Two children were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

09/24/2018: Assailants damaged several areas of a railway line between Duisburg and the Dusseldorf Airport, North-Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. There were no reported casualties in the attack. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in order to demonstrate against deportations from Dusseldorf Airport.
09/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Levies official providing security for a polio vaccination team in Badan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

09/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military convoy escorting internally displaced persons (IDPs) between Wau and Mboro Payam in Busalia district, Wau, South Sudan. At least one soldier was killed and six soldiers were injured in the attack. The Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO) claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/01/2018: A roadside bomb detonated in Tuwayliah, Kirkuk, Iraq. Two civilians were killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Eric Jean Baptiste in Carrefour-Feuilles, Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Haiti. Baptiste, the secretary general of the Rally of Progressive National Democrats (RPND) and former presidential candidate, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Savane Pistache gang.

10/01/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Naik Mohammad Sherzad detonated in Maymana, Faryab, Afghanistan. Sherzad, the commander of the governor's security guards, was killed and four other guards were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ethiopian refugees in Santos, Bari, Somalia. Four people were killed in the attack. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked pro-government militia members in Qara Hindi, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least six people, including four assailants and two militia members, were killed and three militia members were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/01/2018: Gunmen attacked border police officers in Ban Manang Panyang, Narathiwat, Thailand. Three officers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/01/2018: Assailants attacked gendarmerie personnel in Lanfiera, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. Three gendarmes were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants threw grenades targeting the Doctors Without Borders headquarters in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants attacked civilians between Cadale and Adan Yabaal in Middle Shebelle, Somalia. Two people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/01/2018: Four assailants opened fire on Thawil Sae-ham near Pho Ming, Pattani, Thailand. Sae-ham, a school director, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

10/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on security guards of Wolesi Jirga candidate, Bilal Sarwari, in Khas Kunar district, Kunar, Afghanistan. Two security guards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian motorcycle in Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants set fire to four trucks at San Juan farm in Lautaro, Cautin, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities identified the assailant as Daniel Canio Tralcal, a Mapuche activist, in connection with the incident.
10/01/2018: An assailants shot and killed Nilo Dahili, a barangay councilperson, in Lomogom, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces post in Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Diyala on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/01/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces post in Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Diyala on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Khwaja Sabz Posh district, Faryab, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/01/2018: Assailants raided a civilian residence in Mejmaja, Jendouba, Tunisia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, though sources noted that the assailants were looking to extort food and money from the victims.

10/02/2018: A suicide bomber detonated targeting an election rally for candidate Abdul Nasir Mohmmand in Sangar Saray, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 18 people were killed and 47 people were injured in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 10/02/2018: Assailants attacked police checkposts in Khwajah Sabz Posh, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least two security officers and six assailants were killed and two uprising members and ten assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Additionally, one security officer was abducted in the attack. The fate of the hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/02/2018: Assailants abducted Ahmed Hamid Ubeid, a village chief, from Zabra, Kirkuk, Iraq. The victim was killed and his body was discovered later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/02/2018: Assailants abducted Mohammed Abdullah al-Shujainah in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Al-Shujainah, an Islamic Reform Group (Islah) party director, was killed and his body was discovered later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants opened fire and a suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle targeting a police checkpoint in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least three security officers were killed and six police officers were injured in the attack. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants raided houses and attempted to abduct residents in Limbe, South-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

10/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Pakistani border post in North Waziristan district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Seven assailants were killed and 11 people, including eight soldiers and three assailants were injured as security forces responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on the home of Jose Rey Bongcawel in San Isidro, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Bongcawel, barangay kagawad of San Isidro, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated in Hayatabad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two people, including a Frontier Corps (FC) soldier and a civilian, were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) convoy in Pirandar, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least three FC members were killed and eight others were injured in the blast. The Baloch Liberation Front (BLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Tump, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian in Khawkhah district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least one person was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
10/02/2018: Assailants shot and injured a Fulani civilian in Riyom, Plateau, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Berom Militants.
10/02/2018: Assailants attacked a fishing vessel near the port of Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants set fire to forestry machinery at Oyama farm in Lautaro, Cautin, Araucania, Chile. At least 10 pieces of equipment, including four logging trucks owned by Sotracer, two front loaders, two people transport vans, and two towers to move logs owned by an Antumapu contractor, were damaged and one assailant was injured in a clash with police officers responding to the site. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/02/2018: Assailants extorted civilians in Nabundas, Maguindanao, Philippines. Soldiers responded to the village, leading to a firefight in which four assailants were killed and two other assailants were injured. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicle in Nasro Qala, Parwan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants attacked the house of Bobby Calo in Nasipit, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Calo, a business owner, was not harmed, but weapons were stolen during the raid. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Bobby Calo was targeted because of his ill treatment of employees.

10/02/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at Mitiga International Airport in Tripoli, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Movement of the youth in Tripoli claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "Kara does not care for the airport or the civilians. Kara only cares about his status. We tell him that he will not enjoy the airport because we will make him go out with his tail between his legs. Mitiga Airport will belong to all Libyans and will not be controlled by militias or any other force with foreign ideologies or agendas."
gname: Movement of the youth in Tripoli

summary: 10/02/2018: Assailants set fire to a Radisson Hotel used as refugee housing at Victoria Park Avenue and Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Mir Ahmad in Loymanda, Helmand, Afghanistan. Ahmad, the acting head of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) for Nad Ali district, was killed in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants attacked police personnel in Shamli, Uttar Pradesh, India. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The Khalistan Liberation Force claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/02/2018: Assailants set fire to a Mozambique Democratic Movement (MDM) office in Bilene Macia, Gaza, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on a minibus transporting khat in Ilbaq, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. In addition, two civilians were taken hostage. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

10/02/2018: Assailants abducted Ahmad al-'Uraybi, the former mayor of Benghazi, along with his son Ali Ahmad al-‘Uraybi in Benghazi, Libya. Uraybi's son was released on November 18, 2018 and the fate of the mayor remains unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Tariq Bin Ziyad militia.
10/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of a cleric in Ablah, Basra, Iraq. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/03/2018: Assailants abducted Tawseef Ahmed Ganie, a civilian, from Unisoo, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The victim was shot and killed and his body was discovered on October 6, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).
10/03/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted near a civilian residence in Kirkuk city, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Asra Wal Mafqudin, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least three civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
10/03/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a power plant in Domiz, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed two explosives-laden vehicles at an unknown location in the Hamreen Mountains, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a traffic police checkpost in Karachi, Pakistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms and rocket launchers attacked Ab Kamari district in Badghis, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the assault, killing nine assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of a former jihadi commander in Dwalat Abad, Samangan, Afghanistan. Three civilians, including two children, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants attacked police checkposts in Bala Buluk district, Farah, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie post at the Inata gold mine in Inata, Sahel, Burkina Faso. At least one officer was killed and another officer was injured in the assault. Additionally, three officers were reported missing. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

10/03/2018: Assailants abducted a student between Bheji and Konta, Dantewada, Chhattisgarh, India. The student was released on October 4, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist).

10/03/2018: Two assailants opened fire on Sergio Martinez Gonzalez in a restaurant in Cacahoatan, Chiapas, Mexico. Martinez, the editor of Enfoque Weekly newspaper, was killed and his wife was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Chakhansur district, Nimroz, Afghanistan. At least eight people, including six police personnel and two assailants, were killed and at least two police personnel were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade targeting the residence of Haji Mohammad Hashim, a Wolesi Jirga member seeking reelection, in northwest Faryab, Afghanistan. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police convoy in Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two people, including a police officer and a civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpoint in Balghi, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including eight ALP personnel and four assailants, were killed and eight police officers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers patrolling in Feriana district, Kasserine, Tunisia. Two soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the attack. Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked civilians in Miango, Plateau, Nigeria. At least 19 civilians were killed and four were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
10/03/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Wangjing, Manipur, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants set fire to crops belonging to Ghulam Mohammed Khan, a Bharatiya Janata Party candidate, in Verinag, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed Barat Ali, a member of the Hazara community, along Spinny road in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a hujra in Malik Abad, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two civilians, an imam and a student, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants abducted 15 people, including teachers and medical workers, in Nduga, Papua, Indonesia. The hostages were released on October 17, 2018 and at least one woman was injured in the attack. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants abducted Cristo Jose Contreras, the five-year old son of the El Carmen mayor, in Guamalito, Marinilla, Antioquia, Colombia. Contreras was released on October 9, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN) may have been involved in the attack.

10/03/2018: Assailants attacked the vehicle of Nisar Chudisaz, an independent candidate, with petrol bombs outside of his house in Rainawari, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: Assailants attacked and injured a Free and Fair Election Foundation of Afghanistan (FEFA) official in an unknown location in Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: An explosive device detonated near a civilian vehicle between Topzawa and Ali Sarai in Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/03/2018: An explosive device detonated south of Daquq, Daquq district, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/03/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated targeting a police vehicle in Corinto, Cauca, Colombia. Seven people, including civilians and police personnel, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents. Sources also suspected the involvement of the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 10/00/2018: Sometime between September 17, 2018 and October 17, 2018, assailants publicly beat a civilian in Toguere-Koumbe, Mopti, Mali. The civilian was injured in the attack. Muslim extremists claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and four were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/03/2018: Assailants attacked an army convoy in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy near Gercus, Batman, Turkey. Seven soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

10/04/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated targeting a water project site in Gharib, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/04/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device planted Koti Sangi, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/04/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device attached to a vehicle in Paghman district, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Maulana Ismail Darvesh, an Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ) leader, in Phandu Chowk, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Darvesh and a police officer serving as his guard were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians at a teahouse in Phithaen, Thung Yang Daeng, Pattani, Thailand. Two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: Two assailants opened fire on Ely Arciaga Ramos outside his residence in Poblacion East, Pangasinan, Philippines. Ramos, a Santo Tomas town councilor and mayoral candidate, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated against a military vehicle in Bartiebougou, Est, Burkina Faso. At least six soldiers were killed and two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) and Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Dakht, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least two people were killed and 16 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated inside a meeting room at a People's Protection office in Khogyani district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. At least two staff members were killed and seven were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 10/04/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in the 5th police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicles in Helmand, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two attacks in the area on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicles in Helmand, Afghanistan. At least one United States soldier, identified as James A. Slape, was killed in the blast. In addition, four other explosive devices were discovered and defused at the scene. This was one of two attacks in the area on the same day. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/04/2018: Assailants attacked Nkiendoro, Bassa local government, Plateau state, Nigeria. At least four people, including a soldier and a police officer, were killed and an unknown number of others wounded in the attack. Additionally, two churches and civilian properties were set ablaze in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

10/04/2018: Assailants abducted Bebi Madavi, a civilian, from Irpanar, Bhamragarh, Maharashtra, India. Madavi was killed and her body was discovered on October 6, 2018. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Bebi Madavi was a police informant.

10/04/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated two explosive devices in Cherla, Telangana, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated in Qaim, Al Anbar, Iraq. One civilian was killed and one civilian was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/03/2018: Assailants set fire to the residence of Showkat Raja, a Bharatiya Janata Party candidate, in Gojwara, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: Assailants fired mortars targeting a military camp in Litri, Mamdi, Lac, Chad. One soldier was killed in the attack. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Yemeni army vehicle in Juraybat, Al Bayda , Yemen. An unknown number of soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: Assailants attacked police posts in Khogyani, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Maruf district on this date. At least 10 assailants and one police officer were killed and 19 people, including eight assailants, three police officers, and eight civilians, were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/04/2018: Assailants attacked police posts in Ishaqzai, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Maruf district on this date. At least 10 assailants and one police officer was killed and 19 people, including eight assailants, three police officers, and eight civilians, were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/04/2018: Assailants destroyed a five-kilometer segment of the Ghazni-Paktika highway in Arzo, Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on National Conference (NC) workers in Qarfali Mohalla, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two workers were killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Hizbul Mujahideen (HM). Sources also suspected the involvement of the Bharatiya Janata Party, which the group denied.

10/05/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) headquarters in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CRPF officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Wajdan Harban in Dali, Ad Dali, Yemen. Harban, a Popular Resistance Committee member, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Zaki al-Saqladi in Ash Shuayb district, Ad Dali, Yemen. Al-Saqladi, an Al-Masdar Online journalist and Islamic Reform Group (Islah) party leader, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants shelled Beni Jaber refugee camp in Al-Khawkhah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least one person was killed and three people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

10/05/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Nasir Ahmad Haqmal detonated in Mujahid Square, Khost, Afghanistan. Haqmal, a parliamentary candidate, was not harmed, but at least one of his bodyguards was killed and five people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police convoy in Solle, Loroum, Nord, Burkina Faso. At least six police officers were killed and five officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) and Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 10/05/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at the residence of Irshad Ahmad Wani, a local Indian National Congress candidate, in Hajan, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/04/2018: Assailants attacked an army post in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least six people, including four soldiers and two civilians, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) was involved in the attack.

10/05/2018: A grenade attached to the vehicle of Supatthanachai Makprasit detonated in Muang Klang, Ranong, Thailand. Makprasit, a Ranger, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/05/2018: A landmine detonated in Benghazi, Libya. One person, identified as Ramzi Mohammed al-Baraki, was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/05/2018: Assailants shot and killed Civilian Armed Auxiliary member Lando Soreno in Trinidad, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Dost Mohammad, a parliamentary candidate, in Lashkar Gah, Helmand, Afghanistan. One person was killed and three people, including Mohammad, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants armed with mortars and machine guns attacked Oicha, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties but several residences were looted in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

10/05/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked and beat up a People’s Democratic Party (PDP) primary election electoral officer at the Ethiope-East Local Government Council building in Ethiope East, Delta, Nigeria. Aside from the injured PDP electoral officer, there were no other reported casualties in the ensuing clash with police officers, but a police van was set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/05/2018: An explosive device detonated at an intersection in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu, Somalia. The outcome of the blast is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire outside the home of Arif Kaka in Darra Adam Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Kaka, a former Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) commander, was killed and another person was injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/05/2018: Assailants attacked a town in search of a National Liberation Front (NLF) leader in Kafr Halab, Aleppo, Syria. At least three people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

10/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of a police officer in Ghazaliya, Baghdad, Iraq. The police officer's wife was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked border police outposts in Dand Patan district, Paktia, Afghanistan. At least two officers were killed and two other officers were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, at least 12 assailants were either killed or injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked police outposts in Burka district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked Waghaz district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/09/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least two security personnel were injured in the incident. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked Arabia Boys Secondary School in Arabia, Lafey sub-county, Mandera, Kenya. Police officers serving as security guards tried to stop the assailants but were overpowered and three teachers were killed. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/10/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were planting it in Paktia, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at a petrol station in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. At least one person was killed and four people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 10/10/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/09/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an improvised explosive device in a water container along the national highway in Tamontaka, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked Iraqi Volunteer Forces in Kashaf, Arbil, Iraq. An unknown number of assailants and IVF personnel were killed and injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 10/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Brigadier General Misfir al-Harithi in Shabwah, Yemen. Al-Harithi, the head of the monitoring and inspection department in the Yemeni Defense Ministry, was unharmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants stabbed and killed Wenceslao Caumban Jr., a farmer, in Tikalaan, Bukidnon, Philippines. This was one of two related attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

10/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on police personnel responding to an earlier attack in Tikalaan, Bukidnon, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related attacks on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

10/10/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Kaiga Kindji, Mamdi, Lac, Chad. In addition to 48 assailants, eight soldiers were killed and 11 soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. It is unknown whether there were any other assailant casualties. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in As Susah, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 28 people, including ten SDF members and 18 assailants, were killed and 25 other SDF members were abducted in the assault. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/09/2018: Assailants abducted six people from between Sabha and Fuqaha, Libya. One hostage was killed in clashes with security forces and four of the hostages were found alive on or before October 17, 2018. The fate of the remaining hostage is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants opened fire on buses transporting journalists and engineers to a hydroelectric dam in northern Colombia. Two assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 10/10/2018: Assailants hijacked at least three police vehicles in Tawurgha, Misrata, Libya. At least one assailant was killed, two police officers were injured, and six officers were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at a passenger bus in Sajapur, Rajshahi, Bangladesh. Two civilians were injured and the bus was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and Jamaat-E-Islami (Bangladesh).

10/10/2018: Three assailants armed with grenades and firearms attacked the residence of Balochistan National Party (BNP) leader Akhtar Mengal in Wadh, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants stabbed and killed Rexan Brital, a tribal leader, in San Miguel, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
10/10/2018: Assailants shot and killed Ronnie Ramos Valiente, a village chief, in Poblacion 4, Siaton, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants threw a grenade into the residence of Serhiy Mazur in Boryspil, Kyiv, Ukraine. Mazur, a C14 coordinator and the assistant of Verkhovna Rada deputy Ihor Lutsenko, was not harmed; however, his father was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/10/2018: An explosive device detonated at the office of Mohammad Anwar Bashliq, a parliamentary candidate, in Qorghan, Faryab, Afghanistan. Bashliq was not at the office at the time of the attack, but one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/10/2018: Assailants abducted a school guard and detonated explosive devices at Fatthabad Girl's School in Surkh Rod district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. The guard was released a short time later and there were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/10/2018: A sniper shot and killed a Ukrainian soldier, identified as Olesya Baklanova, near Butivka coal mine in Donetsk, Ukraine. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/10/2018: Assailants set fire to a conveyor belt at a Societe Le Nickel (SLN) mining site in Kouaoua, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 10/13/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkpoints in Shahr-e Safa, Zabul, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were killed in the ensuing clash. The assailants also sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/14/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) outpost in Dara-i-Sufi Bala district, Samangan, Afghanistan. Three police officers and one assailant were killed and one assailant was injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/14/2018: Assailants armed with knuckle-dusters assaulted and wounded Herman Gomes, a Times Now journalist, and his friend in Gamdevi, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/14/2018: Assailants set fire to the campaign office of Khitab Durrani, a Wolesi Jirga candidate, in Puli Kandahar, Logar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/14/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a civilian residence in Husseinia, 9 Nissan, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/14/2018: Assailants attacked a group of miners in Bochinche, Bolivar, Venezuela. At least six miners shot and killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

10/15/2018: An assailant attempted to stab Israel Defense Forces (IDF) soldiers at bus stop in Ariel, West Bank. The soldiers responded to the attack, killing the assailant. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Elias Saleh Yassin, a Palestinian extremist.

10/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle between Maymana and Andkhoy districts in Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one civilian was killed and six were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Taliban was involved in the attack.
10/15/2018: Assailants attacked a residence in Qaim, Al Anbar, Iraq. One civilian was killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: An assailant set fire to a McDonald's restaurant in the main railway station in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. The assailant then went into an adjacent pharmacy, took a civilian hostage, and covered them in petrol. Police were able to free the hostage on site. Four people, including the assailant, were injured during the attack. An unaffiliated individual claimed responsibility for the incident and "demanded to be allowed to leave Germany for Islamic State in Syria."

10/15/2018: Assailants launched a rifle grenade and opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) 183rd battalion camp in Newa Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two CRPF officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of police posts in Zerki, Samangan, Afghanistan. At least 21 people, including seven police personnel and 14 assailants, were killed and at least 19 people, including three police personnel and 16 assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. The victims included the provincial National Directorate of Security (NDS) director. Additionally, at least 15 police officers were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: Assailants threw 40 petrol bombs at a police station in Omonia, Athens, Attica, Greece. At least four police officers were injured and several vehicles were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Tiali, Mopti, Mali. At least 11 people were killed and an unknown number of people were reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists were involved.

10/14/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkpoints in the 10th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar incidents in the city on this date. At least two people, including a police officer and an assailant, were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

10/14/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security checkpoints in the 12th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two similar incidents in the city on this date. At least two people, including a police officer and an assailant, were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked a Somali National Army (SNA) base in Daynunay, Bay, Somalia. At least eight assailants and one soldier were killed in the ensuing clash. The attack also resulted in an unknown number of injuries. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting railway tracks on the Up line near pole 326-15/17 between Chaudhribandh and Chengro in Giridih, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties, though the track was damaged in the blast. This was one of two related incidents to occur on these train tracks on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

10/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military checkpoint in Jowhar, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least one soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: Assailants fired a rocket at a bazaar in Yangi Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. At least 11 civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/15/2018: An explosive device detonated along the security fence in Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed and eight were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
10/15/2018: Assailants attacked soldiers in Kunduz, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked the district center in Sewri, Zabul, Afghanistan. Five police officers were killed and 10 were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

10/15/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of villages in Macina, Segou, Mali. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

10/15/2018: Assailants armed with firearms entered a water supply plant and forced workers to close the plant in Tarhouna, Murqub, Libya. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/15/2018: Assailants ambushed military personnel in Cristalina, Meta, Colombia. Two soldiers, identified as Jose Alexander Oino Guevara and Andres Felipe Cano Echavarria, were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 10/15/2018: Assailants set fire to an unknown number of houses belonging to National Uprising Movement (NUM) members in Gozare, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported. This was one of two similar attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

10/15/2018: Assailants set fire to an unknown number of houses belonging to National Uprising Movement (NUM) members in Taghaye Khwaja, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported. This was one of two similar attacks in the area on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Taliban.

10/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on Khayri Hankurah outside the Al-Mahari Hotel (Radisson Blu) in Zawiyat al-Dahmani, Tripoli, Libya. Hankurah, a senior Ministry of Interior leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/15/2018: Two explosive devices detonated near a Peshmerga residence in Hayy Yusuf Bayk, Diyala, Iraq. At least one Peshmerga member was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 10/00/2018: Sometime between October 1, 2018 and October 31, 2018, an explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol near Kumshe, Borno, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

10/00/2018: Sometime between October 1, 2018 and October 31, 2018, assailants physically assaulted Zeljko Matorcevic in Grocka, South Banat, Serbia. Matorcevic, a Zig Info editor, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/16/2018: An explosive device detonated in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Five children were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/16/2018: Assailants poisoned and abducted 12 security personnel in Mirjaveh, Sistan and Baluchestan, Iran. The hostages were taken into Pakistan. At least five hostages were released as of November 15, 2018 and four additional hostages were released on March 22, 2019. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. Jaish al-Adl claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to the repression of members of the Sunni Muslim community within Iran.

10/16/2018: Assailants set fire to a Roel Noel Gigi Mar Company road construction vehicle in Villa, Aurora, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

10/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers responding to an earlier incident in Villa, Aurora, Philippines. One police officer was killed and another was injured in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in this area on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the New People's Army (NPA).

10/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Iraqi Volunteer Fighters in Himreen, Diyala, Iraq. One volunteer fighter was killed and two were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the office of Parisa Shams Sadat, a female parliamentary candidate, in Zari district, Balkh, Afghanistan. Sadat was not harmed but three people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2018: Assailants set fire to a civilian residence along Leckagh Walk in Magherafelt, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Gran Tierra Energy oil pipeline in Porvenir, Villagarzon, Putumayo, Colombia. There were no reported casualties, though the pipeline was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2018: Assailants attacked the Government Bilingual High School Atiela and abducted six students in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. One student was injured and escaped; the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/19/2018: An explosive device detonated along a railway track near Hirak, Balochistan, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties, but the track was damaged in the blast. This was one of two coordinated bombings targeting this railway line on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

summary: 10/19/2018: Security forces identified and engaged three suicide bombers attempting to attack Rashad, Kirkuk, Iraq. Three assailants were killed in the blast and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 10/19/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mounir Okab al-Duleimi, an imam of a mosque, in Rutbah, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

This was one of 16 coordinated mail bomb attacks between October 22, 2018 and November 1, 2018 that targeted critics of President Donald Trump. Cesar Altieri Sayoc was arrested in connection with the incidents. Sources noted that Sayoc's vehicle was covered in right-wing paraphernalia.

This was one of two similar attacks in Deir ez-Zor on the same day. At least 92 people, including 68 SDF personnel and 24 assailants, were killed and 100 other SDF personnel and an unknown number of other assailants were injured across both assaults. Additionally, at least 20 SDF personnel were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

Bowers claimed responsibility before the attack on social media platform Gab, stating "I can't sit by and watch my people get slaughtered. Screw your optics, I'm going in." Sources also noted that Bowers shouted "all Jews must die" during the incident and that he had a history of anti-Semitic rhetoric on social media.

We decided to respond to the aggression and acted with will-power and determination. We will maintain the resistance and its stance—bombing will be answered with bombing and blood with blood. We will be committed to a cease-fire deal if Israel commits to it. The Palestinian resistance will respond to any Israeli attack."
