summary: 10/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in Alingar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. A Khassadar officer was killed in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the house of Abdul Razaq Wagey, a former Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) MLA in Zawoora, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an Ethiopian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Ceel Gaal, Hiiraan, Somalia. At least four soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Assailants attacked Hayes town in Al Hudaydah, Yemen. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

10/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Chardahi, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and three others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in Taji, Saladin, Iraq. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
10/29/2018: Assailants abducted Jesús María Rojas Prada, a civil engineer, in Saravena, Arauca, Colombia. Prada was rescued on October 30, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/29/2018: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused near Daulat Pur, Bihar, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Hinakpan, Negros Oriental, Philippines. One police officer was injured in the attack. This was one of two related incidents that took place in this area on this day. The New People’s Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Security forces identified and killed a suicide bomber, attempting to attack civilians on a road in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. There were no other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/29/2018: An explosive device detonated in front of a shop in Asadabad, Kunar, Afghanistan. At least nine people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
10/29/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed two explosive devices in Wad al-Ayn, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/29/2018: Security forces discovered and destroyed five explosive devices in Nuaimiya, Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Assailants attacked the district police chief in Farah, Afghanistan. The chief was injured and two other police officers were killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Assailants shot and killed Nur Kheyre Gutale, a former electoral delegate, at the Bakara market in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Nur Kheyre Gutale was targeted for participating in the selection of parliament members.

10/29/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated along Al-Azraq Road in western Bab, Aleppo, Syria. At least three people, including an Ahrar al-Sham leader Abu Abdelrahman, were killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/29/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Makhzoum, Al Hasakah, Syria. At least two Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the residence of Colonel 'Abduh Nu'man al-Zurayqi in At Turbah, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Zurayqi, a military commander, was unharmed as here were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/29/2018: Assailants attacked security outposts in Qaysar district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least two pro-government militia members were killed and four were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

10/29/2018: Assailants attacked police outposts in Fayzabad district, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban.

10/29/2018: Assailants armed with sharp weapons cut off the fingers of plantation workers in Tiko, South-West, Cameroon. At least seven people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

10/30/2018: Assailants attacked Dawud al-Alukah, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: Assailants attacked Hanani, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least two Iraqi Police Service (IPS) officers were injured in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of a the mayor in Khatoniya, Kirkuk, Iraq. It is unknown whether or not the mayor was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Shia-Kurdish pilgrims near the Iranian border in Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least two people were killed and 11 people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military vehicle in Memender, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and grenades ambushed Doordarshan journalists and police personnel in Aranpur, Chhattisgarh, India. Six people, including a cameraman, three police personnel and two assailants, were killed and two people were injured in the attack. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was intended to avenge civilians who had been mistreated by the police.

10/30/2018: Security forces discovered and defused at least eight explosive devices in Aranpur, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.

10/30/2018: Assailants attacked the University of Bamenda in Bambui, North-West, Cameroon. Security forces responded and four assailants were killed and two people, including a student and a soldier, were injured in the ensuing clash. In addition, an American missionary, identified as Charles Wesco, was killed in the crossfire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

10/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie brigade in Bambili, North-West, Cameroon. It is unknown if the attack resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.

10/30/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police picket outside of the house of Mohammad Shafi Banday, a former congress leader, in Bona Bazar, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/30/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Miran Shah, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants abducted Mohibullah Khattak, an accountant for the Frontier Corps (FC), in Lakki Marwat district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Balogo, Negros Oriental, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related incidents that took place in this area on this day. The New People’s Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: An explosive device detonated after a buffalo stepped on it in Balrampur, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two similar blasts in the same area on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected Maoists.

10/30/2018: An explosive device detonated in Balrampur, Chhattisgarh, India. A civilian identified as Budhan Yadav was killed in the blast. This was one of two similar blasts in the same area on this day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected Maoists.

10/30/2018: Police arrested six assailants who were on their way to plant landmines along a road in Cherla, Telangana, India. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI - Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Security forces identified and arrested an assailant planting an explosive device at an army member's house in Domiz, Kirkuk, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: Assailants entered a municipal office and set tires on fire while also harassing the security guards in Macassar, Western Cape, South Africa. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants threw firebombs at an Albanian travel office on Deligianni Street, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, authorities suspected that the attack was related to the police killing of a Greek civilian in Albania two days prior.

10/30/2018: An explosive device attached underneath the vehicle of Judge Fa’iz al-Ubaydi was discovered and defused in Jawlan, Fallujah, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
10/30/2018: Assailants fired four rockets landed and detonated in Nile, Babil, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: Assailants carried out an attack in Qarabagh district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Ghazni on this date. At least 37 assailants were killed across the five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/30/2018: Assailants carried out an attack in Dih Yak district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Ghazni on this date. At least 37 assailants were killed across the five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/30/2018: Assailants carried out an attack in Malistan district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Ghazni on this date. At least 37 assailants were killed across the five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/30/2018: Assailants carried out an attack in Ghazni city, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Ghazni on this date. At least 37 assailants were killed across the five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/30/2018: Assailants carried out an attack in an unknown district of Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of five coordinated incidents in Ghazni on this date. At least 37 assailants were killed across the five attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/30/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a Marine recruiting station along East Speedway Boulevard in Tucson, Arizona, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Tucson on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at an under-construction Starbucks along East Speedway Boulevard in Tucson, Arizona, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Tucson on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a Chase bank along East Speedway Boulevard in Tucson, Arizona, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Tucson on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at a Wells Fargo bank along North Wilmot road in Tucson, Arizona, United States. There were no reported casualties in the incident. This was one of four coordinated attacks in Tucson on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants abducted Kilian Wirngo, a Government Technical High School principal, in Jakiri, North-West, Cameroon. Wirngo was released on November 3, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive device after entering the Federal Security Bureau (FSB) office in Arkhangelsk, Russia. The assailant was killed and three people were injured in the blast. In a message prior to the attack, the assailant identified himself as an anarchist and stated that he targeted the Federal Security Bureau (FSB) because it "fakes cases and tortures people."

10/31/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive vest near a prison bus outside the northern gates of Puli Charkhi prison in Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, seven people were killed and eight others were injured. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 10/31/2018: Assailants opened fire on laborers at a construction site in Ganz, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least five laborers were killed and three were injured in the attack. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the workers were targeted to send a larger message that construction in the region without their consent is illegal.
10/31/2018: Assailants shot and killed four laborers constructing a road in Kharan district, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the vehicle of Colonel Taher Musad al-Aqla, an army commander, in Sanah, Ad Dali, Yemen. Al-Aqla's vehicle passed by unscathed but the device destroyed a police vehicle, killing four officers and injuring three. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Gwazari-Kofa, near Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. At least one person was killed in the incident. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Dalori IDP Camp II in Dalori, Borno, Nigeria. At least two people were killed in the incident. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents and set fire to buildings in Bulabulin, Borno, Nigeria. At least nine people, including an Islamic cleric and four family members, were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the assault. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Kofa, Borno, Nigeria. At least at least six people were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the assault. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Mallumti, near Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the incident. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Ngomari, near Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the incident. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Gozari, near Dalori, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the incident. This was one of seven attacks in Borno on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to Boko Haram.
10/31/2018: An explosive device detonated in Jalawla, Diyala, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/31/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol near Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. One police officer was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/31/2018: Assailants threw grenades at a police checkpost in Spin Kelai area, Kabul, Afghanistan. At least two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the Bawa Mahmoud shrine in Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. No casualties were reported, but the shrine was destroyed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
10/31/2018: An explosive device detonated in Kohlu, Balochistan, Pakistan. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/30/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a pro-government militia vehicle in Arjal, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least two militia members, including a local commander, were killed and five other members were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

10/29/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked the residence of Muhammad Jama'ah, the mayor of Al Jasimiyah, in Jasimiyah, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. The mayor was killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 10/30/2018: Assailants attacked Kundulan village in Khas Uruzgan district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks on villages in the area on this date. At least 40 people, including civilians and police officers, were killed and an unknown number of people were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants attacked Hussaini village in Khas Uruzgan district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. This was one of two attacks on villages in the area on this date. At least 40 people, including civilians and police officers, were killed and an unknown number of people were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

10/30/2018: Assailants attacked Sher Dagh village in Malistan, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least 11 soldiers an unknown number of civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

10/31/2018: Assailants abducted Moddi Gawde, a farmer and police volunteer, from Naranur, Maharashtra, India. Gawde was shot and killed later the same day. The Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was targeted for being a police informant.

10/31/2018: Assailants attacked Batangafo, Ouham, Central African Republic. At least 15 people were killed and 29 people were injured in the ensuing clash, which lasted until November 5, 2018. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: A letter bomb addressed to Tom Steyer, a Democratic donor, was discovered and defused at a mail sorting facility on Rollins Road in Burlingame, California, United States. This was one of 16 coordinated mail bomb attacks and one of two letter bombs addressed to Steyer between October 22, 2018 and November 1, 2018 that targeted critics of President Donald Trump. Cesar Altieri Sayoc was arrested in connection with the incidents. Sources noted that Sayoc's vehicle was covered in right-wing paraphernalia.

11/01/2018: Assailants armed with pistols shot and killed Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) State Secretary Anil Parihar and his brother, Ajeet Parihar, in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

11/01/2018: Assailants abducted six civilians from Kherbari, Assam, India. Five of the hostages were shot and killed while the sixth hostage escaped later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Paresh Barua subgroup of the United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA), which the group denied.
11/01/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Utthedu Gollagudem, Telangana, India. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/01/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device between Alubaka and Abbaigudem, Telangana, India. Maoists claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants set fire to at least five vehicles at Dunlop Motors car repair shop along Woodburn Road in Carrickfergus, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the South East Antrim Brigade and stated that the owner had previously been threatened by the group.

11/01/2018: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in the 1st police district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Six people, including police officers and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the convoy of Saladin governor Ammar Jabr Khalil al-Jabouri in Siniyah, Saladin, Iraq. Al-Jabouri was not harmed, though two bodyguards were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol west of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. One soldier was killed and seven others were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants fired projectiles at Syrian Army soldiers in Mazroui, Idlib, Syria. At least four soldiers and one assailant were killed in the ensuing clash. Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham claimed responsibility for the attack.
11/01/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated along Maka al-Mukarama road in Mogadishu, Somalia. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Tufanganj, West Bengal, India. At least one person was killed and another person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants shot and killed Roldan Mansamahan, a militia member, in Guinabsan, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/01/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of National Uprising Movement (NUM) members' houses in Shewa, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents. At least 10 assailants were killed and two NUM members were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of National Uprising Movement (NUM) posts in Shewa, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents. At least 10 assailants were killed and two NUM members were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

10/31/2018: An assailant armed with a knife stabbed Aleksey Mikerov along Privolnaya street in Moscow, Russia. Mikerov, the chief of staff Moscow's North-Western administrative district, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants armed with machetes and rifles attacked civilians and briefly held them hostage in Kombo Aliba, South Darfur, Sudan. At least 19 people were injured, including seven women who were sexually assaulted. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants abducted Hamid al-Qa'ud, a photojournalist, in Al Asbahi, Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/01/2018: Assailants attacked the Pul-i-Acha base between Shirin Tagab and Dawlatabad districts in Faryab, Afghanistan. At least seven people, including three officers and four assailants, were killed while 17 other officers were abducted in the attack. One officer was killed on November 4, 2018 and the fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and sharp weapons cut off the fingers of plantation workers in South-West, Cameroon. Four people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/01/2018: Assailants extorted money from residents in Malbang, Nueva Ecija, Philippines. Soldiers intervened, leading to a clash in which at least one soldier was injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that communists were involved in the attack.

11/01/2018: Assailants attacked a gathering of Syrian Arab Army and National Defense Force soldiers and Syrian Social Nationalist Party members in Al-Safa, Rif Dimashq, Syria. There were an unknown number of causalities in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an AsiaCell telecommunications vehicle transporting fuel in Msafa, Saladin, Iraq. Two civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated near a United Nations supply convoy in northern Mali. At least two civilian contractors were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Itmar bus in Al Bayda, Yemen. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspect the attack was carried out by Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/02/2018: An assailant entered Hot Yoga Tallahassee and opened fire in Tallahassee, Florida, United States. At least two people were killed and five other people were injured before the assailant killed himself. Authorities identified the assailant as Scott Paul Beierle, who was described as a misogynist that identified as an involuntary celibate.

11/02/2018: An assailant set fire to a closet inside Yeshiva Beth Hillel along Hawes Street in Brooklyn, New York City, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related arsons in Williamsburg on the same day. The assailant was arrested in connection with these and other incidents, including writing "Hitler," "Jews better be ready," and "Die Jew rats we are here" at Union Temple.

11/02/2018: An assailant set fires at an unknown number of Yeshivas and synagogues in Brooklyn, New York City, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related arsons in Williamsburg on the same day. The assailant was arrested in connection with these and other incidents, including writing "Hitler," "Jews better be ready," and "Die Jew rats we are here" at Union Temple.

11/02/2018: An explosive device detonated in Ash Shuqaq, southwest of Tal Afar, Nineveh, Iraq. Two people were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants abducted a Peshmerga fighter and a civilian, identified as Fahmi Salih Mustafa and Sarhan Muhammad Salih, in Tuqtuq, Dibis, Kirkuk, Iraq. The two hostages were released on November 16, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on buses carrying Coptic Christians traveling to St. Samuel the Confessor monastery in Minya, Egypt. Seven civilians were killed and 20 others were injured in the attack. The Islamic State in Egypt claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: An explosive device detonated near a Border Security Force (BSF) demining operation along Markanar Road in Koyalibeda, Chhattisgarh, India. At least two BSF soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/02/2018: Assailants armed with knives stabbed Maulana Samiul Haq at his residence in Rawalpindi, Islamabad Capital Territory, Pakistan. Haq, the head of the Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam Sami-ul-Haq (JUI-S) party was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Jar Quduq, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and 10 were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/02/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused along Shopian-Pulwama Road in Nikas, Jammu and Kashmir, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants fired a ballistic missile targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia that was intercepted in Saada, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants abducted Naresh Singh from Ahiyari, Bihar, India. Singh was shot and killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

11/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Abdullah Al Wasmi, a village chief, in Mahmudiya, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy in Bulobarde district, Hiiraan, Somalia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Gozari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of five related incidents in Borno on this day. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Ngomari, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of five related incidents in Borno on this day. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Alhaji Mallumti, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of five related incidents in Borno on this day. There were an unknown number of casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosives-laden vehicle in Akashat, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants abducted Kubum Martin, Principal of the Government High School Jiyane, from Oku, North-West, Cameroon. Martin was released on an unspecified date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/02/2018: Assailants attacked the Union Parishad office with a molotov cocktail in Saidabad, Rajshahi, Bangladesh. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near Syrian Army and Russian Armed Forces soldiers in Panorama, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 11 soldiers, including five Syrians and six Russians, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on Territorial Defense Volunteers (TDF) in Tanyong Dalo, Pattani, Thailand. Two rangers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Mohammad Abdullah Hamid Gul on the Islamabad Expressway in Islamabad, Pakistan. Gul, the son of former Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) retired chief Gen Hamid Gul, was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Muhoza Rugiza, the assistant chief intelligence officer for the National Intelligence Agency, in Tambi, Bashali Mokoto, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Rugiza and his wife were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed a taxi driver in Lanny Jaya, Papua, Indonesia. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the taxi driver was targeted because the group believed he was an intelligence agent.

11/01/2018: An explosive device detonated at an electrical power tower in Mahmudiyah, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one electricity maintenance worker, identified as Mohammed Ahmed, was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants fired a missile targeting Najran, Saudi Arabia. Security forces intercepted the missile; no casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed Javier Ancizar Fernández, a trade unionist and primary teacher of the Educational Institution Francisco Antonio Rada, in Suarez, Cauca, Colombia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated in Mashtal, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one person was killed and two other people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy in Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. At least three soldiers were killed and an unknown number of soldiers were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: An Afghan soldier opened fire on United States military personnel in Kabul, Afghanistan. One US soldier, identified as Major Brent Taylor, was killed and another US soldier was injured before the assailant was shot and killed by security forces. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked a Trabmenco road construction company site and set fire to a lorry in Sake, Masisi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Six people, including civilians and an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) soldier, were killed and five people were injured in the attack. This was one of two attacks in North Kivu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/03/2018: Assailants attacked Oicha, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. One person was killed and 15 people were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapped is unknown. This was one of two attacks in North Kivu on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/03/2018: Assailants attacked a joint military and police base in Nawa, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed, six were injured, and 20 were reported missing in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers in Datta Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeted a civilian vehicle in Udhaim, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. Two farmers were killed in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Udhaim on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting military personnel responding to an earlier attack in Udhaim, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. One soldier was killed in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in Udhaim on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: Assailants fired projectiles at Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in Jaaby, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/03/2018: Assailants armed with explosive devices attacked a power transmission line in Havice, Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/03/2018: Assailants abducted two civilians from Baddepara, Chhattisgarh, India. One of the hostages was released and the second hostage, identified as Aaytu Hemla, was killed on or before November 6, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist), noting that Hemla was accused of being a police informant.

11/03/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes cut off the fingers of Cameroon Development Corporation (CDC) workers in Tiko, South-West, Cameroon. Six people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a hardware shop in Kwakeithel, Imphal, Manipur, India. There were no casualties, but the store was damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: Assailants attacked military outposts in Yaka Tut, Faryab, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and three others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/03/2018: An explosive device detonated near shops in the Kangpokpi bazaar in Kangpokpi, Manipur, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: Assailants set fire to construction equipment at a construction company camp in Ekilsara, Hazaribagh, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
11/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations convoy near Adaabo, Mudug, Somalia. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI) soldiers attempting to retrieve the corpse of a taxi driver from a previous attack in Lanny Jaya, Papua, Indonesia. At least two assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka).

11/03/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and arrows attacked an Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) camp in Muganga, Sumbusu, Bahema Nord, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 11 people, including three soldiers, were killed and nine other people were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
11/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed Amanul Mulk Shah, an education official, in Kalpani Kalay, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2018: Assailants attempted to extort food and money from civilians in Umiray, Quezon, Philippines. Security forces responded to the incident. At least one soldier was killed and an unknown number of assailants were killed or injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked Philippine Army soldiers in Trinidad, Negros Oriental, Philippines. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/04/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated near a hospital and school in Shirqat, Saladin, Iraq. Two people, including civilians and security officers, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near shopping areas in Turath, Rasheed, Baghdad, Iraq. At least three people were injured in the blast. This was one of five coordinated attacks in Baghdad on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated at a local farm in Kiluwat, Muqdadiyah, Diyala, Iraq. At least two farmers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
11/04/2018: Assailants shot and killed an army soldier outside his residence in Hayy al ‘Askari, Karbala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near a vendor stand in Sadr City, Baghdad, Iraq. At least three people were killed and five other people were injured in the blast. This was one of five coordinated attacks in Baghdad on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near a bus stop at Aden Square, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were killed and four other people were injured in the blast. This was one of five coordinated attacks in Baghdad on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device planted in a passenger minibus detonated in Habbibiyah, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were injured in the blast. This was one of five coordinated attacks in Baghdad on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated in Shuala, Baghdad, Iraq. At least two people were killed and two other people were injured in the blast. This was one of five coordinated attacks in Baghdad on the same day. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated near a military convoy in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. At least one soldier was killed and two other soldiers were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of a government employee detonated in Sahha, Baghdad, Iraq. The driver of the vehicle was killed in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: Assailants opened fire at the residence of Erika Montero, a Common Alternative Revolutionary Force (FARC) party leader, in Belen la Nubia, Medellin, Antioquia, Colombia. Montero was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers in Kafrij, Nineveh, Iraq. One soldier was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Colonel Ali Arfidah in Al-Khums, Murqub, Libya. Colonel Arfidah, a Force of the Security and Protection of Sirte deputy commander, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked a joint military and police checkpost in Wali Muhammadi Shahid district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting posts in Ghazni on this date. At least 13 security personnel and 22 assailants were killed while two security personnel and 15 assailants were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/04/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) personnel along Al Basel Street in Raqqah, Syria. At least one person was killed and seven other people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Kofa, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. Six people were killed and at least 24 people were wounded. Additionally, an unknown number of house were set on fire in the attack. This was one of five related incidents in Borno on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/02/2018: Assailants attacked Bulabulin, Borno, Nigeria. Five people were killed and an unknown number of others were wounded in the attack. This was one of five related incidents in Borno on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/04/2018: Assailants set fire to plantation equipment in Balit, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Charity Ampong was targeted for mistreating her employees.

11/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a National Guard patrol in Puerto Ayacucho, Amazonas, Venezuela. At least three soldiers were killed and 10 soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

11/04/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb at a civilian residence along Wheeler Road in Hannahstown, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/04/2018: Three explosives devices were discovered and safely defused along Dunsilly Road in Antrim, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Qush Tepa, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Security forces repelled the assault, killing 21 assailants. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked the convoy of Chief Alhaji Bala Usman, a traditional leader, in Nasarawa, Nigeria. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked the Al-Wadi Battalion in Sabratah, Nuqat Al Khams, Libya. At least three assailants were killed and five other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Anas al-Dabbashi Brigade .

11/04/2018: Assailants, including suicide bombers equipped with explosives-laden vehicles, attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in Bahra, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 12 SDF members and 17 assailants were killed and 20 other SDF members and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/04/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Lingagri, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.
11/04/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Thalkobad, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked two Afghan Border Police (ABP) Humvees in Dashti Qala district, Takhar, Afghanistan. One security member was killed and a second was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Nagahan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/04/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Pashtun Kot district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed while seven assailants and two pro-government militia members were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Shah Salim, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least one officer was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/05/2018: Assailants abducted 82 people from the Presbyterian Secondary School in Nkwen, North-West, Cameroon. The victims included 79 students, a driver, a teacher, and the principal of the school. 76 students and the driver were released on November 6, 2018 with 12 of these individuals were injured. The remaining hostages were released on November 12, 2018. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident and demanded the closure of schools.
11/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on Hadd al-Akhdar, Diyala, Iraq. Three guards were killed in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police officer in Garas Balley, Banaadir, Somalia. The officer, identified as Wadaad Yare, was killed and his rifle and vehicle were stolen in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Tang Killay, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/05/2018: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Nassoumbou, Sahel, Burkina Faso. Two soldiers were killed and three more were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked a joint military and police checkpost in Malistan district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting posts in Ghazni on this date. At least 13 security personnel and 22 assailants were killed while two security personnel and 15 assailants were injured across both attacks. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/05/2018: An assailant attempted to stab civilians and an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) officer in Kiryat Arba, West Bank. The assailant was shot and injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as a Palestinian extremist.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked Benjamin Tarug Ramos in Kabankalan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Ramos, a human rights lawyer and founding member of National Union of People's Lawyers (NUPL), was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked security outposts in Sangcharak district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. One pro-government militia member and ten assailants were killed and five police officers 20 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) outpost in Shindand district, Herat, Afghanistan. Seven soldiers were killed and four were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked security outposts in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Kandahar on the same day. Five police officers and 30 assailants were killed and seven police officers were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked security outposts in Arghistan district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks in Kandahar on the same day. Five police officers and 30 assailants were killed and seven police officers were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Khakrez, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 12 police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Qalat district, Zabul, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and two were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Border Police (ABP) outpost in Morghab district, Badghis, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and three were injured in the ensuing clash, while 10 assailants were either killed or injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/05/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of a police officer in Sheikhupura, Punjab, Pakistan. Zahid Mehmood, a Station House Officer, and two others were killed in the attack. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Kukawa, Borno, Nigeria. An unknown number of soldiers were killed and up to 16 soldiers were reported missing following the attack. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: Assailants set fire to placards on the porch of Jumoke Emery in South Hilltop, Denver, Colorado, United States. Emery, a lead organizer for a campaign to remove slavery language from Colorado's constitution, was not harmed. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources indicated that the attack was racially motivated.

11/05/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Kumshe, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the attack is unknown. The Shekau faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident. Separately, the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), also claimed responsibility for the attack.
11/01/2018: Assailants attacked and killed Thobani Mathews Ndaba, a municipal officer, in Greytown, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/04/2018: Assailants abducted a Jose Gonzalez Castellar, national guard sergeant, on a road leading to Higuerote, Miranda, Venezuela. The hostage was killed the following day when he attempted to escape. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian residence in Wadi Melh, Sanaa, Yemen. At least one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/06/2018: Assailants shot and killed Diosdado Garson Estrabela, a police officer, in Mantiquil, Negros Oriental, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/07/2018: Security forces discovered and safely defused an explosive device in Poblacion, Ampatuan, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).

11/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on vehicles carrying Catholic priests in near Abraka, Delta, Nigeria. Four priests were abducted and were rescued on November 9, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

11/06/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) vehicle of Burundian soldiers in Huriwa, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least one soldier was injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: Assailants opened fire at a cafe in Miitaqwo, Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least four people, including three civilians and one soldier, were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Bashir al-Faysal al-Huwaydi inside his vehicle along Al-Nour Street in Raqqah, Syria. Al-Huwaydi, the Al 'Afadilah Tribe chieftain, was killed in the assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that the victim was targeted for his alleged collaboration with Kurdish armed groups. Sources also attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK) and the Syrian Democratic Forces.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/05/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Border Police (ABP) base in Qala Kah district, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 20 border police officers and 15 assailants were killed in the attack. In addition, 20 border police officers were abducted during the raid. The fate of the hostages is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpost in Dehyak, Farah, Afghanistan. At least five assailants and eight police officers were killed and three officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/06/2018: Assailants abducted at least seven people, including five students and two teachers, in Kumba, Meme, South-West, Cameroon. The hostages were released unharmed on an unknown date sometime before November 20, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2018: Gunmen opened fire on Yemeni army colonel Haidrah Askr in Enma, Aden, Adan, Yemen. Askr was not harmed but one soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2018: Assailants stopped a bus and forced passengers to disembark before setting it on fire near Usur, Chhattisgarh, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

11/06/2018: Assailants attacked a pro-government militia outpost in Barikab, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. Three militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/06/2018: Assailants attacked security outposts in Sang-I-Zard, Faryab, Afghanistan. Four pro-government militia members and two assailants were killed and two militia members were injured in the ensuing clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2018: An assailant equipped with scissors attempted to stab Israeli Border Police officers at a gas station in Kfar Adumim, West Bank. The assailant was shot and injured, and there were no other reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

11/06/2018: Assailants attacked Azrak Oil Field in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. There were no reported casualties in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/06/2018: Assailants ambushed military personnel in Benue, Nigeria. At least one person, identified as Army Captain Zakari Sani, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/06/2018: Assailants abducted Muhammad 'Aydah, a cameraman of Al-Hurra Television channel, in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related abductions in Sanaa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/06/2018: Assailants abducted Fu'ad al-Khudur, a journalist, from his home in Sanaa, Amanat Al Asimah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related abductions in Sanaa on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Isma'il al-Jabiri in Amarah, Maysan, Iraq. Al-Jabiri, the Al 'Amarah prison director, was not harmed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint in Anguri, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated assaults on checkpoints in the area on the same day. At least six police officers were injured across both incidents. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

11/07/2018: Assailants attacked a border police checkpoint in Anguri, Ghazni, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated assaults on checkpoints in the area on the same day. At least six police officers were injured across both incidents. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

11/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on a passenger bus near Beit El, West Bank. At least two Israeli civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

11/07/2018: An explosive device detonated as security forces attempted to defuse it in Mohmand Gat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Army captain Zarghaam Fareed was killed an another soldier was injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/07/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol in Rogha Badar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Three soldiers were injured in the blast. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/07/2018: Assailants shelled houses in At Tuhayat district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Four civilians were killed and several others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/07/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Afghanistan National Army (ANA) base in Dashti Archi district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. At least four soldiers were killed and several others were wounded in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/05/2018: Assailants detonated a remote controlled explosive device targeting military personnel in Shibam, Hadramawt, Yemen. Two soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP).

11/07/2018: Assailants armed with sticks attacked Kalmu Dhruva in Bodko, Chhattisgarh, India. Dhruva, a Communist Party of India (CPI) worker and the husband of a village sarpanch, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).

11/07/2018: Assailants attacked Katarko, Damaturu, Yobe, Nigeria. Assailants opened fire on a military base in the village and set fire to an unknown number of civilian residences.
