11/15/2018: Assailants shot and killed a municipal councilor in Bossey, Arbinda, Soum, Sahel, Burkina Faso. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso) and the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).

11/15/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Gansh, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of four attacks on security posts in Qalay-i-Zal district on this date. At least three soldiers and 13 assailants were killed and two soldiers and 16 assailants were injured across the four incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/15/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Tapi Afghan, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of four attacks on security posts in Qalay-i-Zal district on this date. At least three soldiers and 13 assailants were killed and two soldiers and 16 assailants were injured across the four incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/15/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Mazar, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of four attacks on security posts in Qalay-i-Zal district on this date. At least three soldiers and 13 assailants were killed and two soldiers and 16 assailants were injured across the four incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/00/2018: Sometime between November 1, 2018 and November 30, 2018, an assailant attacked a woman wearing a coat with a fur-lined hood at Whole Foods in University Heights, Ohio, United States. One person was injured in the attack. The assailant, identified as Meredith Lowell, had a history of and later carried out similar attacks on people wearing fur and had said “she wanted to set up an animal rights militia.”

11/16/2018: Assailants abducted Charles Doumta, a University of Buea faculty member, from South-West, Cameroon. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources stated that the assailants intended to intimidate students and faculty in the Anglophone university.

11/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Malik Ameer Mohammad, a tribal elder, in Hasham Charmang, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Mohammad was injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants fired a mortar at a United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) base in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants raided Oicha, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five people were killed, three others were wounded, and several houses were burned in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/16/2018: Assailants attempted to attack a United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) base in Boikene, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least eight UN peacekeepers were killed and one peacekeeper was injured. Additionally, two houses were burned in the ensuing clash. The Central Africa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).
gname: Central Africa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on Police Corporal Abdulloh Waeali as he was driving near Lahan, Pattani, Thailand. Waeali was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anti-government extremists.
11/16/2018: Security forces discovered and safely detonated and explosives-laden vehicle in Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/16/2018: Assailants shot and killed the son of the mayor of Abu Khanazir village, in Abu Khanazir, Diyala, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/16/2018: An explosive device detonated at a market in Quaidabad, Karachi, Pakistan. At least two people were killed and eight others were injured in the blast. A second device was defused at the scene. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jeay Sindh Muttahida Mahaz (JSMM).

11/16/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the Manipur State Legislative Assembly in Imphal, Imphal West, Manipur, India. Two security guards and a Border Security Forces (BSF) jawan were injured in the blast. The United National Liberation Front (UNLF) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on Pastor Benjamin Imeogu, an All Progressives Congress (APC) chieftain, along Nnamdi Azikiwe Airport Road, Abuja, Nigeria. Imeogu was killed and four family members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Ustadz Musa Panday, a cleric, in Badak, Maguindanao, Philippines. Panday's son was killed and Panday and his wife were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on Levin Uy near his residence in Bayambang, Pangasinan, Philippines. Uy, a former town councilor, was killed and another person, identified as Cesar Salosagcol, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/16/2018: Assailants abducted five employees of a military-contracted construction company working with the Armed Forces Engineering Authority in Gaal, south of Bir al-Abd, North Sinai, Egypt. Four of the employees were released hours after the attack but the whereabouts of the owner, identified as Mahmoud Hamdy al-Qalaagi, remains unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/16/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Yusuf Adabenege in Okene, Kogi, Nigeria. Adabenege, an aide to the Kogi governor, was killed along with two other people. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Islamqul, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/16/2018: Assailants attacked a United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) base in Gbambia, Mambere Kadei, Central African Republic. A Tanzanian peacekeeper was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Siriri was involved in the attack.

11/16/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Army soldiers in Al-Ghab plains near Sirmaniyah, Hamah, Syria. At least 22 soldiers and five assailants were killed and an unknown number of soldiers and assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Hurras al-Din.
11/16/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device near the border in Gaza Strip. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/16/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Kekeno, Borno, Nigeria. One soldier was killed and four others were injured. It is unknown whether there were any assailant casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).
11/16/2018: Assailant set fire to the Millaleiva school in Chequenco, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/16/2018: Assailant set fire to Cristo Divino Catholic chapel in Labranza, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Mainok, Borno, Nigeria. One soldier was killed in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a National Gendarmerie position in Makalondi, Tillaberi, Niger. At least two gendarmes were killed, one was wounded, and one was reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/17/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle carrying government officials in Puli Alam, Logar, Afghanistan. Two people, including district chief Ainuddin Amin and National Directorate of Security (NDS) head Aziz Rahman were killed and three security officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on Sheikh Wisam Ghazrawi outside his residence in Basra, Iraq. Sheikh Ghazrawi, a leading anti-corruption activist involved in the recent protests, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants abducted 18 fishermen at the Hudaydah port in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists and noted that the victims were accused of working with the government.

11/17/2018: Assailants abducted at least 50 loggers about 25 km from Gambaru, Ngala, Borno, Nigeria. As of November 22, 2018, two of the hostages escaped and the whereabouts of the remaining hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shekau faction of Boko Haram.

11/17/2018: Assailants abducted three civilians from a bakery in Sadi Pora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two hostages were beaten and released, while the remaining hostage, identified as Huzaif Ashraf (Kutay), was killed later the same day. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were targeted for being police informants.

11/17/2018: Assailants abducted two civilians, Hakib Javid Ganie and Ishfaq Ahmad, from Memender, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The two hostages were beaten before being released later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants attempted to attack the residence of Javaid Qadri, a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) district president, in Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties as security guards repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants set fire to a panchayat ghar in Reshwari, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties, but the building was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/17/2018: A female suicide bomber detonated at a police checkpoint in Grozny, Chechnya, Russia. The assailant was the only reported casualty. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Tagab district, Kapisa, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed and one was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed Naeem Kakar, the former Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of police, along Zargoon Road in Quetta, Balochistan, Pakistan. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device and opened fire on a police vehicle in Mambulo Nuevo, Camarines Sur, Philippines. Six police officers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpost along the Kunduz-Takhar highway in Charkh Ab, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks along the highway on the same day. At least three security officers and seven assailants were killed and three soldiers and five assailants were injured across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpost along the Kunduz-Takhar highway in Khanabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks along the highway on the same day. At least three security officers and seven assailants were killed and three soldiers and five assailants were injured across both incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants fired rockets at a security vehicle in Gurbaz, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two soldiers were killed and two were injured in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants attempted to extort civilians in Laptang, Arunachal Pradesh, India. At least one assailant was killed in the ensuing clash with Assam Rifles members. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-Unification (NSCN-U).

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Bakhshabad, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed, two were injured, and one was taken hostage in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of security outposts in Pashtun Kot district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least one security officer and seven assailants were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants attacked a security outpost in Qizlar Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. Three security officers were killed and five were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants stopped three dump trucks of Jejors Construction Corp and temporarily held five drivers hostage in Kasuga, Davao del Sur, Philippines. The five drivers were released the same day and the trucks were set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/17/2018: Assailants fired three missiles at residential areas of Marib, Yemen. Security forces intercepted the missiles; there were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/17/2018: Assailants launched a mortar shell at a civilian residence hosting a wedding in Jalrez district, Wardak, Afghanistan. At least two civilians were killed and 13 were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/17/2018: Assailants equipped with an M79 grenade launcher and rifles opened fire on the Ranger Company 4316 base in Bango Sako, Pattani, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anti-government extremists.

11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying judges in Bagram, Parwan, Afghanistan. One judge was killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on fishermen in Lake Albert in Kaiso, Western, Uganda. At least seven people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Lendu militia.

11/17/2018: Assailants fired projectiles at Syrian Armed Forces (SAF) soldiers in Safsafa, Lattakia, Syria. At least 18 soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the attack. Incite the Believers claimed responsibility. for the incident.

11/17/2018: Assailants held 20 Petroperu employees hostage in Peru. All 20 hostages were released on November 20, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the Wampis extremists, which denied involvement.

11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Brigadier General Adnan al-Hammadi in Maafer district, Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in Shibam, Hadramawt, Yemen. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Two assailants threw a grenade at a prayer hall in Adliwala, Punjab, India. At least three civilians were killed and at least 16 others were injured in the blast. The Khalistan Liberation Force claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police camp in Ijara, Garissa, Kenya. This was one of two related attacks in Ijara on this date. At least one assailant was killed and several assailants were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Safaricom telecommunications mast in Ijara, Garissa, Kenya. This was one of two related attacks in Ijara on this date. At least one assailant was killed and several assailants were injured across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/19/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and rocket-propelled grenades attacked a military base in Mitile, Borno, Nigeria. At least 118 soldiers were killed and 150 other soldiers were reported missing in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/18/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Gajiram, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/18/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in front of a restaurant on Doctors Street in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. Five civilians were killed and 13 people were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Brigadier General Fahd Gharamah, the deputy Hizam Brigade commander for Abyan governorate, outside his residence in Shaykh Uthman, Adan, Yemen. Gharamah was killed and seven students from a nearby school were injured in the attack. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants shelled a civilian residence in Zahir, Hajjah, Yemen. Four civilians were killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied involvement.

11/18/2018: Assailants attempted to attack military personnel near the old airport in Taizz, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents in the city on this date. An unknown number of assailants were killed and injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/18/2018: Assailants attempted to attack military personnel in Khazzan, Taizz, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents in the city on this date. An unknown number of assailants were killed and injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/18/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. At least one police officer was killed and a second officer was injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: An explosive device detonated near District Reserve Guard (DRG) officers between Bheji and Elarmadgu, Chhattisgarh, India. At least one officer was killed and two other officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
11/18/2018: Assailants abducted civilian Suhail Ahmad Ganie from Memender, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ganie was released unharmed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants launched grenades and opened fire on a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Kakapora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One CRPF member was killed and two others were injured in the attack. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also suspected that the attack was carried out by Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind.

11/18/2018: Assailants fired missiles at a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) base housing Lithuanian forces in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a Frontier Corps (FC) vehicle that was providing security for a supply vehicle in Mar Gat, Balochistan, Pakistan. Three FC members were killed and four were injured in the blast. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security patrol in Wana, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. One soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Mizan district, Zabul, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and at least two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/18/2018: A sniper shot and killed Dawood Laghmani, an Afghan National Army (ANA) commander, in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on civilians in Farah, Afghanistan. Two people, an economic department employee and a teacher, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/18/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier at the Bakara market in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Aran Boller along San Francisco Street in Catbalogan, Samar, Philippines. Boller, a former mayor and mayoral candidate, was injured in the assault. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Aran Boller was targeted for past crimes he had committed. Additionally, sources noted that Boller was a mayoral candidate in upcoming elections.

11/18/2018: Assailants set fire to a vehicle in Chandannath, Karnali, Nepal. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of Nepal - Maoist (CPN-Maoist-Chand), which the group denied.

11/18/2018: Assailants set fire to a Government Higher Secondary School in Hatmaloo, Kupwara, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire at a tea shop in Kalabo, Yala, Thailand. One civilian, identified as Manakuti Chema, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/18/2018: Assailants fired five rocket-propelled grenades at civilian residences in Taizz, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on the convoy of Brigadier General Abdul Rahman al-Shamsani in Maafer district, Taizz, Yemen. Four soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants abducted five fishermen from Lake Zarkah in Zarkah, Saladin, Iraq. Two of the hostages escaped and the bodies of the remaining three hostages were discovered the following day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

summary: 11/19/2018: Assailants opened fire and detonated an explosive device targeting a police post in Ehkwa, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least one police officer, identified as Faysal Kirawi, was killed and four police officers were injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/19/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Mammanti, Borno, Nigeria. At least nine farmers were killed and 12 other farmers were abducted in the assault. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/19/2018: Assailants abducted seven women in Bama, Borno, Nigeria. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
11/19/2018: Assailants attacked Jaghuri district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants set up a checkpoint and stopped civilian vehicles at the entrance of Wadi al-Haniwa, Sirte, Libya. There were no reported casualties. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/19/2018: Assailants attacked soldiers in Dhagaxyaale, Galguduud, Somalia. The ensuing clash resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/19/2018: An explosive device detonated along a highway in Labu-Labu, Maguindanao, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two similar bombings in Labu-Labu on this day; this first explosion was designed to draw a crowd. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack. Additionally, sources suspected that the attacks were carried out by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/19/2018: An explosive device detonated near 57th Infantry Battalion soldiers along a highway in Labu-Labu, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least one soldier was injured in the blast. This was one of two similar bombings in Labu-Labu on this day; this later explosion targeted first responders at the scene of an earlier blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack. Additionally, sources suspected that the attacks were carried out by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/18/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Shinkay district, Zabul, Afghanistan. At least one police officer was killed, one was injured, and 10 were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/18/2018: A sea mine detonated off the coast of Munirah district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Two fishermen were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/19/2018: Assailants detonated and explosive device opened fire on an army convoy near Boni, Douentza, Mopti, Mali. At least three soldiers were killed and five soldiers were reported missing following the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM).

11/19/2018: Assailants attacked a farm in Molai, 10 km from Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. A security guard identified as Ali Inuwa Bwala was killed after he and his wife were briefly held hostage and later released. The wife was unharmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/19/2018: Assailants abducted Pervaiz Ahmad Wani from Batmuran, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Ahmad was shot and injured before being released shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants abducted Apurba Kakoti in Jagun, Assam, India. Kakoti, a stone quarry manager, was released after the payment of a ransom on November 28, 2018. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) base in Achakzai, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 31 people, including 20 assailants and 11 soldiers, were killed and nine people were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/19/2018: Assailants set fire to two coal trucks in Bukru, Bukru, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Jharkhand Janmukti Parishad (JJP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated the trucks were targeted because the workers had refused to respond to an extortion demand.

11/19/2018: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. Three soldiers were killed and five were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/19/2018: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Shirin Tagab district, Faryab, Afghanistan. Two soldiers were killed and one was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/19/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier and a civilian at a restaurant at the Fagax intersection in Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Al-Shabaab was involved in the attack.

11/19/2018: Assailants abducted 'Abd-al-Razzaq 'Awad in Idlib, Syria. The whereabouts of 'Awad, a Violet Organization official, are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

11/19/2018: Assailants attacked the private vehicle of a police officer with a petrol bomb in Red Barns Road, Dundalk, Louth, Ireland. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants abducted five civilians at El Ciervo ranch in Santa Rosa del Aguaray, San Pedro, Paraguay. One civilian, identified as Valmir de Campos, was killed and the four other hostages were released later the same day. The Paraguayan People's Army (EPP) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "anyone who is caught growing transgenic corn or soybean will be shot."

11/19/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle along Ghor-Herat highway near Feroz Koh, Ghor, Afghanistan. Three civilians were killed and three were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/19/2018: Assailants shot and killed Afzal Jhummat, leader of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf (PTI), at a bus station in Thana Chatola, Punjab, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/20/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest at a wedding hall where religious scholars and clerics had gathered to celebrate the birth of the prophet Muhammad in Kabul, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, 55 people were killed and 94 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that either the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State or the Taliban were responsible for the attack. The Taliban denied responsibility.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 11/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on Chakama trading centre in Kilifi, Kenya. Five civilians were injured and Silvia Costanza Romano was abducted in the attack. Romano, an Italian Africa Milele Onlus NGO volunteer, was released on May 9, 2020. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Romano converted to Islam in captivity because "she saw with her own eyes a better world than the one she previously knew."

11/20/2018: Assailants attacked sub-station B-6NC-186 of the Sharara Oil Field in Wadi Al Hayaa, Libya. There were no reported casualties; however, three vehicles and mobile phones were stolen in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police vehicle in Shah Wali Kot district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Four people, including three police officers and one civilian, were killed and two police officers were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants attacked residents in Likobe, Cabo Delgado, Macomia, Mozambique. At least two people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Muslim extremists carried out the attack.

11/20/2018: Assailants abducted at least 10 people, including nine students and one teacher, from the Lords Bilingual Secondary School in Kumba, Meme, South-West, Cameroon. Three hostages were rescued by security forces later the same day, and the remaining seven hostages were rescued the following day on November 21, 2018. At least one hostage was injured during the rescue operation. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/20/2018: Assailants attacked a police post in Lamongan, East Java, Indonesia. The outcome of the attack is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/20/2018: An explosive device fitted in the vehicle of Dahir Amin Jesow detonated on Maka al-Mukarama road in Mogadishu, Somalia. Jesow, a Member of Parliament, was not harmed, but two people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: An assailant stabbed and injured an Israeli civilian outside a shop in Har Gilo, West Bank. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the assailant was a Palestinian extremist.

11/20/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mir Hafizullah, a Tehreek-i-Hurriyat leader, at his residence in Badoora, Jammu and Kashmir, India. His wife was also injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants abducted Numal Boruah in Sapekhati, Assam, India. The fate of Boruah, a tea estate manager, is unknown. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/20/2018: Assailants kidnapped a trader in Borbil, Assam, India. The fate of the victim is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA).

11/20/2018: An assailant, armed with two kitchen knives, stabbed a police officer outside the Grand Place market square in Brussels, Belgium. In addition to the assailant, the police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities apprehended an assailant suspected of being a jihadi-inspired extremist.

11/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on Rodrigo Tambo along Dulong Hernandez Street in Catmon, Malabon, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. Tambo, a local village councilor and Arya Progresibo leader, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/20/2018: Assailants established a fake checkpoint and abducted two soldiers in an unknown location in Kunduz province, Afghanistan. The soldiers were killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/20/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a 183 Battalion Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) camp in Newa, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on Suresh Sharma, the former Amritsar district president of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), at his shop in Chheharta, Punjab, India. Sharma was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) members in Guindulungan, Maguindanao, Philippines. Two MNLF members were killed and one civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/20/2018: Assailants attacked military trucks transporting aid in Panpi, Myanmar. It is unknown whether there were any casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Shan State Army - South (SSA-S).

11/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy between Wanlaweyne and Afgoye in Lower Shebelle, Somalia. At least two soldiers were killed and three were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: An explosive device detonated at the 111 marker of the Cano Limon-Covenas Oil Pipeline in Canaguata, Boyaca, Colombia. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

11/21/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a civilian vehicle in Charmang, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: An explosive device planted at Eidgah Qadeemi Mosque detonated in Chaman, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least 13 civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct Shaykh 'Ali 'Ali Ahmad al-'Azzani, a tribal chieftain, from his residence in Al-Haymah ad-Dakhiliyah district, Sanaa, Yemen. Three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash with armed tribe members. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed two Hormuud Telecommunication workers at the Bakara market in Hawl Wadag, Mogadishu, Somalia. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Jabha East Africa.

11/21/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian from Palnar, Chhattisgarh, India. The hostage was killed on November 23, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/21/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device along a road in between Manatu and Chak, Jharkhand, India. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists.
11/21/2018: Assailants shot and killed Chiakuo Emmanuel, the Government Bilingual High School Vice Principal, in Belo, North-West, Cameroon. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Tongomayel, Sahel, Burkina Faso. A police officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).

11/22/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a bus carrying students in Shorah, Nineveh, Iraq. At least three civilians were killed and four others were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2018: At least two explosive devices detonated in Islah, Jalawla, Diyala, Iraq. Two security officers were injured in the blast. A second explosive device was discovered and safely detonated at the scene. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/21/2018: Assailants attacked the residence of Dhaqane Qasim Amin, an electoral delegate, in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. Amin was beheaded and two of his sons were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the town on this date. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants abducted two herders in Konton, Wajir, Kenya. The hostages were freed on November 28, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab and noted that the victims were targeted for not responding to extortion demands.

11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire at a Foraco drilling site in Toumour, Diffa, Niger. At least seven employees were killed and five people were injured in the attack. Additionally, a government employee was abducted and killed a short time later, and two trucks were stolen during the incident. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

11/22/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms looted a number of shops in Toumour, Diffa, Niger. There were no reported casualties. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date; the vehicle used was stolen in a previous incident. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

11/21/2018: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Laman, Badghis, Afghanistan. At least three soldiers and 10 assailants were killed and nine soldiers and 13 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on an army camp in Khudwani, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian, identified as Muskan Jan, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at a hardware shop in Demow, Assam, India. Two people were killed and two people were injured in the blast. The United Liberation Front of Assam (ULFA) claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on a United Nations helicopter in Semuliki valley, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: An explosive device detonated near a shop in Angoor Ada, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two people were killed and 12 were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants armed with rockets attacked a security checkpost in Norak, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. No casualties were reported. Hizb-ul-Ahrar (HuA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: An explosive device detonated at the office of Naik Muhammad, a Haqqani Network leader, in Wana, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Muhammad was not harmed but at least two people were killed and 11 were injured in the blast. The casualties included members of the Haqqani Network and civilians. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) base in Zangitan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 18 soldiers were killed and 16 were injured in the attack. Additionally, four soldiers were taken hostage. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/22/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) base in Maywand, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 13 soldiers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/22/2018: Assailants fired mortars at a village in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. Three civilians were killed and several civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/22/2018: An explosive device detonated as Thai Rangers and police personnel removed pro-independence banners in Kayu Khla, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the blast. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants tossed a grenade and opened fire on a police camp in Gagran, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants attacked a village in Dowm Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. Three security personnel were killed and five were injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/22/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Jilib Lower Shebelle, Somalia. There were an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/22/2018: Assailants equipped with explosives-laden vehicles attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) near Tanak Oil Field northeast of Kashmah, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 17 assailants were killed and 10 other assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on volunteer defense corps personnel at a market in Talo Due Raman, Pattani, Thailand. Two defense volunteers were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however sources attributed the attack to anti-government extremists.

11/22/2018: Assailants set fire to agricultural machinery in Curanilahue, Bio-Bio, Chile. The assailants also fired on the vehicle of the night watchman, forcing him to flee the area. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The Arauco Malleco Coordinating Group (CAM) - Chile claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants set fire to a conveyor belt and damaged 15 trucks at an SLN nickel mining site in Kouaoua district, North, New Caledonia. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Ughelli North, Delta, Nigeria. One police sergeant was killed and an unknown number of other officers were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on army personnel in PK5, Bangui, Central African Republic. At least four people were killed and at least 21 people were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/22/2018: An explosive device detonated near an Iraqi Volunteer Forces inspection mission near Khawaja Khalil, Nineveh, Iraq. At least two soldiers were killed and four other soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on Jalameh crossing near Jenin, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/23/2018: An assailant in a vehicle attempted to run over worshippers exiting Congregation Bais Yeshuda along La Brea Avenue in Los Angeles, California, United States. There were no reported casualties. The assailant, who shouted anti-Semitic slurs during the assault, was later arrested.

11/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers on the road between Kirkuk and Sulaymaniyah, Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one officer was killed and two others were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2018: Three suicide attackers wearing explosives-laden vests opened fire and threw hand grenades at the Chinese consulate in Block 4, Karachi, Pakistan. Seven people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. The casualties included assailants, police officers, and civilians. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2018: Assailants attacked a police station in Tazirbu, Kufra, Libya. At least nine people were killed, 10 were injured, and at least 11 were abducted during the raid; the victims included police officers and civilians. The an unknown number of hostages were released January 1, 2019. The Barqa Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Barqa Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle in Daarul Salaam, Banaadir, Somalia. At least three soldiers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting soldiers responding to an earlier incident in Daarul Salaam, Banaadir, Somalia. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The blast did not result in casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/23/2018: Assailants, armed with machetes, attacked civilians in Chicuaia Velha, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least 12 civilians were killed and several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

11/23/2018: Three assailants opened fire on Raed al-Fares and Hamoud al-Junaid in Kafr Nabl, Idlib. Syria. Both al-Fares, the Radio Fresh FM founder, and al-Junaid, a camera operator, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham, which denied responsibility.

11/23/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive device at a mosque on an Afghan National Army (ANA) base in Mando Zayi district, Khost, Afghanistan. In addition to the assailant, 27 soldiers were killed and 57 others were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to the Taliban.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 11/23/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden motorcycle at the Juma Bazar in Kalaya, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. In addition to the assailant, at least 33 people were killed and 50 people were injured in the blast. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 11/23/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked a security checkpoint in Qaws, Abyan, Yemen. At least four security personnel were killed and three were injured in the attack. Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2018: Assailants attacked lorry in Balama, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. A guard for the governor's palace was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/23/2018: Assailants opened fire near an army base in Chattergam, Jammu and Kashmir, India. One civilian, identified as Ishfaq Ahmad Ganaie, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2018: Assailants abducted three people, identified as Basharat Ahmad Wagay, Zahid Ahmad Wagay, and Reyaz Ahmad Wagay, from Rebon, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Reyaz and Zahid were released shortly after the abduction and Basharat, a former Special Police Officer (SPO) was killed later the same day. Hizbul Mujahideen (HM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that Basharat Ahmad Wagay was targeted for being a police informant.

11/22/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army post in Dowm Qala, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. Three security personnel were killed and five were injured across the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/23/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military patrol near the Cano Limon-Covenas Oil Pipeline in Tarra, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Two soldiers were killed and two more were wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army (ELN).

11/23/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Mitile, Borno, Nigeria. Six soldiers were killed and at least one other was abducted in the incident. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

11/23/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in Al Bahra, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 24 SDF members were killed in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/22/2018: Assailants set fire to a JCB machine in Lewadih, Latehar, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/23/2018: Assailants opened fire on Jitendar Singh in Mansehra, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Singh, a minority community member, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/23/2018: Assailants launched a ballistic missile targeting Marib, Yemen. The missile was intercepted by the Arab Coalition's defenses. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attribute it to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/24/2018: An explosive device was discovered and safely defused in Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM).
11/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: Assailants armed with firearms, grenades, and explosive devices ambushed a military convoy between Qalimow and Gololey in Middle Shebelle, Somalia. At least 10 assailants and six soldiers, were killed while 10 soldiers and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: Assailants armed with grenades attacked a police station in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. An unknown number of people were abducted in the attack and their fate is unknown. This was one of two related attacks in the town on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/24/2018: Assailants attacked the district headquarters in Beled Hawo, Gedo, Somalia. An unknown number of people were abducted in the attack and their fate is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/24/2018: Assailants fired chemical-laced projectiles that landed and detonated in Khaldiyah neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. This was one of three related attacks in different Aleppo neighborhoods on the same day. At least 32 people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attacks were carried out by Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham, which denied involvement.

11/24/2018: Assailants fired chemical-laced projectiles that landed and detonated in Zahra neighborhood, Aleppo, Syria. This was one of three related attacks in different Aleppo neighborhoods on the same day. At least 32 people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attacks were carried out by Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham, which denied involvement.

11/24/2018: Assailants fired chemical-laced projectiles that landed and detonated along Nile Street in Aleppo, Syria. This was one of three related attacks in different Aleppo neighborhoods on the same day. At least 32 people were injured across all three incidents. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the attacks were carried out by Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham, which denied involvement.
11/23/2018: An explosive device detonated near the Jordanian border in Rutbah, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least four Iraqi soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/24/2018: Assailants abducted at least nine girls from Blaharde, near Toumour, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The outcome of the kidnappings is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.

11/24/2018: Assailants abducted at least seven girls from Bague, near Toumou, Diffa, Niger. This was one of two related attacks in the area on this date. The outcome of the kidnappings is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Boko Haram.
11/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed Mawlawi Abdul Basir Haqqani, the head of the Kabul Ulema Council, in Chihil Sutun, Kabul, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Surinder Singh, a Congress leader and panchayat candidate, in Padibal, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated targeting a police patrol in Badush, Nineveh, Iraq. Two police officers were killed and one was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on Hawk Force police personnel in Godri, Madhya Pradesh, India. One assailant was killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
11/24/2018: Assailants shot and killed Barangay captain Napoleon Sambayan in Antipolo Del Norte, Batangas, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on Teofilo Gulanin Niez Jr., the chairperson of Barangay Dontolan, in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Niez Jr. was killed and his companion, Estrella Hinoqin, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: An assailant set fire to St Mary's Church along Chapel Street in Penzance, England, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in Al-Bahra, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. This was one of three related incidents in Deir ez-Zor on the same day. At least 29 SDF members were killed across all three clashes. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members in Kharayij, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. This was one of three related incidents in Deir ez-Zor on the same day. At least 29 SDF members were killed across all three clashes. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) members near Tanak Oil Field in Deir ez-Zor, Syria. This was one of three related incidents in Deir ez-Zor on the same day. At least 29 SDF members were killed across all three clashes. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incidents.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/24/2018: Assailants opened fire on the Estancia La Suiza ranch along the Rio Verde between in Concepcion, Paraguay. There were no reported casualties. The Paraguayan People's Army (EPP) claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/24/2018: Assailants fired projectiles targeting government positions in Kulat al-Zuqri, Ad Dali, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).
11/25/2018: Assailants shot and killed a civilian in northern Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police convoy in Takht-i-Tewsak, Farah, Afghanistan. At least 22 police officers were killed and two officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants set fire to the Caiseal Mara Hotel, a planned accommodation for asylum seekers, in Moville, Donegal, Ireland. The owner was injured and the hotel was damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants set fire to a panchayat ghar in Batagund, near Kapren, Shopian, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants fired a rocket targeting the Martyr Bulent Aydin border outpost in Igdir, Turkey. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

11/25/2018: Assailants attacked an army outpost in Ark Elek, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least 10 security personnel were killed and two were injured in the attack. The victims included soldiers and a police officer. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/25/2018: An explosive device detonated at a mosque in Muhmand Dara district, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. A prayer leader was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a mayor inside his residence in Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. The mayor was killed and his wife was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/25/2018: Assailants executed three civilians in Baaj, Nineveh, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) was involved in the attack and believed that the victims were targeted for suspicion of operating as informants for security forces.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/25/2018: Assailants abducted Dipak Parsa, a Congress worker, from Bijapur, Chhattisgarh, India. Parsa was killed later the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/25/2018: Assailants attacked police checkpoints in Sar-e-Howz, Faryab, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and three assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on security personnel guarding Tha Yee market in Huay Pling, Songkhla, Thailand. Three people, including two security personnel and an assistant village chief, were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/25/2018: Assailants opened fire on a pavilion being used by military personnel in Ai Pase, Rangae, Narathiwat, Thailand. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Rajinder Singh, a sarpanch, in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/25/2018: Assailants entered the residence of Paulito Villaceran Jr., village chief of Barangay Sion, and opened fire in Sion, Davao del Norte, Philippines. Villaceran Jr. and his bodyguard were killed while four others were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/24/2018: Assailants established a checkpoint and kidnapped Abdul Qawi Abdulrahman al-Odaini and several others in Radaa district, Al Bayda, Yemen. The fate of al-Odaini, a provincial leader of the Yemeni Socialist Party (YSP), and the other hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/26/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at the gates of a Sufi shrine that also serves as the residence of Sheikh Abdiweli Elmi in Galkayo, Mudug, Somalia. Following the blast, four additional assailants entered the compound and opened fire. At least 22 people, including Sheikh Elmi and four assailants, were killed and 21 people, including an assailant, were injured in the attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the Sheikh was targeted for allegedly disrespecting the Prophet Mohammad.

11/26/2018: Assailants fired two rockets at Bagram Airbase in Bagram, Parwan, Afghanistan. Security forces intercepted the rockets; no casualties were reported. The Taliban and the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State separately claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near a market in Wadajir, Mogadishu, Somalia. At least eight people, including civilians and soldiers, were killed and 15 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/26/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Jiddari, Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. Four people were killed and another was injured in the attack. The Shekau faction of Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants attacked Abuenshie, Donga Mantung, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two attacks in Donga Mantung on this date. At least one police officer and two civilians were killed and an unknown number of assailants were wounded across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/26/2018: Assailants attacked Ako, Donga Mantung, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two attacks in Donga Mantung on this date. At least one police officer and two civilians were killed and an unknown number of assailants were wounded across the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/26/2018: Security forces intercepted and killed a female suicide bomber at a checkpoint in Dar, Madagali, Adamawa, Nigeria. The assailant was the only reported casualty. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants abducted nine people, including religious leaders, from Ira, Kossi, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on Brigadier General Abdul Aziz al-Majidi at a military checkpoint in Turbah, Taizz, Yemen. Al-Majidi was not harmed but three assailants and three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: An assailant rammed a vehicle into Israel Defense Forces (IDF) personnel in Al-Aroub, West Bank. The assailant was killed and four people, including three IDF soldiers and the assailant's wife, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Ramzi Abu Yabes, a Palestinian extremist.
11/26/2018: Assailants set fire to a panchayat house in Goripora, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device at the residence of Abdul Rashid Bhat in Kuchmullah, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Bhat, a panch, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks in Jammu and Kashmir on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/26/2018: Assailants threw an incendiary device (or a grenade) at the residence of Ghulam Muhammad Mir in Batagund, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Mir, a Congress leader, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. This was one of two similar attacks in Jammu and Kashmir on the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

11/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a 42 Rashtriya Rifles (RR) patrolling party in Pinglish, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Eduardo Esternon in Catmon, Malabon, Metropolitan Manila, Philippines. At least three people, including Esternon, an Arya Progresibo advisor, Marcos de Leon, the Flovihomes Homeowners Association president, and William Mortar, an Arya Progresibo organizer, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/26/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two people between Mbau and Kamango, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/26/2018: Assailants attacked Oicha, Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Seven people, including six civilians and one assailant, were killed in the attack. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

11/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on District Reserve Guard (DRG) personnel in Sakler, Chhattisgarh, India. At least 11 people, including two DRG members and nine assailants, were killed and an unknown number of assailants were wounded in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/27/2018: Assailants kidnapped and killed Iyad al-Braykat in North Sinai, Egypt. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that al-Braykat was targeted for being an informant.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/26/2018: Assailants set fire to the Qaysari Bazaar, a historic Ottoman market, in Kirkuk, Iraq. There were no reported casualties; however, over 300 shops were burned in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: An explosive device, planted in a traffic cone, detonated near a 47th Ranger Regiment foot patrol in Asen, Yala, Thailand. At least one soldier, identified as Arong Yuso, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/24/2018: Assailants abducted Father Jude-Thaddeus Langeh Basebang, a driver and two others in Munyengue, South-West, Cameroon. Three hostages were released as of November 29th, 2018, and the fate of the driver is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Territorial Defense Volunteers (TDV) base in Thung Don, Songkhla, Thailand. At least two volunteer rangers, identified as Kosin Kaewmanee and Manit Damdee, were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/26/2018: Assailants abducted Hashim Salih al-Bouri, a lawyer, from his residence in Az Zuhrah district, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/26/2018: Assailants abducted the Gola block pramukh, identified as Jaleshwar Mahto, in Koiya, Jharkhand, India. Mahto was released on an unknown date. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the People's Liberation Front of India.
11/26/2018: Assailants attacked an immigration building in Taizz, Yemen. One person was killed and two others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of an Abu Abbas Brigade captain, Al-Majidi, in Al Dabab, Taizz, Yemen. Two civilians were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated against a passenger bus in Shuala, Kadhimiya, Baghdad, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and two others were wounded in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/28/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near civilians in Abu Sayda, Diyala, Iraq. At least one civilian was killed and two others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Four assailants opened fire on Cpl. Ariel Evangelista, a soldier, in Parangbasak, Basilan, Philippines. The soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicle in Shahbaz, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least four United States soldiers were killed and three people, including two United States soldiers and a contractor, were injured in the blast. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked Sitio Bugtong Kahoy Patrol Base in Asia, Negros Occidental, Philippines. One soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked a military detachment in San Jorge, Samar, Philippines. One soldier was killed and one other was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/27/2018: Assailants stopped two mini-buses and abducted at least 25 passengers in Aq Kakrak, Balkh, Afghanistan. An unknown number of female hostages were released as of November 28, 2018. The fate of the remaining hostages is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/26/2018: Assailants abducted at least three civilians in Umm al-Aranib, Murzuq, Libya. At least one hostage escaped and two other hostages were freed a short while later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the Fezzan Province of the Islamic State was involved in the attack.
gname: Fezzan Province of the Islamic State

summary: 11/28/2018: Assailants attacked the district center of Dara-i-Sufi Payin district, Samangan, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and eight people, including four police officers and four assailants, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Oronto, Hiiraan, Somalia. At least three assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were injured. It is unknown if the military sustained casualties. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/27/2018: A landmine detonated targeting soldiers in Mankote, Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/27/2018: Assailants fired rockets at a security check post in Kajori, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a security vehicle in Boya, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked Nacotuco, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. One person was killed and one person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked Shirin Tagab district in Faryab, Afghanistan. One soldier was killed and one soldier was injured when security forces responded to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked the district governor office in Sayyad district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Two Afghan Local Police (ALP) officers were killed and two were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated prematurely as assailants were attempting to plant it in Mandi Kariz, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2018: Assailants ambushed a military vehicle along Ali Abad road near Kunduz, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting District Reserve Guard (DRG) and Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (COBRA) personnel in Minpa, Chhattisgarh, India. One DRG officer, identified as Madvi Sukka, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that Maoists were involved in the attack.

11/27/2018: Assailants set fire to five cars at local businesses along Woodburn Road in Carrickfergus, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the South East Antrim Brigade.
