11/27/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it at an airport in Bulobarde, Hiiraan, Somalia. Two assailants and one Djiboutian African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) soldier were killed in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Kauwa, Kukawa, Borno, Nigeria. Three soldiers were killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

11/27/2018: Assailants armed with firearms attacked Ganjuwa, Bauchi, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of casualties and an unknown number of buildings, including a church, were set on fire in the attack. Additionally, a civilian was reported missing in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Boko Haram and noted that the assailants stated that "all Christians are infidels and they must die unless the renounce their faith and be converted to Islam."

11/27/2018: Assailants abducted two civilians, identified as Udai and Ibrahim, in Arhab district, Sanaa, Yemen. Udai is the son of General People's Congress (GPC) leader Sheikh Mujahid and Ibrahim is the son of GPC leader Sheikh Mohammed Hadi al-Nakee. Their whereabouts are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Army forces in Jubb Al-Ahmar, Hamah, Syria. At least one soldier was killed and there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. Incite the Believers claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources also attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.

11/27/2018: Gunmen set up a roadblock and abducted an unknown number of students and faculty at the University of Bamenda in Bambili, North-West, Cameroon. Additionally, a taxi was set on fire. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Gunmen abducted Anglophone lawyer Suh Fuh Benjamin in Bamenda, North-West, Cameroon. Benjamin was released on November 28th, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the incident was motivated by the victim's defense of Anglophone activists in court.

11/27/2018: Assailants opened fire on Oulad Ghaylan (Brabiche) tribal members in Azara, Timbuktu, Mali. One civilian was injured and one other was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/27/2018: Assailants abducted Miguel Humberto, Manosalva Ovalle, and Jorge Antonio Sanchez, civilians, in Carmen, Norte de Santander, Colombia. Ovalle and Sanchez were rescued by December 1, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 11/27/2018: Assailants abducted six civilians, including Nigeria Customs Service and the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) officers, in Akoko North-West, Ondo, Nigeria. The hostages were released December 1, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

11/27/2018: Assailants severed an oil pipeline in Mayuriaga, Loreto, Peru. Technicians were also physically prevented from halting the spill. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Wampis extremists allegedly sent a letter to Petroperú, a state oil company, threatening to target the oil pipeline unless recent election results were deemed invalid. Other members of the community denied involvement in the attack.
11/28/2018: Assailants abducted and killed a school principal in Ajmeleh, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle and additional assailants stormed the G4S Risk Management Group security compound in Kabul, Afghanistan. At least 11 people, including five assailants, were killed and 32 people were injured in the ensuing clash. British and Nepalese nationals were among the victims. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident and stated the attack was carried out in retaliation for military operations against civilians.
11/28/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device in Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Amrullah Saleh, a former intelligence chief, in Kabul, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) posts in Kwero, Mahagi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three related incidents. At least 11 people, including soldiers, assailants, and civilians were killed, and at least four soldiers were injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) posts in Mukatshi, Mahagi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three related incidents. At least 11 people, including soldiers, assailants, and civilians were killed, and at least four soldiers were injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC) posts in Nzonzo, Mahagi, Ituri, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three related incidents. At least 11 people, including soldiers, assailants, and civilians were killed, and at least four soldiers were injured across the three attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on soldiers in front of Taqraft Camp in Bani Walid, Misrata, Libya. At least two soldiers, identified as Isam Abd-al-Aziz al-Mabruk and Saddam Husayn Blihah, were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/27/2018: Assailants attacked a police post and abducted five police officers in Chahar Bagh, Farah, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on the Nest Cafe Bar in Andalus, Tripoli, Libya. One civilian was killed and another was wounded. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/28/2018: A female suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest at a market in Am Chide, Extreme-North, Cameroon. A second female suicide bomber was shot and killed by security forces. The two assailants were killed and 29 people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/29/2018: Assailants attacked a gendarmerie station in Namsiguian, 65 kilomters from Kongoussi, Bam, Centre-Nord, Burkina Faso. One officer was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Ansar al-Islam (Burkina Faso).
11/28/2018: Security forces discovered and defused 14 explosive devices in the 15th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/28/2018: A sniper shot and killed a soldier at a security checkpoint in Abu Karmah, Diyala, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/28/2018: Assailants denoted two explosive devices and opened fire on police personnel in Vandrangula, Andhra Pradesh, India. Two people, including a police officer and a civilian, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Communist Party of India - Maoist (CPI-Maoist).
11/28/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device at a market in Insein, Yangon, Myanmar. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked Somali military personnel in Ceel Cadde, Hiiraan, Somalia. Five assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked the 118 Battalion in Arege, Abadam, Borno, Nigeria. There were an unknown number of assailant casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

11/28/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Deedar Singh, a village Sarpanch, in Tral, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants armed with firearms abducted Mehraj Ahmad Para, a Peoples' Democratic Party (PDP) worker, and set fire to his vehicle in Litter, Pulwama, Jammu and Kashmir, India. The whereabouts of Para is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Park Rangers post in Vitshumbi, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people, including a ranger and two civilians, were killed and two civilians were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on Edwin Chovwen inside his vehicle along Lagos-Ibadan expressway in Lagos, Nigeria. Chovwen, a Province newspaper investigative journalist, was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Sajad Mirza near Bahauddin Sahab (RA) shrine in Hawal, Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Mirza, a Janata Dal (United) leader, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/28/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Gendarmerie Brigade in Gomboro, Boucle du Mouhoun, Burkina Faso. There were an unknown number of injuries in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/29/2018: Assailants attacked a federal police barracks in Zanqar, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one police officer was injured in the attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) group claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: An unknown number of explosive devices detonated targeting power lines in Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four similar incidents in Diyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at soldiers at a checkpoint in Bosaso, Bari, Puntland, Somalia. Two soldiers were killed and four people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack separately to Jabha East Africa and Al-Shabaab.

11/29/2018: Assailants ambushed a security forces convoy in Juye Ghazi, Herat, Afghanistan. Abdul Matin, the Herat intelligence chief, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/29/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police patrol in Kasserine, Tunisia. One civilian was injured in the assault. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security check post in Gurbaz, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Iraqi Volunteer Fighters in the Himreen Mountains, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. Two volunteer fighters, including Commander Abu Jamal al-Janabi, were killed and three volunteer fighters were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: Security forces discovered and defused an explosive device hidden beneath a dummy in Chintagupha, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

11/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a vehicle in Khar, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two people, including a tribal elder and his bodyguard, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/28/2018: Assailants attacked an African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) patrol in Shalan Bood, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. There were no casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/30/2018: Assailants detonated an explosive device targeting military personnel in Kaunlaran, Remedios Trinidad Romualdez, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Three people, including two Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) members and a soldier, were killed the attack. One soldier was also reported missing following the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

11/29/2018: Assailants abducted 30 civilians in Bangourain, West, Cameroon. The fate of the hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

11/29/2018: An explosive device attached to a vehicle detonated outside a hotel in Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
11/29/2018: Assailants opened fire on a humanitarian aid convoy in eastern Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least one person was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/29/2018: Assailants opened fire on a lieutenant colonel in the Basra Operations Command in Shamal, Al-Zubair, Basra, Iraq. The officer was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/29/2018: Assailants abducted three construction workers on National Highway 2 in Kanglatongbi, Manipur, India. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of Kuki Tribal Militants.

11/29/2018: Assailants opened fire on Charanjeet Singh in Badaber, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Singh, a social activist, was killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility, though two people were arrested in connection with the attack.

11/29/2018: Assailants attacked an Iraqi Volunteer Forces headquarters east of Albu Kamal, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. It is unknown if there were any casualties, but the headquarters was damaged in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting power line workers and their Iraqi Volunteer Forces escort in Hafair, Diyala, Iraq. One volunteer fighter was killed and two were injured in the blast. Five other explosive devices were discovered and defused at the scene. This was one of four similar incidents in Diyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/30/2018: An explosive device detonated near employees of the Basra Oil Company in Rumaila, Basra, Iraq. At least three employees were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/29/2018: Assailant fired mortars at maintenance workers repairing power lines in Diyala, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of four similar incidents in Diyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 11/29/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting volunteer fighters in Diyala, Iraq. Two volunteer fighters were killed in the blast. This was one of four similar incidents in Diyala on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Hariwah, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Ad Dali targeting military personnel on this date. At least 12 assailants and a soldier were killed and seven people were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Husmi, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Ad Dali targeting military personnel on this date. At least 12 assailants and a soldier were killed and seven people were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Jashah, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Ad Dali targeting military personnel on this date. At least 12 assailants and a soldier were killed and seven people were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel in Hayd Kannah, Ad Dali, Yemen. This was one of four related incidents in Ad Dali targeting military personnel on this date. At least 12 assailants and a soldier were killed and seven people were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked Goof Gaduud village in Bay, Somalia. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

11/30/2018: An explosive device detonated and assailants opened fire targeting a security convoy escorting goldmine workers in Boungou, Gnagna, Est, Burkina Faso. Five people, including four police officers, were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Philippine Navy soldier, identified as Senior Chief Petty Officer Jesus Jacinto Zaavedra, in Binodegahan, Albay, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sparrow Unit of the New People's Army (NPA).

11/30/2018: A Jordanian assailant armed with a hammer assaulted two Israeli port employees at the Eilat port in Eilat, Southern, Israel. Three people, including the two employees and a bystander, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Jordanian national, identified as Taher Khalaf.

11/30/2018: Assailants shelled a residential area in Samtah, Jazan, Saudi Arabia. Two civilians were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

11/30/2018: Assailants abducted 10 construction employees and set fire to at least 14 construction vehicles in Etapalli, Maharashtra, India. The hostages were released the following day on December 1, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.
11/30/2018: Assailants set fire to a vehicle owned by Derry City on Rathmore Crescent, Londonderry, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on Abdullateh Yanya in Kasang, Bannang Sata, Yala, Thailand. Yanya, a local subdistrict head, was killed in the attack and an assailant was killed in an ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Runda Kumpulan Kecil (RKK).
11/30/2018: An explosive device targeting a civilian vehicle detonated in Shinwari, Parwan, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked a military base in Arege, Abadam, Borno, Nigeria. One soldier was killed and seven others were injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

11/30/2018: Assailants threw a petrol bomb near the residence of A R Mahalakshmi, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) state women’s wing president, in Teppakulam, Tamil Nadu, India. There were no reported injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/29/2018: A pressure bomb detonated in Kakri Forest, Chhattisgarh, India. At least one police officer, identified as Assistant Constable Renu Bhaskar, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

11/27/2018: Assailants fired projectiles intending to target a military convoy in Nad Ali district, Helmand, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and 14 others were injured when the projectiles hit civilian residences. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked a military convoy in Moshki, Qarabagh, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least five assailants, two soldiers, and three civilians were killed and seven people were injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost in Parchawi, Helmand, Afghanistan. Seven police officers were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
11/30/2018: Assailants opened fire on Tera police station in Tera, Tillaberi, Niger. A customs official was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants attacked a police check post in Vavunathivu, Eastern, Sri Lanka. Two police officers, identified as Dinesh Ganesh and Niroshan Indika, were killed in the attack. Rasanayagam Saravanandan, a former member of the now defunct Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE), claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a tax official's vehicle in Wedow, Banaadir, Somalia. Four people, including the tax official and three bodyguards, were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: An explosive device detonated on a passenger train in Harisinga, Assam, India. Three people were injured in the blast. The All (Baksa District) B.F.D.N Sangodan claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) members in Kibudoc, North Cotabato, Philippines. Three MNLF members were killed and three others were injured in the attack. Additionally, one other member was reported missing. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

11/30/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the United States (US) consulate on Calle Progreso 175 in Guadalajara, Mexico. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG).

12/01/2018: Assailants stormed the Dar as Salam hospital and held dozens of administrative and medical staff hostage in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. At least 12 nuns and 42 patients were detained in the attack. The outcome of the incident is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
12/01/2018: Security forces identified and shot down an explosives-laden drone in Marib, Yemen. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked an army base in Buni Gari, Gujba, Yobe, Nigeria. At least eight soldiers and 10 assailants were killed in the incident. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/01/2018: Two suicide bombers were stopped by Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) members at a checkpoint and one detonated their device in Maiduguri, Borno, Nigeria. Five CJTF members were injured and the two assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

12/01/2018: Assailants set fire to four forest machinery trucks between Collipulli and Curaco, Araucania, Chile. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Mapuche extremists claimed responsibility for the incident and alluded to the situation of Camilo Catrillanca.

12/01/2018: Assailants abducted seven people, including traditional ruler Semh Mbinglo, from Kumbo, North-West, Cameroon. Mbinglo was released the following day on December 2, 2018, but the fate of the remaining six hostages is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

12/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Special Deterrence Forces in Souq al-Juma, Tripoli, Libya. One Deterrence member, Fadhl Yunus Fadhl, was killed and one civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries.

12/01/2018: Assailants abducted 25 Istaka Karya construction workers from a camp in Nduga, Papua, Indonesia. The hostages were marched to the Karunggame River, where they were kept overnight. The following day, December 2, 2018, they were marched to Puncak Kabo hill, where the assailants opened fire on the workers. At least 14 workers were killed while the other 11 hostages pretended to be dead. Upon attempting an escape, the 11 victims were spotted and the assailants caught and slit the throats of five more hostages. Four of the remaining hostages made it safely to a TNI outpost while the other two hostages were reported missing. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of checkposts in Andkhoy district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks on checkposts in Faryab on this date. At least 11 assailants and seven security forces were killed, while 24 assailants and 11 security forces were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked an unknown number of checkposts in Qurghan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks on checkposts in Faryab on this date. At least 11 assailants and seven security forces were killed, while 24 assailants and 11 security forces were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/01/2018: Assailants opened fire on Nelson Ligaya, a village chief, in Paloma, near Bacolod, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Ligaya was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: Assailants abducted Naresh Salame in Belgaon, Chhattisgarh, India. Salame was killed shortly thereafter. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists and noted that the victim was accused of being a police informant.

12/01/2018: Assailants abducted Jesus Alejandro Marquez Jimenez in Tepic, Nayarit, Mexico. Marquez, a Orion Informativo journalist, was shot and killed shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: An explosive device detonated in Injari, Andhra Pradesh, India. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked Machava, Nangade, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. Four people were killed in the attack, including a district administrator. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked Fifth Congress, Nangade, Cabo Delgado province, Mozambique. One person was killed and another was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked members of a pro-government militia in Kishindih district, Balkh, Afghanistan. Six militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked members of a pro-government militia in Hazaraha, Takhar, Afghanistan. Four militia members were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/02/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of the director of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications detonated at a checkpoint near the ministry in Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. The driver of the vehicle, Sa'id Huke Jama, was killed and two civilians were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/02/2018: Assailants attacked the son of Ali Ja'far Daquqalli, member of the Badr Organization Office and Hizballah, in Daquq, Kirkuk, Iraq. It is unknown whether he was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/02/2018: Assailants opened fire at a People’s Militia Forces (PMFs) camp in Muse district, Shan, Myanmar. At least three border guards were killed and two guards were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/02/2018: Assailants stopped coal trucks and abducted 45 drivers in Khushk Dara, Samangan, Afghanistan. The hostages were released shortly after the kidnapping. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban and stated that the drivers refused to respond to the group's extortion demand.
12/02/2018: Assailants shot and killed a soldier in Silini, Benghazi, Libya. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/02/2018: Assailants fired a missile toward Marib, Yemen. Security forces intercepted the missile. No casualties were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/02/2018: Assailants set fire to a truck in Hedri, Maharashtra, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/02/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Jay Mamasabulod, a municipal administrator, in Pagalungan, Maguindanao, Philippines. The caretaker of the home was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/02/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated prematurely in Maruf district, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least 35 assailants were killed and an unknown number of assailants were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the incident to the Taliban, which the group denied. Sources also noted that the vehicle was intended to target security forces.
12/02/2018: An explosive device detonated in Mazari Garhi, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Two people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
12/02/2018: Security forces defused explosive devices planted at a gas pipeline in Rukanpur, Punjab, Pakistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2018: Assailants attacked Kurdi an Nasir, Hawijah, Kirkuk, Iraq. At least one person was killed and two others were injured in the incident. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

The whereabouts of Al-Shibani, a field monitor for the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR), are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

At least one soldier was killed and another soldier was injured in the assault. This attack targeted an outpost where four construction workers were seeking refuge from a previous incident. The Free Papua Movement (OPM-Organisasi Papua Merdeka) claimed responsibility for the attack.
12/03/2018: Security forces discovered and defused two explosive devices in northwest Mogadishu, Somalia. Jabha East Africa claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at the residence of Ma'alin Nur Hassan Ibrahim in Baidoa, Bay, Somalia. Ibrahim, a former Transitional Federal Parliament member, was among three people who were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants attacked a group of fishermen in Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

12/00/2018: Sometime between December 1, 2018 and December 3, 2018, assailants attacked an army base in Malum Fatori, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related incidents in Borno on the same day. There were an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

This was one of three related incidents in Borno on the same day. There were an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

12/00/2018: Sometime between December 1, 2018 and December 3, 2018, assailants attacked an army base in Kangarwa, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of three related incidents in Borno on the same day. There were an unknown number of casualties across all three attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

12/03/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in the Defense Housing Authority neighborhood of Karachi, Pakistan. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on Frederick Valin, a former barangay captain, in Cabuago, La Union, Philippines. Valin was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a gendarmerie patrol in Bougui, Est, Burkina Faso. Six assailants were killed and one gendarme was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2018: Assailants attacked police personnel in Sayyad district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. At least 12 people, including seven assailants and five police officers, were killed and 10 people, including three assailants and seven officers, were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/03/2018: Assailants opened fire on a vehicle carrying journalists in Sarband, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. A journalist, Noorul Hassan, was killed and a camera operator, Sabir, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/01/2018: Assailants attacked a Civilian Active Auxiliary (CAA) patrol base in Lindoy, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/03/2018: Assailants abducted two women in Uduwa, Chikun, Kaduna, Nigeria. The women were rescued the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
12/03/2018: Assailants shot and killed a police officer in Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/03/2018: Assailants abducted the Fon of Wat in Donga-Mantung, North-West, Cameroon. The hostage was released on December 5, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/03/2018: Assailants attacked a Tiv community in Abako, Benue, Nigeria. This was one of two attacks on Tiv communities on this date. At least one person was killed and several houses were burned across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/03/2018: Assailants attacked a Tiv community in Sai, Taraba, Nigeria. This was one of two attacks on Tiv communities on this date. At least one person was killed and several houses were burned across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/03/2018: Assailants attacked Border Post 64 near the Bangladesh border in Maungdaw district, Rakhine, Myanmar. The ensuing clash lasted until December 4, 2018. 12/04/2018: Assailants attacked civilians in Amrini, Nineveh, Iraq. Village mukhtar Al-Shaeikh Raghib Abid al-Hadi al-Badrani was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant.

summary: 12/04/2018: A civilian was shot and killed in their car outside of St. Mary's Grammar School on Glen Road in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Irish National Liberation Army (INLA).

12/04/2018: Assailants attacked a police checkpoint in Herat, Afghanistan. At least ten people, including one police officer, three civilians, and six assailants, were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/04/2018: Assailants abducted Engineer Zalmay, a radio and television director, in the 4th police district of Jalalabad, Nangarhar, Afghanistan. A driver was killed in the attack. The hostage was released on April 10, 2019. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting José Auden Bautista, a farmer, in Hacari, Norte de Santander, Colombia. A farmer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the National Liberation Army of Colombia (ELN).

There were conflicting reports whether commander Hozan Abu Agid was killed; additionally, at least one member was injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attack.

summary: 12/04/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Ismail Sheikh Khalifa detonated in Waberi, Mogadishu, Somalia. Khalifa, the director of Hiddo Radio, was injured in the blast. 12/04/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police officers in Hawz Madad, Zharay, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and one was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/04/2018: Assailants threw firebombs at a security detail guarding the residence of Minister of State Alekos Flambouraris in Exarcheia, Athens, Attica, Greece. At least one officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Shopian district, Jammu and Kashmir, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants opened fire on Romeo Tumapon Mainar, a member of the Sangguniang Bayan, in Bobongan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Mainar was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two former Maoists accused of being police informants in Bastar district, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/04/2018: Assailants abducted five people, including Federal Medical Centre (FMC) workers and Rufus Giwa Polytechnic lecturers, in Amurin, Ondo, Nigeria. One was released by December 6, 2018, one was found dead on December 10, 2018 and the fate of the remaining three is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

Three hostages were released shorty following the attack, one was killed and the remaining four were released by December 7, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/04/2018: An explosive device detonated when a child stepped on it near a school in Amhara, Ethiopia. Two children were killed and six people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants abducted four Directorate of Refugees and Repatriation employees in Mir Ali, Herat, Afghanistan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants shot and killed two members of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) in the 14th police district of Kandahar, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/04/2018: Assailants attacked the location of the Maguindanao massacre memorial in Masalay, Ampatuan, Maguindanao, Philippines. At least four assailants were killed in the attack. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Movement (BIFM) claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/04/2018: Assailants fired a mortar targeting a civilian residence in Barawolo Kalay, Kunar, Afghanistan. One civilian was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/06/2018: Assailants opened fire on residents, briefly took residents hostage, and set fire to buildings in Mangolikene, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 13 people were killed in the assault. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/06/2018: Assailants abducted five residents in Paida, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. All five hostages were executed a short time later and two other people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/06/2018: An explosive device detonated near a military convoy carrying high-ranking military personnel outside Dhanaane, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. 12/06/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) base in Chashmah, Herat, Afghanistan. At least 14 soldiers and 30 assailants were killed and 20 soldiers were abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

In addition to the assailant, at least two police officers were killed and at least 42 people were injured, including civilians and police. Ansar al-Furqan claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/06/2018: Assailants attacked military outposts in Chora district, Uruzgan, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the district on the same night. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attacks.

12/06/2018: Assailants abducted Manku Potai in Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh, India. Potai, a deputy sarpanch and former Maoist, was killed shortly after the kidnapping. Maoists claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/06/2018: Assailants shelled a shopping center in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. No casualties were reported in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/11/2018: An explosive device detonated in an orchard in Yusuf Bak, near Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. At least two police officers were killed and four civilians were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/11/2018: Assailants attacked Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least six people were killed and 14 houses were set on fire in the attack. Additionally, three people were abducted, and the outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2018: Assailants attacked Nalyandele, Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least three people were killed and 15 houses were set on fire in the attack. It is unknown whether there were any other casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2018: Assailants attacked Miando, 10 km from Palma, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. One taxi driver was injured in the attack and several houses were set on fire in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2018: Assailants publicly executed three people, including two soldiers and a tribal elder, by firing squad in Mubaarak, Lower Shebelle, Somalia. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victims were executed for being in the military and participating in local elections.

12/11/2018: Assailants shot and killed a police applicant at his residence in Santo Domingo, Sorsogon, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the New People's Army (NPA) carried out the attack.

12/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Philippine Army (PA) detachment in Asinan, Matanao, Davao del Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/11/2018: Assailants attacked army posts in Marawara district, Kunar, Afghanistan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two related attacks in different districts of Kunar on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/11/2018: Assailants attacked army posts in Wata Pur district, Kunar, Afghanistan. The attack resulted in an unknown number of casualties. This was one of two related attacks in different districts of Kunar on the same day. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incidents to the Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State.

summary: 12/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police post in Zainapora village, Jammu and Kashmir, India. Four police officers were killed in the attack. Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2018: An assailant opened fire after Mass at the Metropolitan Cathedral in Campinas, Sao Paulo, Brazil. At least four people were killed and four other people were injured in the assault. After the assailant was shot in the rib by responding police officers, he turned the gun on himself and committed suicide. No group claimed responsibility; however, the assailant was identified as Euler Fernando Grandolpho.

12/11/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Bouroum-Bouroum, Sud-Ouest, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties, though offices and vehicles were set on fire in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/11/2018: An assailant attempted to ram his vehicle into Israeli Civil Administration patrol in Idhna, West Bank. One border police officer was injured in the attack. The assailant was shot and killed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist, identified as Omar Awwad.

12/11/2018: An assailant attempted to ram his vehicle into Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Jordan Valley, West Bank. The assailant was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to a Palestinian extremist.

12/11/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel in Chintagupha, Chhattisgarh, India. One CRPF officer was killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Ranger patrol in Ban Hae, Rangae, Narathiwat, Thailand. At least two assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants attacked military personnel at a checkpoint in Salma, Herat, Afghanistan. Four soldiers were killed in the attack. The Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
gname: Khorasan Chapter of the Islamic State

summary: 12/12/2018: A suicide bomber detonated her explosives prematurely while approaching a security checkpoint in Gajire, Maiduguri, Borno province, Nigeria. The assailant was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected that Boko Haram was responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants attacked military checkpoints in Haider Abad, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Three assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on security forces in Aliabad district, Kunduz, Afghanistan. One police officer was killed and one member of the National Directorate of Security (NDS) was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/12/2018: Assailants shot and killed a police officer, identified as SPO4 Ronald Galap, in Tanggal, Isabela, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident in a note left at the scene.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Datu Jumar Bucales in San Isidro, Surigao del Sur, Philippines. Bucales, a tribal leader and former New People's Army (NPA) member, was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected that the New People's Army (NPA) carried out the attack.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Samsudin Abdulkarim, a village councilor, in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, Philippines. Abdulkarim was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Felisberto A. Dumadag III, a concurrent member of the Sangguniang Bayan in Surigao del Norte and Tubod, in Surigao del Norte, Philippines. Dumadag was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Ahmad Kumayog, a Barangay Mudsing treasurer and civic society leader, in Midsayap, North Cotabato, Philippines. Kumayog was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: An explosive device detonated near Kurdistan 24 journalists Akram Salih and Haitham Hassan outside Hajin, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. Neither Salih, a reporter, nor Hassan, a camera operator, were injured as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/12/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near a Turkish Post Office (PTT) building in Al-Rai, Aleppo, Syria. At least eight people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

12/12/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated near Al-Majed Hospital in Cami Kebir neighborhood, Bab, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and seven other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

12/12/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated near Al-Ahaly Hospital in Azaz, Aleppo, Syria. At least one person was killed and 18 other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/12/2018: Assailants threw a Molotov cocktail and opened fire on the house of Milan Jovanovic in Vrcin, Belgrade, Serbia. Jovanovic, an investigative journalist for Zig Info, and his wife were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/00/2018: Sometime between December 9, 2018 and December 14, 2018, a suicide bomber detonated in Kolofata, Extreme-North, Cameroon. The outcome of the blast is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/00/2018: Sometime between December 9, 2018 and December 14, 2018, a suicide bomber detonated in Kolofata, Extreme-North, Cameroon. The outcome of the blast is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants attacked Shib Koh district in Farah, Afghanistan. At least 20 assailants were killed and 15 were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants attacked a checkpoint belonging to the police officers providing security for the Herat-Khawf railroad in the Cheshmadam, Herat, Afghanistan. At least five police officers were killed, four were injured, and three were abducted. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/12/2018: Assailants opened fire on Oscar Andig, a Teduray chieftain, while he was tending his cattle in Saniag, Maguindanao, Philippines. Andig was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Assailants attacked Dhagaxyaale, Galguduud, Somalia. Militia forces responded to the incident. It is unknown if the ensuing clash resulted in casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.
12/13/2018: Security forces discovered and defused five explosive devices at Ibn Sina hospital in Sirte, Libya. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Assailants set fire to an Independent National Electoral Commission (CENI) warehouse in Gombe, Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: An assailant opened fire on Israeli soldiers at a bus stop in Givat Assaf, near Orfa, north of Ramallah, West Bank. Two soldiers, identified as Yuval Mor Yosef and Yosef Cohen, were killed, and two others, including a soldier and civilian, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Asam Barghouti, a Palestinian extremist.

12/13/2018: An assailant stabbed two police officers in Old City, Jerusalem, West Bank. Both officers were injured and the assailant was killed when police opened fire. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Majd Jamal Mteir, a Palestinian extremist.

12/13/2018: Assailants attacked Syed Ali Alavi in Sangcharak district, Sari Pul, Afghanistan. Alavi, a senior police officer, was killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/12/2018: Assailants attacked Tuareg civilians in Tinabaw, Menaka, Mali. This was one of two coordinated attacks on the same night. At least 47 people were killed across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of Muslim extremists.

12/13/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct a police officer, identified as Special Police Officer 3 Reil Morgado, from his residence in Jagupit, Agusan del Norte, Philippines. Morgado was shot and killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
12/13/2018: Security forces identified and killed a suicide bomber in Tarmiyah, Saladin, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on Sahabudin Madendog, a barangay chairman, and his son Nasrudin Tumagantang in Tugal, North Cotabato, Mindanao, Philippines. Madendog was killed and Tumagantang was wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/13/2018: Assailants threw a hand grenade at Vishal Mega Mart in Imphal, Manipur, India. There were no casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Assailants attacked the former Deputy Commissioner of Police, Innocent Brown, and his wife in Umuoke, Imo, Nigeria. Brown and his wife were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Assailants opened fire on Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) soldiers in Tall Rifat, Aleppo, Syria. At least one soldier was killed and four other soldiers were injured in the assault. The People's Protection Units (YPG) claimed responsibility for the attack. Sources also attributed the incident to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

12/13/2018: An explosives-laden motorcycle detonated in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. At least four people were killed and nine other people were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/13/2018: An explosive device detonated inside a house in Haraz, Taizz, Yemen. Two civilians were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/13/2018: Assailants set fire to the house of Gabsa Nyagha Sixtus, a disarmament committee coordinator, in North-West, Cameroon. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/13/2018: Security forces intercepted two ballistic missiles fired over Rawda, Marib, Yemen. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.
12/14/2018: Assailants beheaded three fishermen in Nfindi, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/13/2018: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Kandahar, Afghanistan. A police commander was killed and another police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Assailants attacked security posts in Mangoti, Jawzjan, Afghanistan. Seven security personnel were killed and five were injured in the attack. The victims included National Uprising Movement (NUM) members and police officers. In addition, the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/14/2018: An explosive device attached to a police vehicle detonated in Diwaniyah, Al Qadisiyah, Iraq. A police officer was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on an uprising commander at a funeral ceremony in Dawlatabad district, Balkh, Afghanistan. At least five people were killed and five people were injured. The victims included uprising members, police, and civilians; it is unknown if the uprising commander was among the casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/14/2018: Police identified and arrested two individuals who were planting a landmine in Naz Dara, Parwan, Afghanistan. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Assailants armed with explosive devices ambushed a Frontier Corps (FC) convoy in Wakai, Balochistan, Pakistan. At least six soldiers and four assailants were killed and 14 soldiers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA), the Baloch Liberation Front (BLF), and the Baloch Republican Guards (BRG) jointly claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on Bacolod City councilor Ricardo Tan and his wife in Alangilan, Negros Occidental, Philippines. Both Tan and his wife were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: An assailant stabbed a soldier and hit him on the head with a stone near Beit El, West Bank. The soldier was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Palestinian extremists.

12/14/2018: Assailants opened fire on a food distribution exercise led by the military in Gudunbali, Borno, Nigeria. At least one soldier and 28 assailants were killed, one person was injured, and an unknown number were reported missing following the assault. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.
12/14/2018: An explosive device detonated at a police station in Chombala, Kerala, India. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Two female suicide bombers detonated targeting a civilian residence in Kolofata, Extreme-North, Cameroon. The assailants were killed and two civilians were injured in the blasts. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/14/2018: Assailants ambushed and attempted to kidnap the former President-General of the Arondizuogu Progressive Union, Uche Ohia, in Imo, Nigeria. Ohia escaped and was not harmed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Police forces discovered and defused two explosive devices near Churagaon, Chhattisgarh, India. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attempted attack to Maoists and noted that the devices were likely meant to target police forces attempting to establish a medical camp in the area.

12/14/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian, identified as Ali al-Ahmadi, from his residence in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/14/2018: Gunmen opened fire on Hamid Ansari near Chinpina village in West Bengal, India. Ansari, an All India Trinamool Congress (AITMC) leader, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants attacked a security forces convoy in Gardez, Paktia, Afghanistan. A rocket fired during the ensuing clash hit a civilian home, killing three people and injuring four others. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the Taliban carried out the attack.

12/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on Salah Al-Marghani at his residence in Bin Ashur, Tripoli, Libya. Al-Marghani, a former Katiba Qasr Bin Ghashir militia commander, was injured and his wife was killed in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/15/2018: Assailants attacked rice plantations in Zabarmari, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks targeting rice plantations in Borno on this day. Four farmers were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/15/2018: Assailants attacked rice plantations in Koshebe, Borno, Nigeria. This was one of two related attacks targeting rice plantations in Borno on this day. Four farmers were killed across the attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.
12/15/2018: Assailants abducted Hamidou Hangadoumbo, traditional chief, in Bolsi, Tillaberi, Niger. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants opened fire on the residence of Mario Mantayona, a Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) member, in Palma Gi, Davao del Norte, Philippines. His wife, Gina Mantayona, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
12/15/2018: Assailants launched a rocket at an airport in Menaka, Mali. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: A roadside explosive device detonated targeting civilians in Jaghuri district, Ghazni, Afghanistan. Two civilians were killed and four were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants stopped three passenger vehicles and set them on fire between Rusizi and Huye in Nyamagabe district, Southern, Rwanda. At least four people were killed and six people were injured in the attack. Additionally, 74 people were abducted. The hostages were rescued by security forces on December 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants set fire to an Independent National Electoral Commission (CENI) warehouse in Yumbi, Mai-Ndombe, Bandundu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties, but electoral materials were destroyed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it on the outskirts of Qalat, Zabul, Afghanistan. Five assailants were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/15/2018: A police officer opened fire on his colleagues in Khak Chopan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. Five officers were killed and one officer was injured in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants attacked a border police post in the Sra Sahan, Kandahar, Afghanistan. At least seven border police officers and seven assailants were killed while three police officers and seven insurgents were injured in the ensuing clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military convoy in Gamboru, Borno, Nigeria. At least two soldiers were killed and one soldier was injured in the blast. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/15/2018: Assailants abducted Michael Olopete, a Rufus Giwa Polytechnic Owo lecturer, on Owo-Ipele Road, Ondo, Nigeria. Olopete was released on December 17, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/15/2018: Assailants abducted an unknown number of students in Ilu Abo, Akure North, Ondo, Nigeria. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/15/2018: Assailants abducted three family members, including Bunmi Falodun, a civil servant in Oba Akoko, Ondo, Nigeria. Falodun was injured while in captivity. The three hostages were released on December 19, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.

12/15/2018: Assailants stopped 12 coal trucks and set them on fire in Kusumba, Jharkhand, India. There were no reported casualties in the attack. The People's Liberation Front of India claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/15/2018: Assailants set fire to the house of Paul John Dizon, the president of the United Workers of Suyapa Farms union in Compostela, Compostela Valley, Philippines. There were no injuries but a number of residences and offices were destroyed. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 12/15/2018: Assailants abducted Edith Blais and Luca Tacchetto between Bobo-Dioulasso and Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. Both Blais, a Canadian national, and Tacchetto, an Italian national, escaped from their captors in Mali on March 14, 2020. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

The four victims were executed and their bodies were discovered on February 16, 2019. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol west of Ramadi, Al Anbar, Iraq. At least one police officer was killed and two others were injured in the blast. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.

summary: 12/14/2018: Assailants attacked Abdul Rehman, a police chief, in Ishkamish district, Takhar, Afghanistan. Rehman and his guard were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting Frontier Corps (FC) in Sibi district, Balochistan, Pakistan. One soldier was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

At least nine people, including five pro-Turkey fighters, were killed and 18 other people were injured in the blast. Wrath of Olives claimed responsibility for the attack and demanded that the Turkish military leave Afrin.
12/16/2018: An explosives-laden vehicle was discovered and defused near a medical office in Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/16/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused in Ashrafieh neighborhood, Afrin, Aleppo, Syria. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/16/2018: An explosive device attached to the vehicle of Mohamoud Omar Ahmed detonated in Hodan, Mogadishu, Somalia. Ahmed, the Somali Football Federation's vice-chairman for Middle Shebelle region, was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Doruma, Haut-Uele, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties, but the assailants looted bags of decorticated groundnuts and restricted resident movement. The incident lasted until at least December 22, 2018. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA).

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Kanwing Andre, a police commissioner, in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. He was injured in the attack; however was killed in a later attack the same day. This was one of two related attacks on Andre on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.

12/16/2018: Assailants shot and killed Kanwing Andre, a police commissioner, at a hospital where he was recovering from an earlier attack the same day in Ndop, North-West, Cameroon. This was one of two related attacks on Andre on this day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of separatists.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked an Independent National Electoral Commission warehouse in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked a military checkpoint near Maghara, Hasna, North Sinai, Egypt. At least five people, including two assailants and three soldiers, were killed and three soldiers were injured in the attack. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
