summary: 12/16/2018: Assailants attacked members of the Afghan Army in Malmanji, Badghis, Afghanistan. Eight soldiers were killed and 10 were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Tamazon village in Uruzgan, Afghanistan. Two police officers were killed and three were injured in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
12/16/2018: Assailants shot and killed Benjamin Oculto, a municipal councilor and vice mayor candidate, in Poblacion, Pangasinan, Philippines. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Banunu tribe residents and destroyed buildings in Bongende, Bandundu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least 339 people were killed in the assault, which lasted until December 18, 2018. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different villages in the area on the same day. At least 111 people were injured across the four events. In addition, several of the victims were behaded or sexually assaulted; it is unknown if any hostages were taken and held by the assailants beyond 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Batende tribal members and posited that the incidents were related to conflicts over resources and monthly tribal duties.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Banunu tribe residents and destroyed buildings in Yumbi, Bandundu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different villages in the area on the same day. At least 196 people, including five assailants, were killed across three of the assaults, while 111 people were injured across all four events. The ensuing clashes lasted until December 18, 2018. In addition, several of the victims were behaded or sexually assaulted; it is unknown if any hostages were taken and held by the assailants beyond 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Batende tribal members and posited that the incidents were related to conflicts over resources and monthly tribal duties.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Banunu tribe residents and destroyed buildings in Nkolo, Bandundu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different villages in the area on the same day. At least 196 people, including five assailants, were killed across three of the assaults, while 111 people were injured across all four events. The ensuing clashes lasted until December 18, 2018. In addition, several of the victims were behaded or sexually assaulted; it is unknown if any hostages were taken and held by the assailants beyond 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Batende tribal members and posited that the incidents were related to conflicts over resources and monthly tribal duties.

12/16/2018: Assailants attacked Banunu tribe residents and destroyed buildings in Camp Nbanzi, Bandundu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of four coordinated incidents in different villages in the area on the same day. At least 196 people, including five assailants, were killed across three of the assaults, while 111 people were injured across all four events. The ensuing clashes lasted until December 18, 2018. In addition, several of the victims were behaded or sexually assaulted; it is unknown if any hostages were taken and held by the assailants beyond 24 hours. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to Batende tribal members and posited that the incidents were related to conflicts over resources and monthly tribal duties.

12/17/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting the Skai TV headquarters in Moschato-Tavros, Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties in the blast. The Group of Popular Fighters claimed responsibility for the incident and accused Skai TV of being capitalist.

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police station in Poblacion, Sorsogon, Philippines. At least four people, including three police officers and one civilian, were injured in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire at a police detachment in San Ignacio, Sorsogon, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police detachment in Cristo Rey, Camarines Sur, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in Camarines Sur on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police detachment in Panoypoyan, Camarines Sur, Philippines. One police officer was injured in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in Camarines Sur on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/17/2018: Assailants abducted Irenio Bohorquez Contreras, a farmer, from Aguas Claras, Norte de Santander, Colombia. The hostage was released on March 21, 2019. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/17/2018: Assailants attacked security forces in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting government forces in the city on the same day. At least 150 assailants were killed between the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied responsibility.

12/17/2018: Assailants attacked security forces in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of two coordinated attacks targeting government forces in the city on the same day. At least 150 assailants were killed between the two attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah), who denied responsibility.
12/17/2018: Assailants shot and killed a Criminal Investigation Department officer in Shibam, Hadramawt, Yemen. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/17/2018: Two roadside bombs detonated targeting a police convoy west of Rafah, North Sinai, Egypt. Two police officers were killed and six officers were injured in the blasts. The Sinai Province of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

summary: 12/17/2018: Assailants beheaded two women, identified as Louisa Vesterager Jespersen and Maren Ueland on a trail in the High Atlas Mountains near Imlil, Marrakech-Tensift-El Haouz, Morocco. Four assailants were arrested in connection with the attack. In a video, the assailants pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) and stated that the attack was "revenge for our brothers in Hajin."
12/17/2018: Assailants attacked a vigilante unit in Olumbe, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. One person was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a lorry in Mangboko, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. A driver was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on a delivery truck in Caraudan, Iloilo, Philippines. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, source attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA) and the Alex Boncayao Brigade (ABB).

12/15/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel near Bhairamgarh, Chhattisgarh, India. Three police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Maoists.

12/17/2018: Assailants in Bangladesh opened fire on a Myanmar police patrol in Maungdaw district, Rakhine, Myanmar. One police officer was injured and another was reported missing in the ensuing clash. The missing officer, Aung Kyaw Thet, was killed and his body was recovered in Bangladesh on December 21, 2018. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/17/2018: Assailants gunned down Amaka Chukwu, a chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party, in Ideato South, Imo, Nigeria. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/17/2018: Assailants opened fire on police officers in Hani, Diyarbakir, Turkey. One officer was killed and one officer was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

12/17/2018: Assailants slit the throats of two Buddhists fishing along Pyu Ma creek in Maungdaw district, Rakhine, Myanmar. The two fishermen were killed in the attack. This was one of two attacks on Buddhist fishermen in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Rohingya extremists.

12/17/2018: Assailants attacked and injured two Buddhists fishing along Pyu Ma creek in Maungdaw district, Rakhine, Myanmar. This was one of two attacks on Buddhist fishermen in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Rohingya extremists.
12/14/2018: Assailants abducted six students and a teacher near Nkwen, North-West, Cameroon. The hostages were released on December 20, 2019. Separatists claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/18/2018: Assailants detonated a landmine and opened fire on a military vehicle between Mckinley and Hinatad, Northern Samar, Philippines. Six people, including four soldiers and two civilians, were injured in the blast and ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) detachment in Albangay, Tapaz, Capiz, Philippines. It is unknown whether the attack resulted in any casualties. This was one of two related incidents targeting CAFGU detachments in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) detachment in Katipunan, Tapaz, Capiz, Philippines. There were no reported casualties in the attack. This was one of two related incidents targeting CAFGU detachments in the area on this date. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the New People's Army (NPA).
12/18/2018: Assailants attacked and killed three civilians in Ubur, west of Mosul, Nineveh, Iraq. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/18/2018: Assailants equipped with firearms entered the Hasawneh pumping station and threatened workers in Jafara, Libya. There were no reported casualties, though valuables were stolen during the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on a motorcycle at Kilometer 5 between Mbau and Kamango, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. Three people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/18/2018: An explosive device detonated as assailants were planting it in Shirin Tagab, Faryab, Afghanistan. Four assailants were killed and two others were wounded in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, source attributed the attack to the Taliban and noted that the device was likely intended to target security forces.

12/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on Quizon Situl, a tribal chief, in Sayog, Lapuyan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Situl was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/18/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) post in Darwazagi, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks targeting posts in Darwazagi on this date. At least eight assailants and three soldiers were killed across the ensuing clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/18/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan National Army (ANA) post in Darwazagi, Zabul, Afghanistan. This was one of two related attacks targeting posts in Darwazagi on this date. At least eight assailants and three soldiers were killed across the ensuing clashes. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/18/2018: An explosive device detonated at the residence of Mayalangbam Bilasini Devi in Nongpok Awang Leikai, Manipur, India. Devi, a local village chief, was not harmed as there were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected that the People's Revolutionary Party of Kangleipak-Progressive (PREPAK-P) carried out the attack.

12/18/2018: Assailants opened fire on the vehicle of Alex Badeh, the former Chief of Defense Staff, in Tudu-Uku, Karu, Nasarawa, Nigeria. Badeh was killed, the driver was injured, and another person was abducted in the attack. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/18/2018: An explosive device detonated at a political rally for Jatiya Samajtantrik Dal candidate Hasanul Haque Inu at Bridge No-3 in Bheramara, Khulna, Bangladesh. At least 12 activists were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/19/2018: Assailants attacked Syrian Army positions in Masasneh, Hamah, Syria. At least nine soldiers were killed and 20 other soldiers were injured while the assailants sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Al-Izzah faction of the Free Syrian Army claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/18/2018: Assailants attacked the district center of Gurziwan district, Faryab, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and 12 assailants were injured in the ensuing clash. Security forces also sustained an unknown number of casualties. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/20/2018: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in Arlik, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qaysar district on the same night. At least seven security personnel and eight assailants were killed while ten security personnel and 11 assailants were injured across both attacks. In addition, five security personnel were reported missing. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/20/2018: Assailants attacked a checkpoint in Bori, Faryab, Afghanistan. This was one of two coordinated attacks in Qaysar district on the same night. At least seven security personnel and eight assailants were killed while ten security personnel and 11 assailants were injured across both attacks. In addition, five security personnel were reported missing. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/19/2018: Assailants raided a military detachment in New Tubigon, Agusan del Sur, Philippines. At least 14 people, including two soldiers and 12 Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) members, were abducted and several firearms were stolen in the attack. Six of the hostages were released on February 14, 2019. The remaining eight hostages were released on February 19, 2019. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in order to force the government to agree to a ceasefire over the Christmas holiday.

12/16/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting police personnel between Yopal and Pore, Casanare, Colombia. Two police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Assailants abducted Sergio Antonio Vargas, a merchant, from San Antonio, Cauca, Colombia. Vargas was freed the same day. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents.
gname: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) dissidents

summary: 12/19/2018: Assailants shot and killed Senior Insp. Porferio Gabuya Jr., a deputy police chief, in Poblacion, Negros Oriental, Philippines. The New People's Army (NPA) claimed responsibility for the incident through a text message, but later denied involvement.

12/19/2018: Assailants attacked a nomad camp in Aboungoulou, Menaka, near Anderamboukane, Menaka, Mali. At least six people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS).
gname: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS)

summary: 12/19/2018: Assailants attacked Shitoyo, Macomia, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. At least two people were beheaded and 70 residences were set on fire in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

12/19/2018: Assailants attacked and killed two people in Mandela, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

12/19/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a minibus between Tongo and Asosa in Benishangul-Gumuz, Ethiopia. At least 10 people were killed and one person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Oromo Liberation Front.

12/19/2018: A landmine detonated against a public transport vehicle in Dallah, Mopti, Mali. At least six civilians were killed and six civilians were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.
12/19/2018: An explosive device was discovered and defused near Ibn al-Nafis Hospital in Nidal, Rusafa, Baghdad, Iraq. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/19/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at a residence near Al-Imam Musa al-Kazim Mosque in Basra, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/19/2018: Assailants fired projectiles that landed and detonated near an intersection in Tikrit, Saladin, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Assailants abducted a civilian and attempted to conscript him into fighting in Mahwit, Yemen. The civilian was killed when he attempted to escape. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/19/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a tribal elder in Boghara, Balochistan, Pakistan. Three people, the elder and two of his security guards, were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Security forces arrested two suicide bombers attempting to attack 222 Battalion defensive locations in Mushemiri, Konduga, Borno, Nigeria. Boko Haram claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Assailants attacked a Burkinabe army detachment in Tayaret, Oursi, Sahel, Burkina Faso. There were no reported casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/19/2018: Assailants attacked the pastor of Christ Holy Church, Justice Njigbo, in Onitsha, Anambra, Nigeria. Njigbo was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/19/2018: Assailants attacked an Afghan Local Police (ALP) checkpost in Baghlani Jadid district, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Four police officers and three assailants were killed and three police officers were injured in the ensuing clash. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Assailants armed with firearms and machetes attacked Mwangaza, Cabo Delgado province, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties and at least five houses was set on fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Ansar al-Sunna (Mozambique).

12/19/2018: An assailant shot and killed Edgar Remorosa, a village councilor, in Tibal-og, Davao del Norte, Philippines. Remorosa was killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/19/2018: Assailants abducted former Commissioner Chris Onogba on the Ughelli Asaba express way between Ughelli and Asaba, Delta, Nigeria. The whereabouts of Onogba are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Fulani extremists.
12/19/2018: Assailants opened fire at Hariharhat High School in Gitaldaha, West Bengal, India. At least three teachers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Lam Mai, Yala, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Yala on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on a civil defense post in Ngoh Ka Po, Bannang Sata, Yala, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Yala on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on an Army post in Ban Patae, Yala, Thailand. There were no reported casualties. This was one of three related attacks in Yala on this date. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents.

12/20/2018: Assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade at a police commander's vehicle in Puli Khumri, Baghlan, Afghanistan. Commander Saleem Kochi and one of his bodyguards were killed in the attack. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: An explosive device detonated near the vehicle of Colonel 'Ali Hadi al-Habadi in Mahfad district, Abyan, Yemen. Colonel al-Habadi, the Al Mahfad Sector Security Belt Forces commander was not harmed; however, at least two soldiers were killed and another soldier was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: Assailants attacked a military convoy in San Isidro, Calabugao, Bukidnon, Philippines. Three soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).
12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire at a bus stop in Ofra, West Bank. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: Assailants set fire to an Awami League election office in Sonatunia, Khulna, Bangladesh. There were no injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on a police checkpoint in Kariz, Ghazni, Afghanistan. At least six assailants were killed and three were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2018: Assailants abducted three people, including a village councilor and a city councilor and his son in Manssifigui, Oudalan, Sahel, Burkina Faso. All three hostages were executed and another person was injured a short time later. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim extremists.

12/21/2018: Assailants attacked a police outpost near Faizabad, Badakhshan, Afghanistan. At least 10 officers were abducted. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

12/20/2018: Assailants stopped two vehicles and abducted nine people between Kaya and Yei in Yei River, South Sudan. The outcome of the kidnapping is unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Sudan People's Liberation Movement in Opposition (SPLM-IO). In addition, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the South Sudan National Movement for Change (SSNMC-Unvuas) and the National Salvation Front (NAS), both of whom denied responsibility.
gname: South Sudan National Movement for Change (SSNMC-Unvuas)

summary: 12/20/2018: Assailants attacked Durayhami, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents in Al Hudaydah governorate on this date. At least 11 civilians were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/20/2018: Assailants attacked Hays, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents in Al Hudaydah governorate on this date. At least 11 civilians were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/20/2018: Assailants opened fire on a security personnel patrol in Muhammad Khel, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. At least two soldiers were injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/20/2018: Assailants ambushed military personnel in Sabon Gari, Damboa, Borno, Nigeria. It is unknown if the attack resulted in any casualties. The Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: Assailants attempted to abduct a woman from Buni Gari, Gujba, Yobe, Nigeria. Two assailants were killed by local vigilantes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Boko Haram.

12/20/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Sirwah district, Marib, Yemen. At least 25 assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah) claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/20/2018: Assailants fired missiles targeting military positions in Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. This was one of two related incidents in the city on this date. At least four soldiers were killed and 16 soldiers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists.

12/20/2018: An assailant dressed in a Santa costume opened fire on a house along Dermott Hill Parade in Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to dissident Republicans.

12/20/2018: An assailant armed with a gun and spare magazine attacked two men laying concrete in a nearby driveway after returning to the area where the men previously had verbal altercation in Reisterstown, Baltimore County, Maryland, United States. One of the workers and the assailant were injured in the attack. During the attack, the assailant harassed the workers, repeatedly saying “go back to Africa” and “‘the n-word’.” The assailant was identified as Brandon Higgs and arrested shortly after the incident. Higgs had been involved with neo-Nazi groups and had a tattoo of a white nationalist symbol. Higgs was found guilty on several charges, including hate crimes, on September 23, 2020 and sentenced to 25 years in prison.

12/21/2018: Assailants set fire to buildings in Chicomo, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique. There were no reported casualties but approximately 103 residences were destroyed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: Assailants threw an explosive device at a police headquarters in Shihr, Hadramawt, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the blast. This was one of two related attacks at the headquarters within a short period. Ansar Al-Sharia, a subgroup of Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP), claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: An explosive device detonated outside a police headquarters in Shihr, Hadramawt, Yemen. At least two civilians were killed and 45 others were injured in the blast. This was one of two related attacks at the headquarters within a short period. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP), which denied responsibility and stated that government forces were responsible for the second blast.

12/21/2018: An explosive device planted in a vehicle detonated at a police checkpoint in Mogadishu, Somalia. An immigration department employee was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: Assailants fired mortars at security forces in al-Fazah area of Hudaydah, Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Houthi extremists, who denied involvement.

12/21/2018: An incendiary device was used to start a fire at a liquor store in Camp Sarah, Karada, Baghdad, Iraq. There were no reported casualties in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: Assailants killed an individual and left a severed head in front of the Expreso newspaper office in Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico. An unknown group claimed responsibility for the incident in a note left at the scene and stated "For newspapers allied with million (dollar) agreements with (Gov. Francisco Garcia) Cabeza de Vaca, they are not going to save you and here is the proof."

12/21/2018: Assailants used slingshots and rocks to attack an RWE energy firm truck in Hambach Forest, Dusseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. One worker was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/21/2018: Assailants opened fire on a Lebanese Army checkpoint in Qasr, Beqaa, Lebanon. There were no reported casualties in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/21/2018: Assailants attacked military positions in Damt, Ad Dali, Yemen. At least 18 assailants were killed and 12 assailants were injured as security forces repelled the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists.

12/21/2018: Assailants set fire to eight houses of Hindu families in Singia Shahapara, Thakurgaon, Rangpur, Bangladesh. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: An explosive device detonated in Dera Bugti district, Balochistan, Pakistan. One person was killed and a second person was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/21/2018: Assailants attacked a military position in Nihm district, Sanaa, Yemen. There were no reported casualties in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Houthi extremists (Ansar Allah).

12/22/2018: Assailants attacked a radio station and detonated explosives in Nurgaram district, Nuristan, Afghanistan. There were no reported casualties, though an employee of the station was briefly held hostage. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive laden vehicle at a checkpoint near the presidential palace at Villa Somalia, Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on this date. In addition to the assailant, at least 26 people were killed and 30 people were injured across both attacks. The casualties included security forces, politicians, journalists, and civilians. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive laden vehicle near a prison operated by the National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) at Daljirka Dahson Square in Mogadishu, Somalia. This was one of two coordinated attacks in the area on this date; this second blast targeted people responding to the earlier explosion. In addition to the assailant, at least 26 people were killed and 30 people were injured across both attacks. The casualties included security forces, politicians, journalists, and civilians. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the incident.
12/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on the gold market in Zliten, Misrata, Libya. One civilian was injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: Assailants abducted an English teacher, identified as Saidou Togo, in Tenenkou, Mopti, Mali. The outcome of the abduction is unknown. Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimin (JNIM) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the victim was abducted for teaching English.

12/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on a military patrol in Capotoan, Northern Samar, Philippines. One soldier was killed and two soldiers were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the New People's Army (NPA).

12/22/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a military vehicle between Diafarabe and Tenenkou in Mopti, Mali. Two soldiers were killed and an unknown number of others were injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on a joint police checkpoint in Bawa Mahmoud, Khanaqin, Diyala, Iraq. One police officer was killed in the attack. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attacks.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/22/2018: An explosive device detonated targeting a police convoy in Mekhas, Diyala, Iraq. An unknown number of officers were injured in the blast. This was one of two related incidents in the area on this date; this bombing targeted police personnel responding to an earlier attack. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the attacks.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/22/2018: Security forces identified and opened fire on a suicide bomber at a government compound in Sado Khan, Zabul, Afghanistan. The assailant detonated when he was fired upon; he was the only reported casualty. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: Assailants threw a grenade at police officers who were returning from a search operation in Arwani, Jammu and Kashmir, India. At least six police officers were injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

12/22/2018: Assailants attacked Mulekara, north of Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo. At least five people, including one soldier and four civilians, and eight people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF).

12/22/2018: An explosive device detonated near a military vehicle along a road between Fada-Ngourma and Pama in Est, Burkina Faso. At least three soldiers were killed in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

12/22/2018: Assailants, including at least 17 suicide bombers, armed with rocket-propelled grenades and firearms attacked Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) positions in and around Hajin, Deir ez-Zor, Syria. At least 17 assailants were killed and an unknown number of other assailants were injured while the SDF sustained an unknown number of casualties in the ensuing clash. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident.
gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

summary: 12/22/2018: Assailants stopped a bus and asked passengers for identification papers in Mbengwi, North-West, Cameroon. Mbah Magellan, a Cameroonian soldier, was shot and killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to separatists.

12/22/2018: Assailants abducted Abd-al-Latif Tawilu from his residence in Sarmada, Idlib, Syria. The whereabouts of Tawilu, the Oxford Private University managing director and the People in Need regional director, are unknown. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham.
12/22/2018: Assailants opened fire on Magami village in Magami, Maradun, Zamfara, Nigeria. At least 17 people were killed in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.

At least four soldiers were killed and 16 soldiers were injured across both attacks. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, sources attributed the attacks to Houthi extremists.

Tawoos, an Afghan National Civil Order Police (ANCOP) Lieutenant Commander was killed along with two other ANCOP officers. Two officers were also injured in the attack. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.

At least four assailants were killed in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Al-Shabaab.

There were no reported casualties in the incident. A Jihadi-inspired extremist claimed responsibility for the attack and an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) flag was discovered at the scene. In addition, sources suspected that the attack was carried out by the South Sudan National Movement for Change (SSNMC-Unvuas) and the National Salvation Front (NAS), both of whom denied responsibility.

At least 13 NUM members and 29 assailants were killed and 13 NUM members were injured in the ensuing clashes. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the attacks to the Taliban.

No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to the Al-Barnawi faction of Boko Haram, also known as the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

12/24/2018: Assailants attacked a Military Forward Operation Base in Kukareta, Damaturu, Yobe, Nigeria. At least one soldier was injured and there were an unknown number of assailant casualties in the ensuing clash. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources attributed the incident to Boko Haram.
